text:
LOVE this place, and here's why......
- GREAT, friendly and fast service. There are always 3-4 people coming by your table and refilling water/soda/beer/chips/salsa/bean dip! They are on top of it!
- Fresh tasting food. A lot of Mexican food around town (and elsewhere for that matter) taste like it's been sitting around for hours waiting to be served. This almost always seems fresh.
- Fair prices! The prices for items and combos are great! Great happy hour too.

I recommend the rancho style tacos and (of course) the fajitas!

I hope people support this place and keep it in town. This is a hard location for businesses to prosper it seems. SUPPORT GOOD BUSINESSES!

Good food, large portions, swift friendly service and reasonable prices. The real stand out was the soup, it's excellent, we all complemented on it and the perfect temp didn't go unnoticed.   
The place was quite full, understandably, so we opted to be seated in the bar rather than wait. Our mistake, good meal in a noisy chaotic environment, bit of a shame, took some of the enjoyment out of it. Fortunately the food is as good as it is and made it worth while. 
Would definitely return given the chance.

The food is always really really good. I have become very happy with their fajitas. My office orders for pick up quite often, and every time we order, something gets forgotten. This time it was the tortillas, which kind of ruins the fajita for me. But regardless the food is still great. I would just suggest dining in or triple checking your order if its for pick up.

I love that this place serves warm bean dip with their chips and salsa, it's the perfect combination. Today I tried the chicken tamales with green sauce, hands down one of the best restaurant tamales I have had in quit some time. 

The servers are very attentive and friendly. I will be going back to try other things on the menu.

Overrated. Place is fueled by popularity. The food isn't great at all, the way some Yelpers described. Ordered the Steak fajita, looks good, but doesn't taste good. Meat was tough to chew. Flour tortillas were stuck together, beans and rice regular. If your looking for "real" authentic Mexican food. This is not the place. Driving North a little or the Eastside can find you close to good Mexican food. Also, save you some money as Juan's can be a bit pricey. Wake up. Unless you like overpriced food for the feel.

My first visit to this restaurant proved to be a huge mistake unfortunately. Extremely busy restaurant so obviously very popular. Chips and salsa and bean dip were all great. However 3 of a party of 6 ate the Shrimp ceviche; all three ended up with food poisoning and not only battled that miserable issue but were also forced to call out from their jobs while they recovered. A health and sanitation check is in order. Be warned!

I love this place. Great food, great people, awesome family environment. Menudo is always fresh. The 3 dipping sauces served with their chips are very good and chips are crisp and warm. The grilled Peppers and onions? are lightly salted and have are a great starter surprise. Never disappointed? when I go their. You know it's a great place when there are lines out the door and everyone is still smiling.

First time reviewing a restaurant, and we picked an unbelievable place to start. Food was top notch and the service was excellent. The guacamole was really good along with the fajitas. We will defiantly come back here again.

Seems to be really busy at times but well worth the wait.

Great place. Chips are served with a delicious bean dip, salsa and grilled veggies. My Margarita was a perfect compliment :) We ate in the bar which is a perfect spot to catch a game.  Fantastic service, flavor and atmosphere.
Customer service is magnificent. Food is absolutely delicious! Next time I'm in town will definitely come back.
Flaming Fajitas is fun place and also a nice casual place for large groups , plus very good authentic food and very affordable.  love the fajitas...
Best Mexican in food in Las Vegas.  Chile Colorado and tamales are awesome.

Been here several times and love it every time. My FAVORITE Mexican restaurant in Vegas and probably all time. The food is always delicious no matter what you get but what really makes this place shine is the impeccable service EVERYONE gives. Love the unlimited fresh chips, salsa and beans they bring out when you sit down. You could probably get full on just those but save some room for the main course! Highly recommend the 1-3 item combination plate where you can have a choice of several items plus soup, rice and those yummy beans. Also top on the list is their namesake Flaming Fajitas, which true to the name, they light on fire tableside before serving! Forget the fancy, overpriced, sub-par service restaurants on the strip and come here for your fix!

This place is wonderful! The chips, salsa and bean dip is amazing. I have to stop myself from filling up on them so that I can eat my entree! I order the tomatillo enchilada and it is just amazing. Definitely my favorite mexican food place.

Great place! Love the sports, music variety, and most of all the bean dip with onions and peppers with the delicious chips and salsa! The food is standard good Mexican what separates this place is price and quality, along with the bean dip and onions and peppers! And oh did I mention the bean dip, onions and peppers!? We'll be coming back!

We were heading to In & Out and smelled the fajitas from the parking lot. Walked in on a whim, the fajitas were amazing!!!! Best we have had. They serve on a flaming pot. So good. Homemade tortillas... I could go on and on.
This place is FUN!  Good food. Excellent wait staff. And, out-of-this-world Margaritta's.

Ambiance was great.  Service was phenomenal!!  Very attentive with chips and salsa and drinks.  Loved the food.  Might want to make reservations it's a popular place.  They said wait time was 30 but only waited 15.

It's probably my fault for not ordering fajitas from a place called juan's flaming fajitas, but they had an extensive menu and I wasn't feeling fajitas this day. I got the shrimp ceviche appetizer. Big mistake... it was not good. It lacked flavor, and barely had any bits of shrimp but plenty of cucumber. The waitress brought my boyfriend his beer but told me they needed to change the keg for mine. That is fine but she forgot and I had to remind her twice. My boyfriend and I shared the gringo tacos. I didn't know "gringo" meant flavorless ground beef with lettuce and cheese. Overall not a good experience. I felt very deceived by the overwhelming amount of good reviews on this place. Will not be returning.

Are you kidding me?!?  The best Mexican food outside of New Mexico, and in a Las Vegas suburb!  We were just blown away.  Great food - I had the mulitas and my wife had the enchilada de mole.  Both just outstanding, and way too much for us to eat.  (That's what take home boxes are for!)  Our server, Hernan, must have been telepathic - whatever we needed appeared before we could ask!  He must have tipped off the cook, too, because our food arrived before we could finish our first glass of wine.  We considered staying one more day in LV just so we could go back.  But I guarantee that we'll be back to Juan's Flaming Fajitas again!

My husband and I always try to have date lunch. So we decided to try somewhere new. This is our first time at Juan flaming fajitas and it was AMAZING!!!
The fajitas are literally flaming on your table. One thing I love was the option of having grilled veggies instead of rice and beans and romain lettuce wraps instead of tortillas, that's is a very clever idea. Excellent service!!! For sure we are  coming back.
The fajitas were delicious! Happy hour was fun with $3.95 house margaritas. I'll be back when I'm in the mood for some serious deliciousness!

Very good Mexican food, I would come back again.  Let's start off with the Chips and Salsa, you get bean dip and salsa.  It was good.  They carry Tecate in the bottle and that's my favorite beer period.  They give you Fideo soup (it's a tomato based soup with angel hair pasta) as a free appetizer.

I ordered the Steak Fajitas and shared it. It was great.  I took the advice of another Yelp user.  If it's in the name, order it.  I was not disappointed.

One of my other family members ordered Carne Asada and it came out a little dry and bland.  I've had that problem before with other Mexican restaurants so it's not that big of a minus.  Ideally, Carne Asada should be cooked well done and still come out flavorful and not dried out.  

One of my kids had Chicken fingers and fries. The fries were a little over cooked. But as I usually say, you don't go to a Mexican restaurant for chicken fingers.  But like most smart Mexican restaurants, they put that on the kids menu for the kids who aren't craving Mexican food at the same time everyone else is.  I will come back again and try some of the other items on the menu.  Order the fajitas if it's your first time, you can't go wrong.
This restaurant is top-notch!  Love the family-owned environment and personal touch by the owner.  He and all of his staff are friendly and accommodating.  Can't wait to go back!

First time we didn't have a reservation. It was crowded. They had a 30min wait BUT we only waited for 20min. We sat immediately someone brought us chips and salsa and beans and grilled onions. Yummmmm.  Then we got our drinks the entree come with a soup entreee rice and beans.  It was so good. Definitely recommend it. Worth the wait and also the price it's so cheap!  :).

Great food! Staff is always fantastic. I would recommend making a reservation or try to get there early because this place gets slammed fast! Rarely say this but I have yet to try something on the menu I didn't like. Thanks for the amazing food! Highly recommend!

Great place to eat  the food is amazing , great costumer service,  we always feel welcome here ,my wife and my kids love this place , Ernan is our favorite server,  great guy and very friendly.  
Whoever is running this place, is doing a great job !
Highly recommended! !!!!

Everything here is amazing! The food is delicious!! You start out with complimentary chips, salsa and refried beans along with grilled jalapeños and onions AND soup - all free!! The entries are huge! ~$25 for two for chicken, jumbo shrimp or steak fajitas served with a plate of rice and beans for each person. And their margaritas are good too! Family friendly. All around good place.

The hubby and I love, love, love this place!  

The fajitas are amazing - I have always loved fajitas but hubby was never a fan until we came here!  Now whenever we come here we share the most delicious steak fajitas we have ever had.  What I really love is that you can get grilled veggies instead of rice and beans.  Their pico de gallo and guacamole that comes with the fajitas is fresh and delish too.

I love the grilled jalapenos and onions that come with the delicious salsas and a basket of chips when you come in.

What gives this four instead of five stars is the chips and tortillas - they are not made in-house.  The chips can be on the stale side.  I'm also not a fan of the soup that comes with the meals but no biggie - more room for fajitas!

However the warm, friendly and attentive service more than makes up for store bought chips.  Most of the time Juan himself comes and checks on you and service has always been terrific!  We love this place!
Great Fajitas! We had the combo for two, shrimp and chicken. Food came out fast, and service was awesome! We will definitely be back again!

Underwhelming. The entrees (steak fajita salad and veggie enchilada) were bland and mostly, well, whatever a good synonym for bland would be: tasteless, flavorless, dull...beige. It's basically Mexican food for people who like Mexican food but don't like all the flavor and spices and all the other stuff that makes Mexican food worth eating. At least the steak was stringy and the choice of vegetables was odd. (Who puts broccoli in fajitas?) 

I will say this in Juan's favor: True to their name, the fajitas were indeed flaming when they got to the table. But once the flames were extinguished so was our enthusiasm for the food.
First time visitor and went because of the positive reviews. They did not let us down. Food was very good and nice proportions. Will definitely be there again on our next visit to Vegas.
My cousin took me here.. Let me tell you, FANTASTIC food! I always get Chilaquilas with 2 eggs and carne asada on the side. Great service, and great food!

it was AWESOME! we went for dinner on 5/5/14. The was a wait, though not long.  Only 30 min. And it was 20 or 25 minutes and we were seated.  My wife had a chicken taco salad,  which she said it was "Awesome". The boy had a chirzo, eegs, and potatoes burrito.  And I had Beef Fajitas, which was amazing!  Definitely going to be back soon.
chips and salsa was amazing...I had the chicken fajitas, rice, and beans....it tasted fantastic and the portions were big!!!
Definitely a family favorite restaurant!! The staff is always friendly and wonderful! They make jokes with our kids and are very attentive! Our favorite place for sure!!
Best Mexican food I've ever had! From start to finish it was amazing!!! If you live here or are just visiting you MUST try this place!!! I don't leave many reviews, but I felt this one deserved it!
awesom fajitas and service is outstanding staff is very freindly one of my new top favorite mexican eateries.
OMG!! you cannot find a single thing wrong with this place!! The service was phenomenal!! Quality great and the portion size?? HUUUGGGE! I  can't wait to go back..

Not a huge food guy but this place is fantastic. Great service, great prices, and some of the tastiest Mexican food in town. What they describe as the small fajita for one easily works for two, and the happy hour deals are nice as well. Just a great restaurant!

My honey introduced me to Juan's 3years ago and we visit just about every week. It is bar none the best Mexican food I have ever had. I am in the restaurant business and the service and food has been terrific all these years we have never had a bad meal or bad service. Without a doubt the best Mexican food in Vegas.
Don't let the name fool you, when you order fajitas, they WILL set them aflame at your table side! Delicious! ! !

Ordered their signature dish steak fajitas. Presentation was nice unfortunately meat was dry and tasteless and served with steaming hot rubbery microwaved tortillas. If you are more interested in drinking and socializing and less interested in food quality might work for you. Anyone who wants a better food experience look elsewhere.
First time there.  Ordered from lunch menu.  Very extensive and priced reasonably.  Service was very good!

Just left after visiting during Happy Hour which is 3-7pm every day of the week. During Happy Hour we had Shrimp Cocktail and Ceviche both cost $7.95. Well drinks only $3.50 but couldn't taste any liquor in them at all and I had vodka & 7 so I should be easily able to taste the vodka.
The food was OK at happy hour price but not worth more. Our main problem was the waiter was a total ass literally throwing an empty chip basket right on my place setting and my lemon that was in my water came flying out onto the table. No apology was made. I see every other review here is positive so maybe he was having a bad day but it was our first visit so we won't be back.

Incredible lunch specials. Perfect service. Plenty of options. And a delicious, jumbo sized bowl of fresh guacamole. We will be back here again very soon! I recommend that everyone gives this place a try!
Great place! You must try their flaming fajitas. Service was fast and friendly but expect to wait to be seated. They get pretty busy.
The fajitas were flaming...the marg's flowing...above average Mexican...excellent service last night!
Seriously some of the best Mexican food in town. It's a bit of a drive from the Strip if you're a tourist, but if you're craving Mexican food then I highly suggest this place.

My family and I regularly eat at Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  The food is great, my kids love to see the fire when they light up the fajitas!  We took my brother there last week and he wanted a shrimp burrito. It was not part of their menu, but they made him one anyway and he said it was GREAT!  They are very accommodating here and always friendly.

My family and I have been here about 8 times. Everytime we leave we say how awesome our meal was. I have tried different items on the menu and have never been disappointed. The food and service is always exceptional..I would like to mention a server in particular who is absolutely by far the best server we have ever had and we dine out alot. His name is Hernan. Hernan is always attentive and always has suggestions for us to try from food to tequila. Great place to bring family and friends. Juan who ever you are I believe you hit the jackpot!
Loved everything! It exceeded our expectations and it's so refreshing to have finally found a great Mexican restaurant. We will be back. Staff was friendly and professional.
Had tacos and a few beers.  The food was good and the server was fast and friendly
Food is always great with fast friendly service, not to mention the margaritas. I've come here often and have never left disappointed.

I was looking up good Mexican restaurants to go to in Vegas and this popped up as number 2. I checked out reviews and decided to go and man am I glad I did.

First off we were greeted very friendly by the front counter. The man in front had a very high spirit and was laughing and joking with the customers. We only waited a few minutes and were seated right away. Our drinks were taken almost as soon as we sat down.

They brought us chips , salsa, bean dip, and a plate of chilis and onions right away and man were they good. The waiter gave us plenty of time to order and were very kind to my children by telling them good job. Our meals all came with sopa and it was delicious. They constantly brought us refills and asked us if everything was okay.

When the food came man was it delicious. It was a big helping and I couldn't even finish it. My kids enjoyed playing with the drawing pads they allowed them to play with which was a good change from the cheap coloring books and crayons they usually get from restaurants.

After the waiter Omar came over to my son and was kidding with him buy handing him the bill and saying "what's your name?" to which he replied.... "Jimmy" and Omar said "oh jimmy I heard you have a lot of money and I was told your gonna pay the bill."

We all had a good laugh. When he took it, he looked in and saw the money and was like "ooooh Jimmy your rich look at all this money."

I ended up having my son give the tip so he asked what the waiters name was and he said Omar. Then my son was like I do have a lot of money and here is your tip. We all laughed again. 

It was a very pleasant experience and you get a ton of food prepared wonderfully for a good price. I recommend going and I will for sure go back. The staff is friendly and courteous. And one of the waiters kept humming and singing Mexican songs which brought back memories. 

Hope this helped and I'm telling you....everyone in Vegas should try this place.
Juan's flaming fajita is my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. The food is very good and the service is wonderful!
Fajitas are amazing !!! Great service and atmosphere. Recommend this to anyone visiting the area you won't be disappointed.

Good food, plenty of options. I like how they give you chips with different dips and soup with your meal. I would recommend to get the fajitas, other items in the menu are good but the fajitas are better

Super Delish!! 

Very impressed with the level of service, the quality of food... Ambiance. All great. Nice bar, Happy Hour deals thru whole restaurant. We will absolutely be returning here again. Yummy!!!
Good food, good prices and a show. What more can you want. if you can handle it they have Habanero. Fun place.
every looking for a taco salad? come here!! I always get the shredded chicken taco salad and oh boy do I eat it all! the chicken is full of flavor  and and soooo Juicy 10/10 HIGHKEY RECOMMEND

Fajitas on Fire.  5 beers in a bucket for $15. Good chips and Salsa.  Mariachi Band.  Strategic TV's for all seats.  Excellent Margaritas. Kid friendly. This place rocks!!!

Out of all the places in Las Vegas to pick for Cinco de Mayo food, drinks, and music, we picked this one based on YELP reviews.  We were first time visitors.  We will definitely return very soon!  

We arrived early to avoid long waits and drunk people.  By the time we left, we might have been the very people we were trying to avoid!  Drinks aside, we enjoyed the flaming fajitas!  We ordered the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp.  It is more than enough for 2 people.  My hubs and I made 7 fajitas from the meat.  We can't speak to any of the other food.  OH WAIT!  Now I remember, we had an AMAZING desert.  A sopapilla topped with ice cream and strawberries.  It was DELISH!!  

We met Juan the owner who welcomed us and our little toddler.  Juan said he built the place to accomodate families and that their daily Happy Hours are restaurant-wide - and not exclusive to the bar only like many places in town.  Their daily happy hour from 3-7pm looked really good!   Our server was very friendly and the service was great!

The Mariachi band was an added bonus - we would love to return to hear them again.  They were very good!  

This is a place worth visiting!  Good food, good drinks, good prices, and good service!  Locally owned.  Flaming Fajitas - what more can you ask for!!!

This place is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. 5/5 service 5/5 food. First off, unlimited chips, salsa and bean dip. And this is a seriously good bean dip- like back in the day bean dip at the Frontier (cheesy and bean-y). Nomz. 
Next up, I ALWAYS get the shrimp tacos. Like every. single. time. That's how good they are. The brunch on Saturdays and Sundays is also an amazing deal. A meal, a bloody and the chips and salsa for $13? Deal. See you there guys.

This place is awesome, VALENTINO was the amazing server that we had tonight, he was on point about everything and tended to everyone, he was never late on the service. The food was really good, we will definitely go back here to eat again, highly recommended

Great Mexican food CAN be found in Las Vegas and it's at Juan's!  Being from SoCal, I've been in search of good Mexican food for quite some time.  We chose Juan's based on the great  reviews.  

Started in the cantina since the wait on this Friday evening was about 20 minutes.  The strawberry Coronarita's were a hit with the group.  Dos XX and Corona Light on tap along with a number of other options.

Chips were good and we couldn't stop eating the salsa and bean dip.

They're famous for the Flaming Fajitas so the mixed chicken and beef were the choice.  In a word, excellent.  Big portions, all the options included (sour cream, pico, guac) along with rice and beans or veggies.

Not only was the food great but service was very attentive including refills on everything from drinks to chips and sides.  We rounded it out with the sopapillas and consensus was, this will be a repeat too. 

Will be back soon and often!  Glad we found Juan's!

Restaurants cringe when my family when my family walks in the door... " 2 Adults and 5 Kids". It's just something we are used to as a large family. Juan's... was completely different. 

Welcomed in and we were seated at our table right away. Adrianna took our drink order and brought chips and salsa to the table before our kids could organize a protest. In fact Adrianna was incredible... drinks were always full and the chips never ran out. 

Rolando our server was excellent. He'd visit with the kids and make them laugh. 

Rolando and Adrianna made the dinner experience perfect for our large family.


I almost forgot the food. When the kids received their food... they were quiet. That's how you can gauge how good a meal is. My wife and I ordered fajitas for two and they were delicious. 

Juan's will be a regular dinner choice for our family.

Absolutely amazing food and atmosphere! I am always pleased when I come here. I would say this is on my top list for favorite restaurants! Super yummy and I will continue to spread the word to my friends and family.
Great chefs and staff they have been in Vegas for many years. Food is outstanding!  Salsa and bean dip are the best!  Great value!
Very good food. The fajita nachos with steak were very delicious and the carnita platter was a good nice size portion. The strawberry Margarita was very tasty.

This place was amazing!! I came here for Happy Hour and had the Shrimp Coctel and Blended Margaritas. The best Mexican food that I've had in Vegas! I will definitely be back to try their Fajitas (a couple next to me had them and they looked amazing as well)!!

This place is a gem!! The ambience is bright and colorful. The food is phenomenal and so were the friendly and attentive workers!!! I Definitely recommend this place. BTW- the fajita portion for one is definitely big enough for two!!! #supportlocalbusinesses

Juans is the best! Everyone here is so kind & the service is above & beyond for how busy they get. Expect to wait, but it is more then worth it! The food is absolutely amazing! This is by far my favorite place to eat. The fajitas are my go to, but I've tried just about everything. Don't fill up on the chips, salsa, & bean dip because their desserts are so worth being miserful!
This is my favorite mexican food in town. A shout out to Sebastian on great service! I had the street tacos tonight and they didn't disappoint.

Meal:  Good portion and pretty good lunch combo deal. Love the chips and dips they provided.  The churros were really good.

Service:  The food was really good but the service was ridiculously slow.  We came here for my coworker's birthday so we have a large party of 11.  I understand that with a large party food sometimes take longer to come out.  However, it is not a reason to make the lunch a 3 hour event.  We looked around and saw that they were a bit understaff so we were a bit patient with waiting.  I was the only one in the group that ordered a margarita because a lot of people said they were great here.  But they managed to forget my drink, it was even harder to wave someone down to remind them.  Alas, I never got it. I'm just going to assume that it was never in the system.  With all the waiting and how long the meal was, one of my other coworker just got up and flagged down the waiter to get our check and paid the bill so we didn't have to wait for split checks. I don't even want to imagine how long that would've taken.

Conclusion: I would tell people to try this place but please only do it when you know you do not need to be somewhere after the meal just because you never know when you can leave.

I have been here many times and the service is always excellent. They bring out chips salsa, bean dip and grilled onions to start. I usually eat here for lunch and go with a special. Lately it has been the grilled chicken taco salad. Yum! They are always on top of drink refills. Best of all they are very reasonable priced for the quality of food and service. Don't forget to try the signature dish as well!

We had dinner here a few days ago. We went based on the reviews.

This is a terrific Mexican restaurant. Probably the best fajitas we've ever had. Flaming them at your table is interesting!  Keeping them war over a flame is a great idea. Incredibly fresh food. Great service. 

We will definitely eat there again when in Vegas.

Excellent, straightforward Mexican food.  Definitely try their signature fajitas. The flaming at the table isn't just for show.  The herb-infused vodka adds a great flavor to the meat.  The fajitas for 2 would easily serve 4, and we are looking forward to the leftovers.  

The place's decor is nothing special, but the service is.  Friendly and always there to refill your chips, salsa, or drink.

Highly recommended!

We have looked for good, reasonably priced Mexican food since moving here 18+ months ago. This place checks the boxes. Good chips, salsa, and bean dip. Food came out quick and was tasty. 

My wife really appreciated the vegetarian option. She bought the avocado tacos which she really enjoyed. I got a two item combo (carne asada taco and pork (al pastor) burrito. It was good. 

Staff was friendly and attentive. A/c could have been dropped down a few degrees but not uncomfortable.
Their fajitas are extremely good! I love this place super much. Honestly, I really do not have anything bad about Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina. Recommend!

Pretty good fajita place especially if you are in the mood for mexican food. Great deal on fajitas for two and they are delicious, the one thing I wish they would not have done is mixed our fajitas. My hubby and I ordered fajitas for two me shrimp and he pork and they brought the meat all mixed together well the only problem here is that I do not eat pork, beef or chicken. I'm not a total lunatic about it so I didn't complain but if someone was and they had ordered just veggie fajitas or if there was an allergy this would be a problem. I used to eat beef and chicken but hate pork and always have so um yea will just make sure to tell them not to next time and I just picked through it this time. Great guac, fresh ingredients and good service would take friends there.

Better than as good as it gets, ITS FANTASTIC, Better than Excellent service, Food is outstanding, prices are super.  I'm sorry I didn't find this SUPER restaurant sooner.  I will keep coming back, this is now my favorite Mexican restaurant.  Thank you for the Best Service I've had in Las Vegas for years

In town for a convention and looking for something away from the strip. Found this place on Yelp and was not disappointed. Mango margaritas were tasty as were the shrimp tacos. The waiter mistakenly brought me the fish tacos (which were actually quite good as well) and was very apologetic when I pointed this out. He then replaced them as quickly as possible.
Best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  You must try their fajitas. Seafood fajita platter (Parillada de Mariscos) is my favorite with the Pork Chicarrones dinner a close second. Service is excellent.

Stopped in at Juan's for a late lunch after a long flight home.  The food was delicious, our waiter was wonderful and the margaritas were superb.  Prices were fairly cheap considering the huge portions.  I left happy, full, and ready to return.

Was here for the second time while in town from Phoenix. Sat in the bar again and had Sebastian wait on us again. First of all the service from Sebastian is some of the best I have ever had both times I was here. The chips, beans, salsas and grilled veggies are great. We got fajitas both times and they are great. Chicken is flavorful and the peppers and onions are too. Sebastian's helper kept our waters full, brought us more chips and kept used dishes clear. I will continue to go back when in town and maybe try something different on the menu one of these times.
Great food & service.  Only docked a star because the singer lingers at your table waiting for a tip.

After reading the reviews, we decided to check this place out. It's only 15 minutes or so away from the strip. The environment is pretty much fun and festive, with a live guitar player. Man, the service and staff are so friendly and attentive. The portions are generous and the food is pretty tasty. I really love the chips, salsa, grilled onions, beans and soup they brought out before our meal. We tried the entomatillo enchilada and it was really good!  Of course we got the flaming fajitas (for one)  and we were kinda let down. Presentation is on point and exciting, but the taste was just ok.  I would definitely come back!

Excellent service and food. Consistently great, Amanda and Juan make the place so inviting.
Juan the owner is HANDS ON, always checking on customers! Their Fideo soup is great, I've had others around town, not as authentic. chicken Fajitas are excellent!

Ask for Omar! We are regulars and he is an amazing waiter. He is fast, funny and works well with large groups and families with small children. Everything on this menu is excellent. Happy hour is never a disappointment!! The sometimes long wait is SO worth it!

I was recently referred to Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina by a friend who was being continuously unimpressed by the taste of the Mexican food in the Las Vegas area.  I found this a little disconcerting being that Las Vegas was essentially a border town of the old west and as the west expanded, Las Vegas continued to maintain the southwest flavor. 

Nonetheless, it was a trusted friend, who had turned me on to some other fine establishments, so I decided to give Juan's a try and see why they were set apart from some of the other Mexican favorites in Las Vegas. 

Upon entering Juan's you see that the Cantina is set aside to the right.  As much as I enjoy a good Cantina visit, I was here for a lunch date and proceeded into the regular dinning area. Inside the dinning area, I was immediately welcomed with the laughter and good graces of a table of about ten people enjoying a birthday luncheon. 

As my friend and I were seated, we were greeted by a team looking to fill our drink order and who promptly brought chips, two salsa bowls (green and red) and beans to the table. I thought this was wonderful, so many restaurants just bring chips and salsa, but then there was more, there was a small dish of onions and sliced jalapeno peppers.  All this just to get us started.  

After looking over the menu and the waiter stopping by a couple times, just to make sure he didn't miss out on our desire to order, we made our selections.  My friend ordered the beef taquitos with veggies and I ordered the chicken fajitas with beans and rice.  

I don't know if our conversation was just that good or if the service was that prompt, but it seemed like no time at all that our food arrived.  As my friend was served her taquitos and veggies, I knew that I had missed out on a change of pace from the beans and rice, the veggies looked grilled and tasty.  

The fajitas were wonderful though, the perfect lunch portion served with three corn tortillas, the perfect amount of chicken and the right ratio of green/red peppers and onions.  All three tortillas were used and there was still a small of chicken left over to munch on.  I really didn't eat the beans and rice, not due to anything wrong with them,but mainly I was sad that I hadn't opted for the healthier veggie option.  

The chicken was tender and juicy, with the veggies grilled to the point of almost burnt, just enough to bring out the flavor and the unique flavor that is expected in a fajita dish. 

I would say that I am not sure yet that Juan's is better than any other Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, I believe I need to further explore their menu, but I would say that it is as good as some of Las Vegas' other premier Mexican restaurants. 

I would also point out that my friend and I stayed an visited for about an 45 minutes after completing our lunch without ever feeling rushed to leave.  I felt the manager and staff were very attentive to our dining needs. 

I would certainly recommend Juan's to anyone looking for a relaxing Mexican style lunch in the southwest side of Las Vegas.

It is worth the wait!!!! Everything and anything you can order here is beyond amazing. I've been coming to JFF (Juans Flaming Fajitas) for over 3 years now (sorry this is my first review). Before I had even visited JFF I had this image of a robertos type place and oh, was I wrong! It is very spacious, family-style restaurant and it can seat parties of 20-30 (I've been to 3). An authentic feature is that they make their own tortillas in the restaurant while you're dining. 
I have brought every family member, friend, coworker, and even my dog to JFF. Yes...you can dine with your pooch on the patio (just let them know before hand and they'll let you and your pup in the side entrance). I have never heard a complaint about the quality of the food, the presentation, or the pricing from any of the several affiliates I have introduced to the JFF family. I often get invites from people I brought to JFF asking me to join them there because they are now JFF (Juan's Frequent Flyers). 
About a month ago I was entertaining family on the strip and while chatting it up with a bartender at a well know Mexican restaurant, she actually mentioned JFF as the best place for locals! That just speaks for itself. I'm excited that they'll be opening another location soon.
Everything is really good. I was skeptical because most Mexican restaurants out here are crap but this one really surprised me. It's real Mexican food. (I'm Mexican af) trust me. Legit

Wow hit this place on a Friday. Line was out the door. Grabbed some margi's from the bar and it was well worth the wait. Chips come with beans, salsa, and grilled chilis/onions. So good. Got the Fajitas and was not disappointed. Definitely will eat here again.
Las mejores fajitas que eh comido :) el servicio excelente very friendly . Thank you mario you are adorable

Service was beyond friendly! Everyone was so accommodating for my two little dogs as well. The vegetarian menu is great, I went with fajitas and put just a tiny dab of habanero sauce, they were so good. Portions are so big we ended up taking half of everything home! Highly recommended if you are looking for somewhere with authentic food and stellar service.
Fast service. Decent food. I wasn't impressed by the chips...what Mexican restaurant doesn't have homemade chips for their salsa?

Second time here, we sat in the bar, it wasn't very crowded.  It took an hour to get our food, 3 other tables around us got here food first after they sat down after us.  I had to go to the bar twice for drinks, my drink was made wrong the first time, and our waitress never came back.  We had to ask for water 4 times and they didn't bring it, finally the bartender brought us some.  When our waitress finally brought our food it was the wrong order.  Finally got our food and it wasn't great or outstanding.  We won't be back very disappointing, and we live close by and had hoped we finally found a good Mexican restaurant close to us.

We had been on the lookout for a place that served fajitas brought to your table still sizzling and thought we better give this place a try.  We are very pleased we did and found our new go to place for fajitas.  We ordered beef fajitas for two.  Chips, salsa were include, along with grilled peppers and onions.  The peppers and onions were a great treat and a nice touch that I had not had in other Mexican restaurants.  Fajitas were served tableside and flaming.  Nice Touch!  We were next in fajita heaven, could not have asked for better beef fajitas, nicely cooked, great flavor, tender beef.  Everything was very good; the soup that came with the meal, beans, rice, guacamole, and salsa.  The portion is big and had extra for take home for another meal.   The service was outstanding.  If you love sizzling fajitas, you need to pay this place a visit, as this was my first of many visits to come!   Thanks Yelpers for helping me find a new place that is great!

I have had a hard time finding a place that serves posole or menudo and the mexican places I've been to haven't impressed me. From chips and salsa when you sit down, to the sangria, to the menudo and the chile relleno, this place is the best Mexican place I've ever had. Ever. Thanks for the good service juan!!

Flaming Fajitas is a great traditional Mexican restaurant. They start you off with fresh chips and salsa, as well as refried beans, grilled onions and peppers. 

They have a huge selection and lots of weekly deals such as happy hour and lunch specials. 
If you're going for lunch I would highly recommend their steak fajitas, it's delicious and a large portion size for the price. 

The service there is excellent and they are always busy still making sure each table is taken care of. 
Enjoyed the experience and will be back again (:
Quickly seated. Enjoyed the Fajitas.  Great place knowing the food was fresh.  My entire family enjoyed our experience and will return on another vacation.

This place has been a once a week stop for some time now.  Their food is amazing and prices are reasonable for the amount of food!  Anyone that I've referred here has loved it and gets hooked as well.  Food recommendations: Have only had steak and chicken fajitas (amazing and a lot of food), taco salad, chicken tacos and ceviche are my go to's. Also love the fact they serve veggies instead of rice and beans upon request. I've never had them but the churro's look great too!  
We used to go to viva Mercado in village square and honestly no other Mexican restaurant compares to Juan's.  Wait time at dinner time can be long but nothing a margarita or two can't fix while waiting!!!! :)

Incredible!!! Probably one of the best sit down Mexican restaurants I have ever been to! Total was $26 for two people ( we both got combination meals).   There was not one part of the meal that was disappointing. We will for sure be back.

Food is always consistently good. Love the chicken and bean burritos-ask to add the queso sauce on top. Mmmm. They have a great Happy Hour menu  3-7, oh you can't go wrong with the margaritas!!! Great bang for your buck! Service is superb.
Awesome food. Excellent service. The staff Is extremely efficient. Since we have found this place we go at least once a week!

Great food! Was on my way to drop my girlfriend at the airport and had my dog with me. They were so accommodating. Even giving my dog some water to drink and set up the patio just for us. 5 stars all the way. Check em out.

Been here too many times to count. Never had a bad meal or experience!
The fajitas are amazing and the fish tacos are always a go to menu item!

This is like Chevy's but, worse. We ordered the Juan's sampler app and shared the steak fajitas. No booze. All the food came at once but, once the server saw our huge eyes of surprise, the flaming fajitas were returned to the kitchen. What happened to them back there? Who knows! :/ My husband was immediately sick when we got home and didn't fully recover for 2 days. Not to mention, we left smelling like a dirty, greasy, fried onion tamale. 2 stars because the staff was nice.
This is the best Mexican food I have ever had I had the combo chile Reano and chicken enchiladas WOW! But can't wait to try the flaming fajitas. Don't miss this place your in for a treat!!!!

Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is my new favorite Mexican Restaurant, I found this restaurant on yelp which was our first visit and we did not know what to expect. Ambiance was nice plenty of booths arrived at approximately 5:15 PM seated within Five minutes, which was a surprise due to the line. the patio area was large and numerous people were enjoying their meals seated in the patio which had misters also they have huge welcoming bar area. I ordered the shrimp fajita and my other half ordered grilled fish tacos which were incredible with home made Corn and flour tortillas. i also ordered the fajita Nachos for happy hour $6.95 which was an incredibly generous portion. Shrimp Fajitas were great not to be forgotten is the Fire presentation for the Fajitas that arrived at our table. Omar was a warm and wonderful waiter who could not have given any better service. Jose the bus-boy was extremely attentive and ensured that all of our needs were met without having to request water or napkins.Jose needs to be promoted as a server as quick as possible.

Happy hour is from 5:00 PM until 7:00 PM so worth the visit you will not be disappointed also the prices were quite reasonable for the size of the portion. Who has happy hour on Saturday? very rare! Juan's offer a happy hour which you will enjoy.

I was so excited about Juan's and our experience i almost forgot to mention the bean dip and salsa with the best grilled onions and grilled chili peppers.     

Omar and Juan thank you for a great experience and your exceptional service which is uncommon to have it all.

I love this place.....

This place is a little hidden gem.  We tried it on a whim and now go regularly because the food is Great.  The staff is super friendly and welcoming and the atmosphere is great.  After chatting with Juan (who is almost always there) and expressing interest in a particular beer, we found out he was willing to order it for us!  Now we go and eat and enjoy our special beers while we are there.  Also, they will make menu substitutions and suggestions if need be.  Try it... you will love it!!

This is absolutely my new favorite mexican restaurant. The New Mexico enchiladas are my favorite. They are amazing, (as is everything else I have tried) and the customer service is superb! This place operates like a finely tuned machine. All the employees help eachother regardless of if it is their table or not and the manager also works the floor to ensure everything is up to par. If I could eat here every day, I would!
Best in Vegas! Omar and the servers are great. Bean dip, chips and salsa to start. Everything tasted authentic and fresh! Will only eat Mexican food in Vegas here!
The best place for fajitas I been here for more than 3 times and is always great food and service keep up. .

Food/Service AMAZING!!! The portions were huge and they even have a great Happy Hour too! We came in with 4min remaining and snagged a Steak Quesadilla for $3 and change! They bring warm chips, warm refried beans, salsa & roasted jalapeño and onions as you arrive.  A tomato based broth soup comes with your entree... So so good!! 
Needless to say we will return!! We also had enough left over for dinner the next day.
The best Mexican food in town.  Everything I've tried (and I've tried a lot) has been delicious. The food, the service and the staff are 5 stars every time!

I have to give Juan's five stars. Our party of four was immediately seated, and we had immediate service though the place was pretty busy.

They have a number of different Mexican beers on tap, and they had a happy hour going when we were there at about 6:00. 

Chips and salsa came immediately and they were excellent. We had chicken fajitas that can be ordered for two, and they came out with a spectacular sizzling, flaming, presentation.

They were dynamite, and the portions allowed us to take quite a bit home for later.

The server was real and down to earth but very professional, polite, and competent.

I will certainly return the next time we feel like eating Mexican when we go out.
One of the best Mexican restaurants on the west side. Better than Lindo and definitely on par with Frank& Fina's. Can't wait to go back.

Very impressed. We got a table right away, got a very nice waitress (thank you Amanda), the food was good, & really enjoyed coming here. Definitely would eat here again &/or recommend it to friends & family.  
    Thanks again Amanda,the 3 of us enjoyed having a personable waitress!!!!

Ordered takeout last night and wasn't disappointed. You can tell a lot about a place when you order to go. The way everything was packaged and separated shows real care and attention to detail. The same goes for the quality of the food. We had cerviche, tacos, fish tacos, guacamole, and the chicharrones which is so good you can't stop eating it.  Great atmosphere inside the restaurant too. It's a winner.

Finally, a tasty Mexican restaurant in town.
Went here with the family and ordered the fajitas.  
The fajitas were perfectly seasoned, which I have found unusual in Las Vegas.  
The tortillas were light and accompanied the food well.
The staff was attentive and pleasant.

My husband and I found this place while searching for our next Mexican hot spot.  We are actually here right now having dinner.   It's part sports bar part Mexican restaurant but all yummy.  We have ordered the chicken pablano faitias and the beef taco they were all amazing.  The quality of food is def up there and the prices r very reasonable.  Anyone out there searching should stop at this great spot.

Still the best value restaurant in the Vegas area. And my only problem is I can't stop eating the same things. Child relleno and or chicken fajitas. 
.

We were visiting Las Vegas for the long Labor Day weekend and had a taste for Mexican food and turned to yelp for help and this place turned up first and after reading a few of the reviews decided to give it a try. The reviews didn't lie it's good food and good service! The beef fajitas are good and do not disappoint! Even the chips and salsa were good!  The sopa de Fideo they give with each meal has a lot of flavor.

Give it a try and you will want to go back again!
The food is excellent,  I recommend the steak fajitas! The chips, salsa and bean dip is amazing! The customer service is excellent!  5 stars!  Great price!

Stopped in for lunch today, having wanted to try this place for quite a while.  Exceptionally friendly staff and service that can only be equaled, because I'm confident it can't be beaten.  As mentioned in other write-ups, you are served complimentary 2 salsas and warm bean dip upon being seated.  Hernan was our server and was terrific.  Wife had the 3 option lunch combination meal.  She thought all 3 items were excellent.  I had a chicken torta (sandwich) which also was very good.  The owner, Juan, stopped by the table and visited with us.  Now we know why all his severs are so hospitable as Juan was very engaging and let us know about the happy hour and other specials.  This place is a special treat and we will most definitely be back and will be bringing friends.  Great job Juan, keep it up!

I've been here several times with my family and the food service just keep getting better. The service is just great and they really know how to cater kids and went out of their way to keep the finicky little ones happy. The wife and I had the chicken fajitas for two and it was delicious. Happy hour is a great time to go with drinks 1/2 off. We'll be back for sure.

I had high hopes for this restaurant based on the reviews and a personal recommendation.  We had beef and chicken entrees and both were overcooked.  The service was excellent and the staff were super friendly.

Super popular.  Definitely make reservations. The only thing is they only do that for parties of 10 or more. Food was good but I need to come back another time to be able to comment on it more. Since I wasn't that hungry I only ordered a chille relleno plate which was good but not the greatest. Leticias was better. Next time I'll definitely try the flaming fajitas.

Yes is is not on the strip but it is definitely with the drive. My two friends and I spent the day hiking and were ravenous after a long day. We started with the chips and salsa then ordered guac to start which could have been spicier but was fresh as could be. For dinner, the three of us split chicken fajitas for 2.the chicken was done perfectly. Stuffed and satiated does not even begin to describe our food coma. Unfortunately, we were too stuffed to partake in dessert. The churros and fried ice cream looked phenomenal!

This place is great. Finally, fresh Mexican with serious margaritas in the Southwest part of town! The food was delicious. Huge portions.  The margaritas were tasty and STRONG (as they should be!) 
One star off for no a la carte options. We had the carne asada burrito, fish tacos and kids beef taco with fries. Entrees come with rice and beans (or fries for kids) and a yummy fideo soup. 
Margaritas were a tad pricey but totally worth it. 
Guacamole appetizer was super fresh and well priced.
Next time we may just share an entree which would make the meal more reasonable.

One of the best fajita joints in town! I come here at least twice a week! I come mainly for lunch but also dinner. The lunch menu is awesome!!! I love their chicken fajitas!!!! Über yum! Great service that is fast and friendly!!! I love that with chips n salsa they serve bean dip and grilled japs and onions to snack on! Yummy!!!
We ate dinner there last night. THE FAJITAS were great and service was also good. It is worth the drive from Henderson.
Love this place!!! drinks, chips, salsa, bean dip and the fajitas were delish!! Good service too!

Service was fast great. The wait was long but well worth it. The food was exceptional free chips and bomb salsa. And the atmosphere was amazing. Super busy but the live mariachi band walking around was cool. Please visit at least once!!!!! Eat here and enjoy

We tried Juan's for lunch for the first time today after it was recommended to us by some friends. It was terrific. Perfect-sized portions, excellent, friendly service and fair prices. 

The flaming fajitas looked great when the waiter arrived with them at our table and they tasted as good as they looked. We also tried the Chicken Chimi and a Green Chili Pork burrito. Both were perfect; very flavorful. We liked the chips, salsa and bean dip served as soon as we sat (included with the meal.

All in all, a very good lunch. We met Juan, the owner, afterward to tell him how much we enjoyed the meal and his clean, friendly, new restaurant. We'll be telling our friends.

We really like Juan's . The service is consistently excellent and Juan is cordial and hardworking.

Lunch is a super deal.  We really enjoy the chicken fajitas.  Have found the steak fajitas to be tough and the shrimp tend to get overcooked.  Stick with the chicken and you will be happy.

Chicken chimichanga was large, but salty.  Ice tea tastes freshly brewed.

My very critical 86 year old mother gives  Juan's the thumbs up.  I don't know a better recommendation than that.

This has got to be my favorite new spot in town. They opened right down the street from my in laws and we are there all the time. As everyone has said, not only is the food great but the service is incredible. There is never an empty cup in that restaurant and they are quick to refill the chips. They light the fajitas on fire for a little flare right before serving them to you. But my favorite part is the grilled onions they bring out with the cips, salsa and bean dip. Yum!
The steak fajitas were pretty good. Not the best not the worst. Must say there carniasada was really tender and delicious. Salsa was superb. so fresh.
Fantastic!  Was so good to get away from the crap food on the strip. Service, food, prices were all excellent. Had to go back a second time!!
First time here! The food was good, the service is great and super fast, always making sure our drinks, chips were full....the flan is delicious!!! I would definitely come back here!!!
First of all the food is great they give you big portions.The service is awesome!  very good for its price.

Have come here quite a few times now and have never been disappointed. The fajitas are delicious and no matter which meat you choose it comes out tender and juicy every time. The chips and salsa are on point and go great with the many different margaritas they have. Most dishes I've had are on point with El Paso restaurants, which if you've ever been to El Paso, you know what I'm talking about.

I will drive 20 miles to get here!! Everything from the drinks to the food.. Margaritas are made from scratch!! Happy Hour is extended to 7pm for those of us that have to bare traffic. I LOVE the Chili's and grilled onions as the appetizer!!! Fajitas, well seriously the BEST in town!!!  All of the food is fresh and tasty. The service never fails and rumor has it that they could potentially obtain a second location in Henderson. I vow to be there every Friday!! I can't say enough of this place. I'll be so happy if they get the Henderson location... *praying*

I've been to several different Mexican restaurants throughout my life and this place definitely deserves top ratings.  Been here twice now and sat in the bar area.  Ordered the Steak and Shrimp combo fajitas and have loved it both times!!  Their fajitas have a lot of flavor!!!  You can't go wrong with ordering their fajitas!! There's only one other place that I know of that can make fajitas this good..  up in Northern Cali.   I also ordered their mango margarita blended which was pretty tasty!!  Getting curious about other items on their menu :)

This place was excellent - high quality, authentic, and with lots of 'extras' - bean dip in addition to salsa provided with chips - AND with grilled jalapeños & onions on side as well.  Portions are huge - 2 people can share many entrees and the fajitas for 2 could probably serve 3.

I don't normally leave reviews, but after the absolutely overwhelming mediocrity of the Border Grill at Mandalay Bay last night (all except the price overwhelmed), I had to review Juan's given it was spectacular in its own right, and spectacular x 100 in comparison to the bland, tiny, over-priced fare at Border Grill.

This was the Mexican fix the family was looking for before our vacation ends - I'll be leaving a recommendation with our hotel concierge.

This is my go-to for Mexican cuisine since Viva Mercados closed.  I love their fajitas~!
Wish the parking wasn't so chaotic lol
Great food and super friendly staff. Manager went out of his way to welcome us and ensure we were seated quickly. This is our new "go to" for great Mexican food!

Good food, extremely friendly service both in the bar and in the restaurant. I had the grilled fish tacos - you have the choice to substitute your rice for veggies. They were grilled, fresh, and a generous serving  - much better than I would expect for veggies at a Mexican restaurant! Reasonably priced.

My husband and I went here a couple of days ago. The Cadillac Margaritas were marvelous, the salsa, bean dip, grilled onions and chips were awesome and the fajitas were flaming!! Pair that with awesome service...two thumbs up!! We will be back when we are in town for the NFR!!!
We went with 6 people on a Monday night at 830. no wait. Excellent food and drinks for a great price. We all enjoyed what we ordered and the service was excellent.

I was really excited about trying this place because I love Fajitas. The service was okay, and the food was good too. But there was nothing really special. I probably would have enjoyed more if I would have actually ordered fajitas. But I got the fajita chimichanga with chicken. I would return to try more options. The margarita was good and so was desert!
Best Mexican restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas. Great food, excellent customer service.

I love the atmosphere in here, it is family friendly which I have 3 kids and they have variety of kids food choices, the food starting from the appetizer is absolutely delicious, the fajitas are the best in my opinion, the customer service is very friendly and very attentive right away, I'd have to say I recommend this place to everyone!

Me and my husband decided to try this New Mexican Restaurant (despite already having a "usual" Mexican place we frequent). We showed up 10 minutes before they closed and honestly expected a little rushing on their part perhaps a little attitude .... I know how it is when customers come in minutes before closing when you're expecting to start clean up and get out of there. However, we were treated very patiently and kindly by the hostess, waiter and busier. We were really hungry and they brought out chips, salsa, retried beans, and grilled onions and peppers! It was great. I was even more pleased to see that they had a section on the menu for vegetarians!! I was thrilled! We got our food rather fast, it looked great and tasted great. Serving size was perfect and we were able to take home leftovers. Bathrooms were clean, restaurant had an overall pleasing atmosphere. Hubby and I decided to make this our new home Mexican restaurant!

We love this place! Normally we dine in getting a queso fundido, shrimp ceviche salad and fajitas, which we always have a ton of leftovers to bring home, typically lasting us another meal or two. It is always pleasant and the food is constantly delicious. We enjoy the free chips, salsa and bean dip as soon as we sit. However, today we got take out of just the shrimp ceviche salad and the fundido to go everything was just as delicious at home. I did ask for the fundido in a metal tin so I could reheat it in the oven, it was perfect, hot and delicious. The salad is constantly perfect to me and the edible bowl has a great flavor.

I've eaten here twice, and both times I've had the chicken fajitas. I loved them. The homemade salsa and chips are fantastic and difficult to stop shoving down your throat. Their guacamole is freshly made and quality. I'd have a chair with my name on it if I lived closer.

Super yummy fajitas! The chicken is my favorite of their fajitas. It's served with peppers, rice and beans, or vegetables. The fajitas also come with a bowl of soup which is very good!

You get a lot of food for what you pay for, so you will leave feeling very full! Good service, very helpful and the wait times to get seated are generally pretty quick.

This place was great! My BF and I went on a week night for dinner. The place was packed, but the service was still above and beyond! Cheap drinks at happy hour, the green chile tamale was OUTSTANDING- nice and fluffy, flavorful and well made. The orange salsa was so good, I literally drank some of it when no one was looking. Best salsa I've tasted in years, and I would consider myself a Mexican food officionado. They even had a decent selection of vegetarian options, which can be hard to find at Mexican restaurants, especially in Las Vegas. Highly recommend trying this place, you won't regret it!
Ask for Amanda! She is the best. The food is great.it is Mexican food. With all the varieties. Plus some tex-mex..Visit them instead of In n out.

Juan's flaming fajitas is a must when I'm in Las Vegas! Honest to God my absolute favorite Mexican place in this planet! The first time my boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas I checked out their reviews and had to try them out. Ever since then we have made it a point to always stop there anytime we are in Nevada. Their service is excellent, everyone is so friendly and you get greeted at the door! Food is top notch, authentic Mexican! I've had their breakfast and dinner, even their fried ice cream is a must. It sounds funny but even their chips and dip, their soups and bean dip which were all complimentary when we went were amazing. I have nothing bad to say about this place other than I wish it were closer to Boston! Keep up the great work at Juans!

Really great restaurant! Excellent and attentive service, good food for a reasonable price that was quickly prepared. All of the staff we encountered were friendly; the outdoor seating was very comfortable. And the end of our meal, we received a complimentary dessert from the owner, who expressed his happiness that visitors to Las Vegas were coming to his restaurant. I highly recommend this restaurant!

We've been going to Juan's since shortly after they opened and we absolutely love it!  The food is great and they continue to update and add to their menu to make things even better.  The happy hour is a great deal for sure and we always try and hit it! Saturday's are insanely busy, so just be forewarned! We've tried to call ahead but they only do call aheads for large parties.  I really do love that they always remember us and stop in to check and see how our meal was!

I don't normally say things are the best but these are the best fajitas I've ever had. Chips are perfect ,salsa is perfect, bean dip is perfect, and the best fried ice cream I've ever had. Plus the service is great.

Standard fare with one very important difference and that difference is taste! The food was flavorful, hot (temp) and not frozen reheated bulk food which seems to be the norm these days. Grilled jalapeño peppers were served, along with salsa to go with the chips. The service is excellent, they honored the Yelp dscount, beers were cold and the staff deerves another mention for excellence. Dirk recommended.

Very, very good food! We eat a lot if texmex and this place us fantastic! Hot food, great service and good prices. They salsa has a chipolte flavor that was refreshing and good. The grilled onions and jalapeños were good, super spicy!

Great mexican food, and great service every time. I measure the quality of any mexican joint by the carnitas. Juan's carnitas are very good - crispy on the outside, and moist on the inside. Their verde salsa is an excellent flavor addition to the pork. The hosts and waitstaff are very attentive, great with kids, and the manager stops by often to make sure the dining experience is spot on.

Best mexican food in town. LOVE the guadalajara special!!!
The service is fantastic!!
We are here at least once a week.

My wife and I went to Juan's while in Vegas for a convention in June of 2015. Wow, talk about a great decision. From the moment we walked in the door to the moment we walked out, the experience was phenomenal. Arguably the best food/service we've ever had. The host was nice when we walked in, the waiter and multiple other waiters/bus boys were attentive and nice the whole time we were there and ALL the food we ordered was great! Their chips, salsa, refried beans and grilled onions with peppers and soup (all are complimentary) were excellent. We had some shrimp ceviche to start and shrimp fajitas for dinner. It was all fantastic. Highly recommend this joint. Food was a 10, service was a 10. No cons to even mention.

It is really hard to find decent Mexican food in Vegas. I have been twice and had the beef fajitas both times. Really delish. Great sides, chips, bean dip, peppers & onions and salsa. Omar was our server this last time and he was great! Attentive, comes by often even though there was a full house. Even other employees stopped by to check on us. Good value. 2 for $20.
Best Mexican food!! Good prices!! I loved the whole atmosphere! The food came so fast and was amazing
Food was good, service was ehh.... Then again I only eat at Viva Mercado's.. So yeah I guess all things would seem mediocre in comparison
Food was absolutely amazing recommend getting the steak and shrimp. Chips and salsa are really very beer is ice cold.. great spot for dates are going with family highly recommend
I really don't like the food here. The ueso is good only when it's hot. The customer is good though

Amazing authentic Mexican food. When you see Mexican patrons in a place you know they got the real stuff. The guacamole is to die for. I also like their american options on the kids menu since my little ones don't eat mexican. The place is busy. Even on a Thursday. it will take a lot for me to go to another place after trying this one.

Best Mexican restaurant in town.  Service is great, food is excellent and queso is perfect.  Chips and queso are a staple in any Mexican restaurant in Texas but for some reason, not out here.  I finally found a spot in Las Vegas that serves it and I'd say Juan's queso would be in the top 15 of all Tex-mex restaurants in Texas
Excellent Mexican food, your in for a treat when you come here. Staff is very attentive, food is superb, atmosphere is perfect. High marks all around.

A few months ago, Flaming Fajitas was only a month old, we stopped in for dinner while my sister and nephew were visiting. The five of us were eager to try the newest restaurant in the neighborhood. You'd think Las Vegas of all places would have great Mexican, and while it does have a couple gems, it really has a poor showing overall. However, Flaming Fajitas has brought some heat to the scene. I mean that quite literally. 

 I love spice. And Flaming Fajitas delivers. I love the plate of grilled onions and jalapenos that gets you started and the salsa is quite tasty. This is often the weak link when I dine out, but it fresh, bold and well balanced. The staff aims to please and they were more than willing to accomodate special requests made by our group. We were started with delicious fideo soup. Then, a short bit later, hot plates piled high with food swirled around us. I ordered the tacos al pastor. However, what was presented before me was not tacos al pastor. I don't know if the kitchen made an error or if they prepare them differently but these had no lingering flavor from chilies, nor a hint of pineapple. Whatever it was, it was decent, but fajitas is the name on the building and it's what you should get here. 

My brother went with their signature Chicken Fajitas and there is quite the presentation; far more showy than any fajitas I've seen before. Usually you can hear them sizzling, but these are actually set on fire tableside. 

The fajitas are excellent. So much so, I took my husband the following night we shared the steak and chicken fajitas for two. The chicken is far better than the steak. I noticed they also offer pork. I will try that next visit. I also prefer the corn to the flour tortillas. They have a great and reasonably priced beer selection to quench your thirst and come for happy hour to enjoy great specials.
Food was very good and excellent service. The margaritas were awesome. I would definitely come again.
Great restaurant, only thing that was bad was the wait but overall it was really amazing. I loved the sharing plates and the food!
Amazing food, and great service! House margarita was perfect, and stiff too! Shrimp and steak tacos were big but flavorful.

Definitely deserves 1,000 Stars! Mary kindly greeted our party and sat us down to our reserved table. Amanda & Pao worked so well as a team serving our party. They both had such a cheerful and positive attitude & kept our drinks, chips, bean dip & salsa topped. The food is in large portions & is very flavorful, fresh, delicious, 100% authentic, which is a must in my book, 2 thumbs up ! Though the food taste like a million bucks, it was definitely cheap/reasonable, & service is quick & served with a smile. Happy hour drinks was on point as well  lol. The guitar guy walked around and played beautiful mexican music. Everything was perfect and very special as it was my Mothers' birthday. I will most definitely be a returning customer, and this is now our chill & family get together spot. Thank you Mary, Amanda & Pao for making our experience a great one!  Everyone was so friendly & made everyone feel welcomed & comfortable.  I'm so happy we finally were able to try this place out. Best Mexican Restaurant in town, hands down!!!

The patio was puppy friendly.  Service amazing!  So accommodating even to the three year old and the dog. Food (fajitas) fantastic. So were the chips, bean dip, salsa, and jalapeños!  Even had kid friendly salsa. Could not have been better.

Left a review that they forgot the tortillas for our office takeout order and the management took care of it and offered a 15% off for the next visit when my boss orders for the next time. 
The food is always prime though. The chicken fajitas is always so delicious. Hits the spot every time.
Seriously, this place has the BEST Mexican food in town! The staff is always amazing, which is just icing on the cake. My family and I have been coming here for years. No other place compares!
Great authentic food, great attentive and friendly service. I feel so welcome and comfortable every time and the flaming fajitas never disappoint. Just go.

I took my family ice skating around the corner from this place. Family decided this should be the place we filled our belly's with after. 
Figured with all the great reviews we would be getting some great food. 
One. Let me say that the hostess at the front is a 5 star. And the ambience in the restaurant is a 5 star. But what else I experienced there means they receive a 2 star overall. 
Our waiter wasn't the greatest. When we started ordering he kept trying to up-sell everyone to one particular dish. I don't didn't catch on to it until after he left the table and we realized that my teenage daughter ordered something he said she should take instead of what she wanted. 
When the dish came, I looked at it like "she ain't going to eat this." One. It was freaking massive. It was fit for 4 people. Not a 115 lb teenager. Two. I had realized that was the same dish he tried to upsell me on and that I said no to. Why the hell was he trying to up-sell us this particular dish? Was it because it was more expensive? Was it something he personally like? I don't know. But I would figure when someone says that they want something specific just let the order be done and let it be over with. There's no need to upsell.
Noticing the commotion on our table, another waitress came to the table and asked if everything was okay. I explained the situation to her and she said she would take care of everything. At that moment the other waiter came back to the table and asked if my daughter would like what she originally ordered instead. Interesting Lee, he knew exactly what the dish was and did not even have to ask her he said he would just bring it right away.
Now I'm not no food kinda connoisseur but I do love food! But I cannot under any circumstance understand what the big hype is about this place. This is not authentic! And I mean not even close! I mean all I had was tacos. And even that was not good. How do you serve a not good taco? Me and my wife and my youngest daughter ate maybe half our dishes we weren't exactly thrilled with the flavors. My oldest daughter the one who was up sold and then got the dish that she did one scarfed all her food down but I think it was more out of thinking she was satisfying me in some way rather than enjoying the food.
The rest of our evening they're followed with a thousand offerings of refills of our drinks even though we constantly said no the offers would not stop.
And oh joy, much to my delight a $75 bill 4 Non authentic food. I'm sorry but I was not impressed.
This is Las Vegas, there are way too many authentic places to get this food then to come here and pay $75 for something that did not taste good at all.
Again, this is just my experience I can't say that that is the experience of everyone and I'm sure to some their food is great... just not to me.

Happy hour here is awesome. I love love love the fajitas! I got the fajitas for two which was a great portion size to share. Tasted delicious and was the right price! And the drinks are delicious. The margarita is a must!

So good!  First time here - definitely not the last. We're already planning our next visit. We had the steak fajitas and the chorizo, egg and potato burrito. Service was excellent (thanks Arturo) and very helpful.

Wow, probably the best Mexican food we've eaten in the Las Vegas area and right at the top of the best we've had anywhere!  The flaming chicken fajitas for two were absolute perfection.  Great service, too.

We will certainly have to eat here one more time before we leave the area.  We will make sure to come hungry, very hungry!!

Love the flame, but not the smell afterwards! The fajita's are flaming and entertaining, but leave your clothes at your front door before you go home. The gracious staff and delicious food are always a constant here. Be sure to try their queso and parrillada de mariscos!

This place is amazing! Food and service is always fantastic! My husband and I have been coming here for a couple of years regularly and are never disappointed! Fajitas and margaritas here are the best!

I liked this place a lot. I had the steak fajitas and they were great. Brought to your table in traditional fajita fan-fare they were tasty, juicy, and the quantity was perfect. My only negatives are that the fajitas had a TON of bell peppers and onions (disproportionately so to the steak) and the refried beans had no flavor whatsoever. Honestly these two things didn't stop me from thoroughly enjoying my meal. I will definitely be back.

We read the reviews and went for a late lunch. It was busy at 330 but we waited. Super friendly and amazing service. The bean dips and salsa were so good. We never had to wait for anything despite how busy the place was.  The portions were quite generous as well. A great place to eat and reasonably priced.

This place is pretty good!  They serve rice soup with the Entree's.  When they bring the chips they also bring some grilled or marinated onions and green chile slices which I really enjoyed.  Includes salsa and bean dip.  If you read my Mex dining reviews you know I'm sensitive to salt.  THIS PLACE WAS NOT TOO SALTY!!!  PERFECT saltiness.  The fajitas are great, the servers were attentive.  All in all pretty good experience.
Very attentive staff, even during a busy dinner service. Great margaritas. Great happy hour. I will come back again. The digital come flaming. I strongly recommend.

Went here on date night with hubby.   It was so good.  I would give it five stars if it were not for these minor reasons: the floor is dangerously slippery, do not wear heels. I had the steak enchiladas,  hubby had steak and shrimp fajitas - his steak was better quality than in my enchiladas.... i am looking forward to returning.

Since I moved to Vegas, almost 3 years ago, I've been on the search of really good Mexican Restaurant.
I've found a couple of good ones, including taco shops, but I still was searching for one like back home, San Diego,  CA.
Today a co-worker texted me asking if I had plans for dinner.  When I didn't she suggested we get together and try out Juan's.  It had been highly recommended by a neighbor of her whose boyfriend is a chef.  So she figured, must be good!
And it was really good.  
I had the carne asada taco plate and the meat was cooked perfectly.   Just like back home at my one of my favorite restaurants.  While the tortillas were not made on site, they tasted close to it.
The beans and rice were just like I like them.
My friend had the fajitas and said they were also really good.
Before you order, they bring the chips out with both salsa and beans.  I had never seen beans brought before with the chips, but it worked out really good.
The service was perfect from the staff.
No question, I will be back again and again!

Let me start by saying the service was fantastic. Our waiter was attentive and funny. Food was great and the portions were quite large. The is a staff member making fresh tortillas in a corner of the room so I know that their food is fresh. I was so full on the appetizer that I didn't need a full dinner. I am fussy about Mexican food and I was very satisified here and will return. The managment staff is present during the evening and I received a very pleasant follow up note from the Owner. This is definately a restaurant that  cares about their customers. This makes for an all around good experience.
In my opinion, once you have found gem like this there is no reason to look elsewhere.

best fajita in town in my opinion! we have been there twice, and the only thing we ordered was fajita for two with beef only. it was always awesome and delicious. staff was courteous there, and the price was reasonable. We aren't gonna go anywhere else for fajita from now on xD.
WOW! What a show! From start to finish the service was wonderful!

Took my parents and boyfriend here last night and left highly impressed!! Delicious food, great presentation, killer prices, good service.
