Both couples had beef & chicken fajitas with all the fixings for 2 people for $24.99. Chips, salsa, bean dip and soup come complimentary. Happy hour until 7. We had tons of leftovers. We all stuck to fajitas so I can't comment on the other food. Although, my mom's margarita was so-so and the chips could've been better warm. Very casual atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

Very good and the best hospitality I've had in s while 
You got to try the fajitas their to die for lunch they have great specials

Great happy hour and really great for groups! The food is good but it does get pretty crowded. The service has been great most times but kind of weird on one or two occasions. To me there's nothing super unique here but the happy hour pricing is pretty good and it's convenient. Fun casual spot if you're in the area.

New to Las Vegas and looking for neighborhood _Mexican Resturant. We kept passing this Resturant on the way home and stopped for lunch. What a great surprise. The food was great. The fijiatas are the best. You get more than what you pay for. The atmosphere is so friendly, from the busy boy to the waiter to the manager. We felt so at home. The margaritas are excellent. Loved this place and the people and will definitely be going back.
The food and the service was excellent. Amanda our server was so attentive as was the rest of the staff. The plates were well served and the food was authentic. We will be back.

Don't think twice...You have to try this place! We visited this restaurant last night for dinner and was floored by service, food, and overall atmosphere. The quality of food was excellent. The staff and service were wonderful. We will return for sure!

One of my favorite spots! Chips n' salsa are tasty, I enjoy the jalapenos and onions they serve with them, love the complimentary soup (squeeze some lime in it, so good) and LOVE the sopapillas for dessert. I've tried a few different entrees, and wasn't that impressed with them until I tried the fajitas... now that's all I order!  Service has always been great. If you're looking for something easy, casual, and tasty, definitely recommend this place.

Okay, I consider myself a huge fan of Mexican food... We drove 17 miles for this place. Shoulda saved the gas and money. The waiter did give us 5 dollars off. Anyway, the queso fundido was awesome. The bean dip with the chips is flavorless. We got the famous flaming fajitas!!
Pork and chicken. Chicken was okay..pork was horrible nasty dark fatty chunks. The fajitas were not seasoned in any way. I got the veggies with mine and took one bite... Ugh no flavor either. Tried salt and pepper didn't help. Also how can you mess up fideo soup?!? I don't know but theirs is no bueno. Was really hoping for a great fajita place but not here!!

Amanda was one of the best waitresses we have ever had..She was through and extremely polite. She suggested that we try the cheese dip with carne asada and it was extremely good and we also had the flaming fajitas. Chicken and beef and both were absolutely amazing. To top it off we had some amazing margaritas. We would return there anytime. thank you so much we enjoyed ourselves and our waitress was a huge part of that
Always a A+ experience, authentic Mexican Cuisine, delightful atmosphere, grade AAAA service. The food is very good.

Excellent Fresh Mexican Food!  Generous Portions, Great Service.  It's a busy place, so get there early or after regular service....like 1PM for lunch!  

Go Juans!

Heard about this place from a friend and it was amazing. Of course being that it's called Juan's Flaming Fajitas I had to order the Fajitas. I must say everything I order from the margarita to the flaming fajita was good will be back soon and recommend to others!!
Best Mexican food in Vegas! Fajitas were amazing- homemade tortillas- delish sopapillas- stellar service. 5 stars all the way

They have the BEST Mexican food in town. Period. There's no argument or debate, the rest are terrible. I know, I've tried them all. Originally from Southern California, Mexican food is not only a staple in my life, but it's also my favorite. 

The low down: 
Viva Mercados USED to have the greatest food, but they closed. Flaming Juan jumped onboard and kept the recipes and food alive in this new location and name. Viva Mercados eventually re-opened in a new location, but the food is awful. Like seriously terrible. 

Bottom line: 
Flaming Juan (yes I realize that's not the name technically, but this is MY review lol) has done a great job at reviving an almost lost and the ONLY decent Mexican cuisine in this dust bowl of a valley. 

Favorites:
Complimentary Fideo soup, green chicken tamale, fajitas (any kind), avocado tostada, happy hour specials, and anything with carne Asada. 

The staff is usually very kind. Especially Juan (waiter, not manager), and Amanda. They're the best waiters. 

* disclaimer *
they've recently changed their bean dip and they need to change it back. It's missing something, maybe the pork it used to have, I'm not sure but that's the first sign of bad news if any.

Riquísima la comida!!! Grilled onions and jalapeños with the chips, salsa and beans... delicious! Then soup... delicious! Husband got the chicken tacos and green chile tomale... Delicious! I had the guacamole tacos... Delicious! Fantastic service and the owner even came by to take our plates and asked how everything was. This is our new go to Mexican restaurant!

Great Happy Hour!  $5 Margaritas and a good queso!  The Fajitas were great and true to form were flaming.  Location is nice but parking can be an issue.  If you can get there early!!!  Service was good, and they have outdoor covered seating.
Another great meal at Juan's!  Great food, great happy hour, great service.   Amanda's the best!
Nice place to eat for business lunch meetings.   Large portions so be cautious when ordering something's you can actually share.  They offer chips salsas do bean dip which is fresh and delicious.

Good service. Good food.

I like how their food doesn't taste heavy like most Mexican restaurants. Chips & salsa to start while you look over the menu, soup while you wait for your food & then the entrees! Everything tasted delicious.

& our server, Omar(?) was very attentive & very nice. 

I think I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant!

Excellent service, above and beyond our expectations. They brought us warm tortillas when we sat, chips and salsa, drinks, dinner. The portion sizes were huge and the food excellent. Would recommend the the skinny margarita!! We will defiantly go back.

My husband and I LOVE this place!! What a hidden gem this restaurant is. We love the complimentary grilled jalapeño peppers and onion that they bring out w/ the chips and salsa.  The staff is very friendly and efficient! Their food is delicious and generous in portion size.

Great service. ..lunches are busy but still within a hour
Lunches specials are not available on the weekend.
Low employee turn over..that's a good thing.
Clean family dining
We first went to Juan's for lunch. We followed that up with a visit on Cinco De Mayo. Great food. They had strolling musicians that day., a nice tough. Our grandsons loved it s much as we did.
This place is yummy!! The flaming fajitas are delicious and fun to watch table side. Great customer service from the staff as well. Check this place out if you're craving great fajitas in Vegas!

Have eaten there 5-6 times. Every time was a good experience. Love that they serve a hot bean dish with the chips and salsa, along with a small plate of grilled onions and jalapeños! The house margarita is pretty good, too. On the rocks! I say give it a try - I've always had the fajitas! Burritos are LARGE. Atmosphere is okay.

Flaming shrimp and chicken fajitas. This place rocks. Killer drinks. Killer dips. Killer staff. 

Most place to hit up.
Yum yum yum!! Such great margaritas!! And food!! The service is great and fast they keep you eating never had to ask for anything even in such a busy restaurant

Best Mexican place in town! The staff is always super friendly. The margaritas are awesome. My husband and I usually order fajitas for one. It's plenty of food for both of us. The chips, salsa and bean dip are really good too.

The food here is amazing. I loved that they had a vegetarian bean dip that is complimentary, and they also bring out some grilled veggies to eat with your chips and salsa and beans. The queso is absolutely to die for and the food is terrific. Their rice was the best I've had. And leave room for the sopaipillas.

From out of town the Bay Area was visiting and went there for the first w/ my friend. We were both very satisfied w/ the service and food. 

We were seated in the bar area.  It was a live atmosphere had Spanish music playing as you watched sport events on big flat TV screens.  There wasn't that many people at first. You don't want the place to be to crowded either.  

We definitely will be coming back again. The food was real good and the prices were reasonable.  Recommend eating at this place.

Wow! I've got to say that the service is wonderful.  They are not short on staff either.  haha!  That's a good thing though.  Plenty of help if you need it.  The food is good too.  I've been here twice and both times with no complaints.
BEST Mexican restaurant in town!  The staff is friendly and there is a unique flavor to their dishes.
We enjoyed our dinner here the staff was very nice.  Perfect Margarita !  Soup was tasty!  We had the shrimp and the fish tacos with rice and beans.  We will be going back to try the flaming fajitas.
Javier was such a fantastic waiter! The food was fantastic and margaritas were delicious. I couldn't have asked for a better date night
Awesome place had a dinner planned there for a wedding. Awesome service Juan the owner was all over it and one of his managers Amanda was super kind and got everything done that we requested.

Visiting from out of town and wanted a nice sit down Mexican meal. This place delivered! Moderately priced as well! Everyone loved their food, hubby loved fish tacos, mom raved about the steak ranchero. Not super crowded or loud either which is nice. Lots of comfy booths or tables & chairs. They bring you fideo soup complimentary and chips and salsa and bean dip! Thank you for a great Sunday lunch!! Will return when we come back to Vegas!

My go-to place for watching football! I live around the corner, and come to sit at the bar. The female bartender always remembers my drink order. The complimentary salsa and beans are better than Lindo's (yes, I said it!). There are also tasty grilled onions and jalapeños that come out to start. Their shrimp fajitas are great, but I honestly come for the ceviche. This place is a neighborhood jem!

Worth a shot, nothing stands out to me on flavor but it's not bad. Salsa and bean dip is good. I don't have much to say about it but maybe because I've been going to chapalas for so long my palate loves the flavor of their food? Idk, try this place and find out for yourself
Food is great , nice and clean restaurant. Very crowded on holiday and weekend( wait time is more 1 hours). Staffs are nice and caring. Definitely would come back
We come here at least once a a month and have since they opened. We love the salsas and the chicken fajitas. I love that we have the option of getting veggies instead of rice and beans. Delicious.

OMG ... do NOT pass this place up if you are in search of the best fajitas north of the border !!! My hubby and I met our family here around 8:20 pm (Leary because they advertise that they close at 9 pm) only to find a line of people waiting to get in. My first thought ... there's no way they're closing at 9 !!

Happy to say the good was amazing  Flaming table side beef and shrimp fajitas were the best I've had in Vegas. Service was impeccable. Guacamole was as good as my own (and that's a very good thing!). My advice ... run to Juan's. Yes ... right now !! I'm a foodie and I wouldn't post this if it wasn't 100% true!!

We were greeted right away. Asked if it was our first time. Taken right to our table. I like the wide openness of the place. Not a million people on top of each other. The server one of two took our drink order. Then brought us chips, salsa and bean dip. They were all delicious. I enjoyed the chips. Fresh and not greasy. They then brought us peppers and onions. My DH liked those also. 
I had the fajitas, had to try the famous flaming fajitas. They were good. I like the char on the beef. The sides of rice and beans were seasoned perfectly. The DH had the tamales. He enjoyed them. Said they were quite tasty. The portions are generous. Both plates were enough for two. We had plenty of leftovers and no room for dessert. 
The service was spot on. Perhaps too many people asking if we were doing OK. Especially when ones mouth is full. LOL 
A really nice pleasant dinner. We will be back.
This Mexican restaurant has the best good in Vegas. Their signature dish, flaming fajitas are excellent and so fun to see flambe table side.

Excellent customer service. Fajita's are great but so are a lot of other menu items. One of the few Mexican restratunts in Vegas where my husband can get broccoli. Everyone leaves happy!!
The happy hour specials are large portions and consistantly tasty.

The food is absolutely wonderful!  The entire family loved their meals. Chips and salsa were great along with the grilled onions and jalapeños. The kids meals are large and the adult meals are huge. Bring your appetite when coming here. You'll need it!

Have been here several times and the food and service is always superb!! They have a great deal on guacamole for happy hour! Yes I said guac!! I love their food but really love their taco plates. They are larger than typical tacos and always overflowing and delicious! Not only does this place have excellent food but the service and prices are just as good. This is by far the BEST Mexican food in all of Las Vegas!!

This place is a great spot with great food. I came here with a buddy and we were on limited time, the prompt service and quick turn-around on our order was just what we needed. Of course, right off the bat when we were served Hot Chips, Salsa and BEAN DIP, I knew we were in the right place. Any Mexican Restaurant that goes a little beyond to satisfy their customers is a winner in my book. 

Food was awesome. We both ordered Fajitas, Steak and Chicken and man oh man.. it was tasty. The homemade tortillas... Whoa! If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go-to Mexican spot. I'll be back for sure!

It took me a long time to find a Mexican restaurant that I liked in Vegas, but I'm so glad I finally did! Their food is great, portions are perfect, and the service is amazing! I will be coming back for sure.
First time customer! Great food and service! Reasonable prices! My family was impressed. We will be back!
Server was great! Margaritas were tasty. Loved the grilled onion and jalapeños that came with the chips and salsa.

I loved this place! The complimentary appetizers & entree was delicious! The service was good!
I would highly recommend!!!

This is the only Mexican Restaurant I have liked since I moved here from California 9 years ago.  Great food,  margaritas,  and service.   Home made tortillas both flour and corn.   My go to is the shrimp ceviche.  Their fajitas are good too.   The fajitas for two can actually feed 4 easy,  just order a couple of extra sides of tortillas.

We have been traveling across America and hands down the best Mexican we have had in any state. Sorry Texas. Great Mexican food. Outstanding service from the moment we entered, until the time we left. Will return again some day.

If I had two more hands, I'd give Juans 4 thumbs up!  This is Mexican food on a whole'nether level! My experience lived up to the hype. The food was phenomenal.  There are Mexican restaurants everywhere but nothing compares......I highly recommend the fajitas and quesadilla, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it and I'm stuffed! 
Juans has a cool atmosphere, plenty of tv's to watch football and the staff was incredibly friendly!

No 10 Star rating??  OMG- this is the best of Vegas!!! No reason to not be satisfied- Juan is almost always there and wants to hear your compliments/gripes. Been eating Mex. every Friday for 18 yrs. all over the world!! This rates top of world rankings as we eat Mex. no matter where we are!!!
Great service, great tasting food, and nice atmosphere. Wasn't too loud and the servers were very attentive.

I love Juan's! I've ordered chicken or steak fajitas to go several times, and my order is always ready to go, the staff is super friendly, and the food is delicious--fresh, savory, with generous portions. Highly recommended.

I have never had a bad meal here . Always top notch ! I love this restaurant! However for the first time I sat with my friend on the patio during dinner and we both agree that you guys need to sex up the patio. Music . Lights. More plants .maybe fire at night ? I still love love the restaurant  but as a server on the strip  this is what I suggest.  Will be back !
Great food, clean, good service. The jalapeños and onions are awesome! It's nice to have a great locally owned spot.

Service was not great.  I can understand the place is busy and our food may take longer.  But that wasn't the case, sure it was lunch hours, but the waiter made no effort to recommend anything or elaborate the menu.  The food itself was below expectation, was pretty disappointed from the high reviews

This was our first time visiting this restaurant and I have to say we absolutely loved it
The appetizers are wonderful and by the time we got our main meal we were stuffed. Lots of food and the drinks were delicious. Also Happy Hour was a great price. Staff was very kind and friendly. We are from California and have already decided that next time we are in Vegas we will be stopping by Juan's Flaming Fajitas.

In regards to Lane L.'s review, there are a couple misrepresentations. We were here this night and the man that climbed on the bar was extremely out of line. However the staff stopped serving him once he was obviously intoxicated and then removed him from the bar. It is not the staff nor the bars fault this man was acting a'fool.

Overall, this place is absolutely fantastic. My friend finally convinced me to come here after raving about how great it is for ages, and I finally caved. The margaritas are hella spicy and their food is (literally) fuego. Come here and you will not be disappointed.

Finally found the best Mexican Food and restaurant since living in Nevada. This place did not disappointed us! There is usually a wait to get in which alone should tell you it's pretty great. Highly recommend the queso dip! Fajitas are yummy, you definitely get your money's worth here as the drink prices are very reasonable as well. The only thing that sucked was the waiting area is way too small and you have to be inside to hear them call your name but it's pretty cramped with people and is uncomfortable. The Host, Waiter and Bussers were so awesome. Overall will be back again and again and again!!

Meh... I was not impressed. This was a recommendation from my sister. Maybe it's because this place is called Flaming Fajita and I didn't order fajitas but the food was not great. I ordered Rajas y Crema which is my favorite Mexican dish and I order it wherever I go and see it on the menu. This was not good at all. I question the age of the chicken and pasilla peppers because they tasted super old! And the "cream" was separating. So nasty. Needless to say I don't think we'll be back.

Wow!  I would give 6 stars to Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina if I could.
Thank you Yelp..never would have found them without you!

Best experience in any restaurant EVER no matter the cost, country or nationality!  From the moment we walked in at 3:15 in the afternoon we were treated like long time customers (that tip very good) It was truly amazing.  The hostess girl at the front desk was so sweet and so nice and our server super nice, helpful and FAST... my only caveat is to be careful with the roasted peppers that come with the chips and salsa...Very HOT! Whew! but I recovered fast...  We arrived in time for happy hour and were happy to see red wine for $4.50 a glass and decided to do 4 different happy hour treats from the special menu.  We do this from time to time at different restaurants as we eat our dinner early so we don't go to bed with a full stomach.

When the food came we were shocked at the size of the portions! they were huge and each came with very generous portions of avocado and sour cream.  We had the fajita nachos and fajita quesadillas, shrimp cerviche and something else I don't recall.  Every thing was delicious and full of meat.  The cerviche was delicious, cool, refreshing and with lots of shrimp and avocado in it.

The red wine was tasty and everyone (including both the manager and the hostess) came by to see if everything was OK, at which time we gave them a total thumbs up!

We ended up packing up enough for us to have a light lunch in a day or two.

I can't recommend this place highly enough.  Excellent experience!

Been here several times and the fajitas are just flamin' on spot!!! I love their chips and salsa to start and good to start with the cervesa. I've brought friends and co-workers here and they never fail. Employees are great and you can tell they're all hard workers.

This place never fail!!! Just finished late lunch with my mom and brother with my family... Everyone was at awe how good the food was and he amount that was served. I love the way we're always checked and made sure we have everything.... Great employees that's why this place is great. This place have such great employees as great assets.

5 stars for guacamole.  It is just yummy! They serve grilled onions and peppers along with chips, salsa, and bean dip. 
Reason for 4 stars is the alcoholic drinks aren't all that great. 
It gets very busy and very noisy in this place. It has a mixture of booths and tables with armless chairs.

The service is absolutely the best I've had ever in a restaurant. Seriously. The free chips n salsa and grilled onions and peppers sometimes hit the table as I'm being seated. They are very attentive and friendly. 

The food is worth the 20 min drive to get there for me and is the best Mexican food I've had in Vegas and I've ha a lot of Mexican food. My favorite lunch plate is Mulitas and my favorite Jalisco dinner plate is the Pollo Asado with Rajas con Crema. Try it! You won't be disappointed!

Some of my family came here for dinner when we were visiting my uncle. Despite the great Yelp reviews, this place was not really busy on a Saturday night. That might have been because it was a long weekend but it was fine as our part of 7 got seated immediately. From the moment we walked in, the service was really friendly and excellent.

They give you bean dip, salsa, and chips to start. The chips were okay; the salsa was good but pretty spicy, and the bean dip was a nice alternative to the spiciness of the salsa. The drinks are really reasonably priced (like $5-6 for margaritas and less for beers) and looked good although I didn't order anything. The menu is pretty extensive and has a ton of options. Everything we ordered looked awesome and what I tried was really good. They light the fajitas "on fire" which is a nice presentation. More importantly, I tried some of my mom and brother's fajitas and they were really well seasoned and perfectly cooked. My cousin had one of the platos, shrimp with the mojo de ajo. He liked it a lot but I found it way too spicy. 

I had the enchiladas de mole. I liked my dish, but I found the mole sauce a bit disappointing. I think it had peanut butter in it did not compare to other mole sauces I have had. A bit too heavy and sweet, but it was alright with sour cream and I liked the chicken inside it a lot. 

Based solely on my dish, I would probably give this place 4 stars but I think it definitely deserves 4.5 based on the other stuff I tried, and I round up because of the service. They have a little stage so I assume they have live music from time to time and their happy hour looks good also. I would come back again when visiting my uncle.

This is the first review I've ever written about anything. This is the motherf'ing place. Nobody messes around. I suggest eating the candy by hostess's before being seated and on your way out the door. Everyone was on top of their shiz. EVERYTHING tasted delicious, the fajitas were incomparable, the French fries were even the best French fries I've ever had. Everything was quality and delicious. 11/10. Went there yesterday with my dad;) for the first time, going there tonight for the second time.
Excellent! Several people had the "flaming fajitas" and others had combination and all was just delicious!  Loved the chips and different dips.  Service was outstanding

Great food and great service! I've taken my family here twice and everything has been on point. Arturo was our waiter both times and he was really great.

By the way, you get 15% off your entire bill when you check in.
Ritas are amazing! Soup is excellent! Chips w/ bean dip was great! Guy playing guitar was great! Overall a great experience with great food (from a south Texas girl! )

If you're looking for great, flavorful food, this is the place!  Aside from the great chips, salsa, bean dip... They serve grilled peppers and onions with it, awesome!  And a really good cup of fideo soup.  The fajitas are the best I've ever eaten and the way they are served is so unique.  I would love one of those pots they use.  I can't wait to take my family, they are having a 3day Cinco d Mayo celebration that promises to be lots of fun!  The staff is great, service the best, this is one place that really wants to provide a great experience.

First time here. Visiting a friend for the weekend and we decided to try this place after our hike at Redrock Canyon. The service was great and the food was very delicious. Top it off with a skinny margarita and you won't leave unsatisfied. Definitely be back next time I'm in town.

First time here, and we were not disappointed!!! 
Food 100% on point
Service 100%
Ambience casual- business casual
Kid friendly and love music which was very lovely!
Thank you for a great time!! Thank you Christian!

Found this spot in yelp and didn't disappoint! 
We ordered the steak fajitas and a combo with some pozole!! Everything was great and had such a good flavor! Usually most Mexican restaurants give you chips with salsa... Juan's flamings went all out and also besides the chips and salsa we got  with  grilled onions and peppers, bean dip and another green salsa!! The best!!

A-W-E-S-O-M-E FOOD!!!!! I haven't had Mexican food as tasty as the one at this place. Oh my goodness! And the margaritas??? To die for!!! I live in Ontario California and come to Las Vegas at least 4 times ya ear. This place is on my regular to visit from now on list. Great food, good music and great drinks! Christian the waiter was really, really nice and helpful!
And they gave me a rose for Mother's Day! How cool is that?

Great friendly customer service and quality food
The waitress checked on and chatted with us throughout our meal. The food is made from scratch from the flour tortillas to the guacamole!  The food is too quality flavored and cooked just right!
Amazing food and even better service!! Every employee was very helpful in ensuring we had a wonderful meal and experience!

First plan ahead when wanting to visit. 30-40 minute wait was for us. Let me tell you it was well worth it. The food was amazing some of the best food I found in Las Vegas. The service was by far the best everyone was so nice you couldn't even believe you are in Las Vegas... blown away from everyone definitely coming back!

I love this place! The food is by far the best Mexican food out here. The only thing I dislike is when they are packed and we have to sit in the bar. It's loud and crowded and the servers on that side don't really know what's going on. The best server is Juan. We have had him the most and he's great! The New Mexico enchalidias are to die for! Go early because if you get there around 6 there is a wait.

The tableside guacamole is the bomb! The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was lively. This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. You must try the Parrillada De Mariscos.

I might have been in a review funk when I wrote my first review of this place. I thought it was strange that it had so many great reviews when I just couldn't seem to see past mediocrity.  I am glad I gave the place another try. My previous experience is leaps and bounds different from today's experience.

As soon as we stepped into the restaurant, the owner greeted us. Our server Amanda was very knowledgeable about the food. She made our guacamole at the table to our liking (e.g., jalapeños, onions, cilantro, salt, pepper, tomatoes). She also waited for us to try the guacamole to ensure we were happy, which is part of my definition of exceptional service. The chips were fresh, light, and crispy. Together this was a great beginning to our meal. 

Amanda then made some recommendations for entrées.  I love when servers take the time to make recommendations or ask if there are questions about the menu. All too often I get servers that approach the table and ask, "Are you ready to order?" or "Have we decided what were going to have?" as though they are in a rush and we are just a number. I definitely believe that good service involves finding out what your customers want - and then making recommendations that you personally know will make their experience a lasting one. 

The Parrillada De Mariscos for two was her recommendation since we both felt like seafood with a Mexican flare. This is a sizzling fajita style fish platter with scallops, white fish, shrimp, onions, and whole roasted jalapeños.  I wasn't courageous enough to bite into a whole jalapeño, but the flavor seeped into the seafood adding just that right amount of temperature and flavor to the combination of seafood. Plus, some color on top of all that sizzling yummy seafood whiteness was definitely well needed. 

The tortillas were offered in either flour or corn. We were able to watch the tortillas being made fresh in the corner of the restaurant. The restaurant also has flowers throughout in beautiful vases. 

Dessert was heavenly fried ice cream. I have had Mexican fried ice cream before at other Mexican restaurants, but this was scrumptious. The corn flakes seemed to coat the French vanilla ice cream like a puzzle. Then it was lightly drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with whipped cream - and yes, a maraschino cherry.

I will come visit again!
Delicious and affordable for the average person. Live mush on Friday nights. Their souls are tasty too.

This place was delicious. I love that they put out onions and jalapenos with the chips. Huge quantities of food and their tortillas are homemade. The service was excellent. Our server was super friendly. Unfortunately after a day or 2 this review will be taken down because 7 of my 8 past legitimate reviews have been taken down as not recommended. If this does stay up go to flaming fajitas. Its good stuff.

This place is awesome soon ask we enter the door we were greeted and sat right away. We sat down and immediately was serve Chips and Salsa delicious! And fajitas were the best i ever had seriously will be back.

I never heard about this place until my girlfriend dragged me in.  To me, Mexican food and the experience that comes with it is the same across the board.  This place got me excited to eat Mexican food!  The presentation of the "flaming fajitas" is so fun.  From the chips / salsa, to the beans, rice, tortillas, and meats,  it all tasted great!  The fideo soup is great as well.  The service was on point.  The staff was prompt and friendly yet not overly intrusive.  A must try if you're looking for good Mexican food.

I have been here twice now, the first time if I was to rate it I would of given it a 5/5, last time we were on the barside maybe that is why. But the last time I went here it was such a let down. I had a group of four for lunch at 2 pm, we were all seated quickly. Nobody really enjoyed the food all found it bland and the server refilled my drink wrong. I am not sure what happened from the first time I was here. My dads order was wrong, my food didn't come out as I ordered. He forgot our sides that we had asked. Maybe It just wasn't their day today.

and to make it worse, it was EXTREMELY cold in here. Like everyone was runny nose cold. I was literally freezing. and my dad who keeps the house at 68, was even cold and the man never gets cold.

Everyone is extremely welcoming and nice though. Just maybe caught them on an off day.

I just want to say I don't really even like Fajitas unless they are with lettuce, tomato and cheese.  Juan's have the best Fajitas I have ever had and I ate them just like they said to.  
This place is off the chain good.  The staff and the food are better than most of the 5 star places I have been at.  the chips and re-fried pork beans (on the house by the way) are the Bomb....  You MUST try this place if you are in Vegas.  You won't be disappointed.

Didn't hate it but expected.. more? The servers were all awesome! Super friendly and attentive. The complimentary chips & salsa were good. We had to wait on a Saturday at 12pm, which I thought was kind of odd... but this place was crowded! Reminded me of Lindo's but more sports bar(ry). It is up there in price range for Mexican food for sure. The tostada salad was good - the shell was the best part, perfectly fried :) Maybe I should have ordered the fajitas, since that is what they are known for but I don't see the hype for this place. I'd pick Lindo's over this any day.

Came for the first time with family. Didn't even know this jewel was near my place. Ordered the Enchiladas Suizas and those were amazing. Had the Queso Fundido as well....super dope. Definitely a fan.
Wow.... Fajitas were incredible. Service 1st class. For a Texas Guy I was really pleased.  If you are staying on the strip- its worth the little drive ! Just do it ! Also... Sopapillas ... perfect.

This is by far our favorite Mexican restaurant. We have been going there for a few years now and have never had a bad experience.
The food is consistently good, the service is great. Staff is friendly and service is fast and friendly even when they are very busy. (and they can get VERY busy at times)
We love their flaming fajitas (shrimp and/or steak) and the fact that you can choose between rice and beans on the side, or fresh healthy veggies, which are NEVER mushy or overcooked.
Some of our favorites are the Beef Taquitos, the Table Side Guacamole, the Shrimp Ceviche and those wonderful roasted Jalapenos and onions they serve for free when you first sit down. 
Portions are big, we always end up eating too much, but food is just so good you can't help but stuff your face.
Margaritas are fantastic too. 
The place is family friendly, good prices for what you get, great for dining with your kids.

I don't know why I waited so long to come here! This place is legit. Great customer service and amazing food. Will definitely be returning to try more on their menu. I had the medium size bowl of menudo.. It was almost as good as my dads home cook menudo. I also had a strawberry margarita mmmmm so good!! My new favorite Mexican restaurant!!
Good food and drinks.  Happy hour from 3-7pm.  Salsa, bean dip and onions/peppers with chips for free.  I will definitely be back.

We are from Colorado and decided to try Juans after doing a little research.  Let's face it - most Mexican restaurants are not really authentic but "Americanize" their dishes to fit everyone's boring concept of Mexican food.  Not this place!  The food here is the real deal.  Salsas were flavorful and the sautéed onions and chiles were delicious!  We think these were poblano and not jalapeno chiles - very good!  We had green chile and steak picado and both were very tender and yummy!  You can tell that the owners have put some thought into their menu choices and the ingredients they use.  We will recommend this to our friends that live in Vegas and anyone who will be visiting.  Great margaritas and greatfood
Great food ! Good margaritas ! Good service wasn't expecting great Mexican food in Nevada visiting from Texas
Very good vegetarian options. the best fire roasted veggie enchiladas. The fajitas are really good too. I have been back over 10 times. Good go to mexican restaurant.

First time in here and well worth the drive from the other side of town. I love Mercados when we're there for soccer games and will have to rethink as the chicken enchiladas were fantastic in the red sauce. Service was excellent and even the manager Juan stopped after walking by hearing us say the food smelled so amazing!  I hope they open another one in Henderson otherwise we'll just make the drive!

Best Mexican I have had in a long time. Fajitas are awesome. The service was extremely good. TVs to watch the bball game was added surprise. Don't eat at the strip in Vegas. Come out here. MUCH BETTER.

Service was outstanding across the board. Everyone was super friendly. 
Had the steak fajita nachos. They were ok. Usually I love nachos...these were good, just not great.

Fantastic and authentic Mexican food. They are also plant based friendly. The service is top notch as well. They are all super friendly and super attentive. There's typically a long wait for dinner so be ready to stand in line. It's worth it though.

Okay. I'm a Vegas local and it took me this long to hear about this place. I was recently recommended and was shocked at the good reviews and how I never heard of this place before! Came here on a Saturday night and boy, it was packed! The wait for 2 was about 20 minutes. We walked out for 10 minutes and came back. We started realizing many groups who got here after us got seated. Roughly about a total of 30 minutes I checked with the hostess and realized our name was called way long ago (when we stepped outside in the first 10 minutes of putting our name down). The hostess quickly apologized and sat us down immediately. 

The vibe is so cool, almost like you're in little Mexico! You get complimentary chips & dip, grilled peppers/onions and soup. We ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for 2 which was way more than enough for 2 people! Everything was so fresh and delicious! Totally worth the hype. 

I cannot wait to come back! This place is also great for kids and big groups of families!

My wife and I just ate there not 10 minutes ago. We enjoyed our meal, the food was good, and everything was delivered promptly. 
The problem came when I noticed a bug swimming in my beer. Keep in mind, we had already signed our check and were finishing our meal. I discreetly let an employee know and a "manager" came to talk with us. Instead of showing any concern, she argued that it was just a cluster of bubbles. WHAT DO YOU THINK MADE THE BUBBLES? She then wanted to filter the beer through a napkin to "test" what it was. THE LEGS WERE STILL MOVING! All of this was in front of other customers. 

In short: 
- we paid for our meal
- the food was good
- INSPECT YOUR FOOD OR DRINK!

I think I just found my second favorite Mexican restaurant aside from Red Iguana in Salt Lake City.  The chips were hot and had the right amount of saltiness.  Four different items are served with the chips and each as equally good as the other.  Hand made tortillas were served with the fajitas.   The chicken had great seasoning and the right amount of char and even had a touch of flare with a fire bath before serving.  So good!   Total bill for two during lunch was $24.

This is our go to place to watch football. The bean dip and salsa is great and the football menu is cheap and delicious. Don't miss the mexi-fries! Only complaint is that they recently installed video poker machines in the bar. Now there's no bar space to sit and eat.

My first visit was a burrito which was bland and painfully average. The service is amazing, the chips and bean dip are great and the price is good. Have been back several times with better success. The flash fried jalapeños they give with the chips are amazing. The guacamole tacos are also great and more filling then you would think.

Not only good, but friendly!  As in, as I walked in on a rainy night, 4 people I know came over to say hi.  So that's where you've all been!  Really, really good fajitas.  Really, really good margaritas.  I'm coming back!

Stopped in with the GF to meet a buddy and his wife for lunch.  The day was rainy and cool; the lighting was dim and coozy; the sizzling sounds and heat from nearby fajita platters kept us warm.  They have a three dollar margarita that will keep you entertained while consuming delicious salsa, bean dip and chips.  The salsa is fantastic.  The smoky flavor reminded me of a favorite haunt back in my home town.

The GF and I split a delicious chicken fajita quesadilla.  Looking forward to trying a flaming plater of meat and vegetables in the future.  Alas, a majority of lunch consisted of $3 dollar margaritas.

The service was at times a little slow, but the server would make up for it with his friendly demeanor.

As the rain continued to fall and eventually start flooding nearby Tropicana.  With check having been paid, I made a run at the cantina.  The bartender was friendly and served up a mean margarita that had a lot more soul and booze than the tres buck version.

Been going to Juans since they opened. Eaten there numerous times and never been dissatisfied. Food is delicious, service amazing , and prices very reasonable. The atmosphere is great and staff incredibly friendly. They even have live music on weekend. Singer has amazing voice but I think he has me figured out. Can't help but think of my grandma when he sings. Tears in my tacos but still yummy.

The food here was very good and I recommend the fajitas. It's a show when they come out, everyone turns their heads and wonders what you ordered. Sit at the bar, the main bartender is quick on customer service.
Visiting from California. My niece found this place. What a suprise. Great food drinks and service. Coming back to Vegas in feb. Will definitely be back. Little far from strip but worth the drive.

Stopped in on a Thursday for lunch. Place was packed. Service was speedy except for the missed napkins I had to request a couple of times. Food was mediocre I thought as well as my dining partner. Ordered a chimichanga & it wasn't crispy or hot. Rice & refired beans were not warm either. Sadly disappointed. Maybe I should have ordered the fajitas as they light them on fire tableside (would have been warm @ least). The old SuperMex on Green Valley Parkway & Pecos had the best chimis. 3 for the great service when they were packed.

There are a ton of really high reviews here, and I love mexican food so I was excited to try this place out, but my experience doesn't reflect a similar experience. 

The chips were okay, kind of thin and tasted like some cheap supermarket chips. The salsa and beans were alright, not special but not bad at all. The non-custom standard guacamole was really good, but that was about the only thing I had that could be called really good. 

My main meal was the flautas combination plate with grilled veggies. The veggies included broccoli which was absolutely ruined. It was grilled fast on high heat, which ended up just burning and charring the florets, and that's a very bad flavor to add to broccoli. The flautas themselves were okay, not special, I just kind of ate them until I was tired of them and didn't take home any leftovers. I feel like that's almost worse than giving me bad food. At least make me have an opinion about it, right? The shell was also cooked a bit too much, so was hard to cut through.

The wife was also unhappy with her meal, I forget what exactly she got but the tortilla it was wrapped in was super soggy on the bottom and not all that pleasant to eat. 

The staff, however, was great. They were very attentive and treated us great. I'll definitely give this place a second chance for sure, if for no other reason than to try their custom guacamole option made table-side. Hopefully this was just a bad outing and they will live up to all these other high praise reviews next time.
Awesome food. Had the carne a sada burrito with chips and salsa togo, it was delicious!

I love me some fajitas so since it's in the name of this place it should be good. Note that I said "should be" good. I want to first point out that the service here was great. Our waiter came back to see if we needed anything and even brought more then 1 bean dip and salsa for the table without us asking. Most of the time you get a tiny cup to share with a group of people but these were decent sized salsa and bean dips and requesting more was no charge. I didn't care for the salsa and it was thin. The bean dip was good and liked by our table. A cup of Fideo soup was included with the meal and it was really good. For dinner I had a 2 item combo. Chili Relleno, Cheese Enchilada and of course rice and beans. The beans were good because it was probably the same bean dip we were eating previously. The rice was dry and nasty. My plate was swimming in red sauce and some of it was soggy. The relleno wasn't great but I did enjoy the enchilada, soggy and all. This plate could have had less sauce so you could get more flavor from what was under it. My wife and a friend had fajitas and I ended up eating a couple. The meat was tough and chewy and the vegetables weren't even cooked. My wife is also in love with avocados and was not pleased with their guacamole at all. Maybe we came on an off night because this appears to be a popular place and the restaurant had plenty of customers in it. I just can't say I ate anything that I would come back for.

This is a place that understands you have to do something to stand out in a city where there are many good/great places to eat. Instead of being just another boring Mexican joint, Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina does a lot of little things to set themselves apart from the rest.

The chips came with two kinds of salsa, beans and grilled onions and chilies. They gave everyone a very good cup of soup prior to the meal. The flaming Fajitas were a nice touch and the food was great.

Highly recommend this place and will be a regular spot on our next trip.

We had steak and shrimp fajitas for two.  The shrimp was large and flavorful, the steak was tender and tasty.  Their were grilled onions and red and green bell peppers mixed in with the fajitas.  The server brought the fajitas to the table in this large cast iron pot and set them on fire at our table!  

The servers were very attentive and by checking in at Yelp, we got a 15% discount off of our bill!  Our sever gave us a free flan just because I mentioned it was my first time there!

All in all, we had an enjoyable evening and we will definitely go back again!

I absolutely LOVE this restaurant. You might have to wait for a bit to get a table, but once you're seated, you're in for a great time, every time. We normally sit in the bar area since it's a lot less noisy than the other dining area. The bartenders are friendly and attentive. Vinny is THE BEST. When they bring out the jalapeños and onions, ask for them to be extra crispy and put some lime on them. Delicious!! There isn't one thing on their menu that isn't fantastic. Hands down, one of the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas.

My son tried this place one time before and knowing how I like fajitas he suggested we all come here for dinner. The wait was about 30-40 mins, which wasn't bad at all. The chips and salsa was awesome and the place smelled really good. 
We all ordered fajitas. My son and his fiancé got the Shrimp for 2, I got the steak and her mom got the chicken. The presentation was awesome how they come out and set it on fire right in front of you. Then he placed them on our table and right away my first comment was "wow that's a lot of onions" 
It was basically lots of Onions, meat and a little bit of bell peppers. No flavor but onions. I whispered to my son, "can you taste the fajita flavor? Cause I just taste onions" He said he must have been really hungry the first time he came because it's not that good today. 

The Margaritas were awesome and so was our server. 
I'll probably come back and try something else, just not the fajitas.
Great fun place always enjoy it here. Great margaritas and appetizers. Really good place to take guest from out of town. The flavor of Mexico in Las Vegas

I've heard so much good things about juans and always drive by it and it's always packed! I usually don't crave Mexican but we gave it a shot! As soon as we seated they served FRESH chips and three salsas and a side of peppers and onions. The fajita for one or two is a must! We tried the chicken and the presentation alone was awesome! They flavors were great while sizzling on the pot and smothered with cheese. We both were served sopa fideo, which of course was tasteful. We will definitely be back for more! They also have happy hour on drinks and food daily from 3p-7p. The service was also great, the buzzer and server were on top of everything.

This place is sooo damn far from where I live so I wasn't sure if it'll be worth coming.. my friend recommended this place to me so I came with my cousins.. the staff is really nice our server was Herran.. he suggested some really good alcohol drinks and food.. he kept coming back to make sure everything was good and that we didn't need anything else.. if I'm ever on this side again I'll be sure to come again

Great chicken fajitas. They actually add accelerant and flame them up at your table. Our waiter wasn't very attentive, but the person who filled our drinks was very attentive. He deserved the tip that I left. Would recommend them for lunch or dinner. You won't be disappointed.

Arrived on a Thursday around 4pm, seated right away. not too crowded but busier within the hour .server came right away. got two HH house margaritas, which were good. have had better and worse. good for the price, chips and salsa were brought out right away. 2 salsas & beans. also plate with cooked onions & peppers = good. I ordered the HH carnitas  quesadilla which I thought was Very good & would order again. wife had the Chapala Seafood Quesadilla which was GREAT. so glad she shared. service was very good, efficient but not overbearing. would return again when visiting LV  and would like to try other menu items. this is one of the better off strip places I have dined in LV.

Rolando is the best bartender ever! The fajitas are seasoned so well and the fire show at your table makes it even more fun! I hardly ever Yelp about restaurants but this is a place I want to keep around. I absolutely love this place! Service and food are way above par!

The best Fajitas in LV. Great service too....can't go wrong with this place. Chips come with not only salsa but with bean dip. Quick tip...the bean dip they serve is NOT vegetarian. They do however serve a vegetarian version of it...just ask. They make their own tortillas...to-order. Generous portions and about a 20 min drive from the strip. Well worth the drive.

FIRST TIMER!!

First impression, kind of quiet, but maybe we got here right before the rush? No complaints here! This was also a Monday night. 

Very low key restaurant ambience.

Great food, actually it was so much food we could have only ordered one entree! 

The chips and dip were amazing!! I could eat these every day! 
We also ordered the chicken taquitos appetizer, these were okay. 

Then we ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for two! Lots and lots of food!! Actually too much! 

This is definitely a place I will return to!
Ryder loved Marcos so much, you made his night thank you so much he loves you and your guitar

This place simply has excellent food and excellent service. The free chips and salsa always come out very quick and fresh. The quality of the food is really good, and they give you good portion sizes. I always order one of their margaritas, and they definitely hit the spot. I highly recommend the fajitas of course, and they come with fresh tortillas that are made in house. This place is definitely a must try, and surely it will not disappoint.

Hooray for Juan's!!   We've now visited twice.   Once for lunch and once for a busy Friday night dinner.   

On both visits, we were greeted immediately.  They have great customer service here.  The waitstaff and hostesses do an amazing job!  Chips, bean dip, salsa and sautéed toppings are brought out with seconds of sitting down.   Fabulous!  The sautéed toppings include onions, jalapeños and red hot peppers.   Yummy!  

With the dinner entrees, their soup is brought out for the table.   It's delicious!  Great flavor!  Honestly I was almost full after the chips and soup! It seemed as if it were 2 seconds after I finished my soup were our entrees delivered.   On our first visit, we had to order the flaming fajitas of course!   What a show!!    The mound of meat and veggies on this are sure to fill anyone's appetite.   They were absolutely delicious and would highly recommend them!   On my second visit I wanted to try the shrimp tacos.  Again, fabulous flavor and filled with a lot of shrimp!  On both occasions I ordered the grilled vegetables instead of the rice and beans.  It's a great side item that compliments any meal.  

Our drinks never went empty and our stomachs were filled to the brim!  A fabulous restaurant!  Thanks Juan's!

Arrived during a weekend night for my birthday dinner.  The foyer was packed with patrons waiting for a table. Thanks to Terri R who made reservations days in advance. Once we told the hostess who we were they immediately took us to our table that already had  menus, place settings, plus we each had our own chips, bean dip and salsa already set on the table! I had brought some cupcakes and the host offered to store in their refrigerator as well. What nice start!

Menu featured their signature Flaming Fajitas, with choice of beef, pork,chicken or shrimp. You can do an individual order or a combo for two which included your choice of 2 meats. The latter being the better deal at $25.95. The extensive menu also included combination plates, vegetarian dishes, specialty entrees, tacos and enchiladas.

Mr. B. got an order of tacquitos for appetizers. It was an unexpectedly huge order too.  This alone could be a meal. It sure was plenty to share with our group. The complimentary bean dip was my favorite side. The beans whipped smooth and delicious!  It was quite addicting.
  
So our orders of the flaming fajitas were presented at the same time. All three were lighted simultaneously right at our table. Flames shooting a good 3 feet! You could even feel the heat! (http://instagram.com/p/jGA9r1jSB9/ ) It went out like a flash and charred the fajitas perfectly. The beef was tender, well marinated, good southwest flavor and seasoning. Grilled onions and green peppers were right texture as well. We each had our fajitas in sterno heated griddles that kept our fajitas sizzlin throughout our meal.

Service from beginning to end..MUY BIEN! Great teamwork by all staff. They were not only gracious enough to store my birthday cupcakes, little did I know my awesome friends also had a birthday cake for me which they not only stored but they provided the candles and brought out the cake lit up and sang HBD, maracas, sombrero and all!

Atmosphere was festive and family friendly. Large dining area, can accommodate large groups. The bar is in a separate section. It's also cool place to watch sports with tvs around the dining area.
 
So summing it all up: 

Festive + FUNtastic + Foodielious Flaming Fajitas + F(ph)enomenal Friends + Forty Niners(cake https://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/photo/YUjPn82nej6E1xy5M4Wtdw/l.jpg) = FIVE Star FAB Fifty Birthday dining experience!

I heard a lot about this place and was excited to try it. Disappointed- by the experience and food. It was very crowded! The fajitas were not anything special. It was fun to see the flame but other than that nothing to talk about. I will not go back.
Excellent food and very attentive service. Give these folks a try. You won't be disappointed!

We have had dinner here several times and have had a great meal each time!  The food, service, and atmosphere are all great!  This is way better than anything you'll get on the strip, so if you are looking to venture off-strip, this is a fantastic place to go!  We will be back again the next time we are in Vegas!

Back again...... Best Mexican Food in Vegas !!!!! Love the ambiance, the service and of course the prices, wouldn't dare go anywhere else, if your unsure come anyways and I promise you won't be disappointed ...

Here's how it went down.   Seated down nicely and the waiter took our order in a timely matter.  The chips and salsa arrived, we ordered and the food came shortly after. I got the tamale and burrito combo.  The tamale came with green sauce which was pretty good.  However, the beef burrito with the red sauce was extremely salty.  It was probably the sauce which probably came out of a can that did it.  It was so salty that the next few hours I had a raised heart rate!  I am healthy that wasn't the issue.
The service was very good and polite but attendants asked one too many times how we were doing.   Another thing I thought the utensils were too cheap and fit for camping.   You would think they would have better ones.   Since they do lit the fajitas on fire next to your table, the place tends to get smoky as will your clothes.  It would have been a better experience and the rating better if only they wouldn't put a ton of salt on the food!   One's health matters most than anything else doesn't it?

Finally a solid Mexican feast that can fit into my low-carb lifestyle! Skipped the chips and salsa, but ate the grilled onions and peppers that come with it! Those peppers have some heat to them. What a pleasant surprise!

Ok, so I read a few reviews that said the food is not spicy at all.  I lean toward my food extremely spicy. They happily brought out a dish of habanero sauce but gave warning to use very little, since it was extremely HOT!!! I think I was more amused as they watched the "little lady" (ME) douse my food in it and eat ALL of it. Love that they have the option of grilled veggies instead of rice and beans.  

I will say the carnitas was a bit dry and not the best I've had, but was fine with a bit of salsa and hot sauce mixed with all the veggies, it was more like a nice Mexican stirfry.    My husband got the "flaming" steak fajita, which is impressive at they brings it out a sizzling cast iron pan with a flame under it to keep it well...sizzling.  My husband enjoyed his feast of  fajitas with surprisingly flavorful rice, beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, guac, and  corn tortilla.  Guess what? We were pleased our food was not drowning in cheese, nor was needed or missed.  However, these servers were nice and attentive and I am sure they would have brought some cheese out if we requested.  

I am sure to be back, nice service, decent Mexican food (finally!).  The Cantina looks entertaining as it is big lined with tvs, has a full bar, and even an outdoor area,  but it was empty since it was just shy of noon on a Monday?  Luckily they also have 4 TVs in the dining area too.   The drink specials look decent, affordable, and even tasty. 

My one negative, is that I am not a fan of "rustic" aka cheesy Mexican decor and this place was dressed just like that...however, I focused my eyes on a 26th seed beating Serena Williams at Wimbledon.   Awesome that they had it on!

We went last night in the food was excellent! We ordered chicken fajitas with shrimp. We ordered it with vegetables instead of rice and beans. The shrimp was so flavorful and thick . They had a man singing just about any spanish song we requested...beautiful voice. The service waa great and so was the Margaritas. Everyone in my group was happy I found this restaurant, thAnks to YELPs reviews.  The onions and chile came with the chips amd salsa that was different,but good. We will be back very soon.

This place rocks! Cant believe I've never been here in the last 4+ years living a minute away. Now I know why its always busy. Best quesdillas, better than Cafe Rio and the overpriced places on the strip. Did wish they come with rice and salsa. Fajitas are defintiely big enough for 3-4 people. Free chips and salsa and soup during dinner dine in. Super friendly service too, but very busy on weekends. Happy hour everyday and great prices.

Excellent! The food, service, and friendliness were all 5-star! I loved that the chips and salsa came with onions and jalapeños! The fideo soup was perfect, too! My mom and I shared the pork and steak fajitas
and had plenty to take home. Our server, Omar, even lit them on fire for us a second time because the baby liked it so much!

Thank you, Shirley B, for choosing Juan's Flaming Fajitas for your birthday celebration. If not for you, I probably wouldn't have made it to this place. I also probably wouldn't have developed an obsession with homemade flour tortillas, either! Yes, it's that good, and I can't stop thinking about it...

Okay, concentrate Suzy. Let's write about the other awesome stuff:

Service.
The water/sodas were filled continuously throughout our meal. Endless warm chips, salsa, and delicious bean dip were replenished quickly. Too quickly! Food delivery was speedy, too. Shirley B & Terri R both brought outside desserts and the staff was more than happy to supply the candles we forgot (oops!) and present it with an enthusiastic birthday song and sombrero for the birthday girl! Awesome, friendly, and efficient staff!

Value.
I don't frequent Mexican restaurants very much, but I think it's a great deal. All entrees include unlimited chips/salsa, fideo soup, choice of vegetables or rice/beans. Our party ordered the infamous fajitas. Get the combo if you're sharing, it's definitely worth the price. Even the other items, such as the big bowl of pozole my boyfriend ordered was only $4.95. 

Food Taste:
I've had the shrimp fajitas. Big shrimps! My party loved them and Chad S loved his carne asada burrito. We've returned back a 2nd night and we ordered the Dulce De Leche Fried Ice Cream. Yum! We have to go back to try their Sopapillas, for sure!

Homemade Flour Tortillas. (Yes, it's that good)
I've been a deprived girl who hadn't been exposed to authentic tortillas very often. From now on, I'll be comparing future flour tortillas to Juan's. And yes, I know, if you're eating authentic Mexican food, you're supposed to be eating corn tortillas. But I can't help it, I love them! Served piping hot, it's so delicious that you can just eat it by itself. Or with a bit of their bean dip. It's worth the drive just for these. I'm planning my next trip there as I write this...

There's TVs to watch the game, decently clean restrooms, and has a very festive atmosphere like most good Mexican joints. Come here for your next fajita fix. But bring me back more tortillas. ;)

Had to check this place out with such a high rating!

After a fun filled day of adventures we were starving driving back into Vegas so I went into my bookmarks and decided we were going to finally come here. I have to say this place is doing it! Lots of people waiting to be seated when we came in and when we came out. That's always a good sign!

It's crazy loud. Lots of celebrations going on everywhere and tons of tv's all around playing multiple games. I wasn't into all the tv's and it made it feel somewhat of a sports bar and the decor wasn't my favorite either as it was a tad on the commercial side. It reminded me of visiting the super touristy spots in Mexico that I didn't enjoy too much. But everything else was great.

The service is very friendly. The food was delicious & filling, especially if you're extra hungry and the best part was the older gentleman walking around singing Spanish songs with his guitar. What a nice touch! Also ~ all Yelp check-ins receive 15% off! Thanks Yelp! 

We of course had to try the fajitas and they are cooked in front of you sparking a fire that warms the entire room and I had a cheese enchilada with a hard chicken taco that were very flavorful. Everything was great and it's definitely a very fun and energetic place. Expect a possible wait time as this place is very popular.
Really enjoyed the Flaming Fajitas, the chips and salsas are great. And of course the Fried Ice Cream.  This place has a real Mexican flavor. The prices are reasonable.

My families favorite place for Mexican food. Always busy, but we don't mind as the food is the best. We used to go to Lindo Michoacán's in green valley, but the view is better than their food.

I recommend to every one I can, friends from Alberta, Canada and friends who live here and haven't been. Keep it up!!

This place is great! I've visited twice now and have enjoyed the atmosphere and food each time. Of course, order the fajitas...I've had the vegetable fajitas, shrimp fajitas, and chicken fajitas. The shrimp fajitas were definitely the best. They're cooked perfectly and the caramelized onions on the skillet are amazing. The wait time can get pretty long if you go around the 5PM hour on a friday or weekends...but I would say it's work the wait.
Came in today for early dinner ! Came in for happy hour, had to have their delicious food ! And was really needing a Margarita. Our favorite Mexican restaurant. Good food and great service.
Their Pozole is yummmmmmmyyyy.  Their food in general is really good. I like the atmosphere and the service. Great place
Good food but I'm from S.Texas so I'm kind of jaded when it come to great fajitas. drinks are kind of pricey

This place is so good. They serve the best authentic steak tacos in town, all for a good price. If I want to go to a good Mexican restaurant I'm going to this place.(Do NOT go here on Saturday night, it is super crowded, if you are coming here on Saturday night I recommend making a reservation.) All and all one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants in the city

Came here because of Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! The best salsa ever. Chips were good though they could have been served hotter. The service was super friendly and the kids menu had lots of options. Small guacamole was worth the extra expense and the bean dip and grilled onions they serve with the salsa were excellent. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars because the fajitas were a bit - well - boring actually. Very well made and fresh ingredients but lacking the seasoning and juiciness I've had from other places. But still - overall an excellent meal and I will definitely be back the next time we are in LV.
Really good service and the fajitas are great. Huge portions - you won't leave hungry!
Gluten free friendly the shrimp are always cooked perfect. Chips come out hot. Love the grill onions and jalapeño on the side.
Everything is excellent about this restaurant. The bean dip is out of this world. Wait staff was awesome. Good thing we live out of town or we would be there every night.

My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Chips and salsa are perfection, Fajitas were excellent, enchiladas were delicious!! Nice employees, good prices. All in all a great experience and a wonderful authentic meal. Will be back very soon.

Incredible customer service! We go about 2 times a month since we are near by for doctor appointments. First time we stopped by during lunch and got the fajitas lunch. Almost didn't eat because the chips and salsa can fool you into getting full before food comes out. The entire staff are always friendly and coming by to check on how we are doing! Definitely our go to when in the area!
My husband and I ate here for lunch. Very friendly staff. Our glasses never got half empty. The food is wonderful. Very fresh.
Overrated. Took over 30 minutes to get fajitas. No desire to return

On the weekend of November 26, 2017 our family visited Juan's Flaming Fajitas. In fact we came all the way from Texas to celebrate our Mother/Grandmothers Birthday. First let me say the food was really good. In fact it was excellent. But the service was amazing. We actually had 50 plus people come from Texas. They let us set up a surprise party for her on their patio. Their staff went above and beyond to accommodate us. If you want to eat good food with a side of A+ service, visit this amazing place. The Casias would like to thank Juan (the owner) for what he did for us and for making our Mother's Birthday Special. Thank you.

Came in with a group of four coworkers for their lunch menu- several plates available, along with combinations consisting of tacos, burritos, flautas, tamales, and such. Nothing too complicated, most dishes $10-12.

Interior of restaurant is nice and service is polite but painfully slow.
Complimentary chips, salsa, and beans stave off hunger, but after half an hour (and being one of few tables, early on a weekday), no one had been served. We let the staff know we would need to get our orders to go, and it still took an additional 15 minutes until we were brought our food and checks.
No one ordered anything more complicated than tacos, burritos, and a chicken breast. We were never given an explanation for the delay. 

CHILE RELLENO: overly battered but tasty, not spicy, quite cheesy.
GREEN CHILE PORK BURRITO: wrapped in a flour tortilla, dry, more like an enchilada than a burrito. Didn't care for this.
Side of GRILLED VEGGIES was an odd assortment of broccoli, cauliflower, and squash- considering this is a Mexican restaurant I kind of expected onions and peppers, maybe mushrooms and squash, so it was an odd but tasty.

Restaurant entrance has several posters with their daily specials, and they also offer a HH and MNF specials. Seems like the fajitas are the best thing to get here, given the name and the fiery presentation.

Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is probably one of the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to...  Great service, nice atmosphere, tasty drinks and the food is SO, SO good. I have had the "Moriscos Adobados" witch is shrimp, scallops over a base fillet in adobado sauce  3 times now and it is out of the world..  If I had to say anything bad about the place, there always seem to be a waiting list to get in, but being so good, I understand...  I have marked this the best Mexican restaurant of anywhere I have been... Gracias to the help and owners....
Happy hour until 7! Great food. Great margaritas and a good atmosphere for families or just friends.
Come here at least once a month with my family. Food is 5 stars, only gave it 4 stars for our server who seemed kind of grumpy. Not worth giving them a bad review because I love this place though!

Delicious!! Highly recommend this place. The hubby and I filled our faces with chips and salsa/bean dip before our entree came. Chips tasted homemade. We had the two person fajitas chicken, steak & shrimp. It was so yummy. Tortillas were homemade and the rice/beans were tasty. We def will be coming back. Not only was the food delicious but the service was great.
Amazing food.  4 days in Vegas and we had 2 dinners here. Deserts were great.  Drinks are awesome. Service was super.  I couldn't say more

This is a great restaurant if you're looking for good Mexican good on the west side of town. I found this yesterday and have driven by and never stopped. Discovering the great service and food was a real winner for the week. Get here early as by 4:00 the lines start and the food was to write home for !!!  Go try...

How did we not know about this place with our umpteen trips to Vegas? What a find! My hubby and I shared some chicken and shrimp fajitas. Yum, yum, yum!!! There is a tortilleria inside the restaurant where they are making fresh corn and flour tortillas! Before they bring your food, you are served with a generous bowl of corn chips, salsa, refried beans and a small dish of sautéed onions and jalapeños.If you mix everything together, what a fantastic combination! Be sure to save some of this fabulous onion and pepper combo for your fajitas. I'm not a huge fan of mariachis, mostly because they're so loud and in your face. There was a solo singer, not a mariachi, with a guitar and a lovely voice. The wait staff was fantastic too. They constantly check on you and are very happy to do so. Our waiter, Omar, was kind enough to tell me about a yelp coupon for checking in. This was great food, the house was packed, the service was excellent and we'll definitely be back!!!
This place is amazing! The fajita's are always a good amount and they have customer service! We went for a birthday party and they were super festive. Don't a place your want to go again!

Went by reviews and really thought this place would be amazing but what  a disappointment  to start I order a mango margarita that tasted nothing like mango. It was bitter and sour.  My tacos were made with flour tortillas that tasted sweet. Not so happy about the whole deal.

One of our favorite restaurants! The service is hit and miss sometimes though but the food and margaritas is always great! I brought in a large party once and one of the women in the front had an attitude with me but other than that, it's always been a good meal.
Good surprise I don't like Mexican food too much but my wife felt like fajitas and we tried the chicken and shrimp fajitas and it was great.

Seated within seconds of arriving at 5pm. The second we sat down there was food at table (chips and 6 trays of 3 sauces), the staff treated us well, they were engaged, joking, and happy to see us. The bus boy Manuel was working SO HARD bringing so many sauces and refills. Good food from a Puerto Rican's POV (excellent soup- brings back memories). Off the strip, I'd rather have a trusted food joint and this is IT. Again, incredibly fast service, large portions, overall 5 stars!

This was such a pleasant surprise indeed. We are vacationing from Australia and asked Siri where the best happy hour Was in our area and we ended up here. So delicious, fabulous service. We're definitely coming back here again before we head back home. Highly recommended

Food was good, how ever the service was the worst we ever had, the waiter forgot about us for more than 20 minutes, he then sent over another person to take our order, never brought the drink we ordered, had to have the manager get it. when my fajitas came i asked for a plate and next thing i know, our waiter is standing around talking and forgot the plate. another person in our party's order was wrong. the 2 tables that came in after us were more important and got their food before we even ordered. when we told the manager, he was less than concerned and explained that there was a large party on the patio, like that is okay for them to ignore everyone else. would not recommend this place at all. after we said something to the manager both him and the waiter avoided our table, very unprofessional and uncaring towards their patrons.
Excellent spot! Ordered the table side guac and the chicken fajitas. We will definitely return soon!

This place is awesome!! The food is amazing. I recommend the steak with rajas and the shrimp fajitas. Drinks are nice and strong. Save room for some sopapillas at the end!!! Omar was our excellent server!!!

This place is THE BOMB!!! So awesome. Chips are thin, crispy and endless. Salsas are great. The bean dip is unique and yummy with hot cheese mixed in.
One of the best dishes are there fajitas.... Huge portion, lots of meat and veggies... And best of all... They light them up to flame at your table!  The food is excellent! Only tough part is it's always busy, so hard to get seats unless you come earlier before meal time. Worth the wait, though!! Service is great, too. Good job!!
Food here is delicious. The service was great. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed. I had steak fajitas and recommend them. I will be back for more! :)
Hands down the best Mexican food I've ever had!!! Oswaldo, our server, was fantastic!!! Impeccable service, very attentive staff and super tasty margaritas!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. I had been looking for a close replacement for my favorite Red Iguana in Salt Lake and this was just as good!  Food is amazing and the staff is awesome.  The only thing that's a little annoying is if you eat inside, everything you bring in will smell like fajitas  but that can be easily solved by eating outside. I also noticed the smell wasn't so bad when we ate in the bar area. I still love this place but wear things you can wash easily!
Seriously some great food. The service was spot on and the price was remarkable. We are looking at going back. This is our new Mexican Restaurant.

This food was sooooooooo good!!!! My family and I was here from Atlanta over the Christmas weekend and was craving some authentic Mexican food and didn't want to go to a restaurant on the Vegas Strip... This was the place.....service, food, and drinks was amazing.  I definitely will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

Great food, great service and great atmosphere. The fajitas were awesome and you can't beat their margarita's . Would highly recommend and we will be back soon. Best hidden Mexican food off of the strip

I really like this place. 

Fantastic prices on their lunch menu...even a cheap lunch margarita on the menu.

Most of the food I've had has been amazing...with a couple exceptions that were merely ok.

My favorite is the steak tacos! Muy delicioso!

The thing I really love is that when they bring you chips and salsa they also bring you been dip as well as a place with grilled onions and jalapeños. I LOVE the bean dip.

They also have patio seating, which is nice.

The staff are always friendly and helpful.

Amazing. Amazing food and amazing costumer service. Everybody works together and really on top of making sure your takin care of. We have been going here since Juan opened his resturant and been fans and regulars ever since. If you like fajitas, then this is your place to go.
Saw the other reviews and decided to give it a try. This place was awesome. The fajitas where great and the staff was extremely attentive.

Hernan was our waiter and he was exceptional. Every time our glasses were close to 1/4 empty he was refilling.

Drink were amazing, strawberry margarita and corona magarita.

Fajitas were quite a show, they looked delicious. Hernan recommended the steak and shrimp and it was money. 

The strawberry sopapita was fantastic.

Definitely recommend that you try this place , great atmosphere and service to back up great food.
We paid to view fajitas be lit on fire with a gas lighter. Not impressed. The steak quality was below average. The food was just not good.

We have been here 3 times. Once it was best fajitas ever- second time it was worse ever..third time it was average.
The prices are certainly really great especially if you get the fajitas for two.  Service is friendly and they have plenty of tables so its never going to be that busy in there. Just dont go there expecting the best mexican food you will ever have.
