Second time here and it was an absolute pleasure! We brought my father here for his birthday dinner and we had a blast. The service was stellar and the food was amazing. I recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant with amazing service.

Best place to go for the margaritas and food!!! We love it here and it is always packed!! We hate crowded places but this is worth it haha chips and salsa, and there bean dip is what we usually get full on the take our dinner home haha it's so good. One of our favorite food places in Vegas

Very good happy hour! Love their Queso fundido! The only thing we have to go extra early due to their wait times they keep going up, but we were told that they are enlarging the place soon! The food is always worth the wait and of course their margaritas are bomb!

I'm seven months away from the magical world of breakfast tacos and salsa on every corner (i.e. Austin) and taking my annualish pilgrimage to Las Vegas to party it up with my family when I have a serious craving for some southern style noms. With my favorite Mexican restaurant closed and only mediocre experiences at others in the area, I turned to Yelp to see what was new. 

Juan's was sort of on the way to the Orleans Arena, so I talked Mom into stopping there for lunch on the way to the Wranglers game. We parked right out front and headed in. Mom immediately noticed a giant jar of peppermints--a sure sign of a restaurant that cares about its patrons. We were seated promptly in a booth (always my favorite) and delivered chips, salsa and bean dip. YUM. Shortly after, complimentary vegetable soup with a tomato base. TWO YUMS. 

As far as options go, there's something for everyone. Several vegetarian dishes were offered. Mom picked the tamale and I ordered the enchiladas, which came with your standard delicious rice and refried beans. It all seemed pretty healthy, my enchiladas stuffed with zucchini, broccoli and bell peppers--unusual fillings, but I liked the mix. 

Everything was clean, including the bathrooms, and large screen TVs were scattered throughout the dining area featuring sporting events. The manager (owner?) stopped by our table for a chat and gave us the history of the restaurant and the building (formerly a BBQ place--my father would be crushed.) 

Service? Super important to me, and spot on. All in all, an excellent experience. Can't wait to go back!!

Edit: totally forgot about the onion/green pepper relish. SO GOOD. I don't usually like onions, but I ate as many as I could stuff in my mouth. They also appear to have wifi for guests, but I don't know how to get the password.
Man this place blew me away. Didn't expect to be that good but it was even better and then some. Was freakin delish lol

Great food and great service, I highly recommend this place. We were looking for a place off the strip and found Juan's Flaming Fajitas, it was awesome.  

Highly recommended.

I dined here on 12/16/14, the food was very mediocre, nothing to rave about. The service on a scale of 1 to 10 was about a 7. My margarita tasted like window cleaner, it was the weirdest thing, really bad. Also, on the way to the bathroom, there is a swinging door leading to the servers stations, I saw a server put sour cream in a container and licking his fingers, I was absolutely grossed out by this, if I had seen this prior to eating my meal, I would have left. I have a restaurant background, this is so dangerous and disgusting I am speechless!!!!

So I would like to start off by saying I have been coming here (quite often) for the last 2 years but have never gotten around to writing a review but it is long overdue!!! I usually go with my boyfriend and we always have a good time and enjoy ourselves, but we have started to request Omar because he is amazing!  I have never felt like "VIP" at a local restaurant but as soon as we sit at his table he treats us like we are family friends.   The feeling is amazing & (along with the delicious food) it keeps us coming back. 
 
We recommend the table side guacamole (extra spicy) or shrimp ceviche for apps.  They also serve sautéed peppers and onions with their complimentary chips and salsa. 
For main course the list goes on and on!  You can never go wrong with the fajitas of course, chicken and shrimp combo is our go to. 
The Guadalajara special is a MUST! We get this more often than the fajitas.... it's perfect to share after a basket of chips, salsa, & guac! 
The parrillada, carne asada a la tampiqueña, marisco adobados, and the parrillada de marisco are all delicious choices!! This place has awesome entrees that are "outside of the box" for a normal Mexican restaurant. Do yourself a favor and skip the traditional tacos and quesadilla and get one of these amazing entrees!

Had to try the fajitas.  They were flaming and yummy.  Im shocked they haven't started a fire here yet.  

The chips and salsa were also excellent.   

I would recommend this place.   The bar area does get quite loud so I would ask to sit inside in the normal restaurant.
Best Mexican in Vegas! Killer fajitas, and amazing service!!! Love this place!!

We found this place on a top ten restaurants for kids site.  It was delicious.  The chips came with two salsas a sour green delicious salsa, a cilantro red salsa And a bean dip.  We gluttons got the queso as well.  My husband thought the queso was delicious.  Everyone at our table from age 2-40 ate their meal.  The carnitas and fajitas were festive and yes you guessed it delicious.  Not even the ridiculously long wait could get me to dock a star.  My waitress got me 4-5 iced teas even though it was super busy.  If we lived in Vegas we would eat here weekly.

I kept seeing this place in my Facebook feed, so I finally went to check it out. The food was absolutely delicious. I love the fact that they gave you large quantities! The complimentary salsa, chips and bean dip were perfect. If you are able to make it during happy hour time, the portions are large and at cheaper prices. This is definitely a new favorite spot for my family!

My favorite authentic Mexican restaurant.  The fajitas are amazing, I usually order the chicken and steak fajitas.  They are delivered to our table in flames.  While we eat we are serenaded by a live singer.  Great experience.  Great food!

The Fajitas at this place are no joke, I guess they should be since that is what they are named after.  Super delicious.  I've been here I think 3-4 times so far, and I've tried the Fajitas and enchiladas, both were as good as any place I have ever eaten.  One of the things that I really like about this place is the chips n salsa they serve as appetizers.  The chips come with usually 3 or more types of salsa which are all very good, as well as comes with bean dip which is also very very good.  The atmosphere here is really nice.  They will often (usually at dinner hours) have a man playing Mexican guitar music while walking around the dinning area which is nice.  I have also been extremely amazed at how quickly the food arrives.  Normally with any Mexican restaurants, my family is able to go through 3-4 baskets of chips before our main course arrives, but here we are getting our food right around the time we finished the first basket.  Now this may depend on how busy they are, but so far I have never experienced a long wait for the food.  I will say the one downfall I experienced (which really isn't a negative on their part), is that we had to wait a long time to get seated due to them being so busy on one occasion.  This was around the dinner rush time on a weekend, so the line was all the way outside, but still it was worth the wait and I can understand why so many wanted to eat there.

My brother suggested we try this place since he and his family recently had discovered it. So glad he remembered to take us here while we were in town. 

Great authentic Mexican food, large portions and fast, friendly service. We ordered way too much food and left with two bags of Togo but that means more for later. 

Whatever you do, resist the temptation to fill up on chips and dip. 

Signature flaming fajitas: well seasoned, cooked to perfection

Menudo: flavorful and well seasoned, no gaminess to the offal

Pozole: melt in your mouth pork, one of the best pozoles I've tasted

We had early 5:00 reservations for a party of 4, our friends recommended Juan's. There was a line formed already when we got here, that's a good sign.  Located at the end, tucked in a strip mall, but ample parking. Fajitas are their specialty, seasoned beef, chicken, shrimp, pork or a combo, served on fire in a caldron with sides of refried or black beans salsa, guacamole and tortillas - husband god the steak said it was delicious. Friends got the chimmy stuffed with steak fajita, they also had some Jalisco specialties which you could order any protein (chicken, steak, fish or shrimp) and they had different combinations of sauces/vegetable specialties such as cactus, chipotle/cream/wine sauce, mole poblano, Vallarta sauce with capers and peppers, a chili/poblano cream and Monterey cheese sauce - these are great. They have an extensive menu including appetizers (excellent ceiviche), salads, soups....typical line up of enchiladas, tamales, burritos, chimmy's, combo plates. Go for their specialties of fajitas or off their Jalisco plates, u can't go wrong. Services are excellent.

Amazing food, fun atmosphere, highly recommend!!!!  One thing , went on a Tuesday : make reservation at least call and check but way worth the wait.
Best fajitas hands down. Steak and shrimp yum!!!!

I frequent all varieties of  Mexican restaurants, from Roberto's to Mundo, but Juan's Flamin' Fajita is on the do not return list after my meal. 
Many of the items that came to the table were not made in house. The chips were not fresh, some store bought variety. The salsa, despite many other reviews, was not fresh and pretty spicy. The margarita was the worst margarita I have ever purchased. The mix they use is super sweet and just plain terrible (and probably old). I tasted very little tequila and even less lime, odd for a drink that consists mainly of those two ingredients. It was so sweet  that my girlfriend couldn't even drink it (and this went completely unnoticed). 

I ordered some of their "Flamin' Fajitas," and was not impressed. It reminded me of something you could find at Chili's. The flame they give you at the table, while fun to watch, is terrible to taste. The protein was cooked beyond well done- chicken being super dry and steak being very tough. 

I will say the service was pretty good.   The manager did notice our apparent dissatisfaction with the food, but at that point we knew we were not coming back and did not even bother explaining everything we found wrong with our visit.  

Overall, it was not the worst meal I've ever eaten, but our experience was no where near five stars. 

And on an unrelated note about Juan's, the font on their menu is horrendous. It is childish and ugly, I think they should change it. However I will not be returning to check.

How have I not made a review for Juan's yet!  Fabulous! The service is always top notch, I love that all of the workers work as a team it makes everything run so smooth! The food is awesome and consistent. The fajitas really as flaming and amazing! Taquitos are good tacos are yummy everything has been great! I don't live in the Southwest at all but go that way just for Juan's! Never had any cocktails there but there's a full service bar which is awesome if we ever go without the kiddos. The only thing I really dislike is their lack of waiting area...you're constantly in someone's way when waiting and often end up standing outside. If they could figure out how to expand that area this place would be perfect!

This may be the best Mexican restaurant I've ever visited. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. Our waiter, Omar, made great suggestions and took plenty of time helping us pick out entrees since it was our first time there. Will definitely be back soon

We were waking in and heard a customer leaving say bye to Juan. We walked in said hi to Juan, and my wife told him we found him in trip advisor (5stars). Right away we were treated like old friends. We were able to make a few changes, like poblano instead of bell peppers on the fajitas. Tamale, confirmed wrapped in corn husk and not the dreaded banana leaf. When asked weather they needed sauce, the answer was no, and they did not. The pork tamale was good enough to stand on it own without being smothered in sauce. I got the chili poblano pepper and it was excellent. Chips, hot sauce red, hot sauce green, grilled onions and peppers came when we sat down. Guacamole was chunky and fresh. It is kind of a shame to visit a place so good when you are from out of town because you will come back next time, and not eat at other places. On the bright side, you know you are not going to be disappointed. Real sopapillas - puffy pillows, not the fake flat ones.
We try to come here a few times a month and we love the food and atmosphere here! Thanks Juan for you great service and friendly place to come!
Good food good drinks enjoyed my time there had a great server his name is Estevan Will visit on my next trip to Las Vegas

Okay so I took my mom to Juan's flaming fajita grill bar. She loved it. This is my second time coming here this is her first time coming here we are definitely going to be making it a ritual every time we're on this side of town to do some eating over here. This is the best restaurant so far in the valley

Quick overview: great service (5/5) and slightly above average food (3.5/5). Added bonus: they offer lettuce in lieu of tortillas for those watching carbs!

We came here on a Saturday around lunch time. There was a wait for seating, with a few customers ahead of us. So we opted for a table at the bar where we were promptly seated. 

The server quickly came to take our drink order, which consisted of a water and a small house margarita on the rocks. The margarita came out quickly. Overall, the service throughout our meal was swift & friendly. 

Complimentary chips with 2 types of salsa (red and green) and beans quickly followed. I enjoyed the red salsa. They also serve complimentary grilled jalapeños and onions. Awesome!  They were a bit salty, but I like it nonetheless. 

We ordered the chile Colorado and the flaming chicken fajitas. Both came with sope de fideo soup (noodle soup). The noodles were thick like spaghetti and there were small bits of tomato. It was okay - not my favorite version of the soup. 

The chile Colorado was okay, nothing outstanding. The flaming chicken fajitas were set aflame table side-this is what sets this Mexican restaurant apart from its fellow competitors. When I order fajitas I like 2 things 1) flavor to the meat and 2) a selection of veggies. Most fajitas have bland meat, requiring me to lime down my fajitas. These fajitas weren't bland, which I was happy about. They came with red & green peppers and onions. Not overly zealous on the veggies, but I like when I get red bell peppers so yay! for this. The fajita menu also offers lettuce wraps in lieu of tortillas.

Good food, I always like free chips and salsa and they even one up that by bringing warm free bean dip, my favorite. There was a group of us, and one guy got the chimichanga and he said it was the best he has ever eaten. I got tacos and while they were good, they definitely weren't anything to rave about. Another friend got the fajitas and he said the same thing. Nothing to overly rave about. All in all, a great place with decent prices to eat mexican food. No complaints, but nothing blows us outta the water.

This was our first time at Juans Flaming Fajitas & Cantina in Las Vegas. We had the Carnitas and the Chicken fajitas. Both were excellent. The carnitas were made in the traditional way. The table side flaming fajitas were tender and well prepared. Our server Christian was very attentive. The prices were very reasonable. They also have $4.00 margaritas on Wednesdays. Overall  a great place for lunch or dinner.

This place is so good!  The fajitas are perfect, and they fully understand that yes some people put cheese on there.  They also understand kids, so you can get a chicken quesadilla with french fries instead of rice and beans.  Quick, friendly service (almost too quick, every time I go there I almost get in a collision en route to the bathroom going past the kitchen, but I digress).  Today I got the fish tacos (grilled, at the server's suggestion) and oh my god those were tasty.  So now I'm torn between getting what I know is outstanding and searching to see if literally everything on the menu is just as great.  The struggle is real!

The wait was longer than I would have expected on a Monday night (20 minutes) but luckily there was room in the bar. 

We got there a little before 7pm and were able to order off the happy hour menu. We got the queso, which was good but more cheese than 2 people should eat in one sitting.

For my entree, I got the 2-item combo (I love a combo!) with chile rellano and chicken enchilada. I enjoyed both, especially because the chile rellano wasn't heavily coated with batter. Came with soup, which I liked so much I also had the hubby's portion. For dessert, we ordered the fried ice cream which I liked. Ice cream is a combination of 3 flavors (I think caramel, vanilla and chocolate?) and was still very cold inside the deep fried batter, but the batter was chewier than I expected.

My overall experience was good. The only thing that dampened it was there was a large projection screen in the bar, which was showing the hockey game and the table next to us was overly loud and obnoxious with their hockey commentary. But that's not Juan's fault, lol.

Been here a few times already, always for dinner and there's always a line. Don't be discouraged if you see a huge line though as it tends to move pretty quick. There's been a few times where the hosts told me it'll be a 30 min wait but in actuality it'll be closer to 10 min. 

You get complimentary chips and three different dips. I can seriously finish a whole basket of their chips because they're that good! For entrees, I usually get the steak fajitas protein style with romaine leaves (instead of tortilla) and side of steamed veggies (instead of rice and beans). Gotta balance it out after eating gorging on those chips. 

Servers are always friendly and there's never been a long wait for the food to arrive. The bus persons are quick with clearing your dishes and making sure you have everything you need. 

I haven't had a chance to try their desserts yet but that's next on my list! Will definitely be back.
Excellent food!! The service was phenomenal!!! Drinks were never empty dishes cleared quickly very friendly staff. Great service!!!!

This might be the shortest review I've ever written. The fajitas are the same exact fajitas you can order at almost any Mexican restaurant. Except they're flaming. Literally on fire. Which is awesome. Not the worst, not anything to die over. Just good.
Great service and good food!!! Went for early Mother's Day dinner and had a large group.  We all enjoyed the food and service.

One of our favorites! I'm not big on Mexican food but my wife loves it. You can definitely bet on great food, service and and overall good time. There's variety with the chips they bring out (Sautéed onions and peppers beans and salsa) and their meat is always properly cooked and seasoned. I usually get the carne asada plate because of the preparation of the steak and they also have a steamed veggies option as a side which I always get. When we don't eat at home this is one of our spots. I highly recommend it.

Absolutely amazing chips with three different awesome salsas and beans complimentary, sampler appetizer platter is to die for if you get the beef taquitos and the steak fajitas are simply the best!

Skinny margaritas are phenomenal if you ask for whole lime to add and jalapeños!

Fantastic service and authentic Mexican music!

As I sit here full and still inhaling the scent of fajitas I am very thankful to the person who recommended this place! 

The chips came out warm accompanied with salsa that had just the right amount of spice and a bean dip that reminded me of my long lost favorite Margaritas Cantina (at the old frontier casino), so of course that alone will bring me back! 

We ordered the fajitas for two people for $25 (a steal in my book) and there was more than enough meat and veggies! The meat is so tender and flavorful that I didn't really even need all the fixings. But I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh the guacamole tasted and used my chips to truly enjoy the taste instead. The rice and beans were also quite good. 

This place is about 20-25 minutes away from our house but we are already planning who we want to bring! 

P. S. Service was great!

3.75 stars. 

Because of past experiences with other large party-friendly, expansive "Mexican" menu, margarita-obsessed restaurants (*cough* El Torito, Acapulco *cough*), I almost dreaded having dinner there. 

I expected watered down, over-saccharine drinks, bland meat, weak salsas, and to eat my weight in tortilla chips.

What we got were surprisingly good margaritas (even the happy hour one I ordered for the first round, nicely charred sizzling meat and juicy shrimp, and a trio of dips to include two tasty salsas and a dip bean that ensured I would still eat my weight in tortilla chips. 

Let's back up to the margaritas. Happy Hour margaritas are usually 99% margarita mix and have no strength. They're also usually some ridiculous price like $2. The HH drinks here come in at around $6 on average, but actually have some body to them. I was surprised to find that even the flavored selections didn't wuss out. That said, on round two, I opted for a full-priced spicy watermelon margarita. It was an extra $2 well spent. 

The food exceeded my expectations. A first timer should definitely order the flaming fajitas. Aside from the name of the place practically telling you to, you should do this if for nothing else than the sheer spectacle that is the meat arriving on a round custom "JFFC" grill. Said grill is then set on fire causing an eruption of flames at such heights that I wonder how many servers have lost their eyebrows as part of regular dinner service. Come on, man. It's in the name. 

My husband and I ordered the combo fajitas for two and opted for steak and shrimp. Oh, yeah. If you have an eating partner, are a greedy face, or like to eat dinner leftovers by yourself for a few meals after, get the combo. It just looks cool. Bigger is better, right (yay, 'Murica?). 

My only squabbles on the food would be that the number of shrimp provided and the sides. The portion of shrimp provided for maybe 2.5 per fajita if you used 3 tortillas for the meal. As for the sides, if you're going to the tex-mex, gringo-leaning menu, then cover the beans in cheese. Smother those things. Yeah, yeah. I know I'm Asian and well on my way to lactose-intolerance, but I love my cheese-covered beans. 

Aside from that, service was just okay. I didn't get the impression that our server cared much for us, but perhaps it was because it was a Thursday and he was as over the week as the rest of us. He gets a pass. 

Based on the scene when I arrived, I would suggest making reservations. When we arrived at about 5:15pm, the lobby area was packed and wait times were at around 25 minutes. Luckily for me, this experienced was skipped thanks to folks from our party having arrived early to snag a table.

Anyway, does this place suck? No. Is it like the El Toritos and Acapulcos of the world? It's a better, upgraded version. Is it the best Mexican food in Vegas? Not by a long shot. 

But I'm not mad at it.

Absolutely loved this place!!! Friendly, helpful staff and overall just a really great atmosphere. My family and I got the steak, pork, and chicken fajitas and they fell nothing short of amazing not to mention they were so generous with portion sizes y

We decided to try this place because my Hubby's boss said it was great. This place is amazing. It is our new favorite Mexican restaurant. We had the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp . All I can say is Best Fajitas is Vegas! Get here early the place fills up but the service is outstanding, Never asked for anything. It instantly appears. 
Also had the Raspberry Margarita delicious

This place is an absolute gem! Juan and the staff are always amazing, the service is top-notch! As for the food, it doesn't get any better. We challenge ourselves to try something new each time and are never disappointed. My wife is Mexican and agrees that this is real, authentic, and fantastic!!! The one must-have each time, the shrimp ceviche...delicious!

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because my take out order was missing items. Fajitas without the tortillas or guac and sour cream just aren't as good. By the time I got home and realized all my sides weren't there I didn't feel like doing the 30 minute round trip back to get them. 
On the bright side, this was my second time taking food home and quality and flavor is great. As well as pricing. And the staff is very friendly and accommodating. We're all human and mistakes happen but next time I'll be checking my order before leaving.

1st time here, we went for happy hour. Service was awesome, food was awesome! I left smiling ear to ear! We ordered fish taco Baja style, taquitos and a margarita all for $25! Yes $25! We couldn't even eat all the food and had tons of leftovers.  I will be back very soon! Looks like a favorite here is the fajitas,  100% will be trying it on the next visit.

The best shrimp cocktails EVER! I was in Vegas for a weekend and was craving a shrimp cocktail mainly because (hungover) but this place made me feel a live again and although I wasn't feeling to good (the hangover was way to real) he made me smile and feel better suggested a beer to help with the headache and I felt way better when I walked out than when I walked in. I go to Las Vegas at least once every 8weeks. I love this place. I make sure I stop by. Hi from
LA!

We came here on Saturday night with a party of 16.  They were SUPER helpful in seating us quickly and at a nice large table.  We asked off the bat if we could split the bill since everyone had cards and they went above and beyond for us and made everything super easy!  The food was excellent and came out in a very timely manner!  I would highly recommend this place and thank you to all the servers who helped the big rock climbing party on Saturday night!  THANKS!

This customer service here is EXCELLENT. Being a hospitality student at UNLV, the service might be the best I've received in years. The food is awesome. We ordered steak fajitas, enchiladas, and queso dip. Steak fajitas was my favorite. Our server Sebastian was quick, attentive, and very friendly. Angel was also quick too! Always making sure our drinks/beers were filled as well as the chips & salsa. Nothing but great service and food over here! First time and will be returning. Hopefully every week!!!

The most consistently great food and service in Las Vegas. This is the best Mexican food in Nevada and maybe beyond. Try the chicken fajitas as they are to die for!!  Table side Guac is equally amazing. If you are a local or in town for any reason this is a must try!  Only one complaint is they really don't take reservations unless you have a huge party. So plan on arriving early and probably waiting a bit. While worth the wait....still a bit of a pain.

The food and atmosphere in this place are incredible I can not say enough good things about them ! Not once have we gone and been disappointed. From the chips and salsa to there most creative dishes, they hit it right on the head EVERY SINGLE TIME ! A+

My wife and I have been here many times and we are never disappointed. The service is great and the food is some of the best in town.  

This last visit we were in the mood for some authentic Mexican breakfast, so my wife ordered the huevos rancheros and I ordered the huevos con chorizo y papas plate. These items are under the Brunch section of the menu and a drink is included from soft drinks to a draft beer, mimosa, or a margarita.  Both of our plates were fantastic and the beers went down nicely as well!! The portions are generous and you also get chips with salsa and beans to get everything started. 

During football season, Juan's also has all day football specials that include $3.50 pints of their Mexican beers on tap and an assortment of appetizers and taco plates. On top of that, they have an awesome Happy Hour from 3-7p everyday that also has similar specials. 

I haven't tried the actual flaming fajitas yet, but I plan on doing so on one of my next visits. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy some killer Mexican food in a fun and relaxing atmosphere!!
The only negative here was that our pitcher of Pacifico was heavy.  Crowded, but seated right away, service was great, food very good, large portions, tasty, and a good presentation.

The most disappointing visit ever. It is always busy & today was no different. We waited, we're seated & pleasantly greeted by Claire who began our service with a smile. It went downhill quickly from there. We had to make multiple requests for replacement dip and our appetizer was completely forgotten (Claire did apologize & comp the table-side guacamole). It was made (AFTER our dinner was served) & was very bland. No offer was made for enhancements. Our chip bowl was crumbs & was never replaced. No one came to check on us. We quickly were out of napkins & were using the beverage napkins. While we were still eating we were offered to-go boxes & plates were removed- WHILE WE WERE STILL EATING!!  We have been here when it was busier but this visit we were made to feel like "Hurry. Finish. Don't let the door hit you in the a**."  I wasn't even able to utilize my Yelp offer. Wow. Still good food but wow is all I can say about the lapse of service overall

I don't even know where to start, this place was the best Mexican Restaurant I've ever been to. I have very high expectations for Mexican restaurants since I am Mexican and it's very rare to find one that has legit authentic Mexican food! From the moment we walked in the ambiance and the staff was amazing very attentive and on point! We order drinks and they literally took like 5min for them to bring them, we also ordered the adobado burrito and the chicken shredded chimichanga, we were so impressed on how fast our food came, they were delish and very worth it!  I'm so impressed with the service the people and the restaurant overall! I highly recommend this place if you're in need of a good Mexican restaurant! Ps: Happy Hour half hour alcoholic beverages between 3pm-7pm ;)

This is a wonderful local spot to have great food, I do have an advantage since it's in the same complex as my job and I get to have it more often then most. 

My husband I get to go and have lunch there all the time and the service is great the food is always consistently good and the salsa is to die for. 

I recommend this place for great food....hope they get some authentic singers in there soon, then I'll be there even more!!!!

I burn with a fiery passion for Juan and his flaming fajitas.....ok, maybe just the fajitas (If my husband is reading this, I apologize). 

This is some of the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. It beats Lindo Michoacan, Benito Michoacan, and even Border Grill in my book. Factor in the price and it's a triple threat. 

I'm pretty sure this restaurant truly has some of the best fajitas in the valley. The meat they use is very high quality, their produce is fresh, and everything is spiced to perfection. It also doesn't hurt that you get a show with the meal when you order the fajitas. 

Their chips and salsa are awesome, served with salsa, refried beans and grilled peppers and onions. Because the wait staff is on fire (badum ching) they keep them refilled too. 

The only thing that keeps this place from being five stars for me is their chile verde. It's good, but not great. The pork has been a little bit fatty at times and the flavor could be a titch more complex. I know its the base for verde, but I like my chile verde to taste like more than just tomatillos. It's still good though. 

If you stick with the fajita's your meal won't disappoint you!!!

I love this place. It's nestled inside of an old strip mall adjacent to an In-N-Out at Trop and Ft. Apache. The view from the patio is non-existent, so if you're looking for that type of ambiance, this is not your place. If you want great friendly service, awesome food, a welcoming atmosphere and a fun time out - THIS IS YOUR PLACE. Tried a bunch of things on the menu, never had a bad meal or bad service ever. The drinks are good too, everything is very reasonably priced. It's also super close to the 215, so it's not far off the beaten path to get to or go from. Recommendation; if you are going out after dinner and order the fajitas, sit outside on the patio if you don't want to smell like your delicious dinner.

Food was ok. Service was very horrible.  Our waiter OMAR was very rude :( 
The food was wrong. Instead of apologizing he brings back the food and throws it on the table. Horrible customer service.

Best fajitas in town

Great meat quality
Awesome flavor
Huge portions
Good prices especially for lunch
Great fun decor
Fajitas have great flavor.  We tried the chicken and the steak.  Very good chips and salsa.  Fried Ice Cream is delicious.

I was impressed. The atmosphere was fun and the food good. Our server, Omar, was spot on; friendly and attentive. Like many others, really enjoyed the grilled onions and jalapenos that accompanied the chips, salsa, and bean dip. Nibbled off the niece's beef fajita (someone had to get them) plate; really tasty. The shredded chicken in my sister's chimichanga was flavorful. That surprised me as many places that I've tried seemed to have boiled the chicken leaving the diner to season with sauces and such. Liked the fact that a plate came with a grilled vegetable option versus having to have beans and rice. Also liked the fact that a cup of fideo accompanied each entree. I'm a carnitas fan and that was my only let down; I like bigger chunks of pork versus the small diced version. Had no complaints about the taste or tenderness of the meat though. Portion size was great. Definitely deserves a return visit next time I'm up that way.
Excellent service, delicious fajitas (I had the vegetarian fajitas), and big screens..pretty much perfection!

I rarely write reviews but this place is pretty awesome! I took the wife and kids here for brunch . I had the carne sada ala tampiequen which is pretty much a surf and turf with a Mexican kick. Wife had the steak and eggs breakfast and we had a couple of michelladas . 


Food quality I give a 7.5
Customer service a 10!! 

Definitely will come back based on the customer service. The manager even dropped by and said hello! Great little hole in the wall spot.
Amazing!!! Fajitas are awesome, bean dip, chips.. yummmmmm! !! The waitress was great, damn if I can remember her name.. kept the drinks full, the desert is fantastic.

We should of known when we walked in on a Saturday night and it was nearly empty.  But seeing so many positive Yelp reviews we had to try it... what a mistake.. ugh.  So the question is?.. "How do you ruin Mexican food?!"

I'll tell you how...

store bought chips
store bought tortillas
store bought re-fried beans
store bought rice
store bought pre-mixed margaritas
pico de gallo so old it looks grey
bland fajitas
awful atmosphere
luke warm service

Now I know why the place was nearly empty.  Don't eat here.

One of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to. The fresh chips and salsa are fantastic and come with a delicious bean dip and grilled onions and jalapenos. Very good. The entries we had were just as good. Service was top notch. Highly recommend this place.

Great place for good Mexican Food. The house specialty is the Fajitas but everything on the menu is good. We went there with a very large group and were quickly seated at the Outdoor Patio, perfect for our group. Service was very good and they kept the Chips and Salsas coming and drink refills were plentiful. Our food came out hot and our orders were all correct. Food was delicious. I checked in on Yelp and received $5.00 off of our order. The staff was very accommodating to our group. We will be back. I highly recommend this restaurant

One of the best service experiences we have had.   The staff members were so friendly, courteous and attentive.   SO much food and everything we tried was very tasty and a great value.   It is now added to our favorite places to dine.
Excellent service and food.When you check this place out sit at the bar for amazing service.The fajitas were so cool and entertaining.I will definitely be repeating very soon

This place seriously took me by surprise! It's actually good! I thought it was your typical Mexican American  restaurant that doesn't satisfy you at all. 

We came during happy hour and ordered rolled chicken tacos that were only $5. We also ordered a one person chicken fajita to share.  

On the house they give you chips and salsa with refried beans. Chips were warm and perfect! Then they give you a tomato sopa that was tasty but a slight salty. 

When the fajitas came.... FIREEEE! They put on a cool fire show with your fajitas and it's comes so hot and sizzling! The one person fajita was more than enough for me and my girlfriend. The rolled tacos were okay and kinda greasy. 

Actually will come back for more fajitas!

Order from here all the time!!! Always get the fajita a quesadilla, chimichangas, case so fun Dedo. All is so good. Service is amazing. They always take care of us. Love this place. Salsa is a bit spicy but super refreshing. always very good portions. Take out is what I always order and they've always been accurate! Fan for life. Go eat here.

Juan's Flaming Fajitas is one flamingly tasty good time!

You feel welcomed the second you walk through the door. The outdoor patio is fantastic to hang out in during the cool and warm months. Be careful because the second you sit down food is being delivered. 

Before ordering, Juan's gives you a delicious basket of chips, salsas, fried peppers, onions and a killer bowl of Mexican soup. Try not to stuff your face with them because the items on the menu are deeeeeeelightful. 

I have been here a few times and ate burritos and tacos, which are amazing, but the last time visited I ordered the flaming fajitas. Can you say NOM? I can!

The meal was lit on fire at our table just before serving which makes the dish really fun. It tasted wonderful too. 

Throughout my meal I was happy to see little flaming flashes out of the corner of my eye of others who ordered their fajitas. It's like a flaming party up in there!

Juan's has a fun happy hour too. The drinks are great, the service is great and who doesn't like their food lit on fire? I know I do!

Go here. Bring friends. One fajita order is plenty for two.
The service was great! We came for a birthday party good size group and they were fast and very helpful!

Great service, great menu, great taste! It's a fun ambiance and you can tell all the customers are enjoying the experience. Ordered the 2 item combo plate with a carne asada burrito & cheese enchilada. The homemade chips and salsa variety was superb but the bean dip was my favorite. Don't forget to order a frozen margarita.

This place is excellent. I never knew about this hole in the wall until family came into town. The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious. 
The free chips and bean dip were made in house and you can clearly tell. We opted for the beef fajitas that they cooked at tableside.  I didn't expect it to have so much flavor and to be so juicy. It reminded me of backyard barbecues my sister had in L.A.  The tortillas and even the rice were so savory and hot.  I liked how attentive the staff was even though it was a full house and they still were able to tend to our party of 12. 
This place knows how to really keep customers happy. We plan on going here with the local fams as well.
Been here a few times now and both the service and food are great. Our new favorite place in Vegas for Mexican food. They are known for fajitas but everything is good.

Great food and great service.  We went there as a party of five and were really impressed with the service.  The fajitas were excellent and the queso was very good too.  A must recommend.  The Yelp 15% coupon helped with our decision to go.
This place definitely deserves a 5 star rating.  I had the flaming fajitas, yum, yum!!!

Great service, lots of fun. Not the most amazing Mexican food I've ever tasted but very good. Their sopa de fideo is great, bean dip is SO good, fajitas are great and they really are flaming. Excellent drink specials too. I give 5 stars because the food is good, service is great, and we always have a lot of fun!

I really enjoyed my experience here!

I had their combination plate lunch special: al pastor burrito, chicken tamale, and grilled vegetables for $10. I ate most of it because it was very delicious...even though I was full off of the chips and delicious bean dip + salsa they gave us!

Our waiter was young and very attentive...although he forgot my husband's tortillas...his favorite part of any Mexican meal. 

We did not order a flaming fajita but it was fun watching other people receive theirs. Those flames really do rise!

For the lunch price, I felt like I got a lot for my money. Come try it out!

Oh, and there is a cantina/bar connected to the restaurant.

My favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  
The food is incredible, the service is amazing and the prices are more than fair.
There is a great separate bar and an outdoor eating area.

An authentic Mexican restaurant, with amazing top shelf margaritas, homemade salsa and hot sauce, and of course the flaming fajitas. The steak tacos are also cooked perfectly. Our waiter handled our huge group of 14 really well. Everyone was happy and it made for great evening.

It's been too long since I've had a flaming fajita.   Portions are very generous, prices are fair, and nice atmosphere.   I always get the steak fajitas for two and split it with the wife.   Super tasty.   Don't need to go into much detail but everything is flavorful and they give you chips with bean dip and salsa when you get to the table.  Plus they re-fill them no questions asked.  

With the meal they give you a generous helping of beans, rice, guac, sour cream and cheese.   They light your fajitas up when they get to your table.   The 5 foot flame that come from it gives you a quality wake up before it's time to eat.

First time here and over all I liked this place. I came in for Happy Hour. It's clean, the Bartenders we're friendly and made sure I never had to wait for a fresh refill. 

The Bar has video slot machines which were Tight with a capital T and even though I sadly kept loosing money, I still was happily consuming tasty drinks and Chips and Salsa at happy hour prices.

The House Margarita tasted (Tony the Tiger) GRRRREight, so was the Modelo Dark Draft served in a large chilled glass with a lime slice that I swilled down with great lewd gusto.

The Chips and Bean dip was decent, but what really shined was the red and green Salsas. The best I think I've had in Las Vegas since being a San Diego transplant many years ago...so I ate all that was put in front of me and even asked for some to go.

I ordered a large Albondigas soup to go as well with all the trimmings which are generally sliced Limes, Spanish Rice, chopped onions and Cilantro and crushed red pepper, all Muy importante preparaciones for an anticipated hangover the next day. Si Si Senor!

What I actually got, I discovered to my dismay after Greedily opening the bag while hungover the next day and looking for my cure...was a large Fideo Soup instead and more Bean dip rather than Spanish Rice ///sigh x@#&%!! at least the chopped Onions and Cilantro and limes were there, but Sheesh! Hay Carumba! Vas Ist Das! Mein Gotte In Himmel !!! Oh thank Heaven they sell Alka Seltzer at 7/11...

Very delicious food, friendly staff, clean environment. We ordered the steak fajitas & it was delish. The soup, can't remember what it's called but it was delicious. The refried beans was so creamy & yummy. We will definitely come back soon.

Im originally from El Paso TX and therefore very picky when it comes to mexican food! I have grew up with Juan at another place he used to work at in town for at least 10 yrs and when I found out he had his own restaurant we now come here on a weekly basis instead of the old place I went to for years. It is the BEST mexican food in Las Vegas and the service is AWESOME!! Ernand is my go to waiter but the others are nice as well!! Love the fajitas the enchiladas the free soup and chips and salsa they serve with every meal and they also have other variety of salsas as well if u like more spice I love the habanero! My whole family goes here from mom dad sisters and husband and kids all love it!!!

My last review was about 3 years ago! This place is very consistent. Staff has changed a bit but still all are very nice & attentive. The Chicken fajitas are still amazing! I always love that first bite when that beautiful citrus marinated chicken hits my taste buds. The flour tortillas are made in the restaurant. That's always a plus in my book. The margaritas are great but decided to be brave & tried the pina colada margarita. I'm in love! The best of both my flavor worlds! The green salsa is awesome!!! I always ask for an extra side to take home. I don't mind an extra fee-give me a big one. My only complaint is that we don't go as much as we used to because they are always so busy! Good for you Juan!!!

We've been hunting for good Mexican food since we arrived from Texas a year ago - I'm happy to say that we've now found it! Not only was the food delicious, but the service was top notch. Our waiter, Omar, took great care of us, and at the end of the meal the manager checked on us as well. Even though it's a 20 minute drive we'll definitely be back again.

Love this place.  Got the fajitas for two and the portion is huge.  Love that they do flaming fajitas right as the table.  Their salsa and refrigerate beans are great.  Will happily go back again. Nice having a great Mexican fajita spot in the west Vegas valley.

Juans' flaming fajitas and cantina was as good as advertised. The service was excellent everyone that worked there was super polite and made sure we felt right at home. Most important of all the food was hot and fresh. I had the steak Picado and I must say it was very tasty the steak was cooked just as I asked and was very juicy not dry at all! My wife had the chicken floutas and she loved it. My grandma had the cheese enchilada and tamale combo plate and everything was fresh as can be. we noticed a lot of people ordered the flaming fajitas. My friend ordered the steak  fajitas for one and he said it ranked up there with some of the best he ever had.I can't stress how fresh the food was we were all very impressed and will definitely be coming back again soon!

I've been meaning to dine here for sometime. Many friends and acquaintances have shared there always positive experiences at Juan's.
They were all spot on! The food was excellent, starting with the chips, salsa and bean starter. Along with that trio , came a wonderful grilled onions and peppers combo. That was the first time I've ever witnessed that accompany chips and salsa.
My family and I felt it was necessary to try the dish the restaurants namesake is, fajitas.
We ordered the combo chicken and beef, and they were excellent. Full of flavor, neither the beef nor chicken was dry. The portion was plentiful. The fajitas were accompanied with rice and re fried beans. The rice was soft and flavorful and the beans perfectly seasoned.
My first experience was excellent all around. The service was attentive the moment we sat down until we said thank you and goodbye.
I will return and make sure I inform anyone who hasn't dined there to give it a try.

Absolutely Superb!
Excellent customer service, our waiter was very attentive and answered all our questions about the menu items. It was a hard decision on what to order so, we ordered a little of everything and it was all good !
Service, food and speed were all fantastic.  Staff is friendly.  Food is fresh and hot.  Atmosphere is great.

My family and I love Juans. The fajitas are amazing and I love that they have the romaine wrap alternatives for those of us on strict diets. I usually always get something different every time I come and it's always been amazing. The chicken fajitas have been my most common choice lately, but I do really like the chicken tacos and the mole. The service is very friendly and fast. I appreciate that the owners work in the restaurant and ensure that everyone is happy with their experience. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a delicious Mexican meal in the southwest.

We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant and wanted to get away from the strip, so we took to yelp and found Juan's. The chips and salsa came with some beans and grilled onions which were both a nice surprise.Three of us went, and all had different things. All excellent. The Chili Colorado, and the Carnita's were excellent. Really really good! planning to go again when we get back to Las Vegas after our Grand Canyon side trip vacation.

The best service ever every time we come. Cesar and the rest of the staff is the best. We got the steak picado and the one item combo and cooked to perfection. This is the most authentic Mexican food you'll find in Las Vegas!
Been here 3xs already I love their flaming fajitas!!!!! Friendly staff, prompt service & great food! Chips n salsa is always great here too!!! Sign up for their txt alerts to save $$$

Killer.  Great salsa, chips and stuff.  Packed on a Friday 7pm.  30 min wait....but well worth it.  Bar area was busy and looks like a good spot to hang out and watch the game.

Had the....

Beef fajitas - amazing.

Cheese enchiladas - awesome.  Great red sauce.

Tacos el Pastor - close second to Tacos el Gordo.  Different, but amazingly awesome.

And last, but not least, service was great.

Second part for Shirley B birthday party week. I got excited again too be trying out someplace new one that rave all about the Faming Fajitas. Need say more its all in the name of the restaurant. I never ordered the Flaming Fajitas. I felt like constant bonfires going off every five mins looking around the restaurant. So really hard not too order the star or show stopper but thankfully bunch of us so got too watch the show up close. I heard about looked and smelled great everyone said that it was really good. 

What I did order was the Carne Asada Burrito. I loved it! The portion size is huge. I know its mexican restaurant so that really should not come as shocker. I felt like you got nice portion of rice and beans. Not only the size but everything on the plate had great flavors and really really good. The Carne Asada meat by itself was fabulous! The thing was the burrito was packed with meat more meat and went with the red not green chili.  The meat was nice, moist, well seasoned, and use base carne asada any style taco, burrito, or whatever be in Carne Asada heaven. The rice and refried beans had nice flavor. Sometimes go mexican restaurant taste very bland or feel like out of can. I felt like both sides freshly made each day. The guacamole was nice. 

The chips and salsa start up with highly ADDICTING. The chips were nice, Hot, fresh and crispy. The salsa too the warm bean dip. Be warned might want too take it easy on the chips before your meal. No room for entree.

The service was awesome. We brought in two different desserts from outside businesses. They still more then happy too keep them refrigerated in the back until we finish with dinner. Missing candles they found two candles for us. The whole they never raised stink eye about us bringing outside stuff. The staff guess birthday they sing happy birthday and the birthday person gets too wear sambrero. We slowly but in time we all showed. I felt like they never rushed us too turn over our big table. Never empty glass of beverage or chips on our table the whole night. They more then happy too split our checks. Talk about reasonable family friendly prices. It been while since went too mexican restaurant but here at Juan Flaming Fajitas one that see coming back many more times.!!!!!!
Our favorite restaurant in town! Great service, great atmosphere and phenomenal food! You wont regret a single penny!
Excellent authentic Mexican restaurant! Came here for my 22nd birthday day yo. This place is popping. Great food. Good vibes!

Great service
Great fajitas
Price is reasonable 
Lunch menu is perfect for quick lunch
Excellent Mexican food! Their fajitas are amazing and their tableside guacamole is so good!

Really great food and drinks for summerlin Area Mexican food. This place has nailed the perfect mix of food and entertainment. Live music, flaming fajitas - its dinner and a show ! Huge portion sizes on the meals too ! Make sure to check for he happy hour drinks and check in offers to get some smoking deals !
Pro tip - 
Always make sure to budget time to be seated during dinner time each time I have had to wait about 20 minutes during peak times to get a table - check to see if you can make a reservation-  but the wait is worth it !

Juans is the best Mexican restaurant In las Vegas hands down !!!!  Moving here from California I was adamant to find authentic amazing Mexican food & I am so glad I finally did! This review is long overdue as my family & I have been coming here basically every Wednesday for the last 2 years or so lol. They treat you like family & are always welcoming & friendly. Anytime my friends or family come into town they ask us to take them to Juans and could careless about the places on the strip lol. Table side guacamole, carne Asada ranchero tacos & much more are amazing ! I haven't tried anything that I haven't liked here !
Delicious food, tasty margaritas, and very friendly people! Juan's has a fun atmosphere and we will definitely be back!

I'm usually a pretty tough judge, but rating this place is easy. The service is excellent, and the flavor of the food is awesome.

I've been here for lunch and dinner and have always been impressed.

Sebastian was the real deal!! So was Marvin. Such great service. Very polite and thorough. I will recommend Juan's Flaming Fajitas to everyone I know that loves great Mexican cuisine. Six thumbs up for Sebastian. Six thumbs up for Marvin and six thumbs up for Juan and his fajitas. Fire!

I wasn't so much disappointed at this place at surprised at the ordinariness.  The four and five star reviews led me to expect something better. The food was okay, but there is definitely better Mexican food in Las Vegas. 

I had the chicken taco and chicken enchilada. They were certainly adequate but not extraordinary. My sister had a ground beef taco and her feeling was the same. I thought the sauce lacked a kick and anything that might make it really stand out. 

The decor was pretty much standard and the place was a little loud. 

I will say that the service was good. There was a line waiting and I was with old friends catching up. I thought the fact that we had overstayed our welcome was well-handled. 

I'd say if you live in the neighborhood and need a quick meal, this is a place to go. If you're looking for great Mexican food Las Vegas has better choices.

Nice staff, clean restaurant, great menu, and happy hour!

Tacos Al Pastor was a good size and great flavor. Of course I always fill up on the chips with the bean and salsa dips that I can't finish my entree. Also tried the shrimp cocktail (on hh menu) which was pretty good. Got a raspberry margarita (hh) which was far too sweet and lacked any alcohol... The sopapillas for dessert! Great airy perfectly fried dough with honey and whipped cream. 

Great place, but could've done a bit more with happy hour menu.

So delicious! We came in on a Tuesday and they were surprisingly busy but the staff made us feel as if we were the only ones there. The food was fresh and tasty but still reasonably priced. I can't wait to go back and have a margarita in the lively bar area.
Absolutely Awesome from the chips and Salsa, bean dip, queso. fajitas are amazing. Tacos and tostada combo was excellent.  Ask for Omar!!!

Love this place. Consistent as can be, and service is top notch.
One might think, "Hmm fajitas - doesn't that usually mean dry chicken and stiff steak?"
(at least that's what I thought) but I've been proven wrong time and time again at Juan's. Juan's fajitas are the benchmark of fajitas. It's almost as if the meats/proteins come out slightly rare on purpose, knowing that they will be the perfect temperature in about 30 flaming seconds, or the time in which it takes to assemble your first fajita and nab a first bite.

If you like fajitas, you will LOVE this place.
If you don't like fajitas, try Juan's and you will understand why fajitas exist.

(Awesome salsa and bean dip, too.)
Here again because it's the best. And it's national Margarita day. The hostess is washing off menus in between seating people which is awesome. I hate sticky menus.

This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas! The service here is unbelievable and the food is simply fantastic! We met Juan the owner and you can just see that his passion is why this restaurant is doing so fantastic. Unbelievable food, you have to check it out.

I have to start with the fact our waiter was in some mood the day we went. Our service was not ideal, our drinks were rarely refilled, and he just, in general, was not nice. However, even though I was seriously underwhelmed by the service I didn't take any stars off for that - everyone has a bad day! We sat down 30 minutes before happy hour ended, and he would not give us happy hour pricing. So I guess my advice would be to finish your meal before happy hour ends! 

So, without considering the service, this place is three stars. The food is alright. On the sampler platter, my quesadilla was underwhelming, to say the least. It wasn't toasted on the outside, which is how I prefer them, but even adjusting for that the cheese might as well have been from a can. The chips that came alongside it with refried beans were better, but the taquitos were basically flavorless. Shrimp cocktail is usually the saving grace of any Mexican eatery for me, and this was my least favorite in Vegas. It wasn't bad, I still ate it, but it wasn't good. If it was my first time having a shrimp cocktail in this style, I probably wouldn't have bothered to try it again. 

If a friend wanted to try this place, I'd go back, but I wouldn't choose it on my own.

My family and I have heard great things about this restaurant! After eating here I will be recommending and eating here more often. Great food and great service! It was my parents and I first time trying this place, and it did not disappoint. The place was packed, so we had a 10 minute wait. When we sat down we were given salsa and chips and soup. We ordered the steak fajitas for two that came with beans and rice. It was $28 so I think it's a great offer! When the food came out the presentation of the fajitas was amazing! The portions are pretty large so it's quite filling and really flavorful and tasty! If you love Mexican food than this is the place to go! I love the variety of the menu so when I come back I will try more things off the menu, this place gets my seal of approval.
Fantastic fajita presentation as they light them on fire, table side. Wonderful service and quality food!

Trying to figure out exactly how, and why, this place is so highly reviewed. Honestly, it feels like a Mexican version of Claim Jumper. Portions are too large for an average-sized diner; hence, both my date and I felt guilty for leaving such large portions on the plate.

I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were sub-par. It's never a good sign when a restaurant uses baby shrimp in their dishes. This means the shrimp is either frozen or purchased cheaply in bulk. Not a lot of flavor in the shrimp but the sauce was pretty good.

My date had the taco salad with chicken and claimed it was okay. Like other reviewers stated, there's nothing necessarily "bad" about the food it just seems like your run-of-the-mill place. Nothing remarkable. That said, by the time I finished one taco my date's tostada was getting quite soggy. It was kind of gross.

So, I can't imagine returning unless it's for happy hour when a mariachi band is playing.

THIS place has shot straight to the number one position in my "best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas" list.  There are a number of reasons as to why I think Juan's is #1 but for the most part: the food is fresh, cooked perfectly, unique, and consistently delicious; the service is probably the best I have experienced at a Mexican restaurant; their alcoholic beverages are nice and stiff (unlike most watered-down drinks at similar restaurants); the decor is actually really nice and comforting with great booths and TVs strategically placed around the whole restaurant; and, last but not least - the waiters and staff are AMAZING. 

Chips, salsa and bean dip were brought to our table within seconds of being seated. I really, really enjoyed the flavor and spice level of the salsa - it was unique, tasty, and definitely did not come from a jar.  The bean dip was great too. 

I ordered fish tacos my girlfriend ordered the Enchiladas en Tomatillo after our waiter highly recommended she try it.  

Before our food came, our waiter brought out some complimentary soup.  I'm pretty sure it was pizole or fideo, but I could be wrong. Either way, it tasted amazing and I actually finished the whole bowl. I never like the soup at Mexican restaurants, but the broth was so flavorful I found myself slurping up the entire bowl. 

My fish tacos were pretty good - the fish was crispy and flaky without that soggy-ness that often comes when you do not eat the fish fast enough. I enjoyed them (although they are no Phranks!).  The REAL winner were the enchiladas. Ohmygod I have never tasted enchiladas so delicious, creamy and unique. They had onions and white sauce and cilantro and chicken and cheese and it took everything in me not to finish the rest of my girlfriend's meal when she left the table to use the restroom. I highly recommend this dish. 

I will be back ASAP to try the flaming fajitas. The table next to us ordered some and all I could hear during the remainder of our meal were variations of "mmmm, ohmygod, did you try this? damn this is good."  

Also, we ordered a couple of Coronaritas, which were made with top shelf tequila,  and they were cheap AND fantastic. 

I wish I lived closer because Juan's has a great happy hour and Mexican restaurants never have great food AND great service.  Juan's definitely gives all other Vegas Mexican restaurants in this price range something to be scared of ... because they all need to step up their game.

The best part of this place is the peppers and onions they give you with the chips and salsa.  I understand that this is the same general staff from Viva Mercados (rip) , that is why Ihave given this place many tries now.  The food is very very bland.  Meat has no seasonings or so it seems.  They put on a go show for the  fajitas, but the fajitas are barely average.    Mole sauce is better then some in town, but it still tastes out of a jar.  Tamales are sub-par, tacos...well who can f-up taco, their tacos were good.  Chili verde was aweful but not great.   I could go on and on. 

 Like I said I really wanted this place to follow the legacy of Bobby's Viva Mercados, but it really falls short.

Excellent.  Been here twice now and both times have been similar.  The service has been great and friendly each time.  The food is very good and tasty.  We have gotten the ceviche, which has been fresh and good both times, as well as the tableside guacamole.  They make it however you want and both times it has been good, although the second time they put too much lime juice.  However, they immediately offered to put more avocados in it to balance out if we wanted.  The fajitas themselves are great.  The flavor is excellent and I have enjoyed them more than your standard fajitas at any other Mexican place or applebee's type joint (although that is not saying much).  Prices are good...ceviche, guac and an order of fajitas for 1 to share...plenty of food for 2 people, was about $40 before tip.

We had a group of 7 that came here for NYE after hearing many other friends rave about the place. Plenty of parking, short wait for the rest of our group to arrive so I had a mango margarita at the bar. We were seated immediately when our party arrived and the parade of deliciousness started arriving starting with the chips, salsa, and received beans. I'm not sure if some in our party requested grilled onions and jalapeños with the chips and salsa or if it's a regular thing that comes with, but do yourself a favor and order it! We also got the table side guac which was great. The highlight, obviously are the fajitas! Tip: if you're getting an appetizer, soup, or multiple baskets of chips and salsa, order the fajitas for one. It comes in a Dutch oven type pot with a burner underneath and they literally light the thing on fire before placing on the table(fire out before hitting the table but burner underneath still lit, so watch little hands).  We made the mistake of ordering the fajitas for two and we had the leftovers for lunch the next day. Great place, prompt friendly service, now I know why everyone I talk to recommends the place! We'll definitely be back and will bring newbies with us too!
This is our favorite place for Mexican in Las Vegas! I highly recommend trying it out! The red salsa isn't bitter like everywhere else we have tried

I love this place! So to start off food is amazing, I always get full off of the chips and salsa! I got their street tacos the other day, which were great! Also, tried their fajitas which they are known for and has exceeded my expectations. Secondly, I love how they are a "family style" restaurant. You might have one server but if you need anything else, the others will be sure to help! Will go back again and again.

All I can say is this place is Exceptional!!! The best customer service my fiance and I have ever had in this town! Staff is very friendly and attentive. The smell when you pull up to this restaurant is AMAZING!! The food is fantastic! We couldn't ask for a better experience! We had the steak and shrimp fajitas and the steak is so tender, definitely not tough to eat and the shrimp was also great. My daughter got a vegetarian enchilada plate and she loved it!!!  We give Juan's Flaming Fajitas 5 stars in quality of food, customer service and just being super awesome! All of you rock!!!!

We found this restaurant on yelp and we were blown away... end of story unbelievable.  If you're staying in Vegas is worth getting away from the strip it coming out to the red rocks and then having dinner at Juan's flaming fajitas! We may actually come back to Vegas just to eat here again.  We felt like this was an authentic experience. The flaming fajitas we had were so delicious! The service was excellent.  The environment was perfect right down to the smoke, music and wait enthusiastic staff.

Great experience at Juan's!  

It was my mid-week birthday dinner and we felt like we wanted to try somewhere new - so I turned to my fellow Yelpers.  Mexican is one of my favorite cuisines (along with everything else it seems) and when I read all of the stellar reviews - I knew I had to try Juan's.

We arrived in time for Happy Hour which let us try two different types of margaritas at a super reasonable price, the house and the Don Julio.  I found the mix a bit lacking in depth of flavor and thought that the house margarita might be watered down - but one sip into my second, and I realized these babies pack a punch! (Also evidenced by the pitcher-sharing table of seniors next to us who were getting into increasingly loud, contentious political conversations in the table next to us. Apparently I'm not the only person that gets sassy on tequila!).

The gratis tortillas chips were fresh and crisp - the salsa and complimentary bean dip tasty!  (Note that their regular bean dip isn't vegetarian - but you can request a veggie version! Love that!) The complimentary plate of grilled peppers and onions was delish as well.

We ordered the shrimp fajitas for two - with two different set-ups - rice & beans, steamed veggies, flour tortillas as well as corn. The best of all worlds and a great way to try a lot of different items on the menu for first-time visitors. When I missed taking a shot of the flaming of the fajitas - our waiter flamed them a second time for me - nice of him!  They don't skimp on the shrimp like some restaurants that serve fajitas in town - here they made up the majority of the meal and were good quality - nice and plump and perfectly cooked. I have to say, the side of veggies was really great - I don't know what they do to it, but it has some really great subtle additional flavorings in there.

I had jokingly mentioned that it was my birthday at some point, and the staff surprised us with churros with chocolate sauce and whipped cream - served up with a hearty version of "Happy Birthday" and a paper tiara with a sombrero on it at the end of our meal.  Awesome touch, you guys!  

Overall, had a great time.  The service was great and friendly, the food terrific, the prices super reasonable during happy hour. We'll definitely be back!

This is our favorite place!  Our kids even request it. We have not tried a thing that we do not love. Our go to favorite is the enchiladas. I also love the steak fajita chimichanga.  The chips, beans and salsa are fantastic. The atmosphere is very friendly and the staff are great. We eat dinner here a minimum of once a month.

Finally found our Mexican restaurant! This place was amazing. The fajitas, queso fundido, rice and beans, and homemade tortillas were so good. The service was excellent too. Cesar did an exceptional job, especially considering he had a large party he was taking care of too. Even the busser was right on it. Highly recommend!

I'm not sure where to start. I am new to Nevada and wanted really good Mexican food which I have yet to find. I took to Yelp and found this heaven! The first table we got we weren't too satisfied and though we aren't picky I asked if we could possibly get a booth instead of a table and boy am I glad that I asked. We were seated in Amanda's section and she was just a blast in a glass! The food was great and the service was AMAZING!  We will definitely be back and will ALWAYS request to sit in Amanda's section! 5 stars, 2 thumbs up and a thank you very much.  Oh and we stopped by the bar while we waited to be seated and the bar tenders were great. I will recommend this restaurant and bring my friends and family who visit! Oh and the fried ice cream.... Omg and I don't even like sweets. Great great GREAT!
First time here...bean dip and salsa was great!! Ordered baja taco , tamale, and shredded beef enchiladas...food was good...margarita was sooo yummy. Will come again
This is our go to local Mexican restaurant. Service is fantastic. Food is consistently great. Great happy hour and generous portions.

Delicious! Affordable! Amazing Mexican food ... my husband and I have been here many times ... the staff is always friend and the food is always great what more could you want? I recommend this place to anyone in the mood for a great margarita and awesome fajitas!
The food was pretty good. What was exciting was their fajitas! Lighting them on fire was an excellent touch. Been there a few times already.

Great service, great food. Amanda, Daisy and Echo were all so nice when I was doing takeout even though they were very busy with diners in the restaurant. Even gave chips and salsa with the takeout order. Looking forward to going back and dining in next time.
Delicious.....like homemade! And they treat me like family.  Very reasonable prices too. Highest recommendation!
Pretty good for what we had. We of course had the fajitas and they were ok. Not the greatest flavor in the meat or veggies but overall I would say I will go back and try something else.
Once again this place never lets me down always good food true authentic mexican restaurant i shall return!

Great prices and happy hour offers... even included original complimentary dishes!

Fresh and quality ingredientscooked flawlessly 

Best part of experience the service by Ceaser.
My daughter took way too long to decide she made him wait 4 times and he remained friendly and attentive the moment she put her menu down!

My favorite part of Juan's flaming Fajitas is the bar area , they always have the games on the machines are always a plus for players. This place has really great service. Depending on who the cook is or how or what you order can determine the number of stars I'd give. At an overall rating for price , food quality and timely ness I give it 4 stars. Juan and Alex behind the bar are both great bartenders. 

Pros : good happy hour 
           Bar/ TVs/ Machines 
           Patio 
           You can switch out your rice or beans for veggies

Cons : if you go to Juan's during busy hours there's a chance it could be really packed 
 
If you have to be at work or somewhere you'd rather not smell like fajita smoke save this occasion for another time

Parking can be a bit of a challenge
Great prices! delicious food! Not sure on customer service felt rushed but that won't stop me! Really good place gone a couple times already and will be back :)

Nearly a year from my last review. Since then, we have consistently visited at least once a week. We've now tried several menu items and they have all been D-Lish. I see reviews have piled on as 5 star. That would explain the wait. It's worth it!

I loved this place. They bring chips, beans, and salsa to start, all of which were good. The strawberry margarita was delicious. But the steak fajitas were amazing. They come with rice, beans, guacamole, and sour cream. You can chose your meat and corn or flour tortillas. Everything was so good and the service was great. I would highly recommend eating here.
Such a great local spot to hit for some authentic Mexican food. Generous portions and quick service, too.

The best Mexican food in Las Vegas! The food the services everything is great! I have people coming for out of town craving Juans..... been going to Juans since they opened and nothing changed! Love love love
The best Mexican place in Vegas, bar none! Love the variety of salsas and the sopapillas!
Amazing 1st time here had the fajitas for 2 everything was amazing we left with more food then we ate.

Found this place on Yelp. Staying on the strip and escaped today to go to Red Rocks for some hiking. We figured we'd find some good local food. Decided to try this place out. Excellent. The service was so great both in the Cantina and the restaurant. The food was amazing, probably the best fajitas I've ever had. My husband and I are on weight watchers and we feel great after the meal. They let you choose steamed veggies rather than rice and beans and have an awesome skinny margarita.  Next time we are in Vegas, we will make coming here a priority!!!
Amazing Mexican food worth driving across town for!  Drinks were on point and the fajitas are a good portion and delicious.
Awesome service. Great Mexican Ambience. However, food is not my favorite. I would be back because service was really great, they do have amazing people that works there.

Great food and drinks.  The flaming fajita for two is more than enough for two people.  You also get chips and salsa and a soup with your meal.  The lime chicken for the fajitas is the best.  

Summerlin Approved!

Friendly people, excellent fajitas!
Good prices, happy tummy!
I've sent so many of my clients here and they are all now regulars! Your welcome Juan!

Long wait after check in, busy Resturant however food was great and service was very good and friendly. Our server Hernan made a great margarita and provided excellent service at our table. He made great recommendations and helped keep our 4 year old happy with lots of orange slices. 

I had the carnitas plate which was good. Others at our table tried fajitas, tacos, and enchiladas everyone stated they were happy with their food.

I wanted to check out this place due to the high ratings and some of my friends have mentioned that they like this place a lot. As most Mexican restaurants do, they offer chips and salsa. They also offer bean dip, grilled jalapeños, and grilled onions. I really liked their bean dip and that they offer the grilled jalapeños.

We ordered the carne and carnitas fajitas for two people. It was enough for three people. It was alright but nothing spectacular that I would come back for. The service was great and attentive. The restaurant is huge with a nice patio. I would come back for their chips, bean dip, and grilled jalapeños and try something else.

I was in the mood for some delicious Mexican food and came to trusty Yelp to find it. Juan's isn't close to me, but I was willing to travel to meet a friend for dinner so this is what we decided on. We got to the restaurant at 7:30pm on a Tuesday night and it was packed! They told us the wait would be around 40 minutes. Both of us were okay with the wait, so we stood outside chatting, waiting for them to call our name. The wait ended up being only 20 minutes or so and inside we went. We were brought chips and salsa fairly quickly and within 5 minutes of sitting down, we ordered our drinks. I ordered a Mai Tai and it was amazing. It was strong and tasty and not expensive. Then a few minutes later, the waiter returned to take our orders. I ordered their flaming chicken fajitas and my friend did enchiladas. About 15 minutes later we received our food and a show of sorts when they light the fajitas on fire in front of you. I also asked for a side of cheese which is an extra $1.50 but holy mountain of cheese Batman! They do not skimp you on anything. Now, the food. No lie- THE BEST CHICKEN FAJITAS I'VE EVER HAD! Ever! The flavor was on point. There was no one seasoning that overpowered another. The portion sizes were good as well and the food that I took home for leftovers was devoured the next day and let me tell you, it tasted just as good reheated as it did the night before. As we finished up, we noticed it was close to closing time, but no one rushed us. We were able to enjoy our food and take our time. When we got our bills, I was so impressed by the total! It was less than $40 for both of us. For good drinks and great food? That's unheard of! I will be singing Juan's praises to everyone, because it was that good and I look forward to returning as soon as I can!

I've been here many times for dinner and it's been good.  However today I took my husband and friend to try the brunch.  I was very disappointed!
