My husband ordered the huevos rancheros it was one corn tortilla heated with 2 eggs on top.  Awful!  My friend and I ordered chorizo and egg with potatoes. The chorizo and potatoes were black from being burnt!!  Rather than scramble eggs into chorizo the eggs were just separate.  It was the worst breakfast we've had!   The bloody mary was watered down.  Very disappointed,  will not be back.  The wait for our food was almost 30 minutes.

I have no idea why anyone would eat here!  Anyone can make better mexican food than this at home. We ordered the Chicken Tostada, Chicken Chimi and Pork Fajitas. Chicken was extremely salty and frankly kind of gross. Fajitas were boring... same quality you would get at TGIFridays or some chain place like that. The free chips and salsa are all store bought crap. I swear the bean dip comes straight from the can. The quality and service are low! There is way too many good mexican resturants in town to eat here ever! Lindo is close by.... go there! Frankly I think Roberto's fast food is better then this place! 

Almost forgot about my terrible Coronarita... cheap margarita mix in a normal drinking glass with a corona sticking out.

1 of my favorite Mexican restaurant went on fathers day she took our names she said about 30 minutes i said thats fine 4 families came after us and they were sat before us i got up and told hostess she said sorry we just walked out and wont be back again will give my business to someone else!

This place is one of my "must haves" when I'm in Vegas. The crowd is always intimidating, and you'll worry when you'll get a table. If you're a party of 2, you'll get right in. From the tasty and fast margaritas, to Christian the super star who got us right in, to the super amazing service from Lupe. The place was PACKED to the doors and the service and timeliness of our food were incredible. We ALWAYS order the flaming fajitas, and we always leave with a goodie bag because the portions are more than sufficient. 

OMG! I forgot this! They serve beans, two salsas, and a plate of grilled onions and poblano peppers with your tortilla chips. And tasty soup when you order the fajitas.

We had all the fajitas they offered among our party of four
All were exceptional
Service was good and place was packed so get there early

This restaurant is all that we read it was! The fajitas were excellent with enough to take home for at least one more meal. Omar was a very, very good waiter. We never waited for anything, and he was very polite. Absolutely will return!

We only stopped in for a quick happy hour but are looking forward to returning during our next visit.  Had a couple of apps and a margarita and really enjoyed it.  We also tried El Dorado Cantina on this visit & preferred Juan's.

It's a must you get the fajitas! Other than the fact it's in the name, their fajita are bomb! Go the extra step and ask for the cheese on top, I promise you won't forget it! The verde sauce they bring to the table was delicious and the jalapeños and onions were damn good! There was some secret garlic salt on them or something, I ate the onions and I hate onions! I was disappointed with the albondigas soup though because the meatballs did not taste fresh and the seasoning was off. That is my favorite soup so I was a little bummed. 
There's a reason this place is so highly rated, do yourself a favor and go get yourself some flaming fajitas!

I really enjoyed this place and the great service.  The food overall was very good but the rice and beans were kind of in small portions perhaps due to the size of the plates.  The flour tortillas were extra good as was the butter I put on them.  So, only three stars.  Well I've had carne asada all over the place and this piece of meat was the worst by far.  Granted it was overcooked for medium but beyond that it looked like a large, thin Wendy's burger expect it wasn't as good.  For over $15 I expect a really decent piece of meat and it just wasn't.

Exquisite Mexican food complemented by amazing, sincere service. Mom and I ordered enchiladas that blew us away. Rich, toasty masterpieces served by warm, attentive hosts-pretty hard competition when it comes to the best Mexican food in Vegas. 

Pros: Flavorful food, fantastic service
Cons: The bathroom was frigid. That's it. That's the only con.

We live around the corner and can't believe how great it is just next door. You know it's good when every table packed w families and couples having fun and flames everywhere! (Amazing fajitas!!) ask for Lupe!!!

Came here for Cinco de Mayo and had a great experience.  Obviously very busy, but did not deter the customer service at all.

Two kinds of salsa and a bean dip come with chips when you sit down, as well as grilled onions and jalapeños. All of which were very good and a nice touch compared with most other mexican restaurants.

Ordered the civiche as an appetizer which was very fresh.  The main course combination platter of a Chile Rellano and chicken flauta was very good.  The star of the show were the steak fajitas.  Outstanding taste and the steak was perfectly marinated and cooked.  Flour tortillas were obviously made in house.  Will definitely order them again on our next visit.

Absolutely excellent in every way!!  The only way they could've made our experience better was by giving us a winning lottery ticket.  The service was excellent, the food was outstanding, the selection was vast and we couldn't be happier. Best food at an unbelievable price!  Absolutely coming here again!!!!!

Juan's has become our go-to Mexican place. They are always cool with special requests (I was on a strict diet for a while). Fajitas are yummy and the Queso Dip, Fundido and Enchiladas. Best frozen margaritas!

Very good service, it's a really nice place. The only downfall is the parking sucks. But that's not their fault so don't hold it against them. The food is excellent. Very attentive and wonderful waitstaff. Will definitely go again. The sauce is fantastic love the food love love love!
Yo Sebastian is the bomb and everyone is super nice. No complaints, good food, lots of chips, feels super authentic. I'm satisfied.

Had heard and read a lot of great things about the eatery - and since our family is a big fan of Mexican food, we were eager to give it a try. 

Didn't have to wait long for a table, despite the fact that the waiting area was crowded. Once seated, chips, salsa, bean dip and a (kind of weird - what do you do with this??) plate of grilled onions and jalapenos were promptly delivered to the table. Our drink orders were also taken. Then, the "chip guy" inquired whether we'd like more bean dip, and quickly brought over an additional four bowls. Seemed a bit like overkill, but OK. 

But then, nothing ... for about eight minutes. No one came to take orders. Our waiter noticed (finally) that we were ready to order, but said he'd be back in a moment. We ordered chicken tacos off the combination menu, a kids' enchilada and chicken asado tacos. All came with bowls of fideo soup, which was on the bland side (and mine was hardly warm). 

We also ordered the queso fundito appetizer. Don't bother: It's a lump of melted cheddar (not in a good way, but a stringy, difficult to eat way) with a few tomatoes and onions mixed in. Thank goodness it was discounted for happy hour (as was the strawberry margarita we ordered - good price, but nothing to write home about) or I would have been REALLY disappointed. 

Overall, the quality of the entrees was just OK - much better than the salsa/beans and queso, thankfully. I just wasn't as blown away by the flavor as I'd expected to be based on all of the terrific things I'd heard. The food was pretty run-of-the-mill. The service from everyone (with the exception of the the chip guy, who was top-notch) was spotty throughout. 

Will we return for another meal? My spouse answered that best: "If Lindo Michoacan is ever REALLY busy, this place could be an acceptable Plan B. But Lindo's never THAT busy" - in other words, we likely won't be back.

Second time I have been here. The fajitas have such good flavor and the prices are so reasonable. If you like great mexican food and a nice atmosphere, Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is the place you need to go.

I just celebrated my birthday at Juans, my favorite restaurant! The staff really took excellent care of us we were never without anything we needed. They are fantastic ! A special thanks to Amanda and all the staff, you guys rock! All my friends really loved the great food drinks and service

First visit here and i would go back, i was very pleased with all the free items served prior to the meal, the soup, salsa and beans were excellent.

I had the chicken fajitas for one and i was pleased, but i have had better.

All in all, very good and i look forward to trying more items from the menu in the future.

This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. The service is amazing but the FOOD!!! The fajitas are the best I've ever had and I love the "show" with the big flames when they deliver the fajitas. They don't cut corners and the tortillas are made fresh there. The soup which is part of the meal is delicious and I absolutely love the shrimp ceviche. Margaritas are also perfection. Try the mango margarita during Happy Hour (it's from 3-7p.m. daily) and you won't be disappointed! I've taken all my friends to try this place out because it really is the best Mexican restaurant in town. Love that they have a gentleman singing on weekends. I celebrated my birthday here and it was great!

We always have an enjoyable meal at Juan's.  Personally I love the Carnitas so much that I often don't stray away, but I did order the Juan's sampler last time.  It was terrific. The staff is so friendly from the minute you walk in the door to the time you leave.  You get a lot of value for your dollar.  I give it a thumbs up, all the way.

This place had great portions of food and prices were excellent. Ordered the Fajitas for 2 and was able to share it with plenty of leftovers. We tried the queso dip which was very tasty. I liked how they bring out chips and 2 different salsas and retried beans. Also and added extra: all the dishes you order come with a fideo soup which was a nice touch! Overall very happy with the food and service, I'll definitely be back!

Start with the bad, end with the good.

Ordered a margarita and unfortunately it was very weak and probably the worst one I've ever had. Barely tasted like alcohol at all but hey maybe I've just been getting some good margaritas EVERYWHERE else I go (including some pretty crappy chains).

Chips, salsa, beans, and jalapenos/onions to start. Great! The salsa had a nice spice to it. The jalapenos and onions were a pleasant surprise and tasted wonderful. I don't like beans but for some reason I liked these and ate more of them than anything else.

For mains I ordered a steak/shrimp fajita combo. Worst thing about it, WAY TOO MUCH FOOD! I guess that's not a bad thing but I did feel bad for how much I left. Every piece of it from the meat to sides were very good. The tortillas ended up getting very dried out since they were just brought out wrapped in some paper. This is something that should be figured out since it does take a while to work through the tortillas.

Overall great food, not good margaritas.
Best Mexican food in town. Seriously the price is right too! The margaritas are amazing, actually everything was!!!

This place is okay. I'm giving it 4 stars cause the staff was very friendly. We were sat right away and the staff was helpful.  Chips and salsa right away with beans.  We ordered a horchata, which was a huge disappointment, and a margarita which tasted horrible.  I'm guessing they use bottle shelf stuff cause it was horrible and only had 2 sips. We ordered their fajitas and the presentation was great.  They smelled amazing but the food was okay. Nothing to give it almost 5 stars.

Great food.  And our server Arturo was awesome. And even the busser was quick and had a conversation with is.  Really liked that the owner himself came by to ask how everything was and to thank us for coming in and to chit chat for a minute. Being in the restaurant industry myself I hold high expectations and this place did. Great job guys. Keep up the good work and great tasting food.

This is must try restaurant I guarantee once you try it you will go back. Since the restaurant opened I have been there at least 6 times. This this is my new favorite Mexican restaurant and once you try it it will be your too. You have to try the Fajitas and the Margaritas are amazing. The service at Juan's Flaming Fajitas is second to none! I highly recommend them give them a try.

This is by far the best Mexican restaurant ever! The chips and salsa, with warm beans and a jalapeño salsa, are like heaven in your mouth! They bring out complimentary soup...not being a big fan of soup, I was hesitant to try it but I did and I loved it! I ordered the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans! They were phenomenal! The service was absolutely amazing, quick and very attentive! This is "our spot" now! Salute!!!

I've been here a few times and I absolutely love this place! Great Mexican food, customer service is great as well. This restaurant is clean!! Which is something I always pay attention to. The menu has more than enough to choose from, but I can't help but to order the fajitas!! They are a 10 in my book.
Best food, best service, best value of all the Mexican restaurants in Vegas. Oh so good!!
Our go to Mexican restaurant. Great appetizers, fajitas, fish tacos! My family loves the Fideo soup and complementary dips and onions and peppers. The staff is nice and attentive.

Seriously exceptional food and service! They were so worth the visit! We decided to drive out a little to avoid the crowds on the strip, so glad we did. They had great customer service from the start, super attentive and nice. The food was really delicious. They also had live music. Such a great time. I'm pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food because I'm from SoCal but gotta say, this was very good.

Best margaritas in town and obviously the best fajitas(just look at the name). Impeccable service. The moment you sit down, chips, salsa and water are served. Food is super fresh..... the table side guac is TOTALLY worth it. I HIGHLY recommend getting the warm churro WOTH vanilla ice cream. Not kidding, LIFE CHANGING! Thank me later!!
Great service, friendly staff.  Food was good. Love the fajitas here.  Great taste.  Good atmosphere even for a very busy time.

We have been here multiple times and it satisfies our taste buds every time. This is our go to Mexican place. The salsa, bean dip,  and guacamole are delicious. They also give complimentary fried onions and jalapeño which pair perfectly with chips and salsa and any entree. The servers are pleasant, accommodating and attentive. The chips and salsa keep coming without asking. I have tried their chimichangas, burritos, Sea Bass, and fajitas. They were all flavorful and scrumptious. The portions are large enough to share. The margaritas are good too. We will be back for more!

Got away from Ventura and was in LV for Memorial Day Weekend.  Hit this spot Sunday for dinner.  Great environment, staff and food was just great.   Great chips, salsa as well.   My kinda place for sure.  But expect some wait bc this joint seems to be popular *(but well worth it for all of us that went) A++++

First time here and no regrets! The service from the hostess to the servers was excellent. The dishes are a good size and super tasty. The jalapeño margarita was bomb. Overall, the prizes are good for what you get. We will definitely come back for more.

I have tried many Mexican restaurants over the years here in Las Vegas, and hands down, Juans flaming fajitas is the restaurant. If you never have the opportunity to go to Mexico for the food, then go to Juans flaming fajitas. Go experience the food and the ambient of this restaurant.
As always great food!!! Good chips n salsa! Great food and service!  Our favorite Mexican restaurant!

Love the table-side flaming fajitas

Tried this place on a random Saturday afternoon around 3pm when nothing else interesting in the area was open.  Great find.  Obviously if a place is called "Juan's Flaming Fajitas", you have to try the fajitas.  Fantastic.  We like to get the combination one with steak and shrimp.

We've since gone out of our way to enjoy more fajitas here!
The chips, salsa, and bean dip that they start you with is amazing. The fajitas are yummy!!! I recommend reservations on the weekend.

My Queen an I Love Mexican food and eat at all kinds of places all over...this place is our favorite! Such amazing food and service at such great prices.

Thanks!
Great service, smiling faces, delicious food and great atmosphere! Amazing happy hour deals and did I say the food was deliciousness!!!!!! Lol

Everything here is perfect! My go to restaurant when we go out 
Happy hour is fun, we just walk in straight to the bar order almost everything on the menu and a pitcher of margarita!!! Yum!

This is a full five star restaurant. The service is as good as it can be and the food is always on the level. This place really goes out of its way to put that little extra something on the plate. Whoever doesn't like Juan's just simply doesn't know good Mexican food. I have been eating here from the day it opened and I'm not going to stop anytime soon. Thanks to all the staff at Juan's ill be back soon as usual. Highly recommend the breakfast burritos and the chimichangas !!!!

This place was amazing.  The service was off the chart and they had wonderful food there on top of it never had an empty drink never had any issues at all.  The fajitas great flavor.  This is one of our new favorite places.
Love this place ! Great service, supper yummy food ! The fajitas are soooooo yummy ! Loved the enchiladas and beef taquitos are a Must !!! The soup that comes with the meal is also very yummy !

I don't understand how people can rate so high. Came in greeters were awesome, was seated and then came the wait. Food was alright a bit salty, the hit here is the flaming fajitas which they douse in vegetable oil in order to light. We did really enjoy the chips, salsa, and onion chile slices however we did not receive amazing service like most if the reviews. They took ten minutes to get our waters and soft drinks, and the pina colada my dad ordered was pretty much ice chunks and milk. After receiving our meal we had to flag them down to get refills and extra napkins or what not. Definitely not a high chance of returning.

One of our favorite spots.  The manager is very friendly and the staff is always helpful and attentive.  The fajitas are all we have ever ordered because they are so delicious and flavorful.   Such big portions as well.  We would definitely recommend to our friends and family.

The BomB.Com every time we come to Vegas it's our go to spot. Huge portions great service and in expensive and I don't mind paying for great food but it's not expensive. Mind you I come from L.A. Some of the best Mex food out there but this is truly up there with OG as the get like going to my grandmas house in Mex.

The service was outstanding!! Our food was delicious!! I love all the way in Aliante which is a 35 min drive. Totally worth my hour 15 min round trip. Growing up eating Hispanic food. This is as authentic as it gets. 5 stars without a doubt.

Happy Hour Daily 3-7pm

Happy Hour specials are beer, wine and margaritas for under $4-$5.  Apps range from $5-$10.  

Sat on the patio which was really nice.  Started with Peach and Mango Margaritas.  For food we ordered the JFFC's Nachos, Queso Fundido and Shredded Beef Taquitos.  Food and drinks were great.  By the time we left we tried all 5 of the flavored margaritas and loved each one.  Can't beat the price of just over $5 (+.55 for flavored).  Service wasn't the best.  We felt rushed even though there was plenty of room of open tables.  Even with the service issues still a good choice for Happy Hour.

A lot of reviews are a little off base and not legit...LEGIT waited 20 minutes for 2 margaritas... service was a 0... I'm sorry but it really was ... food was a 7-10 pretty decent, nothing to write home about though. Lindo is better..

Update 

The owner contacted me and reached out. Lunch was very good and the service was much better. Thank you Juan I will be back again.

Holy crap! like the name of the place says thier fajitas are flaming! Located close to Tropicana and Fort Apache in the same center as In n out burger. When you come in you can go right which is a bigger dining area or go left which is their bar area which also has ample seating. 

They got TV's by the bar area so you can watch your sports (golf was on...?) this area is pretty tight so impossible to get bad service in my opinion because staff is always walking by you, they really can't miss you.  

You start out with noodle soup which I enjoyed, wasn't spicy. I ordered the steak ranchero, basically a steak with melted cheese on top. Comes with rice and refried beans. I enjoyed my meal but was thinking maybe I should have ordered the Fajita. Ellen F. ordered it and this guy rolls it out on a cart and whoosh! sets it aflame. 

Wifey ordered it for one and aside from eating my steak I was able to pick at it as it was more than enough, they also have an option for two. We ordered margaritas and we're with my parents, they had booze to and some extra sides. All in all with Steak a Fajita for 1 and Fajita for 2, booze for four people it came out to about $81 with the 15% check-in coupon from Yelp. 

Word of advice if your going to a place with the words flaming Fajita in its name, have the Fajita. As you want regret it, next time I'll try the shrimp Fajita.

First time coming here. First time at any sit down Mexican restaurant. Wish I had come sooner, muy delicioso. Food is great, drinks are great, service is nothing exceptional but not terrible. 

Had a carne asada burrito with green sauce from the one item dinner and two margaritas during happy hour. Everything was really decently priced and margaritas are a steal during happy hour. They give you chips, salsa, beans, grilled onions and jalapeños (and soup with your entree) before your actual meal so before you know it you've eaten your weight in chips and when your actual food comes out you're on the struggle boat trying to finish. All good though. I finished. Came at a cost but had to do it. 

Btw, you come out of the restaurant smelling like their flamin' fajitas so make sure you've invited everyone you needed to because people will definitely know you were there and will be bummed if you "forgot" to invite them.

My Husband and I Enjoyed our Mexican food!! I had the Chicken Chimichanga . Beans & rice, He had  1 chicken  & Beef Enchilada. Beans  & rice  large portions. Great Margaritas the best place in town .we'll  be back!!

Came here w/ a couple friends for my bday dinner it was so much fun! We live in vegas so I wanted to stay away from the strip & this place was perfect, they're super friendly, and provide great service, atmosphere, and food of course!

Update:The owner called and took care of the issue. Great resolution and he was apologetic.  I am thankful for the quick follow up. Juan took charge and I am satisfied with the outcome.

Check your credit card statement with your receipt!  I went there for the first time a few days ago and gave a generous tip of 30 percent. I checked my credit card statement and noticed the restaurant charged an extra $22 in addition to my bill plus tip! I called three times and explained what happened. I was told the owner was the only one who can help me out so I left 3 messages. I was told the owner would call today but when I waited all day and didn't receive a call, I called again and was told the owner left for the day. I got the impression this isn't the first time this has happened.  It's not about the money, it's about the principal and service. A few dollars added to a handful of tabs each month can make for a nice bonus.

The hostess were nice and welcoming. The atmosphere was great. The server and her assistant were both awsome The knights game on which was a bonus. They started us off with chips, beans and salsa. Their green salsa is really good.  And they give you a plate of sautaide jalapeños and onions. We ordered a lovelady to drink.  We ordered the chicken fingers and fries for my daughter. My boyfriend asked the server if they had carnitas as an option for a chimichanga ( it's not an option on the menu) and she said yes, so he ordered that with rice and beans. I ordered chicken mulitas. They start you off with video soup. 
 The beer was good. Served in an iced glass. The kids tenders and fries were great. My mulitas were really good, but they're hard to eat. It gets a bit messy. My boyfriend took a couple bites but didn't like his chimichanga. The carnitas weren't what he expected. They were a bit dry and weren't the shredded soft kind hes used to so he didnt eat it. He let the server know and sent it back. She asked if she could get him something else but he declined. When we got our check we were still being charged for the chimichanga even tho he sent it back. He talked to the manager Mimi. Her answer was, " you should have asked for the shredded carnitas." She made it clear that she believed she was right and the customer was wrong. She came to the table and offered 50% off the chimichanga meal. I asked her why if they had two types of carnitas it's not on the menu ot wasnt mentuoned by the server. She was very quick to say that other restaurants do it different ,but they have two types. Again i asked, if you have two types why wasn't  it mentioned. She said she thought 50% was fair because we also had chips and soup. I asked her why she was arguing with me if all i was asking was why if theres two types of carnitas it's not mentioned upon ordering. She mentioned  that she still believed that 50 was fair but that if we wanted off the check she would take it off. She walked away with the check and came back with it off our check. We don't go to restaurants to get a free meal. We go to have an experience and try amazing food. A customers feed back should be most important to a restaurand and it's managers. We didn't apreciate Mimis attitude. I loved everything else about the restaurant but vecause her unappreciative and rude attitude, we will not be back. She ruined our experience.
This review is long overdue. Been here twice and the food is ok. The reason I'm giving the 3 stars is because of their awesome customer service.

Simply the best tasting, reasonable-priced, and freshly made Mexican food I have had... and our server, Amanda, was very pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable about each item on the menus... they even accommodated a vegetarian diet.. which was a BIG plus for us.. highly recommend it!

Wonderful food, service and music!  Delightful atmosphere and delicious food  every time we go to Juan's.  Guacamole tacos were super and enchiladas super cheesy and food came quickly even though restaurant was packed.

First of all, parking is a bit of a mess since it shares a lot with in n out.  Sat in the bar area.  Service was attentive but they seemed to keep forgetting things. It was busy but they seemed to be fully staffed so I shouldn't have to ask 2-3 times for something.  Onto the food.  They dropped off chips and 2 kinds of salsa and a bean dip.   Salsa are pretty generic as was the beans.  Ordered a shrimp ceviche that was recommended by waiter but they seemed to forget about it.  Got the fajitas since that's part of the name.  Nice flashy presentation but pretty boring on the follow through.   Lacked flavor.  After asking the runner that we never got our ceviche, it finally showed.  It was okay but again lacked flavor.  Sadly, cucumber was most noticeable part which obviously shouldn't be the stand out ingredient.  All in all, a nice place but more for atmosphere than food.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas no contest.  Amazing albondigas soup, and the best fish tacos.  I wish they were here when I lived on this side of town .
The food was good but a little overpriced for what you got. The meat was also a little greasy for for my taste.  Not bad overall.

EXCELLENT
Always fresh and tasty.
They first serve your table with chips and 2 salsas with beans and grilled onions and serranos.
Then we always get the fajitas for two with steak and shrimp. It is always very tasty.
Comes with sour cream, pico de gallo, guac, tortillas, rice and beans for each person.
We dont live close so we have not tried their other menu items, but they all look great.
Each time we have been here there has been live music. (GREAT AMBIANCE!)
NOTE: Friday and Saturday nights for dinner can be 1-2 hour wait.

First timer but I'll be back! Awesome shrimp fajitas, great Margaritas (no high fructose nasty sweet and sour), can't wait to come back and try their other stuff. The owner Juan is present and making sure his guests are happy... very personable and it looks like it's paying off, the place was very busy. next time I'll sit in the bar though, too many kids, it's like chucky cheese in the diningroom.

Juan's was one of the first restaurants I went to when I moved to Las Vegas. It also happens to be about two blocks away from my home, so maybe that has something to do with it. This is a fantastic lunch spot and I've been here about 20 times in the last two years. It's a pretty large place between the restaurant and cantina side so if there's wait it usually isn't too long. I work from home and have often just came here for lunch where I almost always get the shrimp fajitas for $11 and leave stuffed. This can be attributed to the fact that I eat way too many tortilla chips because the warm bean dip they bring when you sit down is addictive. Service is usually pretty good here and I've never had a complaint about the food either. Perhaps the only thing I dislike about coming here is that it's in a busy shopping center next to In-N-Out so parking can suck sometimes, but it's not really a big deal.
Sebastian was an amazing server! The shrimp fajitas were heavenly. Tried this place on a whim and it happened to be $4 margarita Wednesday. So good! Can't wait to come back!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town! You want to try the quesadillas and the Guadalajara special steak with shrimp and scallops! It's my favorite thing on the menu. I haven't ordered anything I didn't like yet. Customer service is great all hands on deck is their motto. Fresh tortillas made every minute. Overall best place a must try for all my friends and family when they come into town!

Holy guacamole!  This place is fantastic!  We started with a few margaritas that were phenomenal. The salsa, beans, and roasted jalapeños followed. They were fantastic as well. We decided on the steak and chicken fajitas for two. It was really enough for four. They were the best fajitas I've ever had. It was a great break from the strip food and we only spent $50!

This place was amazing from start to finish. My hubby and I ordered the fajitas for two (just under $30) and were overwhelmed by the amount of food we got. Chips with two kinds of salsa and bean dip, two cups of soup, six tortillas, two plates of beans and rice, two trays with pico de gallo and sour cream and guacamole, and a huge serving of sizzling steak, shrimp, peppers, and onions. Which they lit on fire when they brought it too our table, which was awesome. It was delicious, and for the sheer amount of food, the price can't be beat. (The leftovers made a huge lunch for us the next day.) We also ordered horchata, which comes with free refills. It was on the sweet side, but I enjoyed it. Very impressed, and we'll go back again the next time we pass through Vegas.

By far the best Mexican food we have had in Las Vegas. The fideo soup was loaded with flavor and so we're the salsas. We ordered the lunch combinations so we could try a variety and we were not disappointed by any of them. The service was impeccable, we will definitely be back soon.

Front office and the ladies that walked us in and greeted us in and out where GREAT. Took us outside to the patio and at a corner it was nice. They are usually great but tonight my server was very lacking, no soup delivered to me and my two guests, asked for water twice, Margarita and drinks came out way too late we were ignored as she practically served other tables but just ignored us, at one point one of my guests had to call another guy over to get us plates to get through the appetizer. We skipped ordering Entrees as the Waitress showed up 30 mins later. I gave her a 40% tip like I usually do but it is was for mainly the front of house and the greeters that took us in. Our waitress dropped the ball her big time.

This place leaves Lindo Michoacán in the dust! The food is delicious and the service is exceptional. I frequent here often and I have yet to be disappointed. Hernan is the reason we keep coming back. He is always very attentive and makes sure we are full taken care of! This place is definitely worth our drive from Henderson.

Excellent service, 3 types of dip, plus onions jalapeños and gigantic chip bowl, super fast service, great prices. Couple of quiet booths Otherwise open Cantina, casual floor plan. Definitely will be back! Oh and $3.97 margaritas for lunch all great!
Wow, everything is great here! From the chips, salsa and bean dip, the fajitas, to the flan, it's seriously fantastic! Not to mention the service is wonderful too. My new favorite restaurant!

Great place! For anyone questioning the quality of food just look at the pictures. I can tell you first hand the taste way out shines the pictures. They bring out salsa, beans and grilled peppers w/ onions with the chips. The shrimp ceviche is to die for while the rice and beans have the perfect balance of authentic Mexican food.  Wash it all down with a red sangria and you will not be disappointed... Really reminds me of Viva Mercados. hint, hint.

By far my favorite restaurant ever!! I have known Juan for a very long time and he always takes care of my family and I! All the staff is very friendly and professional. Anything you eat is amazing and taste very good! I always recommend Juan's to everyone!!

I had been wanting to try this place every time we ate over at In N Out Burger across the way. We finally got to try it the other night.  Eric and I both had the flaming fajitas.  It was good and the onion and peppers they serve with the chips and salsa were so good.  We also had the churros. Yummy.  Crunchy and sweet.

Just great! First time here and I gotta say this will be my new spot. We had a pitcher of Cadillac Margarita ($33) and then we order a regular pitcher, all I got to say is pay the extra $9 bucks. Its well worth it! 

The food is great, we had the Chicken and stake fajitas and it was Amazing. The kids had Rice, beans and a cheese quesadilla. They loved it! 

The staff is great and very kind. The manager offered us an order of free churros. Those were so good, next time I need to try the fried ice cream. 

Over all my experience was great!
Decided to celebrate my birthday dinner here and glad we did. Food was amazing. Had a Cadillac Margarita, highly recommended. Birthday dessert was my favorite churro. Definitely will be back.

Loved loved loved this restaurant!  Friendly service, margaritas were with us in two minutes.  They bring you bean dip, peppers and onions and salsa with the chips. And the "flaming fajitas"!!!! Oh my!!  Can't wait to return. 

This is our 11th check in!  We really enjoy the friendly atmosphere and the great food!

Great food and nice ambiance. Servers were very accommodating and smiling. 

However, we literally waited 46 MINUTES before our food arrived!!!!!  I would have wanted to walk-out and cancel our orders but my wife was still busy talking to somebody over the phone. So I waited, waited and waited. And then I noticed that the 2 customers on the other booth who arrived 5 mins late than us received their orders already and then the 2 other tables received theirs as well..Then finally, came ours. I didn't complain about the unreasonable delay but the servers noticed that I was not happy. A server approached us and apologized for the delay and few minutes thereafter, they gave us a complimentary dessert.

I hope this won't happen to future customers. Good food but too much delay in the preparation. 20 mins of waiting is acceptable, 30 mins is already considered delayed but 46 mins of waiting is totally unacceptable. It's our first time to dine out here but it's not worth it. 

Thanks for the free dessert though!

The food is good. The fajitas are put on fire at your table, but are already cooked when they arrive. But I had a margarita, frozen, and was good. It really put me in a good mood for the food. The bean dip you get with the chips is good, get the pork fajitas because those are the best. I can't wait to come back. 
The down side of this visit is that there were two large parties right by us. The music from the man with the guitar was good, it really entertained us. But this white lady was the best. She was super friendly and smiled the whole time. Will come back for sure. Large parties welcomed.

The first time that my fiancé and I went here, it was a suggestion from my boss who said that the food is extremely good. We decided to come back again because not only is the food delicious, but the service is outstanding. The place was packed with not only people waiting inside, but outside as well. That's how good the place is. We were told that it would be approx a 30-35 minute wait and actually got seated within 10 minutes! The chips and dips were delivered almost immediately as was our drinks. After 2 or 3 sips of our drinks, they were continuously refilled the entire time. Our entree's came out rather quickly also. These people are the model of how service should be at any restaurant. We will definitely be back again.

Excellent fajitas!!! Recommendation for two people: get the fajitas for ONE. You will still have leftovers! We got a steak and chicken combination and it was delicious. My only complaint is the house margarita tasted like it came straight out of the bottle of premixed Jose Cuervo... I prefer something a little fresher. Other than that, the food and service were great.

5 stars for food & service! We have been coming here for many years and can't speak highly enough to the quality and freshness of the food and attentive staff. A family favorite where we bring out of town guests often! Way to go Juan.

Food is absolutely wonderful. The margaritas are very weak on alcohol we had to order 2 shots but it's ok, now we know and we can order something diff next time. The quality of food is great and customer service is awesome too. Thanks for the hard work!

We recently ordered a catering order for 60 people on a busy Saturday night. The food was packaged nicely, exactly as ordered, and great quality for the price. I definitely would use catering again at Juans and can't wait to return for our regular family meal!

After seeing so many of my friends check in to this place and proceeded to give it no less than 4 stars, I knew it had to be good. Just the pictures alone made my gut instinct (also known as my stomach growling and my mouth drooling) tell me it was gonna be good!

So I take my wife here to dinner on a late Friday afternoon around 5. We are greeted warmly and are seated immediately. Nice place. Very spacious. They even have a little stage for bands to perform I assume. Before we even see our server, there was already another guy putting down a basket of chips, salsa, and bean dip on our table. Talk about calming down a hungry customer! What an awesome feeling it is to chow down on some delicious chips and salsa while trying to decide what wonderful menu item(s) to order. Besides the chips and salsa, they also give you a cup of fideo soup before your entrée comes out. 

So we go with Juan's Flaming Combo for 2. It's your choice of two meats (Chicken, Steak, or Pork. Shrimp is a dollar extra), grilled with onions, green and red peppers on a sizzling fajita skillet. We chose Steak and Shrimp. When they bring it out, not only is it sizzling, but they throw some alcohol on top of it (some kind of tequila I think) and ignite it with a lighter. Which at this point makes you understand why they call this place "Juan's Flaming Fajitas and Cantina". This dish comes with your choice of rice, beans, and pico de gallo or sour cream, guacamole, and sautéed veggies. I went with the first choice while my wife went for the second so we can try all options. Turns out all items are very good. Of course to round it out you get either flour or corn tortillas because what is a fajita without the tortilla? It's like having a gun with no bullets or brushing your teeth with no toothpaste. It just wont work without it. 

As for the service, we didn't have to ask for anything. One thing that really stood out was that even though our server was doing an excellent job already, another server from another area saw me finish my water and as I was putting the empty glass at the edge of the table, she proceeded to fill it with fresh water. Wow! I like the fact that other servers are not just looking after their own area, but are more than willing to help out their fellow servers when it comes to simple things like refilling water glasses. Bravo to whoever does the customer service training at this place. Keep up the good work for im sure every customer will notice these things.

So any time I see or hear of anything fajita, I will automatically think of Juan's Flaming Fajitas! Im looking forward to bringing my friends and family here! Ole!
Fun atmosphere (indoor/outdoor seating), family friendly, great food, great service, clean facility.

This is my first visit here. It's a Sunday night at 6 o'clock and it's very busy. Theres a 30 minute wait and we were seated in 15 minutes.  we didn't have to wait for our server to take our drink order and our food was served in 15 minutes. Guss, our server, was on top of things.

I went back last week and had the Fajitas and Margaritas. As expected, it was great

Before I ate here I didn't like Mexican food but this restaurant has completely changed my mind. This is the best Mexican food I have ever eaten in my life. This place will turn anyone on to mexican food for sure. It is delicious and you get so much food for a very very low price. 

I loved the steak fajita and the california burrito was also really yummy and unique. The churro dessert was very good as well. They also provide you with so many complimentary appetizers like fresh tortilla chips with multiple dips and they will give refills on chips or dips. We refilled our refried bean dip about 3 times because it was so delicious. They also provide a complimentary soup which was reminiscent of noodle soup with chicken broth. We went home with full bellies and lots of leftovers. 

The service here was amazing. We came in 7pm on a monday and it was packed with a 25 minute wait. Somehow we were seated in only 5 minutes and our servers came by very frequently always refilling our drinks and dip and chips. 

I would definitely recommend this place & I would love to come back again.
Everyone treats u very nice .. Food is delicious.. Tortilla are . Well worth the price..

You guys are SO AMAZING! Seriously! From the servers, to the drinks, to the manager who walks to each table asking if the food and everything else! And the main reason why I come- THE FAJITAS! I recommend this place to everyone who wants good fajitas and a cool spot to eat with friends and family!! It's one of the best in the state, hands down! I love that I'm so close to this location as well! Makes it hard to stay away.. keep up the great work guys!!
I had the fish tacos. They were average. They have a good happy hour here. It was really busy after 5 and people were waiting for tables for quite awhile.

Love this place! Come here all the time for lunch. Service is always amazing & food is AMAZING! Love that they give you peppers and onions with your chips and salsa. Queso dip is fabulous. Would recommend anything on menu. They never disappoint.

Absolutely love this place. I literally crave it daily. Such a fun, friendly staff. Amazingly fair prices, and the best Happy Hour in town!  I've been three times, this week, alone. Entertained friends, and they've gone twice already, this week. We are all in love!!!

Good service good fajitas. I would describe the fajitas to have a Mexican citrusy flavor that stood out most. I liked that they offer grilled vegetables instead of rice and beans. I have to try again to have a better idea of the true quality of the food. But a solid pick and good choice.
Seriously amazing fajitas! The queso fundido is a must! You get three kinds of salsas which taste fresh and delicious. Great service and food comes out hot and fast.

Went here for happy hour and dinner recently with a party of four.  Drinks were fine, prices good (especially happy hour), food was so so.  Although their soup was excellent and their chicken was good, the beef was just rough.  Came out grey and just looked gross.  Flavor wasn't good either.  We all said the same thing about the beef, no matter what it was on: a taco, burrito, fajita, whatever.  Seating outside is nice.

It's a decent place for happy hour and cheap apps, but the food wasn't what it should've been.
Best fajitas I've had in years. And I eat a lot of fajitas. Lively happy hour with killer margaritas. Homemade chips. 2 different salsas and bean dip. Flaming fajitas are awesome. Love this place.

Wow!! So happy we found this place! The first time we visited, the waiter recommended the chorizo fundido for an appetizer. Good call! It was delicious! My husband and I ordered the fajitas for two...again, excellent call! So much food! We had plenty for lunch the next day. My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Oh and service is great too!
3rd time here from Los Angeles. Service has always been very consistent and excellent. Fajitas are awesome.
Great food! Great service. I will definitely be back! Love the presentation of the food. Get there early because parking is limited. It gets super busy.

Let's say the food was good, however the server was not! The atmosphere is loud, dark and crowded.  But the worst was Service when we finished we asked our server for a check he left ten minutes returned twice to clear the table I asked each time for the bill!?!   Finally he pulled it out of his apron like he was a magician or something what he heck?  If your table wants to pay and leave isn't that a good thing for the restaurant? Likely that I would not return

I have eaten Mexican food extensively throughout the entire SW USA for many years.   Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina have the best Fajitas that I have ever eaten anywhere, bar none!   They bring the Fajitas to the table and then throw on a large shot of clear liquor which instantly burst into flames.   We get the Steak Fajitas and the meat is deliciously flavored, soft - not dry and hard as so often they are else where, and mouth watering!   Of course you get the Nachos served immediately with both a hot dip and a hot bean dip.   With the Fajitas for 2 you get a very tasty cup of soup and then a large platter with rice and beans which are delicious.   The decor is simple with an outside eating area offered as well.   The service is fantastic, attentive and always give you the feeling they really want you to enjoy your meal with them.   On our second visit, though not our waiter, the waiter who had served us the last time checked on us several times to insure we were enjoying ourselves.   He actually remembered us from our first visit.   You can tell the staff enjoys working together and insuring that each customer enjoys their visit with them.   It has become our number one place to take visitors to eat and they are always impressed with the quality, amount and taste of their food!
I come here anytime I want Mexican food, Everything on the menu is good and so are all the drinks. Honestly I enjoy this place best in Las Vegas
This place is deelicious. If you're in Vegas you have to stop by and try it.  Large portions and authentic.
Had a great time!   Service was awesome.  Mimi was fantastic.  Delicious food and awesome drinks.

Okay first time best shrimp fajitas I have had in town yet 
Service is quick and friendly and even the wife who is not huge fan of Mexican food loved it. 
This place is much better than Pancho's in Downtown Summerlin. 
Great happy hour but get reservations or early it's so good you might there for a few till you get a table.

In Las Vegas for my Niece's Birthday and I needed a good Mexican restaurant near where we were staying, so I went with my tried and true Yelp App. Juan's had really good reviews and the pictures and menu looked great.There was ample parking in the adjoined mini-mall lot and it didn't take long to get a nice big table for 9 outside on the patio. As soon as we sat down the chips hit the table along with a bean dip and fresh roasted peppers and onions. Right off the bat the service was excellent and we never had less than 3 waiters hovering around for our every request. We all settled in with drinks before ordering our dinners. I went with the Guadalajara special, I got a large piece of Carne Asada topped with scallops and shrimp covered in a delicious brown sauce of some sort.My Carne Asada was a bit overcooked for my taste, but the seafood and that sauce were simply amazing. Everybody got different things including my niece who went with an order of the Taquitos. Her Taquitos were huge enough that they made a meal  for herself and her girlfriend. By the end of our meal the wait staff brought over a nice dessert with a huge Sombrero for my niece as they sang Happy Birthday. Overall everybody loved their food and Juan's really made my niece's Birthday dinner super special.

So I bookmarked this place because I heard from my friends that this is the go-to place for mexican food. Then.... my work got catered food from here and oh my golly gosh. Hello! The best. You will not be disappointed. Their rice, beans, tortillas, chicken fajitas and beef enchiladas are delicious. The flavor on their beef enchiladas are to dream about. The guacamole and pico de gallo was on point. Their chips are perfectly salted, not too much but enough to get addicted and eat it all. I definitely will try to eat at the restaurant. But if you need catering, this the place to order. They have a friendly delivery staff... and ... they set it up for you!
So yummy. I ordered the carne asada. It was so good. And the staff are all very friendly . Will definitely recommend this place
My best friends took me to lunch here for my birthday, I was great food and the server what wonderful and very attentive, I will be taking my husband here very soon.

Juans Flaming Fajitas is literally fire, pun intended. This place is always busy so you know this place has to be good. I ordered the steak and chicken fajita and my total was $30. Best $30 I ever spent. The customer service around here is A1. They always constantly check on you if you need a refill on your tortillas, chips, or water.

Top notch service!!!  Wow!  My buddy and I ate here after rock climbing and we were blown away by the attentiveness of the wait staff. Could not have asked for better service. The food was excellent as well. We will definitely go back the next time we are in Vegas.

Here on vacation and looking for a place besides casino food. Found this place through yelp and saw all the positive reviews. This place was awesome! Great customer service, good food and reasonable prices. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was nice. I would recommend this location for Good Mexican food!

You really can't go wrong here!  The food is amazing and the service is great.  The fajitas are served flaming on a cast iron pan.  I think the tortillas are homemade and the side dishes are always fresh and good.  The drinks are well done too.  It does get busy and sometimes there's a short wait.  Parking can be a pain because it's so busy but this is a very well run restaurant that serves amazing fajitas at an affordable price.  UPDATE: We're still eating here regularly; food and service better than ever! I'd say one of the best run restaurants in Vegas- really amazing; highly recommend!

Great food awesome Server. Visiting from Idaho . Juan Armenta was our server n what great service we received. He said he had only been here for a month or so but he was able to help us get around. Next year when we come back, we hope Juan will still be working here.

I've been here twice for dinner and both times my fajitas were delicious! I love the grilled chile's and onions served with your chips, salsa and bean dip which by the way is flavorful and yummy!! I must mention how impressed I am with their service, it's the best! The staff is so friendly and attentive which makes the experience all the better. I definitely recommend this spot for Mexican food. This is now our favorite!!
Love this place once again. Came for lunch and the special lunch margaritas $3.75. Service was great as always. We will be back.

Jaun's Flaming fajitas
Very, very good food!!!  The service is  very good.   The waiters and waitresses and even management is often checking on you to make sure everything is great,  and believe me it always is!!!

The food and service were excellent. Drinks were filled and empty plates were removed.  I had the shrimp and chicken fajitas. Awesome! Wife had the California burrito and my son had the asada torta. Both said their   food was really good.

The Caronaritas are amazing!!!  5 stars for sure. We had the chicken and beef fajitas that they let us split. I am amazed anytime I receive amazing customer service!  This is on our go to list for sure. A ton of family members have went just from us telling about it. Omg chips and salsa they do let u fill up be care cause you won't have room for the amazing meal your about to eat :)

Found this place on accident. It worked out great, it's far from our house. Well worth the drive. We've only been a few times. Every time the service has been great, food awesome and good price. What else can you ask for?

The food, service and atmosphere here are top notch.  I've tried many of the Mexican restaurants around town and this is the one I keep coming back to.  The menu prices are reasonable and their happy hour prices are really good.

Came here on a Sunday night during Happy Hour. We were pleasantly greeted and escorted to our table. The hostess informed us we were in time for Happy Hour, so we scanned the menu to see if anything caught our eye. Man oh man is their HH menu extensive!? I was blown away!? We settled on a beer and strawberry margarita. Beer is standard, good as always; as for the margarita, that could be deadly and dangerous. It is so perfectly blended that you cannot taste the tequila. As for munchies, we were given an endless supply of chips, salsa, and refried beans. Yum.

As for our entrees, they were ridiculously good. We both live in San Diego, so our standard for Mexican food is relatively high, but I would come here in a heartbeat, if in the area again. We ordered a beef chimichanga and a chicken enchilada. Both were delicious and flavorful, especially the chicken. Neither were dry either. The portion was just right too. Not something you would share with someone else; if you took any home, it would be a VERY small amount.

The service was excellent, above average I would say. The food was spot-on. I hope this place makes it. It's a hidden gem if you are looking for somewhere off the strip to relax and enjoy.

I was in Vegas a couple of weeks ago and I went to Juan's with a huge group. First, the chips and salsa are endless and excellent. Vegetarians, be sure to ask for the vegetarian friendly black bean dip! I am told by my meat eating friends that it is not as good as theirs, but oh well!  Juan's was located on the way to the Red Rocks so it was a perfect stop for us. The atmosphere was casual, and everyone was very friendly. 

I ordered an enchilada, and it came with a huge portion of rice and beans. The portions in general are HUGE. Oh, and did I mention they bring out a little bowl of tomato soup before your meal? It was a nice touch, even though it was 110 degrees outside!

American Mexican fajita joint done right.  Nothing crazy here...just solid all around with an extensive menu, solid bar, home made tortillas and salsas, and good service.  Heads and shoulders above all others in Vegas.

Frank & Fina's used to be my go to Mexican sit down restaurant in town until I discovered Juan's. The name is super cheesy but it's the closest I've found in LV that I feel is similar to the food in San Diego that I grew up on. 

I like that they give you bean dip and onions with your salsa and that it's not too salty. Though, it'll make you eat more chips than you'd like! 

I had the best carnitas plate here. Soooo good. Crips edges and moist pork.....that's my favorite thing there!

Of course, the margaritas are great and the service is always quick and super friendly. Love!

5 STARS!!!  Love this place.  I have to drive to get there but happily make the trip.  The fajitas are the best in town.  The condiments that go along with it are generous (grilled onions, peppers, avocado, pico, sour cream.  You get a choice of either corn or flour tortillas.   They also bring out an interesting cup of soup before the meal.  They also bring out hot bean dip and salsa and chips before the meal which is one of my favorite things about this place.   Juan, the owner is often there and working his butt off.  I wish they would open another location (ie. Summerlin would be awesome!!  (Juan, if you are listening).  What else to say about this place?  Everyone is friendly...service is great!!!! I love everything about this place.
Great food and good service! Thanks to our server Arturo. The busser was also very attentive. Enchiladas and guacamole was very good. My son had the Colorado burrito and he loved it. 4 1/2 stars
One of my and my mans favorite restraints. The food is always amazing and customer service great!!!!

We're local folks who absolutely love spending time at Juan's...especially on a Friday evening. Great food and the servers are awesome.  Love Maria and Amanda.  We're Juan's Flaming Fajitas happy fans.

I loved that they offered vegetables for a side. Usually Mexican food is so heavy but this was a pleasant surprise. And the veggies were delicious.  Actually everything was delicious.  We will be back.

Finally...decent, well seasoned carne-asada. Vegas is hit and miss with Mexican food. I guess I was spoiled being from Southern California and have high expectations. Their chips and salsa were excellent as well! I didn't have any drinks but I saw several other tables ordering some pretty legit looking margaritas. I will be back again for sure!

Everything went great! Amazing dinner! Margarita!!! Fajitaaaaaaa! Churrrrrrooooo Cant wait to be back!
Happy Hour 3-7 daily its the entire place not just the bar! Yey!

Very good food! They've always given us a lot for our money's worth. I love the shrimp fajitas and I find myself craving their signature soup. We've ordered take out a few times, but when we've dined in, the service is great and the manager (owner?) comes around to the tables making sure things are up to par. I like the decor and the atmosphere is relaxing. Will have to try out the bar area for a margarita or 2:)

Simply the best fajitas in town!  Juan makes you feel like his Oklahoma family every time you visit! The food is awesome and the service impeccable!  Their bean dip as well as the onions and peppers before the meal are the perfect complement to your food. Their homemade tortillas are also great. I am so glad Juan and his team have brought their brand of Oklahoma Mexican cooking to Vegas!

Excellent and Flavorful! We got the flaming fajita for two and was well worth the money and we will
Definitely return.

Best Mexican food I've had in a long time! I'm a native to Las Vegas and have tried many different places from here to Arizona, California, and New Mexico and this place is awesome! I came here with 3 other people and we all had positive things to say about our meals. The green chile and cheese tamale is amazing!! The rice is moist and not hard and crunchy like some places. Our service was great. No complaints from this bunch! Definitely recommend and we will definitely be back.

I cannot stress enough how happy I am that the talent behind the recently closed Viva Mercado's has found a new home here.  I was really hoping that I would find the same level of service and quality of food when I went here last Friday and I must say my expectations were far surpassed.  The happy hour deals were superb and the food was absolutely the same, if not better, than the food I used to eat at the old place.  You will not be disappointed with the food or service at Juan's.

The best Mexican restaurant in town. I'm happy they have exploded in business but sad the secret is out because now there is usually a 30-45 minute wait during prime hours BUT it's definitely worth the wait. We have been going to Juan's for years and I've never had bad service. The food is always delicious, always. Everyone is so nice from the time you walk in to the time you leave. It's definitely one of our favorite places in town to go to. Excellent service, great food and decent prices!

Wow is all I can say from start to finish. This was my first time here and I will be going back. There's not too many Mexican places I can rave about, but this place is. And for those who think Lindo Micochan is So Great - first of all, that place is terrible and Both times I went, service was lousy and the food was not only over priced but not even that good. Anyways! 
My friend and I walked in on a Friday night with no wait, around 8pm. We were brought to a booth with a friendly hostess and no more than 4 minutes later we were brought chips with bean dip and salsa. Both were good. 
Then a few minutes later, we were brought Fideo soup! That was unexpected even though it comes complementary at some places. I have to say, I'm not huge on this soup because nobody ever seems to get it right and I've tried it at a few places. This was by far the best Fideo soup I've ever had and was impressed already. 
Our waiter, Amanda, was So Friendly and pleasant along with being helpful with the menu, it was very comforting along with the great soup and chips so far.
I got the chimichanga with shredded chicken which came with a generous portion of sour cream and some guacamole and pico. I also got a taco with shredded chicken on the side with rice tortilla, fried. It was whoa! Ask for the house salsa with the taco or whatever you get and I recommend mixing in a little tapatio sauce. You'll be happy you did. 
Great portion sizes too! All that and my friend got an enchilada burrito with veggies on the side. I can't believe they serve veggies on the side. That's unheard of, and I'm not talking about a few peppers and onions. No. It was broccoli, zucchini and cauliflower that filled 1 half of the plate and had really nice seasoning on it and it; so good with the salsa too! All that for $28. Go here if your'e craving Mexican food and I don't think you will be displeased :)

The food was good. The fajitas were flaming as advertised. They are warmed with a flame under the hot plate. I have never seen this before. There was plenty of food and we all left full. The place was clean and the staff were friendly.

BEST. MEXICAN. FOOD. IN. SUMMERLIN!

I saw this place every time I was going up or down Trop (we live nearby) and always wondered how it was.  Our friend told us she loves the place and we had to try it.  Ho-leeee Mo-leeeeeeee.  Their food is amazing. Authentic Mexican (we're from San Diego - we KNOW Mexican food).  I would go on and on and on about their food, but suffice it to say, EVERYTHING is beyond FRESH and DELICIOUS.  They start you off by not only bringing chips (which by the way are really good - not greasy, light and always fresh and hot), they bring you the salsa, some beans and a bowl of fideo soup.  If you haven't ever had fideo soup, you haven't lived.  It's so easy to scarf down those chips, so be careful!  I order the fish tacos - and I swear they make their own tortillas. I keep meaning to ask every time we're there.  If they don't - they're the best corn tortillas you'll ever eat in a restaurant.  My husband usually orders tacos, enchiladas, or burritos, and he's always loved what he's got.  Never one complaint about the food. And I'm picky.  Especially with Mexican.  I grew up eating it in Tijuana.  

The best part?  AWESOME wait staff.  Never have to wait for refills, always checking on  you, and always very very pleasant.  

Definitely check this place out if you've been curious. I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.

This is seriously the best Mexican food I have ever had.

I love Juan's. My son took me there while visiting and we loved it!

We were so happy this place was as good as it's reviews. Everything was fantastic, super delicious! Our service was top-notch, Oswaldo and his partner(unfortunately we did not catch his name) took excellent care of us. The prices were so incredibly reasonable we were so shocked. A big five stars
One thing I miss from Michigan is the great Mexican food in Detroit.  Juan's  fills that void!  Everything is fantastic and we are never disappointed.
I've been here a handful of times. Can be tough to find great Mexican food in the valley. This joint delivers the goods. Five star approval and great service.
Best fajitas in town with great service. I recommend Juan's Flaming Fajitas to all my friends and they've all been very happy with the food and service n

wow,wow!
that was amazing! the food,and a service was excellent! 
if i could give them 10 stars! 
and i am a very picky eater.
i  wish all the employee a wonderful 4th of july celabration they deserved that. our server was melissa.
she did awsome job. i hope the keep the master cook!
thanks for the great experience! 
my friend recommended this place.
we were there last night.

The food is so good and so is the service.
The happy hour prices are ridonkulous - especially the fajita quesadillas.
Also, they service this amazing grilled pepper and grilled onion dish with the free chips, salsa and bean dip.

This place rocks! First of all, they show up with two different kinds of salsa, a pot of refried beans dip, and some sautéed jalapeños and onions just with the chips. Delicious! Prompt and courteous service, chicken and steak fajitas were tender and tasty. The pork enchilada and ground beef enchilada with their own separate sauce was tasty. Highly recommend!

Love this place...great food, margaritas, sangria and salsa.  Service was amazing! 
Waits can be long so check before you head there!

I know why this restaurant has food reviews, all friends of probably the owner. But let's face it seriously needs management, the food was wasteful. I ordered the mole inchelada which I could tell the chicken was pre-cooked and overlooked. Why are you guys wasting sour cream and lettuce? Nobody eats that, I could of gotten an extra enchilada for what was wasted in lettuce. I went with a party of five, I can tell the cook needs major improvement you can tell that none of the food is fresh. And for the price per plate I rather go to Denny's. I don't see this restaurant open when their lead is over. The
Ambience is dead boring, the manager took the waiters check which I don't approve of because I have worked in the restaurant business. The place can use a touch up, and I can save the owner more money Nd put more quality in the food myself. The French fries and chicken fingers my kids for we're just plain crap they didn't even eat them because it was so gross.  Cut back on the waste, fix the lighting. Have some Mexican music playing, make me feel like I'm in Mexico for some real Mexican food. Not some microwaved feel dinner, no offense. I give it two stars because the mole sauce was good that's it.

Finally ate here for the first time and let's just say, the fajitas do not disappoint! Quite possibly the best fajitas I've ever had! I love how they light them on fire before they put them on your table. Great presentation! And I also like how the fajitas are in a round raised bowl instead of flat on the table with those long handles so you're not constantly having to be careful to not burn yourself! The chips and salsa are excellent and bean dip is super good!
The service was outstanding. Several workers checked on us throughout our meal and were very friendly. I can't wait to go back. The only reason I did not give it a five star rating is because the place needs more decor! I like going to Mexican restaurants that are all decorated inside like a fiesta! There was nothing fun about the inside of this place. Will definitely go back

Checked this place out after hearing great reviews and we happened  o be in this side of town. We were there on a busy Saturday evening the wait for 4 was about 45 minutes. The front waiting area is a tight squeeze and a lot of foot traffic of people coming in and out. Once we were seated we were greeted with bean dip, two types of salsas, and chips. Our waiter came really fast before we even looked at the menus, but my kids knew they wanted horchata. They thought it was just okay. I had the guava colada and my husband had the sangria. Both drinks were decent, but we've had better. The food portions were large enough to share, but since it was our first time we all wanted our own dish. They had a live músico who my kids enjoyed listening to. Our food came out fairly fast and it was good. We'll try it again!

You know, for what I see outside versus the food inside, I'm impressed.  Their food is fresh, delicious, and portions can feed 2 people!  I signed up for their VIP texts that provide huge discounts and event info.  You should try this place.  It's flamin' good.

We love this place! I'm so happy my fiance' and I found our favorite Mexican restaurant. After moving out here to Vegas, we have realized how many mediocre restaurants there are and we haven't been "wowed" with any place but this one. The service is fantastic and the staff is so friendly. The complimentary fideo soup is always good. We usually order the beef fajitas which are never disappointing! This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in Vegas!

Man, the service at this place is phenomenal! 

As soon as we sat down, we were asked for our drink orders and were served a complimentary chips and salsa/bean dip. All of that happened even before we can open the menu! It's a bunch of different servers working together. I think that's one of the things that made this place stand out for me. We have one server who took our orders but there were a bunch of other people working around making sure our drinks were filled, our dips were not running low, the used plates were out of the way, everything they were on top of it!

The food was excellent too. I got shrimp fajita that came with a side of rice, guacamole and beans and your choice of corn or flour tortillas. I was excited to see them light it on fire! It was surely entertaining! If you order the combo on a Tuesday night, instead of paying $12, you only pay $10. The portions were huge and the sauces they provided were abundant. For two people, it was definitely a feast. We made room for desserts and ordered churros. It was sooooo good. Maybe because I have been craving them but seriously, with a little bit of whipped cream and a drizzle of chocolate syrup, those churros were melt in my mouth good. 

Also, I love it when the whole restaurant sings when it is somebody's birthday. It makes the ambiance more friendly and festive. I was definitely a good change from my boring Tuesday nights.

Wonderful. Staff service is excellent. Friendly, warm and attentive. All we've had so far are the fajitas and the guacamole. Both were excellent. Plenty of televisions, bar area is great. Just can't find anything to complain about. 

Oh, and the fideo soup they serve before every meal is fantastic. Have had a lot of different fideo soups, and this is number one without a doubt.

The food was good but the whole place was very dirty, also the service was not that good we didn't get our Fido soup until after the main course arrived but that was because the buser was more interested in flirting with the girls at the bar. I won't go back until I hear that this place has been cleaned up.

Great Mexican food and very affordable. There Fideo soup is the best ever. Service is always very good. Waiters, bus boys, hostesses always friendly. They seem to care about their job and enjoy their work.

Food is delicious. Wait staff was on point and worked as a team. Get there early if you want a seat because parking is horrendous. The in and out burger in the same parking lot takes up half of the parking real estate.

Excellent service and such yummy food! We will be back for sure! 
Our water cups were always full, super fast service, manager comes around talking to the tables. Food is so good! This is our go to place at least weekly!

Great atmosphere, fair prices, good food, and family friendly. Great margaritas, too. My only complaint is sometimes there is a wait even though it's a decent size restaurant. It's just so popular! Time to expand, Juan!

Okay so I really liked this place because it's super group/family friendly, and they're very attentive. Service was great, and appetizer replenishing was on point! They really know how to put on a show with their food:)
Recommend: sizzling fajitas, the veggie burrito, and the anejo is awesome. That bean dip at the start is also just perfection/addictive. 
The only reason I gave 4 stars is because it isn't the most beautiful of places, just average. But it is still excellent Mexican food and service. and I would totally go back
Tip: checkout happy hour times and try to always get reservations since they're always so busy

Great guacamole made table-side.  The soups are wonderful, so far i have tried the fideo and posole, both were outstanding.  I also had the special Margaritas and they were perfect.  We enjoyed the flaming fajitas and ended the evening with fried ice cream.  I can't say enough good about our new favorite.

Pretty mediocre Mexican food, in my opinion. It wasn't bad, just wasn't "Oh my God, this is the best Mexican food of my life" status. But I will say their margaritas were pretty stellar. Got a great deal for happy hour and had a coupon. Staff was friendly and quick, too.

Wow where to start. We came on a Thursday night during the last hour of happy hour 6:00 pm. The wait was 40 minutes. I asked if the bar was open seating and they said it was. We got there and were so lucky to have gotten a spot at the bar. The bartender Juan greeted us right away. He offered chips and salsa. The other bartender Javier came by and got our drink order. The server assistant was younger and walking around the bar he asked if we needed chips and salsa. All within 10 minutes of sitting down I had three people come and greet me! I was already sold! Great service is hard to find, next we ordered appetizers that were on the happy hour menu (shrimp ceviche, and shrimp cocktail) they came fast and were delicious. They served the cocktail with saltines and the ceviche with tostada. The bean dip and salsa they serve with the chips are really good. They taste like authentic salsa. We were so impressed we wanted to try more food! We ordered the two combo plate with Chile rellenos and an enchilada with chicken and red sauce. It also was served with fideo. The fideo is a light tomato based soup served before the main entree. This one at this location is so good! The food was great and I feel like I'm really picky when it comes to Mexican food. The service, the food, the ambience. They have it all. There is a reason there was a 40 minute wait! I love it I will be returning to try their specialty the Flaming Fajitas!

Awesome fajitas, great portions! Their happy hour is really worth it, excellent specials.  Do not underestimate their fajita quesadilla-delicious!  We would go more often if it wasn't all the way across town from us.
Fajitas were good, but appetizers and other dishes could use some work.  Flavor and texture was off.

New to town & was looking for a yummy Mexican food place nearby -- so glad we decided on Juan's! Everything was fresh & delicious. I had the pick 2 combo with a fish taco & pollo asada taco & my boyfriend had the seafood enchilada's. They were both cooked perfectly-- nothing overdone or too greasy. We both cleaned our plates. 
Service was awesome & friendly. Inside was clean & inviting. We will definitely be back for more. 
++ Happy Hour everyday from 3-7pm!
Las Vegas locals already know that this is the absolute best Mexican food in town. Service and food are perfect!
The food was amazing and the service was friendly and attentive. I will definitely come back.

Juan and his crew are amazing.... I've enjoyed Lunch, Happy Hour, dinner by myself, with friends, and with a large group.. Always outstanding service, HUGE portions, and the onions and peppers served with the chips and salsa are insanely delicious..

If you're looking for a new spot to make yourself a regular at, with incredible food and the service that consistently goes beyond your expectations, look no further - this is the place for you. 

My husband and I stumbled upon Juan's when we were going to in-n-out (who they share a parking lot with) and knew we had to try it - we are so glad we did. We were quickly welcomed by the host, who I believe is the owner, seated quickly, and had the best first experience - our server explained the menu, made suggestions, and was just a pleasure to be around. Every single one of our experiences since then have been just as awesome, or better. The service is always spectacular, fast, and everyone working always acts like a team. The last time we came on a weekend, they had a full mariachi band and chorus of singers - the atmosphere here is warm and comfortable, but also lively and fun... It's like they're welcoming you into their home. That's how great this place is.

Now the food - yes, the tacos are amazing. The chips and salsas (they have several- just ask!) are fresh and tasty - but they live by their name. The fajitas are where it's at!!! They have a great deal for fajitas for 2 - we always get chicken, and they are truly the best fajitas we have ever had. It's a huge portion and we always have leftovers. Plus we love when they come out, pour the vodka over the grill, and light the flames - what a presentation :) 

We're completely in love with this place and it's hands down our favorite mexican place in Vegas. Highly, highly, highly recommend!

This place is always busy and it's easy to understand why. The service is fast and efficient, the food is good, and the prices are very fair for what you get. The beverage selection is average. Portions are large. The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is the long wait times to get a table and the TINY waiting area.
