My friend and I were craving Mexican food so I found this place on yelp. We went for lunch & it was okay. We started with coronitas which were very tasty. I had the shrimp fajitas and my friend has the fish tacos. Over all the food was good but nothing amazing to where I have to come back again. I liked their chips and salsa that they served before the food came. Wish they had a better selection with fun alcoholic beverages or fresh Mexican waters.
The food & ambience is worth coming down to check out this restaurant.  It's great for large groups celebrating special occasions.

I am extremely disappointed in my experience this evening at Juan's. My husband have enjoyed coming here regularly since moving to Las Vegas. Their Queso Dip is one of the reasons we like it so much. Tonight, we were having friends over and decided to order their queso to-go to bring home and share. Upon arriving, the to-go waitress brought out a very small cup in a brown bag with nothing else. When I asked why there were no chips, I was told "chips and salsa are only complimentary for dine in guests". I reiterated that I ordered the Queso "DIP" and was expecting chips to DIP in the dip. She again said that "chips and salsa are only complimentary for dine-in guests" but she would be happy to ADD chips and salsa to my order. Let me be very clear, this was not a small side of queso that we ordered, it was an appetizer listed under appetizers on their menu. If the queso is not SERVED WITH chips it should not be listed as an appetizer but as a side instead! The to-go server did not see the problem with an appetizer of queso with no chips and ensured me I could ADD salsa and chips. I had no interest in adding additional food to an order I expected to be complete with chips. She did not offer to bring only chips, only that I could add them with salsa. 

In the past, the same to-go/host has greeted us. She's not friendly. The service staff is usually much more friendly. But, we go for their food. After this experience and the disappointing fact that because I'm not DINING in this evening I will not be given chips with the queso "DIP" appetizer I ordered to go, we will not be returning to this restaurant. Juan's is not the closest Mexican Food Restaurant to our house, but we've enjoyed the food. After this experience with their host / to-go person, we will find a different restaurant to frequent. 

I want to give zero stars for this evening alone, but I don't think it's fair to the kitchen staff to not at least be recognized for the food we've enjoyed in the past.

This place was really really good! You get a ton of food here! The drink prices are really reasonable, and if you go on a Tuesday you can get a 2 item combination plate for $10.95. My boyfriend and I got to the restaurant an hour before they closed and the place was packed, and now I know why. I will definitely be going back!
The food here is excellent however the REAL reason why I come here is for their homemade Flan! It's by far the best in town! If you ever eat here make sure to order it for dessert! The best!
This place is really good. Good prices and great food. Always busy but make reservations and you'll be fine.

Fast fast fast service! The menu didn't accurately describe each item- I didn't realize there were going to be beans in the quesadilla appetizer. But the tacos were amazing and we LOVED all the salsa options! Sat at the bar and had seriously delicious margaritas. I'll just pay attention to the menu next time! We enjoyed dinner on Monday 1/29/18

Start off with chips, salsa, bean dip and fried onion/jalapeños before digging into one of the amazing dishes Juans has to offer.  An obvious go to: fajitas, which they add flair to buy adding a bit of tableside fire to them prior to serving. They have a great, attentive staff who are friendly and ensure your dining experience meets your expectations.
The best Mexican food in LV! Long wait times Friday and Saturday nights. Well worth the wait!
Just had lunch here! Such a great environment ! Staff is very friendly. I had the taco de calle, food was very fresh. Will be returning soon.

The wife and I have been coming here since the day this place opened. They start off with chips and salsa AND bean dip AND grilled onions and peppers. They added a second type of salsa just recently to the mix which is awesome called Salsa Casera. The soup comes standard with almost all meals. I get the Carne Los Altos every single time. The pork is incredible and the sauce it's cooked in is sweet and jalapeño spicy. The corn tortillas actually smell like corn when you open up the holder and are super fresh and thick. Greatest Mexican restaurant I've been to. 
We also get the blended margarita. They have many other options but we think this is the best blended margarita we've had.

Had dinner here with a couple of co workers and wow the service was the best! They bring chips and salsa out first with some kind of bean sauce that is AMAZING. I had the appetizer sampler which had quesadillas taquitos and nachos and it was so filling. We ordered the cheese quest bake that they have and would definitely recommend that as well. Our servers were so attentive and nice they really made the experience for us!

Excellent meal! My party and I enjoyed almost every aspect of our dining experience. Everything from the beef in the fajita chimichanga to the presentation that resembled a volcanic eruption to the fantastic service of Oswaldo...Juan's Flaming Fajitas gets five gold stars and two thumbs up!! Can't wait to pick up some more flavor at Juan's!

With a long time lived in LA and now living in Vegas the search for good Mexican food was on.  This place has hit a g- spot. The fajitas are excellent..steak and shrimp.  Steak tender and shrimp were good size
 For starters the salsa,  bean dip and margaritas... thumbs up.... the jalapeño, onion mix is awesome, atmosphere great and service to match. 
We will be back....

After a busy day, I was starving and craving a little Mexican food. After checking Yelp, we decided to give Juan's  a try. 

We went early around 6 pm and were seated rather quickly.  The service was very good and the server, busser, and manager were all attentive. They brought out bean dip and salsa immediately which was so good. 

Once we ordered , we received fideo soup which I could have eaten 5 bowls of.  

I ordered a shrimp chimichanga w veggies and my hubby ordered a carne asada burrito.  Both of us cleared our plates!  

My first margarita was a little strong and just ok. But it was happy hour so it was good for the price. 

I definitely wouldn't go that early again as the place was packed with kids. I'm not anti kid but don't think they should be allowed to run around and scream in a restaurant. 

We will totally go back again soon and will recommend to friends.

Everything was absolutely amazing!!! Service on point the bussers the servers and even the hostess. We never had to wait for a thing and the food was authentic and big portions!! This was our first time here and we will definitely be back :)
Great lunch spot. Service was spot on. Had the shrimp fajitas- full of flavor! Will definitely be back again.

Been here several times and it has always delivered solid food and service. 

The chips, salsa and bean dip here are to die for. You can probably just order an appetizer and the chips, you are good to go. 

Their combo for two people is a good deal. For $25, you get their famous flaming fajitas (choose from chicken, beef, pork and shrimp), rice, refried beans, pico de gallo, guacamole and a soup. 

The service here was also great. Fast and very attentive. 

This is one of my go to places now for Mexican food.
Hands down the best Mexican food in Vegas! Our service was exceptional. You have to give this place a try. You won't be sorry.

Juan's Flaming Fajitas is my absolute favorite place to eat.  The food, service and casual atmosphere are AMAZING!   No matter how busy they are, they consistently deliver the same level of attentiveness and food quality making this a great place to dine or bring your friends!

Founded by a Mom on my niece's volleyball team who is a regular there. What a place. Fresh guacamole made at the table, house made tortillas soft, warm and great taste. The meat and veggies flavored perfectly. Great customer service. During peak times do expect a wait! Enjoy!

Really good Mexican food in a city full of crappie ones. Salsa is fresh and the grilled onions and peppers they bring out are a very nice touch.  Definitely going to become our go to Mexican restaurant.

The food was great!!! Everything from the chips and salsa to the main course rocked. They give you bean dip and sauted onions/bell peppers along with the usual chips and salsa. I am a fan of the salsa because I like it mild and well blended. So good! We had the chicken and shrimp fajitas. Very very good. The service was good too. They offered us tons of napkins over and over for our messy 1 yr old. We are going back for my birthday. I am excited.

excellent service & employees, always crowded and jam-packed, crappy watered-down tasteless Margaritas loaded with ice, no flavor , no booze, no sweetness, all food arrived cold and/or luke-warm. extremely popular crowd usually a wait for seats. lots of family and kids screaming. not cheap like most Mexican joints. keep going back for all the activity though not the food or the terrible drinks.

Upon entering Juan's we were greeted by friendly smiling faces. It was perfect weather to dine on the outdoor patio. The patio is nicely decorated with fresh flowers and most of the tables were in the shade at 6 PM. 
Service was prompt and we started  with a pitcher of margarita's. A complementary appetizer of sliced jalapenos and sauteed onions was well received along with chips and 3 types of salsa. The Chicken Fajita for 1 was large enough for 2. The entree is served on a dutch oven type pot and is flamed table side. The chicken and vegetables were cooked perfectly and piping hot. A very tasty and satisfying dish that is served with tortillas, rice and a choice of black or re fried beans. The black beans were excellent. 

Our server Hernan checked on us periodically and also refilled our margarita glasses.
Juan's has a very comfortable atmosphere and treats it's guests like family. I look forward to a return experience as their menu has a large number of choices.

Every bite was delish from the chips and  salsa to the finger licking good chicken fajitas. The chicken was very flavorful and veggies tender but still crisp. Cooked to perfection!  Dave the Manager stopped by our table twice to chat with us. 

Can't wait to come back and try some other offerings here.

I took my friends from out of town here for the first time and we were very pleasantly surprised. The fajitas were amazing. The chicken tacos were awesome. Great service. I highly recommend making a reservation. Yes the place is busy even during the week. Enjoy.

Omg the food was awesome. I know good Mexican food and this was it!! I also got the seal of approval from my sis who only orders rice and beans and ventured out and ordered a taco and tostada which she said was awesome. Please go see Amanda our server !

This place is still going strong!  Excellent service, great quality food.  Whenever we cannot agree to a place for lunch, this is always the peacemaker. 

Their taco salad is delicious and a go to item for me.  Their free chips and salsa with bean dip are an appreciated bonus!

I always ask for Diet Cherry Coke and I get it with no problems whatsoever. 

Clean restaurant. Awesome food.  Entertaining with TVs where ever you look. The staff is top notch!  One major reason we come here. They remember us!

If you STILL haven't tried this place you really are missing out.

Go.

Now!

Amazing food, service and ambiance. Ernoldo and Chopo were excellent in their table side manner and customer service was exemplary!!  We will definitely be regulars!! We had the Guadalarja Special and it was delicious!!!

This place is wonderful! My husband and I decided to try this out for our Wednesday night date night and went for happy hour....service was fast food was delicious! We sat on the patio and it was such a beautiful day. I got the Steak Fajitas which were the absolute best I have ever had. The steak melts in your mouth and is so tender and the peppers and onions were cooked perfect! My husband got the Steak Chimichanga and it was so flavorful and the best we have ever tasted. The margaritas on happy hour are a great deal and we got the Sopapillas for dessert. They were so delicious and made you feel so happy! I would give this place 6 out of 5 stars if I could. Love love love and will definitely be back!

Got here on a Friday night around 6:30pm. They said the wait was an hour but it was only about 20 minutes so that was great. Food was tasty so if all you care about is eating some good food, maybe order to go. 

Here are my issues: Their service sucks! 

We ordered their namesake- Flaming Fajitas. This was our first time here and I specifically wanted to see the flames. The person who brought the cart over didn't say anything. He just lit up the food. I had my back turned and was engaged in conversation. I happened to turn around as the flames were lit and had to get the attention of the people at the table to watch the 7 second spectacle. If this was the only issue, it's not a big deal. But it wasn't. 

Here's the main issue: The fajitas are served with a plate of rice and beans. I barely ate one fourth of it before the waiter asked to take it away. I would understand if my plate was empty but it wasn't. I informed him I was still eating. About 5 minutes later, he stops by and asks if I want to box up my food. I had another uneaten plate on the table which I was going to eat after I finish my fajitas. However, I felt rushed so I said ok to a box. I guess I'll just eat it at home. He brought the box and I placed it at the corner of the table so I could finish my first plate. He came by another two times to clear out dishes while 5 of us were still actively eating with no empty dishes to clear out. Dishes that my family were still eating from. We basically were being kicked out of the restaurant. We were not even asked if we wanted to order dessert which we were planning on doing. We were in the restaurant at the table for about 35 minutes from start to finish. I don't think that's too long of a time to be kicking people out.

Wow,  first the grilled onions and chili's served with the chips as well as the refried beans made just sitting down awesome.  Then we got with our meal the Sopa soup,  excellent and unexpected at lunch,  but it is what they do.  Now on to the Fajitas,  beef and steak combo for two: they were great.  Beef and chicken was tender and tasty.  A must try. .

We frequent Juan's a lot since they opened, sometimes more than once a week. We take everyone from out of town there and it's fantastic. But I realized when you are put in the bar area and aren't drinking you are forgotten. Tonight was our second awful experience and we will never let them seat us there again. It wasn't very busy at all but yet after 10 minutes we had to ask for someone to come over to us. Everything took forever and one guy even sat at a table to talk to a girl instead of working . The guy who took our order kept asking things over and over about our order so I told him he should write it down but he didn't and our order was all wrong. We couldn't get a refill on chips or salsa. I couldn't even get my water refilled. I know this isn't typical but tonight was a huge disappointment and things like this really turn you off from an establishment.

Probably the best fajitas I've ever had.  The service is very friendly and  great.  It has a typical cantina feel.  It was very clean in there. The chips are served with two kinds of salsa.  I only had the red, which was great and perfectly spiced.  They also served grilled onions and peppers to go with them, which is a nice touch.   I had the combination steak and chicken fajitas.  They were great and flavorful.  They brought them out sizzling on a cart.  And then they pour something on them and light them on fire. It is a neat presentation.  They serve them with soup (which I opted not to have, because I felt like it would be too much food), your choice of refried or black beans, rice, guacamole, and pico de gallo, as well as choice of corn or flour tortillas (I got the corn).  And the tortillas are made there at the restaurant.  It was awesome.  My only complaints are that the rice and beans were lukewarm.  It was alright though, because I put them into the fajitas anyway.  They brought the tortillas a couple of minutes after my food, which they probably were fresh from the oven, which was nice, but they probably should wait and bring everything at once.  The worst thing is that it is in the same parking lot as a crappy In-N-Out Burger.  I almost got into a wreck twice, with people trying to get to In-N-Out.  But I look forward to going back there again soon.  It's the closest thing to Tex-Mex, as I can find out here in Vegas.
Favorite place to go. Great service. Fresh food and oh so yummy. The fajita specials are great....soup chips and dips and the fried onions are bomb

I love this place! They have an amazing happy hour, great drinks, and pretty authentic Mexican food. I'm pretty picky about Mexican food and they definitely met my standards. They make really good margaritas and have such reasonable prices. The chips and salsa are the BEST I've ever had! They give you 2 different salsas, refried beans and cheese, and grilled peppers and onion. Really great to munch on while you drink and wait for your food. The service is also outstanding. I love their chimichangas, fajitas, and enchiladas. Their shrimp ceviche is pretty bland and tasteless, it's definitely missing seasoning and that tangy lime juice taste. They could definitely improve on that. Overall one of my fave spots in Vegas. Five stars!

I'm A Local And A Mexican Food Aficionado, Food Is Ok But Overpriced Based On Their Selection Of Food And Or Margarita's Not Sure If They're Trying To Bring Southern California Mexican Cuisine To Vegas But This Establishment May Have To Do Their Homework On Mexico's Region Of Different Styles Of Mexican Food...Just Saying On The Positive Side They Are A Small Business Owner

Finally good Mexican food! The portions are huge so be prepared to leaved STUFFED! They have great happy hour specials too. Staff is always friendly and attentive. I have gone many times and will continue to go back.

I've been here many many many many times and it's REALLY great food but I warn you, don't sit at the bar. The bartender who's name is "Juan" (not the owner) can't multitask to save his life. I waited 15 minutes and he never even acknowledged me or said hi or anything at all. There were only two people at the bar and I was one of them. He just stood back there making drinks pretty much staring straight down not caring about anything else. I asked to be moved into the restaurant because of terrible service in the bar and then on the restaurant side my order was taken immediately by my waiter as it always is on my visits. Customer service goes a very long way in my book and unfortunately that guy has none. They might want to tell him to step his game up or get rid of him.

UPDATE: I was served again by that same bartender last week and he was on point and very helpful, so maybe the first day he was just having an off day.
The best ever. Best service and food. The drinks are perfect. Would eat every day. All my fiends love it as well. They can handle big groups, with reseveration, as well.

Food was delicious and servers were very friendly and attentive and always checking on us!!! Got the the steak and shrimp combo fajitas.. It came out flaming if course!! Coming back for sure.. New favorite place to eat!!

The staff was so incredible! Very attentive and so helpful! I never had to wait for anything! The food and drinks were delicious! I came for happy hour and left very happy! The steak was so fresh and had great flavor! I will be back a lot more, one of my new favorite Mexican place! They brought out chips, salsa, and the best bean dip I've had in a while with sautéed peppers and onions... Right when I sat down! Can't wait to go back!

Delicious food with a great atmosphere (energetic, loud, and colorful), which I love.
They have a cute little one man guitarist.
Their tortillas are homemade and are awesome and they give you unlimited salsa, beans,and tortilla chips

Dinner with the best friend. Wow, cool place decent service and great food! 
My girl and I stopped in after shopping at ikea. What a great find. Few TVs in bar area, great selection in the bar for drinks, but we had margaritas. Very good standard margaritas. 
My girl had the Huge burrito with French Fries in it. She said it was really good (it looked great). And I'm one for visiting new places and trying what they advertise... Fajitas of course!!! The steak fajitas are so good and the Presentation when they are brought out, wow oh wow cool! 

I wanted a nice spicy sauce but all they delivered weren't very good ( for my taste). Everyone else must like them. 

The guy that waited on us seemed like he was really into himself. Like everyone walked in wanting him. Kinds cocky but whatever. Good luck with that. But the food was good!
Our waiter Omar was the best as usual, he is always kid friendly and very personable. Great service from the staff from hostesses and bus people.

I thought I had yelped this already but here goes....
This place is AMAZING.....beats Lindo by food and price!!!
My family and I go at least once a week and anytime we have out of town guests we take them too.
Fajitas for 2 is the best deal in town (it can actually feed 3 depending on your appetite)
They also have a great happy hour and you don't have to sit in the bar to order from the happy hour menu.
Def my favorite Mexican food in Vegas!

Holy cow I finally found a great Mexican place in Las Vegas! I have been on the hunt since we moved from California & I'm happy to say the search is over. Excellent food & excellent service. Such great service we tipped our waiter, Omar, quite well. I don't mess around when it comes to something I love! 
Since finding this gem we go about once a week for dinner. Fajitas are huge and delicious, the fish tacos are great & the Margaritas are amazing. Plus all the staff are friendly. Try this place out, you won't be disappointed.
Juan's is always fantastic.  They have lots of tasty dishes to choose from- even if you're vegetarian!

Must try their flaming fajita when you come here! They didn't name their restaurant after it for no reasons haha the fajitas are delicious! I like going here for lunch, as they have many options for only around $10. Their portions are also generous. I always have a leftover to take home. Best of all, a margarita is only $3.75 during lunch! Scored!! I also love that they serve their chips and salsa with a bean dip and grilled onions and jalapeños. Friendly service all around. During busy hours, parking can be tricky as they share the space with an In N Out.

Great food. Solid chips, salsa, bean dip, drinks. The entrees were good. If you like your flautas super crispy like my partner, just ask, they'll cook 'em a bit longer. Locally owned and operated and some of the best service I have had in a Mexican in Vegas.

First I would like to give you a short history on my relationship with Mexican food so that you can fully understand how genuine my review is.  I was born and raised for 17 years in Los Angeles, where I was treated with fantastic Mexican food on every corner.  I moved to Las Vegas and worked in construction for 10 years, surrounded by Mexicans and their wondrous food.  I learned to appreciate everything about authentic Mexican food as well as learn their language.  The problem, there was no good authentic Mexican food in Las Vegas.

I have tried almost every restaurant Las Vegas has to offer, and I can tell you now, after visiting Juan's almost 10 times, there is no question that Juan's is the best.

You are always greeted at the door with a smile.  If there is no wait, you are quickly seated and if you don't like the table, the host/hostess is more then willing to switch you to the table of your choice.  The bussers  are always quick to respond to your table with chips, salsa, bean dip, and a plate of sauteed jalapenos and onions.

The salsa is the closest to Los Angeles style restaurant salsa I have found in Vegas.  My wife caught me eating it with a spoon yesterday.  Yes, it is that good.  The bean dip is the best I have ever had.  I can't explain to you what that really means, just know that Mexican food is my absolute favorite and I love my bean dip.  My wife loves to take the onions, dump them in her bean dip and eat them with a chip.  The flavor is pretty mind blowing.  I prefer to take a jalapeno, and put it on every chip dipped in beans.  If you like spicy or jalapenos, give it a try.  Beware because they staff will continue to replace the bean dip and salsa and attempting not to stuff yourself on these delicacies is a difficult task.

Juan has 8 beers on tap.  8!  For a Mexican restaurant this is quite unique.  I have sampled the Dos Equis, Negro Modelo, Victoria, and my wife's Budlight.  The draft is always fresh and the prices are amazing.  Their happy hour runs from 3-7 every day throughout the entire restaurant.  A 22 oz fresh draft for $4.50 is hard to beat.  Every Mexican brew is served with a lime.

I am usually almost full by the time the entrees come around but I try to find a way to fit them in.  I have enjoyed every item on their vegetarian menu, their flaming fajitas, their carne asada, and all their entree's have been excellent.  Their flaming fajitas have a great presentation and the portion size is rather large.  There is one restaurant in Las Vegas that beats Juan's just in the Fajita category and that restaurant is called Leticia's.  The reason is because Leticia adds mushrooms and zucchini into her fajitas.  I had to find a solution for this because my wife is a Fajita snob and I didn't want to go to a restaurant that lacks in all other categories because their fajitas were "better" (according to my wife of course).  The solution was simple.

"Could we add mushrooms and zucchini to our fajitas?"  we asked.  "Of course" was the reply.  And so, our love affair with Juan's has continued and my wife gets the fajitas her way, every time, and they are excellent.

This restaurant is the best Mexican food that Las Vegas has to offer and I would put it up against any place in L.A, anytime.  To all my friends that haven't had a chance to partake in Juan's, make time, you are missing out on life.

P.S.  If the staff makes any slight mistake, which most restaurants would shrug off, you will be treated with free churros and whip cream.  Pray for a mistake because they rarely make one.

I loved the atmosphere, the food and the flaming fajitas, that was a nice surprise. 
For sure it's a nice place to get a great dinner!
Ya friend, you're gonna wanna go here, and often! Homemade flour tortillas and truly amazing dishes, cheerful service, you won't be disappointed.

This place will definitely be out go to for Mexican food! It's so good and the fajitas had such good flavor and the flaming of it in front of your table is a nice touch. It's kids friendly which is good being we had our daughter with us. Happy hour menu was good but we got a Margarita they had for cinco de mayo. Will for sure be coming back!

I love this place! I love their fajitas, the grilled onions and jalapenos, the bean dip, the chips and the soup that comes with the most amazing big, juicy shrimp and tender steak and chicken flaming fajitas! Super happy with Juan's from the day I stepped foot into this restaurant and Juan himself served us dinner until today! Keep up the great work :-)
Happy hour is the best! Good food, affordable prices and the staff is so friendly. We will be returning with our friends!

Horrible food and service. The atmosphere is tacky and the food is cheap. Will never be returning. Much better mexican food all over the valley. Most of these reviews are delusional, the food is less than mediocre and I've given this place several chances but enough is enough. Roberto's is better or even Taco Bell in this case

Being an original Texas girl, I grew up on Mexican food. I'll be honest, I've only been there once but will now be a regular! Every single thing from the chips to the deep fried ice cream was great! The service was amazing! It was early in the evening so they weren't too busy but no one stood around!! I loved it and will be back this week!

We went here for my boyfriend's grandma's birthday as this is her favorite restaurant. We were sat inside the restaurant and there were many TV's playing sports. 

When I looked through the menu I noticed a vegetarian section and was impressed that they notified vegetarians that their bean dip was not vegetarian and that there was an option of vegetarian bean dip. 

I ordered a vegetarian burrito with no cheese, cauliflower, and sauce. The burrito I got was literally just a bunch of vegetables wrapped in a tortilla with no beans inside. There were beans on the plate and another portion of vegetables, including cauliflower. 

The vegetables were good, but I was a little disappointed. I was expecting something like a portion of black beans, rice, and some veggies inside the burrito, but that's just not what it turned out to be. 

My boyfriend order the California Burrito with chicken and thought it was pretty good, but not amazing. One of our family friends also did not think the food was that great. His grandma seemed satisfied with her shrimp fajitas. 

The waiters were very nice though! They put a sombrero on grandma's head and sang her happy birthday, giving her little churros with a cherry and candle. They also brought a "shot" (looked more like a glass but it probably was watered down) of tequila out per her request and said, "ready?" She said yes and they held it to her mouth and had her chug it, no warning. It was pretty funny. 

Grandma is pretty lit.
Really strong flavorful margaritas and delicious fajitas that are set on fire before served. We received great service and the entire restaurant has a clean appearance.

If you view my profile, you will see that I don't provide a lot of 5 star reviews. I'm very critical of the service I receive. I'll give a 5 star review if I feel the food/service really warrants it.  Well guess what, today I'm giving a 5 star review. Several co-workers of mine recently came here and raved about the place.  So today, I decided to accompany them again and check out this place for myself.  Before you know it, there was group of 10 heading here for lunch.

When we arrived, we entered into the lobby and there was no host or hostess to greet us. However, 45 seconds later, we were welcomed by a gentleman. I said that we had a group of 10. He told me that the wait will only be a few minutes while they set up.  We didn't wait more than 4 minutes to be seated.  Immediately, a few servers came over and gave us chips/salsa and took our drink orders.  I explained that we would like separate bills and the server advised that we they cannot split 10 of us. I then asked for a compromise (5 on each bill) and he agreed. He even apologized to me when I was leaving for the inconvenience. I explained to him that I understand the policy and thanked him for splitting the bill.

Our orders were promptly taken and we were provided updates on our food by the server. Meanwhile, our server along with his help, refilled our drinks, and constantly kept our chips/salsa bowls full.

When I placed my order, I asked for french fries instead of beans and the server without problem said that he can sub the fries for the rice and beans. I was very happy that he allowed me to make the swap.

The food came very fast and it was delicious. I asked for cheese and ketchup for my fries and the ketchup was given to me 20 seconds later. Talk about efficient. These servers were right on point. I ordered the steak fajita and it was perfect.  

When we finished, the server processed our payment quickly and thanked us all for coming.  I will definitely return here as a result for the great food and superb staff. I hope the owner reads this review and feels proud that he has such a great team.  Feel free to send me a private message for more details on my dining experience. Thank you.

We really enjoy coming here. Our waitress (yes we come here often enough to have a favorite waitress), is always super sweet and provides personal and attentive service. Love the onions and jalapenos they provide with the chips and dip before your meal comes out. Be sure to get the guac and you've got the perfect appetizer. 

I always order the carnitas (I'm boring) but everything my husband has tried has been really good. Portions are generous and the atmosphere is lively but still good for families too. 

Only removing a star for the take-out situation. Trying to order over the phone is usually a disaster with either getting disconnected or not being able to hear to properly take our order. Once you arrive to pick it up though, they are always very nice & quick to get your order out the door.

It was okay. I would not drive out of my way to eat here. Everything was a little underwhelming but not horrible. The biggest disappointment was guacamole which was full of tomatoes. I could not taste avocado, citrus, or anything else really. There was more tomato than avocado.
Great food! Awesome service. They were on top of refills, chips, extra napkins. Every and anything you think of. Highly recommend this place! Awesome staff and yummy food. Can't be beat

Came here with hubby, bro in law and a friend after a day of moving. We were seated promptly and were given chips, salsa, and bean dip. The staff was very friendly and they even had a guy playing guitar and singing some old Hispanic ballads. 
We ordered the chicken tacos, shredded beef burrito, and chicken fajitas. Each entree came with a yummy fideo soup (tomato soup with noodles), a choice of rice and beans or steamed veggies, and guacamole and sour cream. Everything was pretty good but I've definitely had better Mexican food. The chicken was a little bland in my opinion but then again my best friend is Mexican and her mom is an amazing cook!

Would we return? Eh probably not unless we were on that side of town.

Happy hour is worth checking out though. They have a good assortment of appetizers and drinks on it.

Wow! 
We were going to hit "In N Out" while waiting on an oil change ,,,,, we saw this place and ditched the burger idea. Glad we did! 
We ordered Taquitos ( i'm not really too hungry, my sweety says)  and I ordered Rancheria Tacos. With a margarita, and a cervesa. Quick and friendly service. 
Chips were brought to the table, with salsa, bean dip, and grilled onions with jalapenos! Very tasty salsa and bean dip - and we massacred the onions , jalapenos :-)
The taquitos - a massive serving, with guacamole, chopped lettuce and queso. Sour Cream, too. The Rancheria Tacos were huge, too. Same garnish as the taquitos ,,, so friggin'  tasty, awesome! 
I don't precisely know what we expected, probably more mex food mediocrity, which is common, but "Flaming Fajitas" really exceeded all expectations for us both.
We will be returning. The prices are very fair, the food was definitely a cut above, service was great, and the drinks were ice cold.
Recommended. We'll be coming back here for sure!
Food was pretty good but the service was fantastic. Even though we walked in 40 minutes to closing, the staff was attentive and polite. I will stop by next time I'm in the neighborhood.
This is my all-time favorite Mexican restaurant the food is amazing. Great atmosphere great prices and just an all-around great restaurant experience

Okay so maybe a little overpriced for what it is, BUT IF YOU DON'T GO FOR THE FLAMING FAJITAS THEN WHY ARE YOU REALLY THERE?? Although not gonna lie, you can't beat $3.95 margaritas for happy hour.  

I mean seriously, Vegas sell fajitas everywhere and this place was like "let's put water on the fajitas, light it up, make it flame up, then make it our best seller. and BAM! Thus Juan's Flaming Fajitas was made. Definitely try it. All about the experience.

Their service is PHENOMENAL! It was jam packed busy and someone was always helping us at our table. If the server wasn't there, someone else was attentive to come by our table and ask if we needed anything. They are on top of the way they run things here so don't worry, no matter how busy it gets, they have enough people to attend to you.

Other than that, get the damn flaming fajita. Food was very flavorful, juicy, and what a cool experience to see my fajita go up in a 5 foot flame. 

This place gets packed towards the evening with a wait, so I suggest going a little bit before dinner because 1) it's happy hour and 2) it's happy hour

This is hands down the best Mexican restaurant I've ever visited. The team-oriented atmosphere made for fantastic service from all of the staff, the chips, salsa & bean dip (for free!) as starters were delicious, the fajitas were absolutely incredible (and really flaming - they light them ablaze in front of you!) & they even brought us over churros for dessert for free! My family and I were so pleased with our service and can't wait to return before we head back to Massachusetts. Thank you, Flaming Fajitas!!

Second visit and second time we had Omar as a waiter. Omari's great. He is a gentleman, personae and
professional. The food was fantastic. Had the New Mexican enchiladas. I thought that I was back in Santa Fe. Wonderful restaurant.

Excellent food, service and prices! We had a huge group and all the food was hot and delicious. They took us without a reservation and quickly accommodated us. They are very kind and professional. We had a really nice time. The bathroom is also clean which is always important to me.
We love the flavors and the service here. So much better than Lindo Michoacan and Macayo restaurants.

Wow! Great big basket of warm chips and salsa and bean dip and peppers right up front. Huge selection on the menu. I had the carne flour tortilla tacos with black beans and rice. Superb, all of it. Reasonable prices and busy, busy, when I was there 6:30 Fri and waited 10 mins for a table. Service was awesome! I wanna go back.

Food was amazing! The wait was long but it was a Friday night. 
  The only thing that was negative about out experience was the fact that we had to wait about 20 mins to get a check. Our table was cleared and cleaned right away, but the waitress was so busy with so many other tables. They need more staff for sure. 
  Again the food was amazing and there was so much. The fajitas for 2 fed us that night plus the next day for lunch.
I Love everything this place has to offer. Great food, great vibe, great service!!!  It's been 5 hours since I left there and I have told about 10 people about this place. I can't wait to go back!

First timer Wife and I had the fajitas they were brought out on a cart  sizzling and then alcohol pour on it then lit up nice show.
food was good portion and very good rice was not dry but the tortillas were kinda hard.Service was good  will return.

Whoever said this is not real Mexican food doesn't know what real Mexican is! We have lived in Southwest Vegas since 2006 real Mexican food can be hard to find. Glad this place opened up hope it stays open. Our first visit, definately not our last.

Loved this place!
drove by today and  decided to stop for a lunch. Let me tell you my friends this place is great!!! We went to the bar and the bartender (I did not ask his name) was the coolest guy. We could see he took a great pride at what he did and really enjoyed his workplace. The owner (or manager, I was not sure) was constantly checking on us making sure everything was to our liking and there were no complains from our side. We used to go to Mi Lindo Michoacan a lot for its Queso Fundido, now this place can easily compete with them. Got a pitcher of margarita made with Corralejo Anejo only for $28 and that's some good stuff!!! Bartender recommended Steak and Shrimp Fajitas and that's what we got for an entree. When the food runner brought it to us he actually flamed the cast iron skillet. Great presentation! Now the flavor was....WOW!!!
Shrimp were so fatty and juicy and steak had nice charr, just the way we like it. 
They told us it's going to be a great fiesta for May, 5th with mariachis and drinks specials, so we will do our best to make it there ( we are in the middle of moving).
Thank you gentlemen for taking such a great care of us! We will be back soon and I would highly recommend it to fellow yelpers!
Cheers!

Best costumer service ever!!! The staff is so nice and attentive. My husband and I had a great evening everything was delicious. My husband had seafood parrillada and I had the veggie tamal and chile relleno with beer! I just want to thank the staff for being so helpful and friendly I really recommend this place!!!!!

First time here and we came on a Sat at 1900.  30 minute wait time and WELL worth it!  By far one of the best Mexican Places in Vegas!  

Food was flavorful & plenty!!!

Live music & not a single employee was standing around.  Huge teamwork!  Our server was Oswaldo and he was great!

5 stars for service, food and value.  Hands down our favorite for Mexican food.  Never had a bad experience. Fajitas are fantastic of course, but everything else we've tried has been excellent as well. Lots of flavor and huge portion sizes. The bean dip and salsa they bring to start are yummy, chips are fresh and warm, service is always top notch!  Kids meals are a wonderful value as well and come with a drink.  

Other Mexican restaurants are much closer to us, but Juan's is worth the drive!
Staff was very friendly and welcoming and the food was so good! Loved the the chicken taquitos on happy hour!

This is was eh, ok. Not eh, I've had better, and not A-OK. It was eh, shoulder shrug.

Came here for dinner with some awesome peeps, Anthony (always fabulous), Cathy and Mark. The company was great. We always have a fun time. 

The service was good, above average. However, $15.95 for beef, chicken or pork fajitas seems high to me. ($1 extra for shrimp). For a combo it's $25.95 (again a buck more for shrimp). The side of guac and sour cream wasn't enough (I mean is there ever enough sour cream? Me thinks not). The fajita's tasted OK. But, for a place that specializes in them, I thought they'd have more wow. They serve horchada which I love. And even that didnt impress me. It tasted weak and strong on cinnamon. 
They do serve complimentary chips, salsa and beans. I happened to like the beans, but the salsa wasn't good. I wouldn't say it's expensive necessarily, but it's certainly not cheap food. I wont say I'll never come back, but it's not a place I'll be back any time soon.

Best Mexican food hands down! Will return when I do go back to Vegas. 

Must try the Guadalajara! Customer service best I had.

I have nothing but great things to say about this restaurant! We choose it because of the reviews and the ratings. The shrimp and chicken fajitas were excellent. Flour tortillas & salsa so very fresh and tasty . The atmosphere was very authentic. I give the restaurant 5 stars for the cleanliness in the bathrooms. I'm a firm believer that you can tell how clean a restaurant kitchen is, by how clean their bathrooms are.!  Staff was extremely attentive! We will go out of our way for a return visit on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Super delicious food, amazing atmosphere,  i like the guy whose singing, margaritas was very cool, servers was very nice and funny.  The enchiladas was amazing, i like that they have meals for vegetarians

A fun, lively atmosphere, solid food, and good service make this one of the better Mexican restaurants in town. The top item to try is the one they're known for -- the flaming fajitas. It's a tableside show of high flames that kids will love. The beef and chicken fajitas for two is the way to go. Portion sizes were large enough that two of us had some left to take home. 

Their guacamole is plenty good as are their margaritas, which they have several to choose from. Try a two item combo if you can't decide what to get. I opted for a chicken tamale that had a masa texture that was somewhat thick and gummy, but the flavor was solid. The al pastor burrito was filled with chunks of smokey, deep flavored pork. To finish the meal we tried their churros -- unfortunately too oily.

This place doesn't try to redefine the cuisine, they just do a solid job of executing typical Mexican-American fare at decent prices in a great atmosphere.

I finally tried out JFF! The parking lot was packed when we arrived, so I worried we might have to wait long for a table. Nope! Just a couple minute wait and we were on our way. Soon chips, salsa and bean dip were at our table. They also brought a side of grilled veggies! The salsa was alright, but could have been thicker for my preference. The bean dip was very good as were the chips. Our server mentioned they have excellent guacamole made table-side. The guac sounded good and I would be the only one trying it so, I asked for the small side priced at $3.95 on the menu. The small side of guacamole was not made table-side so I didn't get to choose any of the ingredients that went into the guac. It was just brought to the table already prepared. I didn't like it at all. it was just bland mashed avocados with way to many tomatoes in it. I would have liked some onion, jalapeno, salt and maybe even some lime, but I wasn't offered any. The kicker for me was when my food arrived and there was about the same amount of the same exact bland guacamole on my plate that I paid extra for prior. Had I known, I wouldn't have ordered the other, but the server also said it would be made table-side and to my customization.

My friend and I ordered "Combo Fajitas For Two" priced at $25.95 with beef and pork. This comes with a cup of "Fideo Soup" that is out of this world yummy. The soup really packed some delicious flavor. One thing that impressed me here is that a lot of the time when you order fajitas somewhere it usually is just meat and tortillas, but they actually gave a small side of sour cream, bland guacamole, pico de gallo and you can choose flour or corn tortillas. The meal also came with rice and beans that were very good. The fajitas were so-so for me. The meat is thicker than I am used to and was a bit tough and the bell peppers were still to raw and not cooked enough. My hubby ordered his own combo plate that had Chile Relleno and a Cheese Enchilada and thought it was good, but nothing to write home about. There were major hits and misses with the whole meal. Our server was very friendly and checked on us often. It was worth at least giving it a try! Will I come back? Not anytime soon, but I can see giving JFF another shot at some point maybe with a coupon.

When you walk in the dining area is on the right and there is a cantina towards the left. Happy Hour is 7 days a week from 3 pm - 7 pm.
Great lunch specials, the fajitas were very good and the service was attentive.  I'll definitely go back! One of the best fajitas in town. Better than lindo michoacan.

clean, spacious, easy parking, super friendly and accommodating service (takes reservations), food is amazing and portions are really generous! i reserved a table for 8 and when we arrived they had placed the 2 salsas plus awesome bean dips to be shared between 2 people and kept on offering refills on their freshly made chips. (grilled onions and jalapenos were also provided.) while it did take a little time for the food to arrive we had fun enjoying the atmosphere and the kids liked watching them make fresh tortillas. we of course ordered a flaming fajita plate, which was impressive and delicious but the rest of us couldn't resist ordering from the happy hour menu, which was impressively inexpensive and incredibly filling (maybe partly because you can almost eat your entire dinner with the bean and salsa dips?). they also provide complimentary soup, which is like a tomato-based soup with rice (the kids loved it), and we all left with to-go boxes! they do have tv's all around tuned into sports if that's something that you're into but a slight draw-back since we had young kids and a couple of the tv's were showing a pretty graphic boxing match. 

i'd definitely come here again and if we were locals we'd probably be regulars!

This restaurant was recommended to me by a couple people before I finally checked it out. I wish I hadn't waited so long. It is amazing. The food is great. The service is very attentive.  The chips and salsa are amazing which makes a big difference when I am picking a Mexican restaurant.  The best part is that you can order the most delicious fajitas without worrying about annoying everyone else in the restaurant when they bring out the sizzling caldron because everyone else is doing it too.
Fantastic by Far. We are very fortunate to have this place on our side of town. FOOD is by far the best we had here in Las Vegas.  Service is quick and efficient.  Worth going back again and again.
Great food, great service. Really not much more needed to say than that. If I'm in the area, it'll definitely be my go to Mexican restaurant.

First time here. Server was Omar. Started with basket of tortilla chips with 2 types of salsa, refried beans for dipping. 
Ordered our meals and we had the 3 taco meal, Chile relleno meal and the salsa verde meal. 

We all enjoyed everything. Our server was totally awesome. He would constantly check in on us and kept us entertained. 

Dessert of fried ice cream was ordered and it was the bomb! 

We would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone. And yes ask for OMAR he is a gem of a server! 

We will definitely come here again! Thank you for letting us have a great entertaining night!

Loved loved the food! I ordered the steak fajitas . The meat was so tender and delicious .. First of all they start you off with chips and salsa and some pinto beans .. Then they gave us some Fideo soup which was really good ( I recommend adding some lime). My kids ordered form the kids meal and their was a lot of food it was also very tasty . We went on Father's Day so it was really full but the wait wasn't so bad. Our waiter was awesome he treated us like he knew us lol I would  come again and I 100 % recommend this restaurant . Great authentic Mexican food

I did a take out order from here and the woman who answered was very nice. I went and picked up my food and I was SO surprised because she was nice enough to give me chips and salsa to take as well. The food was AMAZING and even my kids, who are picky eaters liked it and want to go back to dine in. I would recommend this place!

Huge disappointment. It got such good reviews and we were expecting authentic Mexican food. Nope this place is definitely food for gringos. Queso fondido was cheddar cheese mixed with mozzarella not oaxa cheese like it's supposed to be. Al pastor was sweet like BBQ sauce. Combination tamale plate came with only ONE small tamale for $10.95! I should have just ate at La Bonitas or Cardenas. That would have been way better.
This was a spur of the moment visit pulled in and we were met by really friendly host. The food was really good, large portions and super great service!! I will come back again and again!

Went back yesterday before we leave Vegas
Had the chile relleno
Wow, maybe the best item for us on the menu
See everyone when we come back to Vegas 
Keep those fajitas flaming!,,
Good job, thanks

I really don't know how I've never been to this restaurant considering that most of the people I know have gone and talk about it being so good. I had the steak fajitas and it really was probably the best I've ever had. I'll be back. Wow, so good.

Went in around holidays...food was not up to par.  Disappointing.  Love the food they serve while waiting for your food...beans, spicy peppers and onions but our meal was not very good.  Chicken was dry.  Not enough cheese.  Just small stuff that ruined the meal.

Good place for Mexican food.  The service is good and the food quality is good.  My only complaint is the wait time during semi-peak times and the waiting area is very small.  Overall a good place just don't be in hurry to get seated.

Great happy hour great food for the price
But just because i am NOT A GRINGO and my friend is hispanic u can tell the difference in the service you recieve its damm noticable

LOVE THIS PLACE! 
The service is impeccable--every time!
The grilled onions and jalapenos.....DROOL!
The shrimp in the shrimp fajitas are PLUMP and large!
The fajita burrito is to die for!
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!
We liked this place a lot.  Everything was very tasty, and the service was friendly.  The portions are pretty generous.

Went to dinner here last night based on a recommendation from my brother and sister in law and it was fantastic!! The restaurant was busy (I had called earlier for a reservation but they were all booked up). We got there at 7:05pm and were seated by 7:20. We were a party of 5 and immediately greeted as soon as we sat down. Chips and salsa (both delicious and fresh) were served within seconds. We ordered both chicken and steak fajitas and they were seriously some of the best I have ever had! Very hot and flavorful. Loved that they were served on a sizzling platter lit by fire from the waiter. Great show! Additionally we had the pleasure of listening to live music provided by the roaming guitar playing musician. He was wonderful and even took our requests and sang to our table! Perfect! Our waiter Gustavo was a "10" in terms of service and professionalism. Definitely worth every cent of our 20+% tip! We never waited for refills or plates to be removed. He was very prompt, polite and attentive. Our party agreed that we would be back again SOON!! Give this place a try! You will not be disappointed!!

Amazing!! Bean dip and salsa were worth going. Food is super. Staff and service are a 5+!
Update: Tonight I went again. It has been a month since I had the time to get back. Amanda was our server and she rocked it!! She was on point, funny and friendly. Food was AMAZING!! It is so hard to explain how phenomenal this place is!! 
Update: I went again tonight for my birthday late about 9:30pm. It was awesome like always. Sebastian was our server and he was fantastic. 
Time and time again a truly amazing experience. 
Thank you!!
Update: I LOVE this place. Went today and had the best service yet from Alex C. He was awesome!!!
Please share with him what an asset he is to your business!!
Update: Back again!

we live about 30 min away but they make it worth it every time! love the food fajitas are to die for!! the drinks are even better! you have to try the mango one frozen! Everyone there is personable, especially the ladies in the front.
Excellent food and service!! Will definitely be back! Even gave my kids a quick Spanish lesson while we were dining! The chips,salsa and guacamole are amazing! Authentic Mexican food to the core!

LOVE this place! My mom and I have been trying every Mexican food place in town trying to find the best and authentic place, and we've found it! Their menu is amazing, all of their food is quality and DELICIOUS, and the service is fast and efficient. I can't speak highly enough of this restaurant, and I'm hopeful they open up one closer to us (and all over town for that matter).

Pro's-
Service was good. 
A couple of the salsa's were good. 
Prices not too bad.
The soup with the noodle sticks was very good.

Con's
All of the food  besides the soup was bland. 
All of the proteins were dry and overcooked. Chicken, Pork, Carne Asada all overcooked and bland. 
Everything on the fajita serving platter had a burnt taste after about 5 minutes. 
Evident that many of the items were not made in house. 

If your by the airport try El Fresco's Cocina Mexicana. The best Mexican food I have ever tried.
I love this place! Good portions, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere, and the food is delicious!

We've come back to try this place out again and again, I think we'll just by pass it from now on.. The chips and salsa are so so, the chips themselves are flavorless and fried a bit too long, the salsa is ok.. I had the fajitas , the presentation it self is cool, but the meat is so well done its almost like having jerky, and really there's not that much meat , mostly veggies.. Since they flame as they come out maybe they shouldn't grill them for so long since they recook at the table.. The service was ok, nothing to wow about. The tacos were hmmmmm, just tacos I guess.. With so many Mexican restaurants around this place won't miss us...
We loved everything at JFF. We ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas for two and the serving size easily was enough for 4! Great food. Great service. We will be back! Yum!

Im a Dallas native and I have been living here for over a year. I have yet to find such a stellar Mexican food restaurant. The food was absolutely great and the customer service was AMAZING!  Not only were they so gracious and sweet, but they waited on his hand and foot with a smile! I will definitely be bringing everybody that I can for happy hour and food here I cannot wait to go back and I'm so glad I found this little hidden gem!

Awesome!  We went to Juans based on reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor.  Not a bad drive from the Vegas strip, and located in a strip mall.  Got in just before the Friday 5pm rush!  I had shrimp fajitas - and yes, they were flaming!  My husband had a wet carne asada burrito, and the meat was so tender!  Homemade chips were served with two salsas, bean dip, and grilled onions and jalapeño - yum!  We also had their special margarita on the rocks, and it was absolutely incredible!  Staff was so friendly and attentive, and helped made this a great choice for us out of towners.   A surprise free dessert of warm churros almost made us ask for a cart to take us out - we were stuffed, but so happy!   We liked it so much, we bought a gift certificate for someone at our hotel who did something nice for us - so that shows you how much we liked the restaurant!  On our list for whenever we visit Las Vegas!

**Edit - we went to the restaurant the next day because we enjoyed it so much, and brought two friends with us!  My husband had the Chili Colorado burrito, and IT WAS AWESOME!!!!!!  Our friends loved the food and staff too!

Great Mexican food The Best in Las Vegas.
The Chef and Wait staff are equal to none and by far the best in Las Vegas. Most of them have worked together for  many years for an established Mexican restaurant that suddenly closed about a year or so ago . The Chef has been doing his thing here in LV for many years and is one of the best. Juan's has everything going for it including some of  the best food salsa and Margaritas north of the boarder. This is also a Dallas Cowboys bar and has great deals on appetizers on game days and nights. Juan's is a great addition to the Mexican restaurant scene in LV. It also has a very comfortable bar and patio area.
Thanks Juan.
Omar is an amazing server. Love this place! Weekends are very crowded for dinner so expect a wait time.

Love Juans Flaming Fajitas, every type of fajitas I have ordered have been delicious especially the shrimp ones. The enchiladas de mole were delicious as well with their margaritas are great as well! The servers are always very friendly and attentive. This is definitely now a favorite and will bring friends and family along next time.

The service is off the charts.  Always friendly, attentive, never pushy.  Food is good, prices are very reasonable (especially compared with Lindo).  I don't know any place where you can get lunch fajitas for less than ten bucks.  Seems word has gotten out as well, it's getting more crowded as we visit more (which is great).  I hope they do really well.

I feel like I need to visit this place a 2nd time to give it a good sound review but I really don't know when I would get an urge to come back again. I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and although it's only 5 minutes from my home, it has taken me at least a year to finally make the trip. It might be because I've pretty much given hope on Mexican food in Las Vegas and rather just wait till my trips back to Texas to satisfy my cravings. Well unfortunately Juan's Flaming Fajitas has not changed my outlook on Mexican food in this city.

They provide salsa and refried beans with a basket of chips for you to snack on while you wait. I really liked the salsa but I wish it was a bit more spicier. Or just spicy in general. Kudos to them for being on point with switching out our baskets as we were close to running low on chips. 

I think these places are smart to provide free chips and salsa because it almost makes you lose track of time of how long your food is getting to the table while you're snacking away, this trickery didn't work on our party though! It took quite some time for us to finally get our food and when it did, 2 of the 4 dishes were already cold leaving it unappetizing -- cold burrito with hardened cheese and soggy fries in the middle? No thanks. 2 of the dishes down, and leaving one of our friends running to the restroom right away. Yikes.

Luckily I was on the (somewhat) winning side of the order. I ordered the Taco Salad which wasn't bad, but how do you really mess up a taco salad anyway? And it sitting out too long doesn't affect it too much, only made my lettuce a little wilted but didn't completely ruin my meal. My friend ordered the fajitas and although it's pretty cool they have it at high flames next to your table, I honestly think it's just for show and does nothing really special for the dish itself other than warm it up again. They then place this giant cauldron with the fajitas sitting on top of it in front of you, taking a large amount of space with little room left for the other people at the table or even (large) side dishes like your beans and rice. 

The prices weren't terrible and it seemed as clean as it could be. I don't think this place is an ultimate failure, we just didn't have the best first experience. Sadly it's the first impressions that matter the most right? So I have to confidently say that it will be quite some time till I feel I can go at this again.
Vegas has a lot of Mexican food. This one stands out among many others. Good food. Good service. Nice environment. Nothing to blow your mind but safe bets
Great food and service, make the drive! what are those Jalapeno grilled onion appetizers you serve with the chips called?
Seriously amazing! Great food, great service, plentiful portions and a dessert on the house... what more could you want?! 6/5 stars!
food was great! fajitas in vegas this good are hard to come by. Hernan was very helpful and courteous. keep up the good work guys. live music is very authentic!
Food is great! Portions are very large ! Kids love going here . The wait is long , but well worth it. Family owned , so they put a personal touch on there decor . Cozy authentic Mexican restaurant..

Shrimp fajitas, amazing!  Omar (our food server), amazing! Fried ice cream, amazing!  I am a Mexican food snob and this place is off the charts yummy!  It's always busy, so be prepared to wait a little, but it's oh so worth it!

My coworker was raving about this place, so I had to try it.

Lunch Specials FTW!!! I thought that was pretty neat that they had the options to choose 1, 2, or 3 items to make a combo. Ironically, I'm not a fajita person, so I ordered the Chimichanga & Rancho Style Taco ($10.49)

I wish I enjoyed the Chimichanga more, but it had a bitter/burnt/smokey taste that I'm NOT a fan of. And it was soggy vs. crunchy =(

The taco, rice, and beans were good though.

The service was superb and is what'll bring me back. They were super busy & food took a little longer to come out (during the lunch hour). But, their servers & staff ensured we were okay.
Our first visit July 26, 2017. It won't be our last! Fantastic authentic Mexican food, huge portions, excellent service. More than your monies worth. Highly recommend this restaurant.

My husband and I decided to go back on our own after we have been there with a large group -and enjoyed it even more! Happy hours margaritas were delicious and the food was fresh full of flavored and yummy! The service was a good as the food! We are highly recommend this place for authentic Mexican food that made practically a front of you! We'll be back soon!

Just enjoyed an excellent dinner with my family. The service was outstanding from beginning to end! The chicken suiza enchiladas and shredded beef burrito with red chili sauce is tasty. And the sopapillas are so yummy. The price is very reasonable for a family of four, with plenty of leftovers to take home. Found our restaurant for authentic Mexican food.

I don't eat Mexican cuisine very often, so I was very impressed by this restaurant. Absolutely fantastic service. Our waiter, Ernie, was very knowledgeable-- I had to ask him what he would recommend and we went through a gauntlet of questions just to get it exactly right. And I'll tell you-- it was perfect. The staff looks happy to be there, and genuinely care about their customers. It's fantastic.

The food is absolutely delicious. They serve up the fajitas by setting it on fire first, then serving it on the table. Super cool, and really pulls the atmosphere together.

I love this place, and will definitely be returning.
This place is awesome. Service is excellent and by far the best fajitas in town

My wife and I are new to Vegas, and after an underwhelming return from our google search for good Mexican food, we decided to try Juan's out.

The restaurant is nice enough: good appearance, well decorated and thought out, everything appeared clean inside and out.  Be prepared for a tight parking situation if you arrive during the lunch hour.  When we went, Juan's was not busy, but its already narrow parking lot is situated right next to a popular In N Out location which can make things a bit tricky around that time. Not a real problem, however.

I enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa.  The chips weren't served warm but they were fresh and tasted quite good.  The salsa was enjoyable too.  It was a pretty standard house salsa but I didn't mind it at all.  Most Mexican restaurants offer free chips and salsa when you dine in, but what I really appreciate about Juan's is there unique addition to this tradition.  They also bring out a bowl of refried beans (very tasty), and a plate of roasted Jalapenos and sauteed onions to the table.  Honestly, I love snacking before a meal, and im a spicy food fanatic, so these complimentary offerings really speak to me.

I can't say I enjoyed the rest of my experience as much. My wife ordered a steak fajita burrito and I got a two-item lunch combo with a chile relleno and an enchilada.  The presentation was decent, but there were no stand-out flavors.  Enchiladas are one of my favorite things in the world to eat and I've got to say that Juan's take on them are just sort of average. I liked the relleno a little better, but it wasn't great.  The meat in my wife's burrito was pretty good but she didn't like her meal, overall.  I'll admit, it's a little unfair to visit a place with "Fajitas" in the title and not order a fajita platter to try on our first trip, so maybe we'll try that if we ever return.

Juan's serves pretty decent Mexican food, the place is clean and the staff is friendly.  I didn't hate anything, but nothing really left me wanting more.

This is the best food in Las Vegas. We came here with a big group from work, and came back two days later with the family. Everything is so good, I could eat here every day and not get tired of the food.

Every time I go to this place it's always better then the previous time! 
1. Staff is amazing and is always there to cater to your needs
2. Food is delicious 
3. Atmosphere is great and family oriented 
4. The fajitas are to die for!!!

Ordered shrimp tacos that were the best I've ever had! Order was To Go- and it came with chips and salsa, beans and rice.  Above and beyond in taste- service and price!  Try the nachos- can't finish them...love this place!

Excellent food!  Tried this restaurant for the first time this weekend and we loved it!  The steak fajitas we very tasty and our server was energetic and on top of her game.  
We will be back!

Wow.  Where do I begin. The food is authentic and delicious. Before your meal arrives they bring out chips , salsa and some tummy refried  beans. So delicious. Great bar & Micheladas are yummy.  The place is always super busy. Its always worth the wait. Everyone is super nice. Thanks For always giving me amazing service. Cheers

Vegas has a plethora of Cantinas and Mexi restaurants....some good and some no Bueno!

I used Yelp to find one close to us that could handle a larger group, have a diverse menu (for picky eaters), great reviews, and good value.

Bingo: Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina!!!

Located right next door to the In N Out drive thru (on West Trop.) Juan's is a legit Mexi restaurant. Food was very good especially their Fajitas...go figure! 

Free chips and two types of Salsa and a great bean dip!!!

Great ambiance! Great bar ( killer patron Margs!)! Their combo plates are legit too!

Service was super friendly and helpful. Table side guacamole is cool!

Juan's also has an amazing happy hour every day and daily specials (each day is different so check out their website). The day we were there it was 15% off for Veterans ( That is Awesome!!!! Thank you!!!)

Plenty of parking. Weekends get crazy busy so beware.

Yelpers get $5 off their $50, or more, purchase!

I freaking love this place. We went there on our last day in Vegas. Unbelievably cheap food with big proportions. The guy who plays the guitar comes around singing, it was nice, but I had no idea what he was saying. $15 for a carneasada ( probably spelled it wrong lol) that includes rice and beans and a soup. Seriously ?! So much food for just $15. If I lived in Vegas I would probably go there every week.

This place definitely lives up to its 4.5 star average review. I'm from California so I've been spoiled with good, authentic Mexican food for my entire life. I was sad to find that good Mexican food is surprisingly hard to come by in Las Vegas. After trying a half dozen places and being sorely disappointed at all of them, I turned to Yelp and found Juan's. Over 600 positive reviews? Can't go wrong with that, right? Right! Everything I've tried here is amazing.

I can't believe I missed this place when I lived closer to it.  

Exceptionally good food (pork and steak fajitas on my first trip),  a great happy hour, a fantastic house margarita, and some of the best service I have ever had in town.  WOW WOW WOW.  Definitely my new first and last stop for Mexican meals.  Prices were more than reasonable.  I look forward to becoming a regular here.

Always great service ever time me and my family come in, I'm trying really hard to find one problem with this place but I just can't.for ever my favorite place to eat .great food friendly staff. Outstanding management

This is 3.5 stars, but I decided just due to customer service the smiles etc that I am going to give them 4 stars. 

The dips are great, the Fajitas are great, I have had nothing bad here.

I absolutely love this place!! For this quality and price, it's the best I've discovered in Vegas thus far. Literally everything is delicious here, starting with the chips and salsa! This place is typically packed, and for good reason.

So I should have ordered the fajitas.  They look and smell amazing.  I work graveyard and I was craving my standard a chimichanga.  But I thought I would throw caution to the wind and also order a fish taco.  
So I have never been here before and I show up at 1pm and I am seated in the bar.  Holy cow, if I knew that the chips and salsa and beans and grilled onions and peppers were showing up I would have NEVER ordered so much food.  Either way.......
My chimichanga was served with some kind of red sauce on it.  Not like advertised which said it would be served with guacamole and sour cream.  I really did not care for it.  My fish taco was right next to this red sauce drenched chimi, so I couldn't even pick up the taco.  The fish was blah and semi cold.  I was not impressed.   My service was impeccable.  I will be back to give it a second chance.

When I relocated to Las Vegas three years ago, I flew out here for a weekend prior to my move to apartment hunt. I utilized Yelp to find places to eat during my visit and I discovered Juan's. I can't say enough good things about Juan's. The servers are SO friendly, the happy hour is great and every time I go I can't stray away from the signature fajitas that they are known for. When ordering the fajita's, before they came out, there was chips, salsa, bean dip and flash charred onions and peppers AND a little cup of soup. It's crazy all of that comes "free" with the order of an entree. My bf and I usually split the fajita's, but if you want leftovers - order two orders. This place also gets pretty busy for dinner and only accepts reservations with larger groups, so we try to go during off hours if we don't feel like waiting.

This place is absolutely incredible!! When you first sit down they immediately drop off chips with bean dip, two types of salsa, and grilled onions + peppers which was incredible. Not your average and boring table-side chips and salsa. The fajitas are amazing, they flame them at your table and it's a very large portion which also comes with a soup as an appetizer. The amount of food you get at this place is incredible and the prices are great! Our server was incredible. All around, it was an amazing dining experience and I look forward to coming back!!
This place is amazing customer service no better in Vegas very friendly people and food is outstanding . A must go to here in Vegas

This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I had been looking for years to find a great Mexican restaurant. Finally the quest was over when I ate her. 
The chicken nopalitos is amazing. My favorite! Anything I have had there is outstanding. Hand made corn and flower tortillas. 
The wait staff is friendly and courteous. Always a great experience!

I can't get over how cool the actual flaming fajitas are! The food was insanely delicious and the staff were well versed in what the items of the menu were.
I normally cannot have milk due to my lactose intolerance, and the waiter who helped us was very sure that the kitchen staff would not have any type of dairy in my dish.
Yum!!!! Had the taco salad and it was delicious!!! I also loved the beans, grilled onions, and bell peppers that came out with our chips :) Great place to eat!
Great food-active and colorful environment! Service is fast-but restaurant is a little loud.

Great Drinks!!! And great food!! After a wonderful hike at Red Rock we were famished and looking for a "prep" beer although it wasn't on the menu our waiter assured us he could get it done!  And he did! We ordered an assortment of ceviches, a burrito and tacos!! Did I mention we were starving!?!? But everything was great authentic Mexican and very flavorful!
Once again another  phenomenal dinner experience . My wife and I shared parrillada de mariscos for 2 and it was great.

We're from SF and eat out a lot and I have to say that Amanda is one of the best servers we've ever had.  The complimentary Fideo soup is fantastic.  Amazing bean deal comes free with chip as well as sautéed onions and jalapeños for the chips.  We had fajitas and chile relleno it was all excellent.  They even set the fajitas on fire at the table.

Coming from New Mexico, we eat Green and Red Chile almost daily. Since moving here to Vegas its hard to find good, authentic Mexican restaurants. This is one of my top picks!! Good food, great drinks, prices are excellent. Suggest you try it out!!

I've been to this restaurant several times and have nothing but positive things to say. The service has always been excellent from the hostess to the waiters and bus boys all the way down to the owner (who has been there to greet us multiple times during our visits). 

The appetizers are very tasty with good fideo, grilled onion and jalapenos, and salsa and beans for the chips. The table side guacamole is also good a good choice. The only detractor is the chips. I thought that they used to make their own tortilla chips but the last few times they were underwhelming and bland. I don't know where they got them but I would much rather have true tortilla chips. 

The meals taste great and the portions are plenty big enough (2 piece combo fills me up and you can add another item still). I've enjoyed the fish tacos and carne asada burrito (red sauce) among other things. The taco salad with grilled vegetables is another highlight for me. On birthdays they will humiliate your friend by throwing a sombrero on and singing their version of happy birthday so that's an entertaining plus ( they get a super sweet churro dessert for being a sport). 

Overall I'm a fan of Juan's Flaming Fajitas and will be back again.

So happy I decided to stop in to dine. I've been passing this place for months, and finally I told my husband "lets try this place" and I'm so glad we did. The margarita's are on point! The service is Great! and the food is Awesome!! We are definitely going to return. Can't wait to try their happy hour!

Food: Delicious. Great chips and salsa. We ordered the queso fundido appetizer and then the fajitas for two with steak and shrimp. We also had a mango and a raspberry margarita. All tasted great and we had leftovers to take home. 

Atmosphere: Great decor. Comfortable booth seating. Friendly staff. Our waiter called us amigos which was a nice touch.  

Price: we thought prices were a little high. We went during happy hour and when we got our check we noticed none of the discounts were taken off. We had to remind them, which is not enjoyable. 

Overall we liked the restaurant and would go back.

Delicious food. Great price. We order to go, and they give us a giant sac of food including chips, salsa, soup, and bean dip included with our meals. They are friendly and quick. Also, they have several vegetarian options.

This place is the best.... And they have modelo on tap. The fajitas are great, so is the taco salad and nachos. They bring out chips with bean dip and salsa, as well as a delicious soup. I'm satisfied every time I come here, and I crave it. It's amazing. The service is fast, but I have noticed the place getting busier. We got the last booth tonight. They remembered us too, which I like.

If you guys LOVE mexican food, Juan flaming fajitas is the place to go. 
One of the best mexican restaurants in town. Best service ever - fast, friendly and right (if you know what I mean). Make sure you call in and book a table, cause usually the wait time for a table is like an hour or so. Busiest restaurant that i know!! Amazing job Juan!!!
