Despite the fact my order had to be remade 3 times as they couldn't get it right and my dad almost choked over a bone he had in one of his chicken tacos I can't give them five stars but I also can't give them less than 4 as they do have good food when prepared right. You can tell a lot about a mexican restaurant if they have good chips and salsa as usually the food is good I have found over the years. This restaurant is great and it might just be one of the top three mexican restaurants in Vegas. I love El Dorado but this is just right up there next to it.

If you try one appetizer, you have to try the queso fundido con chorizo! I can eat that and skip dinner. But they have amazing fajitas and burritos. These burritos are awesome bc it's a three meal size burrito... but maybe that's bc I fill up on the queso everytime. Great food, super nice staff. Definitely repeated visit type of place!

Tried Juan's the other night and LOVED IT!!! The service was top notch...very friendly and did a great job. We tipped the waiter and bus boy separately because he was also that darn good. The fajitas were decent but what stood out was the other little things. Amazing house margaritas, beyond delicious guacamole, awesome happy hour deals, super tasty salsas. I'm telling you..we will come back here 100 times. My girlfriend had vegetarian fajitas. Not my cup of tea but it was very refreshing to see a whole vegetarian section for her. 5 stars!!! I would give them 10 if I could!!

Had dinner there tonight. Flaming Fajitas, chicken and beef, flour tortillas and rice & beans. Two beers too. Soup was good. Grilled onions and jalapeno are great with chips and salsa with bean dip. Omar was on his game. Watch the Angles play the Twins. I would go back and you will get a good meal. Can`t wait till they get the homemade tortilla machine cranking out fresh tortillas. Still like Roberto`s hot sauce. Maybe i`ll bring some next time. 9/5/14

As promised, I returned with friends in tow. The food was as good as I remember. Right from the start, our friends commented on how good the bean dip was that was served with the chips and salsa. My girlfriend and I had the chicken fajitas and our friends had the steak fajitas and the enchilada de mole. Everyone loved their food as evident by the lack of sharing. :-)

Thanks Juan and team! You never disappoint!

Authentic, appetizing, and simply delicious Mexican food. Their fajitas are outstanding. The restaurant isn't called "Flaming Fajitas" for nothing. They literally flame the fajitas right next to your table and serve them hot and fresh. Service is the best part about the restaurant. I must say, there is no better service anywhere else in Las Vegas. I'm not exaggerating. Once you become a regular, they really take care of you. 5/5
Awesome place if you have patience to wait, yet well worth it. Everything is good from the fajitas to the churros, which are a must. Sometimes I just go for desert

So a friend insisted that I give Juan's another try, that maybe I had just visited them on a bad day...so I did, got a large bowl of Albondigas soup, the one item I raved about in my original review. Pik attached.

It was just as good as my original visit, so guess on my previous visit the "cook" must of had the day off, cause that soup wasn't the one I just tasted.

Was good.
Love this place!!! Omar our waiter really went out off his way to make my friends Juanito birthday boy a Wonderfull time !!! Grasias a todos por tan burn servisio!!!

Great place. The service was amazing, the prices were very reasonable and the portions were good enough for anyone to be pleased with. I am a sucker for table side fire shows like they do with the 2 person fajitas as well. Mix in a good happy hour menu and prices and you get me as a customer 4 lyfe vato.

Javier,Gustavo and the hosts are so amazing here! They were so personable. We have been wanting to try this for a long time sooo we decided to have a cheat day today;) and wow it was so worth it! Everything we tried was beyond amazing. Amazing food and great service we will be back with family and friends for sure! Thank you for such a great lunch!

Finally was able to try this place out. Once we entered and greeted by a couple of workers we were seated in 20seconds. Then our server introduced herself and made us feel welcome and took our drink order. Since it was Happy Hour we had their house made margaritas and was very pleased.

Everything was delicious especially their famous Flaming Fajitas. I opt for the steak fajitas and enjoyed every bite. The meat was well seasoned and wasn't over cook but consistent and flavorful especially the grilled veggies and I was surprised with the portion size for a single serving of fajitas.

My sister and I shared a Flan for dessert and didn't regret it, because it was simply amazing especially since we had one in awhile. The soft texture and not so sweet caramelized sauce was perfect.

Our server Noemi was very friendly and energetic like the majority of the employees including a manager on staff. From the outside it look like an average size restaurant but it's large and broken into three sections: Main Dinning room, Bar room & Patio facing Tropicana. Will be back in the future!

Hernan our server was A+ ....I didn't particularly care for the vegetarian burrito as it had enchilada sauce and was a little moist for me . When Hernan noticed I wasn't eating it he quickly got the Mgr on duty Amanda who was Very understanding and had me a custom burrito out in 5min which was Bomb but the way . Awesome Service!

My husband and I are obsessed with this place! The food is great (we usually order the fajitas for two), the staff is amazingly attentive and super friendly, the service is quick, and we really enjoy having a great Mexican restaurant close by. Highly recommend Juan's!

The food and service (especially at the bar) are really great!! My only complaint is it's not very well ventilated. the bar area is better ventilated than the restaurant part however I have a serious shell fish allergy and since they have "flaming fajitas " if they walk buy with flaming shrimp it's very hard for me to breathe. if you have an allergy I'd definitely suggest sitting on the patio since the smoke consumes the room.
Everybody's so nice and friendly, and by far they have the best fried ice cream I've ever had!!

We came to take advantage of happy hour and it was so worth it! The margaritas with coronita or pacifico were great we order one on the rocks and one frozen they bot were equally good!! 
Chips, bean dip, rajas and salsa are complimentary and are constantly refill through out your dinner experience. 
Our server Mary was very helpful suggesting items and helping us decide what to eat, over all we enjoy every bite and every moment!! Great place, service and happy hour!!!

We were referred here by a friend so we decided to check it out (we live in dtlv btw and drove the distance). My husband got the 2 taco hard shell shredded beef combo and I got the beef fajitas. His tacos were bigger than most Mexican restaurants in the area. They were brilliant with their presentation because the tacos were laying on a flour tortilla to absorb the juice so your taco stays hard and doesn't fall apart when you try to pick it up. My beef fajitas were soooo good too. Oh, we got guacamole as an app and it was delicious as well. Great service, reasonably priced and best tasting Mexican restaurant style food in the LV area that we've had in the 10 years living here.

The food was delicious, the service excellent ! The Margarita!s the best! They also have an amazing Happy Hour! I have eaten here on several occasions and have never been disappointed !  The Fajita's are the best in town, Holy Mole, you must try the enchilada mole!

I honestly can't remember the last time I've eaten good authentic Mexican food at a restaurant until now. Holy guacamole, this place is legit. The parking lot was packed and there was a 45 minute wait but we decided to wait it out and I normally roll my eyes to people who say, "it's worth the wait" at restaurants, but shiyet... it's worth the wait!! (Cue eye rolling)

The service was friendly and quick! They have mastered getting you in and out since they probably always have a wait. Their guava margarita was strong and good, their shrimp ceviche was delicious, and their steak sizzling fajitas were tender and amazing! We only ordered an order of one for the fajitas and it was actually perfect for two! We also decided to order the fried ice cream and that too certainly did not disappoint. We practically ate the whole thing. I see now why this place is bringing in the crowds....

You want Mexican food? This place is where you need to be.

I don't understand how this place got the reviews it did, maybe friends and family. It's just another below average mexican restaurant. Same old beans covered with jack cheese, converted rice cooked with tomato paste and canned salsa. The tamales had little filling and the masa wasn't cooked. Look I'm not gonna criticize everything. If your idea of mexican food is cheap canned product covered with cheese and "red or green" sauce this is the ideal place.

Ordered takeout: combo fajitas (steak and chicken) and chips and salsa. Meat was seasoned very well and cooked perfectly. Food was delicious. It was ready very quickly even though it was ordered when they were very busy. Very friendly.
I've been here several times for lunch. The chicken fajita lunch is about $10 and it is always cooked well. Chips are thin and delicious and the salsa is good as well.
Perfection!  Yummy yum yum!!  Great food, great service.  I'm from AZ and have tried every Mexican food place in the city.  This is by far the best!

This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.  Not Mexican restaurants, all restaurants including fine dining.  

The service was amazing, from the manager who locked up our mountain bikes to the busser who made several jokes.  

The food value here is excellent and the quality is top notch.  We got the chicken fajitas and they were perfect. 

I can't recommend any restaurant more than this one.
The best Mexican restaurant in town. Food is delicious and sooo tasty. I ordered beef burrito so flavorful mouth watering.....

I ordered the steak fajitas because of the name of the resturant.  They tasted really good, and their service was average.  I could be going to too many Mexican resturants, because my baseline expectations are no longer reasonable, which is why I still give them 5 stars to help them out.

This is - hands down - the best Mexican restaurant you will find in the USA. Heck, in North America. 

Everything was made to perfection and the service was outstanding. 

This place will now be the PRIMARY reason for me to visit Las Vegas. 

It does not get better.

My husband and I came here for lunch on New Year's Day. Everything was delicious; from the complimentary bean dip, chips and salsa to my amazingly good ( and $9.99!) steak fajitas to my hubby's 3-item combo plate of carne asada, carnitas tacos and cheese enchilada ($10!). Our guacamole was delicious.  I love this place!

I've eaten here a few times now and it's definitely the best fajitas in Las Vegas. If you live on the southwest side of town and you haven't tried this place you are missing out. Me and my wife always get the fajitas for 2.

This place is amazing! Out of this world mexican food, excellent prices and the friendliest staff in town. I had a combination plate with a chile relleno and a fish taco and a carne asada rancho taco and everything was delicious! They served us chips and an amazing salsa plus bean dip plus a plate of grilled onions and jalapenos and a small bowl of guacamole. I just cannot say enough about this place. My new favorite mexican food place in las vegas. Thanks to Mary our server, she was on point the whole time and just fun ti have serve us.
BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS!!! Literally my favorite spot to eat & everyone there is so awesome. I've been there over 50 times & not one bad complaint about the service or food!

After reading all the reviews on Yelp, I made it a priority to make this my first stop after my conference.

Arriving on Tuesday afternoon, the place was packed.  The hostess recommended I sit in the bar area.  Unfortunately, the table they sat me at was right by the door going out to the patio, so cold air would rush in every time they opened the door.

I ordered a house margarita, which was pretty good.  Chips and 3 types of salsa came out soon after.  The salsa was mild.

I ordered the flaming steak fajitas.  It came out 10 min. later, I was still working on the chips and salsa.

One observation about the fajitas, is that they didn't have a lot of seasoning to it.  Besides that, it was some good fajitas.

My waiter Sebastian was very accomadating.  Other staff members stopped by the table to see how I was doing, I was never left alone.

Probably will go back, next time I'm in town.

Juan's is awesome. The fajitas are fantastic! Delicious margaritas. Really great lunch specials. The staff is really friendly and someone always comes by the table to make sure that everything is right. My favorite lunch is the chicken asada and their special margarita.

I've been all over the world and have dined at some pretty incredible places, but I have to say this place has the best customer service I've ever experienced.  The entire wait staff will stop by your table and ask how you're doing.  The waiter noticed our chips were crumbled and he got us another one just because of that without us even asking or noticing. The food is excellent and I will definitely be a regular here.

Always a great spot for great and fast service. The food is always consistent and  the menu offers so much to choose from. This is one of the best local spots that offers a delicious happy hour menu as well.

We are always searching for great Mexican food, with our favorites being Javier's and Sol Agave, both in Orange County. Move over guys, as I discovered Juan's Flaming Fajitas on a recent Vegas getaway. This place is the best! Great food and prices also extremely reasonable, but it's about 6 miles off the strip. This is my new go to spot when in Sin City, try it you will not be disappointed.

Great great service. Hernan, Arturo, Chapo and the rest of the gang are always happy to serve. You have to try the Menudo(served daily) pollo asado tacos, soap de fideo and pretty much anything else on the menu:) See you soon guys!
I am addicted to this place. So good. I love their chicken Mulitas and their grilled pepper/onion with their bean dip.

Went to Applebee's right before this and didn't get service there, so we left and came here. Been here a few times and it's amazing every time! Spectacular service! From the server to the bidder to the managers. There was even a singer with a guitar and he sang a song for my daughter! The food was amazing, can't go wrong with those combination plates. This is great Mexican food and it's solid every time!

Another amazing meal with the best service.  Had the two item combo chicken taco soft on a corn tortilla a cheese enchilada with green sauce an rice an beans. Another hit. Loved the chicken taco omg all white meat an seasoned perfect. Its a def must have. The cheese enchilada with green sauce was also very good. Thanks for another awesome meal....

Love this place...one of our favorite places to relax.  Italian margaritas are the best!  The flaming fajitas are not only showy but taste great.  Love the fedio soup.  Atmosphere is great and servers are awesome.

Best Mexican food I've had in a VERY LONG TIME. I've tired several Mexican places in Henderson and they come no where close to the yumminess of food from this place. We all had a variety of their fajitas so can only comment on that for now. Their rice was delicious and their bean dip with chips was out of control! Definitely going back.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It is great for my kids and the food is yummy. Service is always great and very friendly. The prices are great and it is always an enjoyable experience!! I would definitely try the Anejo margarita.

This places earns a legit 5 stars. Came here for lunch and was severed endless chips with bean dip and salsa. Chips, dip and salsa were so good we couldn't stop eating while waiting for the lunch entree. They were on top of drink refills and chip refills like some kind of magic from Disney land. It's hard to make me feel like I am on vacation while on lunch break but hey I really felt that way. I got the Mulitas and it was very good. The service coupled with food quality were out standing for the price. I will be back for sure.
This place is awesome. Anything I've ever had here is delicious, authentic, and fresh. Juan's super friendly and always checking in to make sure the experience is great.

Juan's is ALWAYS busy because it's ALWAYS good. It's great food, but the excellent, friendly service is what keeps people coming back. I've been here dozens of times...date nights, with family, with kids, girls nights. Always wonderful. Try the shrimp ceviche!

We have been going to Juan's ever since they first opened and I can honestly say that both the food and service has remained excellent every time we've gone.  The atmosphere is clean, casual and open.  The staff are very attentive and friendly.  A lot of the staff are previous employees of Viva Mercado.  Our usual waiter, Hernan, is awesome and has great recommendations.

The grilled fish tacos and steak fajitas are excellent.  The fish tacos are not fishy at all and has a great charred flavor along with a generous portion of fish.  The steak is very tender and seasoned well, unlike some places where the steak is chewy and tough.

Overall this is our favorite place to go for great Mexican food.  Highly recommended. If you have a large party make sure to make a reservation because it gets pretty crowded at dinnertime.

This place is my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant. Their food is amazing from start to finish. The chips and salsa also come with bean dip and awesome grilled jalapeños. Their fajitas are delicious. I especially appreciate that they can be ordered with grilled vegetables in place of rice and beans. The fideo soup is also delicious. I drive forty minutes from my neighborhood to eat here anytime I want Mexican food. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Our drinks are never empty and the food is always served fresh and hot.
This place is awesome!! Food is super yummy wait was very short and service was good. I'll definitely be back!!
By far the best pozole I've ever had! This place rocks and they have great drink specials!

Pleasant people and generous servings. If you are hungry for Mexican food and nearby this is a good choice. 

Pork Chili Verde for me and was impressed. Wife got  enchiladas and they were OK.

This place is really hard not to LIKE! I do not really know if anything is Superb about it, but I found the atmosphere great and the staff was very friendly and the servers we on it and made sure we had everything we needed taking care of us very well. I cant say the Fajitas were "the Greatest" I have ever had, but both the Steak ones and Chicken were very good and they brought the food out to all of us at the same time and that was five steaming plates. The Salsa was very good, some of drinks seemed amazing others had as I just had Iced Tea, but I had a very good experience at a nice place not too expensive....

Overall Very good and will be back soon to try some of their other Dishes.

Currently my favorite fajita spot. I love me some fajitas and this place knows exactly how to serve them up. While you're waiting for your food you are given chips, salsa, AND bean dip. Yum! The fajitas come out table-side, as the waiter creates a flame on them, before handing them off to you. Dinner and a mini show! The margaritas are my favorite there as well!

My nephews are in town from Denver for a BB tournament n after today's game I mentioned that had to try my favorite Mexican Restaurant...they said ok. We order (Tacos Adobados, Tacos Ranchto, Tacos de la Calle, Pollo Azado Tacos), Arturo was our server. As always, excellent service, polite, quick n when they would see a drink almost empty they immed ask if we need a refill. The food excellent ..my nephew's keep saying "thank you Auntie for bringing us here"  - not sure how many times I heard them say that. So than I see Amanda (1 of our favs)...we say hello n she brings out  churro!! And what I hear my nephew's say...

We stopped here yesterday for late lunch/early dinner.  Since it was Sunday, they had a brunch menu but neither of us were interested in that.  Immediately after being seated, we were asked about drinks and two iced teas were brought quickly.  

After looking at the menu for awhile, my wife opted not to have the fajitas for two but ordered the chicken azado Vallarta style--salsa Española with capers, banana peppers, and olives.  I ordered the flaming fajitas.  After all, it's the name of the place and that's why I stopped.

We were brought chips, salsa, bean dip, and a small dish of grilled onions and one half of a grilled jalapeño.  Standard fare except for the grilled onions and jalapeño.  

In a short time, our dinners arrived.  Mine was flamed near the table but far enough away for safety.  The fajita pan is a high pan with a circular top.  The chicken, peppers, and onions were nicely grilled and the flavors were very good.

My wife's chicken was good, and it was a very large portion.  I have leftovers for dinner this evening.  It was one whole chicken breast.

Not finishing her meal allows my wife to justify dessert.  I need no justification.  We shared an order of fried ice cream that was very good.  The crust on the outside was tasty and the ice cream was nice to have on one of our 100 degree summer days.

Service was excellent.  Multiple people came to check on iced tea refills, was it OK to remove dishes, anything else, etc.  One of the managers (owners?) came by and chatted and made sure all was well.  He asked if it was our first time at the restaurant.  He explained some of their current promotions.

I normally would have given Juan's a 3 star rating.  However, the service and the appreciation shown for patronizing Juan's figured in my upping the review to 4 stars.  I appreciate when businesses give good service and are glad that you stopped there given all the choices we have in this city.  I am a fan!

Was here on Saturday before fathers day around 5pm. They were pretty busy we had a party of 8, we were seated with 5 minutes.  The hosts were so nice to my kids they gave them some doodle pads to play with.  The minute we sat down,  someone was right there to get our drink order. Chips beans and salsa were delivered right after.  Took our food order, food came out so fast.  Food is delicious. Shrimp fajatis are bomb.  Chimagana are Amazing. Soup is the best ever.  Drinks were never empty even the manager was right there getting refills and asking us how everything was. love this place and you guys have a great process down of how to serve customers.  Don't change anything.

This place is amazing! This was our 1st time here and our server, Chris, was awesome. We started off with house chips/bean dip/salsa green & red).... we ordered the fajitas for 2 and it was sooo delicious! It was more then enough for the both of us. The service was excellent ! We would highly recommend this restaurant...one of the best (if not the best) Mexican restaurants we've dined in.

We made the trek down southwest to try this place after seeing all the positive reviews. It ended up being pretty decent but not worth repeating the trip from downtown.

The chips and salsa were fine, in fact, the salsa was actually pretty flavorful. The fajitas were very enjoyable, but the accompaniments left a lot to be desired. The refried beans creeped me out a little, and my wife reported her guacamole to be quite watery at the bottom. They just didn't seem very fresh.

I had a pretty strong-ass Patron margarita, too. Although - and this sounds totally lame - the balance was a bit off. The tequila overpowered the rest of the drink. I know - that's the dumbest thing ever to complain about.

Overall, Juan's is pretty decent but not good enough to justify the long trip.

After reading the reviews decided to check the place out! Of course we ordered the flaming fajitas & we were not disappointed dinner was delicious, the service was excellent & the strawberry margarita was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend this restaurant well worth the drive off the strip!

Tired of those little, itty-bitty fajita plates at those big chain restaurants? Want really awesome fajitas, that are so good they are literally on fire? Then Juan's Flaming Fajitas is the place for you. And it doesn't hurt to know that the red sangria is pretty darn good.

This place is delicious! I am a sucker for good Mexican and this place had it. My husband and I ate here after the Knights game on Black Friday. The place was packed but we were able to get a table in the bar right away. They had margaritas on Happy Hour, which we ordered and were glad we did! My husband ordered the carne assada burrito for dinner and I ordered the chicken rajas with sour cream. Both meals were delicious! Another reason I liked this place is because they do 15% off for military every Monday. I am not military but have family that is and I know they appreciate these types of things!

I really love this place.  Oddly enough, I've never tried their fajitas!  But, I've had just about everything else.  The Queso Fundido with chorizo, and Chile Rellenos are good stand-bys.  Happy Hours are great. 3-7 PM
4 buck Margaritas, and 8-10 great items for food.

Great Mexican food!
We came around 4 pm on a Saturday afternoon and it was really busy. We had about 40 minute wait, and decided to hang out at the bar. There was no seating at bar either, so we had to stand, but bar tenders were quick and friendly. They have happy hour EVERYDAY! The margaritas were like $5 and cheap beers. The margaritas were not watered down. I had the Pina Colada flavor, and it had sweet pieces of coconut and pineapple. 
I also had a spicy watermelon that was not on happy hour menu, but only $9 nice flavors and strong. 
Our waiter was really nice and took our orders pretty quick. Then we had the complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip. The bean dip is sooo good, but no free refills. 
2 other staff members came by to check on us throughout our meal and even apologized to us for the long wait.
Our food was delish and tasted homemade. Beans were creamy and full of garlic flavor. My fave was the chile relleno. It was stuffed with cheese and had a nice crispy coating even with the delish red sauce on top.
I will def be back especially for the delish and cheap margaritas! Hopefully not much of a wait on the next visit.
Great Mexican spot with good service and excellent food.  This place gets very busy so plan ahead and show up early.  Great place.

Juan's has quickly become our favorite Mexican place! 

I've been about 8 times now and it's always pleasant and yummy. Unfortunately, the word is out...it's busy! It's family friendly which means there's kids everywhere! So many, in fact, that they ran out of highchairs on our last visit. The good news is it's the perfect place for antsy noisy kids because they are at every table and no one would notice. 

The happy hour specials are great! The ceviche is generous and tasty. The quesadilla is huge and packed with meat and cheese. The house margarita is meh but the fresh ones and skinny ones are very good! The sangria was ok; the flavor was too muddled. 

Our last visit with yummy food, leftovers to take home, 3 full bellies and 3 cocktails was only $48. Can't beat that! There is a singing guitar mariachi that serenades your table and is great with the kiddos too. Fun!

This place was great. My favorite item so far is the Queso Fundido w/Chorizo, but the Al Pastor burrito was excellent, as was the Baja Fish Taco.

I look forward to returning and trying many more items.
The fajitas for two combo is awesome. It's so worth the price because you get sooooo full, plus get to take some home. Best part is that the food tastes authentic.

What a nice surprise coming off a 5 hour flight from NJ. Did a Yelp search for Mexican restaurants and Juan's came up so in true Las Vegas fashion we rolled the dice only this time you stand to win a delicious meal instead of losing a couple of grand. The service was excellent and the Fajita for two was a great value for portion , quality and overall flavor. I think we'll pop in again before we go home on Saturday. Go Now !
J
Best Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Best margaritas in Vegas. Best customer service in Vegas. If you like good food, sports, etc., this is your place to be.

Happy Birthday, Tita Shirley B!!  

For now on when I think of Juan's Flaming Fajitas, I going to think about Shirley B's Birthday celebration. It was Shirley's pick to come here.  And when people asked her why Juan's for her birthday, her response was "because it's MY birthday".  I agree with your choice, Tita.  Juan's was a great dinner.  

One thing I love about fajitas in general is that you can chose to make it a high calorie meal or a low calorie meal.  It really all depends how many fajitas you plan on demolishing and what you put in it.  But Juan's is more than just their infamous flaming fajitas, right?  Sure it is.  At Juan's there's a huge selection of Mexican dishes and by the looks at everyone's orders around the restaurant, the dishes are definitely hooked up.  Review their menu...you got burrito options, taco concoctions, salads, nachos, ensaladas, soups, chimichangas, and of course, fajitas.  But before I even talk about their main dishes, I have to mention their bottomless tortilla chips.  My goodness, it should be a crime that these are bottomless.  The chips didn't even have a chance.  After multiple chip refills (i.e. 9 basket of chips), I came to the conclusion that their tortilla chips are addicting.  I swear, they should rename this place to Juan's Flaming Fajitas and Tortilla Chips.  Just saying. 

Everyone on our table, with the exception of Chad S and Mr B (aka Shirley's husband), got the fajitas.  I didn't try Chad's Carne Asada Burrito, but was able to sample some of Mr. B's Steak Taquitos.  The taquitos are bigger than most. It's was more like a mini-chimichanga if you ask me.  Terri and I shared the steak & chicken fajita combo (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=l3lS7rPzGYQukY10aqTMSQ&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ).  This is huge, feeds two, and was served flaming.  Yup...this was one good dish.  Both the steaks and chicken were seasoned, properly cooked, tender, and fresh.  Hard for me to describe, but their fajitas is pretty much as good as it gets.  

As for their service, I thought that it was pretty good considering how busy the place was.  The restaurant is decently sized with the bar on one side and the main dining area in another.  Both had one thing in common...tons of TV's from every angle.  Yeah buddy!!  Not missing sports at this restaurant.  Our server was Juan.  No joke.  We had Juan, not THE Juan, you know the one.  He was great and treated us like we were his only customers.  It's like Juan on One.  Hah!  All joking aside, Juan was great.  By the way, there's 3 other Juan's working here too.  I bet you can't find that anywhere.  I wonder if I go to Mel's Diner would I find 3 other Mel's.  I bet not.  

Juan's allowed us to take our own desert, which consisted of Hello Kitty cupcakes and an Niner/Hello Kitty Birthday Cake.  All for Shirley B.  Juan and the staff at Juan's brought the deserts to our table while singing Happy Happy Birthday to Shirley B.  

Overall...fajitas and a lot of sugar with friends equals a great time.  Happy Birthday, Shirley B!  Go Niners!!!

PS:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=nf8fxHNYMolClFYLYU3yQg&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

I'm not a local, but I found this place as it was recommended by a buddy. It's a little ways off the strip, but totally worth the venture. Portions are very good, and quality of food was excellent. Service was above expectations.  Each person I encountered seemed very concerned with my groups experience. All of us enjoyed our meals. Between us we have chips/salsa/bean dip, soups, chile Colorado, fajitas (chicken and steak), and some really yummy looking tacos.  I tried both, the corn and flour tortillas with the meal and they were also a good compliment. I didn't drink as I went for lunch so unfortunately I wasn't able to rate the margaritas.  Highly recommended.

My coworkers and I had many meals at Viva Mercado in the past and we were pretty disappointed when it closed. A friend mentioned that many of the former staff of Viva had moved over to Juan's Flaming Fajitas, and suggested we give it a try. I am SO thankful they did! 

Everything I loved about Viva can be found at Juan's, from the friendly staff that remembers regulars to the grilled onions and jalapenos served with the complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip...  

Every meal I have had at Juan's was been for lunch, they have numerous lunch specials daily, including a $3.75 lunchtime margarita.  We always sit in the bar area and get fantastic service. 

Every item I have ordered has been fantastic, I especially enjoy the chicken flautas. And I LOVE that you can get steamed veggies in places of the beans and rice as a side, at no added cost. 

Juan's Flaming Fajitas is not close enough for me to frequent for dinner, but for weekday lunches it's one of my favorite spots in town.
Lupe and Angel were a great serving team, the anejo margarita was expensive but delicious, and the carne asada tacos were tasty. I'll definitely come back!

I pretty much think God invented Mexican food to make up for M-F work weeks.  Because my BF is such a Lindo fan, it wasn't easy convincing him to come here instead.  After our awesome lunch, he was very apologetic for doubting my Yelp abilities.

I came here when this was Buzz, and Juan has really transformed the place.  Looks like a legit Mexican cantina.  Juan himself greeted us at the door and sat us at our table.  3 big screen tvs are visible in the dining room.  Always good, especially during the NCAA tournament (if you are not a Kentucky fan like myself).  Negra Modelo on tap = Sunday Funday.  Although I am a Lindo fan, the chips and salsa at Juan's are much better.  So is the fideo soup.  We decided to split the flaming chicken fajitas because it is the namesake.  Because I will always be 10 years old, I was overly facinated with the tableside flaming fajitas (see pic).  In addition to the show, the fajitas were great.  Came with the aforementioned fideo soup, guacamole, salsa, sour cream, cheese and tortillas.  The only thing I wasn't wowed by were the tortillas, but when your BFF is a latina rockstar and her fabulous momma hooks you up with decilious tortillas, your standards can be pretty high.  Don't worry Lindo.  There's room for two great Mexican spots in the Southwest.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Juan.

So freaking good here! Service, food, atmosphere, specials.. definitely one of the best in Vegas!

They have Happy Hour everyday from 3-7pm. You can get beer & cocktails starting around $3.50 during HH.
You get free chips & salsa, but don't fill up too much because their portions are pretty big. Each entree can feed 2 people. They are very good on refills too.. when you are not even half way done with your drink, they come by & fill it up for you. 

You definitely need to try their staple, Flaming Fajitas. They set fire to it at your table! Also, let them know when it's your birthday.. you will get some tasty caramel churros on the house!

Don't forget to Check-in to get $5 off $50.

I've been wanting to try this place for sometime. I am so glad we did. Came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience. Great food, giant portions, great service and all at a good price.  I will definitely be coming back again.

Wow Juan knocked it out of the park I ordered a dozen Tamales for Christmas eve dinner 1/2 chicken and 1/2 beef with both sauces the BEST. Like Juan says don't nuke them steam them what difference. GREAT JOB JUAN!!!!!!!!

I've tried this new place several times now so I figured it was time to write a review! I'm a big fan of fajitas and Juan's does it right! The veggies are really good and the seasoning is tasty. Best of all, the kitchen uses high quality meat and it shows. If you don't want beans and salsa, they'll sub a very hearty portion of garlic butter vegetables that are really yummy! 

The tableside flaming fajita show is a lot of fun for kids and adults. It's a neat gimmick. I do think the portion size on the fajitas for 2 is a bit small; you are better off paying a little extra and order your own fajitas. 

The chips are pretty good and the salsas are tasty. I really like the bean dip, it's my favorite. The service has always been absolutely amazing. Out of the few times I've dined here, only once did it take a super long time for our food to come out of the kitchen. I don't know what was going on, but it took over 30 minutes. Usually they are pretty fast, making this a great spot to grab a quick and healthy meal before going to a movie, out shopping, etc. 

I only have two criticisms for the place: 1, make the portion size on the "fajitas for 2" a bit larger and 2, I wish the kitchen would serve homemade tortillas. The tortillas are so bad I usually ask for none to be brought to the table. 

Overall, the restaurant is cute and comfortable, the prices are fair and the food is good. What's not to like?

I was a little hesitant to wait a minimum of 45 minutes to eat here, thinking it had to be overhyped. The outdoor seating was closed off for a private event that seemed to only be hosting a few people so there were a lot of empty seats not being used. And groups were showing up after we'd been waiting and getting seated before us so there seemed to be preferential treatment to regulars or people the hostesses knew (we were told they don't do reservations or waiting lists). Once we were seated everything was great. No complaints whatsoever about the food and honestly the best horchata I've ever had. We came three hours before a show we had tickets for and because of the wait to be seated and then service being backed up we nearly missed the show so I'd say come when you don't have plans for anything afterwards. But the food really was great!

Everything was pretty damn good! I might have to say those were the absolute best fajitas I've ever had, and their presentation was pretty cool to boot. Two things I think could be improved, one: check on your tables a little more often (everyone was extremely friendly and very accommodating, I just would have liked to have my drink refilled w/out having to flag someone down) and second: the lights were very dim and the ceiling fans were going a little slow creating a very odd effect of making all of us dizzy; had to walk to several tables before finding something acceptable to dine at. Mind you I was pretty tired but I've never had that happen and I think it could have been avoided by either turning the lights up or even down a little bit more. Could have just been an odd occurrence but everyone in my party complained about it as well. Wish we had saved room to try the desserts because if the entrees are this amazing I bet the sweets are just as good! I would recommend this place to everyone...give it a shot!

I love everything about this place.  They always have GREAT friendly service and it's always crowded...for good reason!  I ordered carry out a couple of weeks ago and they put everything in the bag that I could possibly want, I was so surprised when I got home.  I'll keep coming back  :)
The food is decent, portions are adequate for the price paid and the happy hour was a good value.

After reading all the reviews my friend and I could not wait to try this restaurant today.   The service was so poor we had to go find out own eating utensils and napkins, which were cut in strips from a larger napkin.  The happy hour margaritas were so sweet that we had to send them back.    They brought us new ones which were better but still not very good.   The chips were ok,  but the salsa, beans and the sauteed jalapenos and onions were really good and a great idea.   It took a long time for someone to take our order and the place was empty except for one other table.    We ordered the flaming beef fajitas but again I expected a "wow" moment upon my first bite.    The flames were the only wow about it!    I would not recommend it.

I love everything about this place.  Greeters were super friendly,  service was excellent, and the food is terrific!  In the last 2 weeks we have been here 4 times!  Jose is our favorite server.  Our family has a lot of allergies and Jose gets it right and is very accommodating...  It is our favorite Mexican food in Vegas now!

Came to celebrate a coworker's Birthday. We had a reservation so they were able to quickly accommodate our medium sized group. At a quick glance, their lunch menu was reasonably priced.

Four people in my party ordered the fajitas which was a sight to see when they came out. They literally lit the skillet on fire and flames were jumping! After a bit the fire went out and we were served. 

I had the flautas which I usually enjoy at other Mexican restaurants. I ordered it in a crispy flour tortilla with grilled vegetables instead of beans and rice. I was surprised that my order was really good! Although they had large servings, I took home my leftovers and had them for lunch the next day. 

The reason why I can't give them the full 5 stars is, as I don't speak Spanish, some of the waiters spoke really fast English and I could not understand them. Additionally, I felt like attitude was given from one person serving us, who I think may have been a manager. Not cool. 

Overall, I would probably eat there again if someone I knew wanted to go. I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food, but I would definitely like to try other items on their menu.

This place is awesome!!!! Valentino and Hernen were spot on with everything. The BEST customer service we have ever had. Blown away from the time we sat down to the time we left. The fajita display was awesome!! Meat was super tender you could taste the marinade. The burrito was the perfect size. We loved the fact that we got salsa (2 types) and bean dip. The staff though, can't say enough on how impressed we were with them.
Amanda was wonderful and helped with the sun on the patio. Took our coupon and made sure everything was perfect

Food was GREAT!!! Service was great! Beverly attentive to their customers! Very relaxing and enjoyable!!! Must try this if you want forest Mexican dinner. We had fajitas and ordered a single person order and the two of us ate on it and still had left overs! Will definitely go back!

This place is very good. Has excellent service, nice and friendly, and always checking on you from all the staff. The food was great and didn't take long to get your food. Food was hot and fresh. I had the fajitas and loved it lots of food and good prices.

I gave them 3 stars because my food was a little plain tasting even after i added salt. Also i ordered the shrimp fajitas and they literally gave me 6 shrimps and probably a whole entire onion to fill in where the shrimp was very much missing. i would have been happy with more shrimp and they'd  have more stars. The restraunt has a nice atmosphere the staff is quick and very friendly the and the horchata was very good.

This place is fantastic. Great tasting food. Excellent service. Staff were very warm and welcoming. Got chips and salsa as well as these delicious grilled peppers and onions as soon as we sat and ordered our food and beers. When our food came.... It was so good.. Will definately be back!!! They have great football specials too!
This place is awesome! great service and authentic food!

Excellent food, excellent service. Their house specialty is the flaming fajitas, very flavorful not overrated. We are very excited that they have ground beef enchiladas, it's very hard to find that anymore.
The food is pretty good but not outstanding. Nice atmosphere. Outdoor seating. I had a great strawberry margarita and their fideo soup is very yummy.
We just moved to the area and this our new favorite Mexican restaurant! Excellent service and they immediately bring us chips, amazing salsa and bean dip. We are hooked!!

Darn Yelp... My favorite Mexican restaurant has been discovered. Arrived  at 6:00 on a Sat  night and had an hour wait. Totally worth it though

I enjoyed carne asada tacos. My husband had a huge burrito and we both enjoyed an organic margarita. (Excellent)

Food-Excellent
Service-Top Notch
Price -Very Affordable
Typically come here for brunch. But dinner is excellent as well. Fajitas, burritos, everything is great!

Had an early dinner here last week with my husband, after looking around on Yelp for a highly rated Mexican place.  As usual, Yelpers were right on the money, this place is FANTASTIC!  Can't recommend it enough - if you're craving Mexican, go to Juan's and you'll have a great meal at a perfect price!

I honestly enjoyed every single thing we ate - the chips (fresh), the salsa (perfect), the soup they automatically serve before your entree, the fajitas, the dips, everything.  I will say it was all slightly on the salty side - but I *love* salt so that's right up my alley.  We ordered the chicken fajitas for 2 and, along with the free chips and salsa, and the tomato-based soup that comes out first, it ended up being 4 meals for the hubs and I.  Well worth the money.  And again, it was all so, so delicious!

The hosts and servers were all super friendly and helpful and everything was brought out quickly.  We honestly don't have a single complaint - except that we didn't go here sooner!  We'll be back very soon to try some of the others options like the quesadillas and enchiladas and I'm already looking forward to it!

The perfect Mexican Restaurant experience!  It has everything you could ask for:  

1.  Excellent chips and salsa ready as soon as you sit down.  Do yourself a favor and put those onions and jalapenos they provide on a chip and dip it in the salsa for a flavor explosion in your mouth!

2.  Super fast and friendly wait staff.  Their "refreshing drink" game is on point.

3.  Decent Margaritas for a reasonable price.  The $5 house margarita is an excellent 12oz cocktail.

4.  Mariachi Guitarist!  Spanish guitar helps with the digestion!

5.  The Food is excellent.  The steak fajita is the best I have ever had with juicy and tender steak.  I also enjoy the pageantry and presentation that comes with ordering these flaming fajitas.

6.  FRIED ICE CREAM.  I have always been a fan of the dangerous idea of dropping scoops of ice cream into boiling oil! 

7.  The overall price is very affordable especially if you use the Yelp Discount!

This is my favorite Mexican food place of all time!! The quality of food is amazing and the customer service is above and beyond my expectations!! Normally there is a wait to be seated but it's totally worth it!! Can't wait to come back!! Harmon was our server tonight and did a wonderful job!!

Have been to this place a few times and have not been impressed. The chips and salsa are average at best and the drinks are very watered down. IF you go here the only edible dish is the fajitas! All the other dishes I have sampled have been bland and tasteless. If your in Vegas save your money for the Casinos and not Juans.

The best mexican deal in town, super clean, everything is fresh, drinks cold. Chips, bean dip and salsa included. Roasted chiles and jalapeños free. Most entrees come with soup . Best fajitas in town, best pricing. Beats all casinos in town

The wait time here is crazy long and people are happy to do it. I waited 45 minutes for a table.  Other people were putting their names down to wait an hour!  Come with an empty stomach because their fajitas are amazingly good and the flambé show is free.  Dinner starts with tortilla chips and a variety of dips and salsas.  All of their fajitas come with a noodle soup and your choice of rice, beans, and wraps. The sopa de fideo is delicious.  I had the chicken fajitas.  My friends had the steak and shrimp fajita combo.  They just might be the best fajitas in the world.

This place is excellent! I was shocked to see how many people were coming in. It was only about a 30min wait since the staff was on the ball getting tables turned over. Thankfully they have a bar you can grab a drink at to wait.

I did the fajitas with steak and shrimp. They come out literally on fire and smoking on a giant cast iron plate. You also get a side of rice, beans, pico, sour cream, and gauc along with your tortillas. The veggies had a little of that char flavor, and the meat was tender. 

They also bring out chips with 2 kinds of salsa and some bean dip that was all amazing. I definitely can't wait to go back and try some of the other food!

Great food, great proportions, great ambiance, great price. The only gripe I have is the meat seems to be marinated in lime and cilantro. Our family is not big on cilantro.

The place is busy, so plan accordingly!

I've been passing this place for quite some time now and always smell the food from blocks away. The yummy smell alone is what brought me in. Upon entering their establishment I'm greeted kindly at the door. I'm usually by myself so I go to sit at the bar. The bartender Alex is pretty awesome. I'm handed a menu and asked for my drink order. Always with a kind smile and great attitude. As I place my order to go, chips, 2 salsas and beans, onions and jalapeños are places in front of me. I've been here twice now and my orders have been: chicken al mojo de ajo and the chicken con nopales. Both come with sopa de fideo (best I've had yet) and rice and beans. The food is mouth watering delicious! This place is all in all 5 STARS!! The service from the moment you walk through the door to the moment you leave AMAZING! The food is the best in town! If you haven't been here it's best to check it out!

Maybe it was just a bad first time the chips where awesome and the Fido soup great service fast and food was presentable. However the enchiladas red sauce was more like a mole sauce almost tasted a little to heavy and not what I have come to expect in a enchilada sauce. Overall. 3 Star because service and cleanliness was on point.

We got the steak and chicken fajitas. It was a very fun experience. The steak fajita was the better one in my opinion because the chicken one tasted slightly bland. Table side guacamole was good, they give you a taste so you can modify it before they serve it to you. Also a lot of TV's, no bad seats for watching games!
Awesome food and service! Went here to "Waste" time before my hair appointment, and had a great experience! Service was outstanding! I will definitely come back!

OMG!! Best Mexican food and service I've had in along time. Reminded me of being at a family party where everyone checked to see if your OK. Fresh beans, I typically grade my Mexican food off of the beans. That's first and foremost the best around. Fresh guacamole made to order. The burritos were amazing. Now it is called Flaming Fajitas, so of course I had to try them. I was not disappointed one bit, great taste and they do a little trick and boom, they're on fire!!! So if your ever in Vegas you've got to hit this spot.
Food is good at the right price, and so are the drinks, happy hr is great. I'm really looking forward for the Henderson location which will be closer to me

My wife and I have a timeshare just up around the corner and in looking for someplace close we stumbled onto this gem. We went their for lunch and we will definitely be back. The service was courteous, pleasant, and attentive. The food was absolutely wonderful. Their chips, salsa, and bean dip are a great starter.
Good food and great staff! Nothing bad to say. Eat the salsa with chips and try the chicken fajitas you will thank me later!

This place is a hidden gem. Fajitas are wonderful and a good size portion. Atmosphere is cute. The staff are very friendly. Happy Hour is 7 days a week from 3-7. Reasonably priced. This is definitely my new "go to" place.

Ate here for dinner and had the steak and shrimp combo fajitas. Was very very good. Best fajitas I ever had. Only complaint was that the margaritas were very weak. I had 4 margaritas and didn't have a buzz.

I really enjoyed the excellent food and service at this restaurant. My son had the fajitas and it's fun when they torch it. I had a carne asada burrito, it was delicious. I loved the various dips for the chips.

I recently moved to the west side of town, and I went exploring for Mexican food one afternoon. My google search brought me here, and it was just as good as I'd hoped. 

For starters, Juan's replaces the mundane chips and salsa from every other restaurant with a medium salsa roja, salsa verde, and bean dip. Both salsas had an appetizing kick, but the verde was my personal favorite. 

As I wandered in around 12:30, I found their lunch specials for $9.99 chicken fajitas. Served with the typical accoutrement of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo, the fajitas were incredible! And as the name implies, they are indeed "flaming" when they finish it off at your table flambé style! 

Overall, this place now tops my list of Mexican eateries in the area, and located within just a few minutes of the 215, I will DEFINITELY be back again soon!

Wow Juan's!!!!

You guys delivered on food, customer service and deliciousness. This is my second time visiting Juan's and both times I have been impressed.

On my first visit I ordered a yummy chicken chimichanga with rice and beans and a 16 oz draft beer. The portions are so big that I had plenty of food left over for lunch the next day. 

On our second visit my fiancé and I ordered the smothers steak, and shrimp fajitas for two and oh my oh my. Each person get their own plate of sour cream, guacamole, rice and beans and a choice of flour or corn tortillas. If you sit close to the kitchen you can see someone making fresh tortillas while you wait for your food. I also order a strawberry house margarita and it was delicious. They have all different sizes but I opted for the 12oz and it was perfect. Amanda out waitress informed me that the house margarita is popular because it is in the happy hour menu so it is ordered more, but her favorite was the top shelf margarita. (I'm trying her suggestion on my next visit)

I love how as soon as you sit down someone is there to take your Drink order and give you complementary chips, veggies, bean dip and salsa. I am unsure if soup comes with every meal but the two times that I have visited, I have gotten yummy soup.

The menu has a ton of food options and a great happy hour menu as well as lunch menu.

If you're ever in the mood for some delicious food I suggest giving Juan's a try. You want be disappointed

I ordered the food Togo on a Saturday night. The wait was an hour for dining in. The food was delicious. I got the combination fajitas with shrimp and chicken. The food and condiments were just if you were to eat it there. I recommend this place, just don't be in a hurry.

4 stars. 

Family friendly place when you have a little one is on my top requirements when we go out to eat now. We actually decided to eat dinner earlier and at 5 there was a bunch of families already there eating and watching football. 

Service was really attentive from the start. We decided to order the mixed fajita (chicken and beef). We both got Fideo soup and it was pretty tasty. The flaming fajitas part was entertaining but I think what matters is the food. The chicken and beef were tasty and moist and I even ended up eating onions with it and I don't like onions.  I asked for double rice instead of the rice and beans on the side and they gave it to me like I asked! The tortilla was a thicker type kind of like the type you get at Taco Bell, but other than the tortilla everything was delicious. We actually ended up ordering the churros for dessert too which was good. 

Overall, this place is good if you want fajitas. I definitely want to try some of the other items on the menu too.

I would've given this place 5 stars, but the server wasn't that friendly. I forgot his name. I was so distracted with the company of my friends that I didn't pay attention. My friends were visiting from out of state and were craving Mexican food. I've never been here, but I went onto Yelp and searched "Mexican food" and this place popped up. I'm glad it did because the food was DELICIOUS! I ordered Enchiladas which were fire! My husband ordered a chimichanga. My friends ordered fajitas and a burrito. I wish I remembered all the names of our order but again, I was focusing on the presence of my friends. I just had a lot of excitement to see them again!!:) And the portions were HUGEEEE. So filling, we ended up taking our food home. Except for my husband, he just eats a lot lol. The restaurant is a bit overwhelming. When we arrived, we sat down and were immediately given salsa and tortilla chips. We thought that was awesome, then like 10 mins later complimentary noodle soup was given to us. I think it was some type of authentic Mexican soup, but it was yummy:) I wish I had more but the portion size was small. Out of nowhere came a man singing in Spanish and playing the guitar. We thought that was a bit overwhelming and told him to just move along (otherwise you'd have to tip). Overall, we were all having a great time. :) I am very pleased with the food, but I think our server needs to learn how to deal with customers and provide exceptional customer service. I dont know if it was the fact that we looked a bit young?, but we did order alcohol... Oh well, I am still satisfied with their food and will def be back:)

The food here is a solid 3 stars, but the consistently amazing service is enough to bump it up to 4.

This is NOT an authentic Mexican restaurant, it caters to the middle aged American palate. That being said, they do a great job with that. All of the usual suspects like combo plates with burritos, tacos, tostadas, tamales etc.. But also some dishes with nopales (cactus) and calabaza (pumpkin) to make some feel like maybe they're eating adventurously.

What stands out the most here is that they are all about the freebies, and I think that's really what draws the crowd here. Heaping baskets of chips with endless bean dip and salsa. Fideo soup to start every meal (they even asked me if I wanted more) and they gave me a side of vegetables with my dinner for free. They also have free grilled onions and jalapeños. They ALSO honored some happy hour prices for some patrons at the table next to me even though happy hour was over to which those people exclaimed "now that's service!" No.. It's not.. You're just jerks, and they're just really nice. A server who couldn't honor happy hour prices when it's been over for an hour isn't a bad server.

The fajitas are their claim to fame here, and while they are impressive upon delivery, I found them to be quite bland. The tall flame is a gimmick, but I think it's fun anyway. All of the food is solid.. But the check backs, friendly chatter, anticipation of your needs and presence of the servers without being overbearing is really impressive. Just don't come expecting something that your abuela used to make for you.
It was such delightful experience dining here. Food was delicious, big portion but not too big, and the service and ambience were wonderful for the family. Coming back soon!
Our first time here. We were impressed. Great service. Lupe was our server and she was wonderful. Really good food. We've found our New Mexican restaurant.
Great food every time. They have the friendliest staff and it is kid friendly. Best chips and salsa. I like the carne asada burrito

Food is great! If you get there early enough you don't have to wait 45 plus minutes for a seat.. what I don't understand is why the patio is closed? My husband and I went out for lunch yesterday hoping to sit outside in this gorgeous 70 degree weather and they have the patio closed for no reason.. makes absolutely no sense.  Open your patio!! The weather is gorgeous people don't want to be stuck inside.

The owner responded to my post about the patio and cleared things up. Very professional! We will be back soon.
Great service and excellent food! Had the chorizo and it was fantastic!!! I definitely recommend eating here!

This place is awesome! The fajitas were amazing. Very tender beef. They serve you chips, salsa, beans, and grilled peppers & onions to start. That in itself was really good! 

The service was also great.
Good service, everyone is friendly. Food is yummy. I like all the extras like the soup and chips and salsa. Fajitas are definitely worth getting.

The name makes me laugh, the experience left me smiling :)

When a restaurant first emerged in this space when I first moved here, there have been at least 2-3 restaurants that have tried to win over the hearts of the locals in the Southwest, but unfortunately they did not succeed. So when we first walked in and saw how busy the place was (there was even a wait!) we were quite surprised!

We were seated within the quoted 10 mins and the moment we sat down, we saw why the word "flaming" is in their name! As you can see from the photos, their fajitas are literally shooting out flames up toward the ceiling! They're quite delicious, I guess the flames add a flavor only a flame can add :)

Also on the menu: Table side guacamole, raspberry margarita and a coronita. Good, bomb, and meh. I'd definitely have the raspberry margarita again, damn thing tastes like juice!

We loves. We're returning.

Skeptical I decided to give Juan's a try. I was presently surprised! The service was flat out above and beyond your average restaurant of this type. The food was delicious, at least the enchilada dinner I had. I here the  fajitas are off the hook also. "Next trip" never had a dry glass or empty chip bowl. The manager or owner not sure which came to the table at one point to ask how everything was I kinda felt like a celebrity! Ha. This is how all restaurants should do buisness.
This place never disappoints! Love getting their tacos and enchiladas. During the times I ordered take out, they packed some complimentary chips and salsa and even some tomato soup.

I really enjoyed my plate. ... since NOTHING was left on it when I was done.. :) I had a fish taco and cheese enchilada... So delish! I've been to a few spots and had sopa and weren't impressed however the sopa here was good... not too salty. BTW.. I could eat the roasted jalapeño and onions that they serve with chips every day!
I also had a frozen Don Julio margarita that was amazing! I will definitely come here again.
I have been to Vegas for 4 weeks in a row and I have come back every week. Fantastic food with great service. A must!!

My roommate goes here all the time for fajitas with his family. They are reasonably priced and taste great. I went with him the other day, and I personally got the tacos. They were huge, and tasted awesome! Super glad for the extra tortillas. Chips, salsa, and condiments were great.

It started off great! Fabulous customer service, very warm & welcoming. But as time went on, a few things happened. Our chips, fresh out of the kitchen...were stale. Not only were they stale but there were onions & green peppers (IN THE CHIPS)! How does that happen?! It was like someone threw it in there! Then! We watched a server clean the table with a rag from God knows where - without sterilizing the table. The veggies tasted like rubber & had no flavor. It's like they just microwaved the veggies...all in all, not clean & food was not worth $40 spent...Left extremely disappointed.

We finally tried this place and wish we hadn't waited so long! First Mexican restaurant in Vegas we like. Great service, good chips, salsa and bean dip and we loved the fajitas! We ordered the steak and chicken for two. It's definitely a popular place all the tables were full lots of people waiting for a table. Looking forward to the next time...

It's been a while since I visited this place with my mom. We went on a whim because my mom likes fajitas, which is naturally what she ordered. I went for tacos and my sister sent for enchiladas. At lunchtime food was good and decently and appropriately priced and the fajitas presentation was FLAMING!!
I think when I return to Vegas, I'll definitely want to come back.

This is another 3.5 star situation for me. But because of a few things, it just feels more like a 3 than a 4. 

My girlfriend and I went here for their happy hour (3-7 daily), and since I love margaritas and very infrequently get them, I was excited about their margarita on happy hour. We got there and we ordered a margarita, a daiquiri, the quesadilla, and the nachos. 

On the happy hour menu, they have a bunch of apps which looked good, but we were sticking to cheap and the nachos and quesadillas were listed as 3.99. 

My margarita was... Bad. It was a house margarita, and weirdly enough I had the exact same experience at a NYC restaurant with their happy hour margarita. It tasted like toilet cleaner. I guess when they pre mix a huge batch for happy hour, it's easy to mess it up. I told the bartender and he switched it out immediately, I don't know if it was because it was good service or because this happens a lot. I barely finished my sentence and he was making me a new fresh one. 

The quesadillas were very very good, and we had agreed to get chicken on it instead of just cheese. I figured ok. At 3.99 we could take the upcharge for chicken right? Well unfortunately he failed to mention that by adding chicken it was no longer the happy hour menu item, so it was $7 dollars. Not a big deal, but was expecting a little bit less. 

The nachos were... Very bland. They had way to much bean on it and it honestly canceled out the cheese taste. It was covered with cheese but you barely tasted it, and nachos without cheesiness are a waste IMO. 

Overall, I liked my second margarita a lot, the daiquiri was pretty good, and the quesadilla was delicious. The manager also checked with us as did the bartender multiple times to make sure things were OK, so clearly they care about service. However, with that bad first margarita and very mediocre nachos, I just can't give this place a four at the moment. Will go back to try again!

Alex was fantastic ! The service at this place is unbelievable, the best ever. You also not be disappointed with the food which is excellent. We come here every time we are visiting Las Vegas no matter where we stay

If you want amazing fajitas try Juan's Fleming! Not a big fan of Mexican restaurants since I would rather eat homemade, however their fajitas and drinks are great! You'll feel the buzz with the first drink. Been here twice and I'll probably keep coming back! Plus on Sundays they have live music on Sundays. Service is always great, nice and friendly staff.
The food was amazing! Get the grilled veggies as a side item rather than the rice and beans. The guacamole is great too!

If you enjoy a sit down gimmicky Mexican restaurant, well come on over! Fun and lively atmosphere with someone serenading and flaming fires on the fajitas are awesome. But when you put the fajitas in the spotlight, they are flavorless and dry. Paying $16 for an bland entree served along with rice, beans, tortillas, sour cream, salsa, and guac, is pretty much an do it yourself burrito. I would rather go to an fast food Mexican spot to indulge myself with an carne aside burrito that can satisfy your palate with flavor. I'm glad I gave this place a chance, as the curiosity will no longer be.
Soooooooooooooooo delicious! My server was wonderful. I definitely recommend coming here.

My parents and I just came here for the first time and we enjoyed ourselves! We had the fajita plate and a seafood plate that I forgot the name of. The food was delicious and very fresh. I'm from LA and I have yet to find a authentic Mexican spot that serves great food. 

Also the service was beyond amazing! From the host to the waiter to the lady that kept asking if we want more ships and bean dip(which was yummy as well). They were all so friendly and so organized. I really enjoyed our time and the dinner we had! Definitely coming back :)

Awesome food and great service all around. The chips we're fresh and loved the salsa, bean dip and grilled jalepenos/onion snack. Was full before the food arrived, should have stuck to only one basket of chips. A great value, great quality and quantity. The best Mexican restaurant in Vegas that I've been too.
Love this place. Great fajitas and margaritas. The service is always good, whether we have a party of two or twenty. Highly recommend.

Definitely get your monies worth!!! A lot of food for a decent price & I like that they give you the option of having veggies in place of the rice and beans. Big menu selection. I will definitely be back to try some other stuff.

Great food
Friendly service
Fun atmosphere

I had the pleasure of dining here and i can't wait to go back. I ordered the chicken chimichanga and was not disappointed. Before my dish arrived they brought chips and salsa and bean dip. All three were uniquely tasty. The strawberry margarita was not watered down and equally as delicious. 
Parking is a bit limited but it is so worth the visit. They have an outdoor patio, the place was packed but honestly our server and the food runner were attentive the entire time.

After moving here from Chicago, I was happy to find a Mexican Restaurant that could come close to the excellent food at Javier's in Arlington Hgts, IL.  Juan's gives you a TON of food so bring your appetite.  You're started with homemade chips & dip, then soup, then your meal.  We always get the Steak Fajitas for 2.  Expect to bring some home.  Lots of steak & veggies seasoned to perfection. Happy hour is 7 days a week but either get there early or expect to wait.  The parking lot is the only negative.  In-N-Out burger is next door & that place is ALWAYS busy.  Hard to find parking during peak hours.  Fast, friendly service. Highly recommend.

Its REALLY good. My best friend and I came in on a Monday night a little less then an hour before closing. It wasn't really busy, there were about 4-5 other tables occupied. Service was exceptional (6 stars!). The staff was so friendly, through out the entire meal. We lost track of time talking and didn't realize that all the patrons had left and that it was waaay past closing (45 minutes +) and no one rushed us out. Even after we left and were getting in our car, someone came out just to say thanks and to have a good evening. On top of the outstanding service, the food was excellent and well priced. The complimentary chips and salsa came with beans and grilled onions and peppers. We ordered the guacamole and fajita steak nachos. Margaritas were only $4.50. Everything we ordered was delish! I highly recomment this place for a casual spot for good food and sipping on margaritas.

The chips and salsa with the grilled onions and jalapeño you get when you are first seated are the best thing in the world, I could that for days. The portions are enormous and definitely worth it. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vegas !

Welcome to the magical land of sizzling proteins and delicious drinks!!! The fajitas are really flaming! Oh man, why did I wait soooo long to visit?!?!?
Came on a gorgeous Sunday evening, hoping to sit outside and enjoy the weather. The patio already had a large party there and our group was large too, no sweat, we can sit inside. 
The restaurant is fairly large with a sort of divided dining are, a patio, and a bar that's separated. I like that it accommodates what ever type of night you're looking to have.
Now the food! I absolutely LOVED the shrimp and steak fajitas! I typically don't order steak unless I'm at an actual steakhouse but took a risk and it paid off! The steak was tender, not at all chewy and had wonderful flavor. The shrimp was great as well. Perfectly cooked with flavors of pepper and onions it was cooked with. I really enjoyed watching the server torch the fajitas, a nice touch that adds flare to the dining experience. 
The fajitas are paired with rice, beans, guac, sour cream, pico de gallo, and freshly made tortillas - corn or flour. You're able to swap the tortillas for romaine wraps, as well as rice and beans for steamed vegetables. Great option for the health conscious. I personally would not sacrifice the flour tortillas for a few calories, they were delicious! Oh, the fajitas also came with a little bowl of soup! I really did not need it as, the table tortilla chips were pretty good and kept me busy while waiting for the food.
Another star of the show for me were the margaritas. ON FIRE! I had the raspberry margarita that got me buzzed, followed by a shot of tequillaaaaaaaaaa, then a pina colada margarita... The Pina Colada Margarita was my fave, perfect combination of sweet and tangy. I look forward to having it again and again :)
The service was good, it seemed to take a little while for us to get our order in but we did not mind as we were enjoying each others company. The drinks came right away though. I am not a die hard fan of fajitas but can have them anytime if they are from here. Really!

I loved everything about this place. Our hostess when we came in was very friendly and excellent. Our server gave us fast and great service. I just want to compliment their amazing staff and workers here. They made us feel welcomed and enjoyed our lunch. Came here to eat lunch with my friend and her daughter. I ordered the shrimp fajita lunch, my friend ordered the steak fajita. My shrimp was big and juicy which was awesome. I  got rice and vegetables with my fajitas. Loved the vegetables that came with it. We both ordered cocktails. My strawberry margarita on the rocks was perfect and yummy. It came in cool cute glasses. They give you chips with three different dips while you wait to order and get your food. Our food came out and everything was delicious. The price here was affordable and not overpriced. I got a new favorite Mexican restaurant here in Vegas and I would recommend this place.

A very good Mexican style restaurant on the West side of town.
We've been a few times now & have not had any issues.the service has been great, even considering how busy this place is all the time.
The food has been fantastic, and the prices are very respectable.
The table side guac seems to be a fan favorite, but we have found the large guac was just as good...and cheaper.
A must try if your in the SW area.

(Be prepared to wait, it seems to be very busy all the time)
Great restaurant very busy. I had the Chicken taco and Chili Relleno. Very good, I'll go back

This is my new place for fajitas in Las Vegas the prices are good for the amount of food that they serve you. 
  As the name implies the flaming fajitas is the best part of this restaurant it's cool when they set it on fire.

This place is amazing ! Great service and even better food !!! Anything on the menu is amazing !!! Busy but for great reason ! Make sure if it's a few people make reservations prior! If not it's worth the wait !
Good, but I have had better food for a lot cheaper. Service was okay. Atmosphere was good.

I had a sub-par time. Wasn't horrible. Walked in and the music was a bit too loud. It was kind of a "Lets try it" sort of night and most of my group (2adults and 3 kids) were in cranky moods, so I might return to try it again and hope for better.

Finding it wasn't easy, the parking area is kind of poop but we found a good spot, luckily. They were doing some construction or set up in the porch area but that didn't really matter since it was kind of chilly when we visited. Sat quickly and our drinks were brought quickly. Bus boy was polite. Our waiter didn't really come check on us very quickly. Complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip was pretty good. Soup with meal -- the step kids loved it. 

I ordered the taco bowl. It's my go-to since I'm not huge on Mexican food anyway. Food took it's time getting to the table, drinks weren't re-filled very quickly. Different waiter delivered our food but eh, at least it came. My chicken was dry and my bowl was soggy to start. The 1 out of 3 kids enjoyed and devoured their enchiladas and the other two just whined and played with it. Neither one could explain why they didn't like it. So it could just be picky children being picky. My guy ordered the fajitas and the waiter bringing our food forgot to bring the tortillas. It took another 10 minutes to get the tortillas and by that time we were ready to go. 

It's not the restaurant's fault everyone was cranky. But the service was lacking, music too loud, and food not done well. I'm willing to try it again since the reviews from all you others are so good and I want to believe my visit was a fluke. =P

I've had this spot on my list for awhile and I finally made it in this week. The food and the service were definitely five stars.

The service was great. We were seated quickly and the waiter didn't delay in taking our orders. The food came out so quickly! Our waiter continued to check in on us and refill drinks well before necessary. 

I ordered the Shrimp Fajitas and loved them. The flavor of the shrimp and vegetables was delicious. The tortillas were warm and soft. The sides that go with the fajitas were tasty as well and I really liked the guacamole. The salsas and grilled vegetables that come out with the chips before the meal were all great too.

Something unique to this restaurant was the option to get healthy options. Fajitas can be ordered with romaine lettuce instead of tortillas and rice and beans can be substituted for steamed vegetables. I love when restaurants offer healthy alternatives.

So glad I finally managed to resist the temptation of the In-N-Out across the street, because Juan's was an incredible experience. 

The food is clearly great. We ordered the chicken fajitas - they were juicy, flavorful, and the spectacle of the flames made them even more enjoyable. (One other thing to note: one order was requested to be well done, and the other wasn't; the restaurant did an excellent job of cooking those two and they even came out at the same time). The free soup was good, too. I was definitely a big fan of the salsa since it didn't have huge chunks in it and it also had a little kick. 

But, the main selling point of this place was the customer service. Every staff member we interacted with was kind and attentive, bringing the sides/condiments we needed with no wait. We never even had to ask for water refills or extra tortillas; they were always on top of things. Everyone seemed genuinely interested in how our experience was, as well.

Just as we thought it couldn't get any better, our waiter returned with a complimentary churro dessert to commorate our first visit! It was an extremely kind gesture - this place really knows how to lure in customers and keep them coming! Make sure you visit this place if you're looking to be treated well and eat the most delicious fajitas on this side of town.
