My family has been back to Juan's several times since my initial review, at least six. Every time  the food & service are consistently good. By far our favorite Mexican place.
They have the best Mexican  food in town. No wait and quick service is the cherry on top. I would definitely and Highly recommended this place to anyone craving good Mexican food.
Great vibe. Just like a restaurant on a beach in Mexico. Food was delicious. Best Chile Relleno ever. Margaritas are very tasty. Expect a wait. My new favorite Mexican restaurant.

Wow, thanks Yelpers for leading me to this spot. Nice to have a high-quality Mexican place on the West/Southwest side of town.

The service was great, food was equally as good, and prices were reasonable. My drink stayed refilled constantly. Chips with salsa and bean dip, both tasty, to start, then Fideo soup before the meal. They've only been open a couple of months, but there is no reason (other than maybe location) they can't give Bonita & Lindo a run for their money.

Will be going back often.

Found some great tasting food and service at Juan's Flaming Fajitas! Was going to grab some lunch while in Vegas for a short time when our party decided to look for something else away from "The Strip" Went inside, ordered and can't say there was anything wrong or needing improvement! The entire waitstaff and all those who work there are the best! Would make another to Vegas just for this place!

Five stars!

The fajitas are literally flambeed tableside.  The mole sauce is complex and delicious.  We discovered Juan's while on a climbing trip to Red Rocks, and the food was so good that we ate here twice in the same week.

Really good service too -- on our second trip to Juan's, we arrived literally 30 seconds before the end of happy hour, and they happily took orders from all six of us at happy hour prices.

Went on a early Friday evening good thing this place was over busy . By the time we left (6:00) it was standing room in and out! 1st impression clean, very courteous staff 
It was very noisy in main room kids screaming well you get it . Maybe lunch would be better 
Now to the food --- right away they brought us our drinks with chips , salsa,& bean dip . Also a small plate of grilled sweet onions & jalapeño chiles nice ...I had a chile relleno & beef soft flour tortilla taco! I always order the relleno @ new places I go to & if it's good all else can't be to bad .
My partner ordered chili Colorado with side of black beans  very good ! he does not like cilantro & I think the red sauce although yummy had to much coriander oh well ! All in all very hopping place will try again on a slower week day!!!!

We went because of the coupon we got in our mail, but were glad we did. We used to go to Buzz BBQ when it was there, and based on the amount of fellow diners joining us, Buzz can't blame their lack of crowd on the location.  Juan's was packed for a random weekday.
I got the carne asada chimichanga, the meat was very good, I just didn't realize it was going to be served smothered in sauce,  which ruins my favorite part, the crispy shell. But it was still tasty.
My boyfriend had the fork fajitas,  and the meat looked dry, but it was actually very tender, and full of flavor and not dry. He loved his meal!
The staff was very attentive and full of energy!

Last night was the first time to visit the restaurant.  Party of 8, wait time for a table wasn't bad, about 20 minutes or so.  The problem came after we were seated.  The service was slow at best, and it took about an hour before our food arrived.  They did keep the chips full so it didn't seem horrible. 

Today, we can't seem to get rid of the flaming fajita smell!  It's all over our sweatshirts and jackets and has even defeated a good spray with febreeze!  I thought maybe it was just me, but my son, who lives in his own home, says he has smelled like Mexican food all day.

I think I'll stick with Mi Casa Grill Cantina at Silverton Casino.

AMAZING & Won't go to any other mexican restaurant .. This was our first visit & will return to have many more.. 
First off:: FREE beans, salsa, peppers with onions & chips.. Sautéed and yummy!
Delicious Cadillac margaritas for $9.50: HELL YEAH.. And can taste the liquor! 
Then food arrived with a fabulous presentation on the fajitas.. Table Side fire in air & very juicy!! Free sour cream, guac as well.. *many places charge extra. 
Amanda was our server:: very personable, friendly & knowledgeable on menu..way to go..
GREAT dinner.. Highly Recommended

Seriously the most amazing HOMEMADE TORTILLAS in the world. I have never been somewhere else with such good tortillas! Also, the fajitas are delicious! It's one of my favorite places to come for authentic mexican food and never disappoints! Bring the family here!

Went for the first time this week and had to get the fajitas for the experience. Wonderful display and great conversation piece. Couple of things threw me off though. 1 the size of the plates in comparison with the size of the table. I was so uncomfortable trying to find a place for everything (and squished next to my husband) and that's with two couples ordering only 2 meals to share! The second thing- I ordered veggies as my side with the fajitas expecting veggies I could add into the fajitas? Corn? Additional peppers? Something? But it was steamed cauliflower broccoli and carrots that reminded me of Marie Calendars. Just unfitting for the restaurant lol

I've gone twice.   The first time everything was perfect.   This last time, not so much.  The food was a bit salty.   However, I was impressed at how the manager immediately jumped to resolve the issue.  He sent the item back and offered to bring a new one.   He also provided dessert on the house.   I think that every restaurant will every once in a while have a missed night.  What made it 4 stars is the manager taking steps to rectify the problem.  I salute the restaurant and the manager.   Will be back.  Great fajitas !!!

After shuffling through the 279+ reviews I talked my husband into driving over 10 minutes to this place. I am CRAZY for Mexican food, so I was excited. 

We walked in and my husband was won over by being placed in front of the 80" LED t.v. with Monday night football showing. 

Not only were we presented with warm tortilla chips, but they also gave refried beans and grilled onions and peppers as well. 

My husband ordered chicken fajitas and I ordered steak and enchiladas. YUMMY is pretty much how I can sum it up! Best meal we had in Vegas out of a total of 4 days.

The service was second to none! Friendly and attentive staff was the big fat cherry on the top of it all! Go!!
This is super yummy Mexican food!  You gotta get the fajitas--it's in their name and they don't mess around!

Hello... My name is Angel. Currently I'm #1 for "Check-Ins" here at Juans Flaming Fajitas. My Family & I have been coming here since the Grand Opening back in 2013. Juans is a place where you'll find loyalty and consistency in your dining experience. You're Family the minute you walk through the door...
Been here twice and the food has been great both times. Best Fajitas ive tasted hands down!!!
If you like Mexican food, this is the place to go when in las vegas. Food and the service was awesome!!!. I ordered nachos off the appetizer menu and it was enough to feed 2 people.

I had to check this place out after reading reviews.This is a great spot! We came in early afternoon and were able to take advantage of some of the specials going on ! I chose the mango margarita and shared a shrimp cocktail with my husband before trying the famous flaming fajitas. Good size portions, you can easily share. The small cup of fideo is a nice touch, It reminded me of home.  I loved that the food is not overly salted. In the end, i opted out of dessert but one of the servers convinced me to try a shot of mezcal. Few slices of fresh oranges and I was in heaven !! This is a super friendly atmosphere, even the manager came by to check on our dining. Will have to come back next time I'm on that side of town !!

We've been looking for a great Mexican restaurant since we moved from California 2 years ago. Little did we know that the best place in Vegas was right down the street from us! My favorite thing to order is the chicken fajitas. They come out and light them on fire! Then the fajitas sit atop a little candle that keeps them warm until you've finished eating. Did I mention that before your meal they give you chips, salsa, beans, AND grilled onions and peppers? And sopa de fideo? My husband is getting tired of Mexican food because I've been coming here so often. Hrs seriously the best. And the servers are always friendly and attentive.

If you want awesome service, great food at a reasonable price you hit the jackpot here!  Whether it's dining in the restaurant with Aurtoro, patio or in the bar with Flacco and Rojas you will be teated like royalty with amazing food and service second to none!    Warning:  this place is habit forming!!!!
Our new favorite place ever. Had the steak fajitas could not have been more tender and delicious  exceeded all expectations.

I like Juan's a very great place to eat at. Also, a very good place to chill at! They have outside seating available, very comfortable booths. The food is always on point, the portions are huge. The chips & salsa are great as well! This place gets very busy at times, so be careful on when you come. You most likely will have a wait time if you come during prime hours. 

Overall great place! Great customer service! I can't be mad.

Juan's is bomb! Took what I loved from viva Mercados and made it better! Love sittin at the bar with the bartenders whom my wife and I love! Of course fajitas are killer .... pork and beef add mushrooms and poblanos instead of bells frickin delish!!! My fave tho is the relleno!!!!!! Always have the right game on tv with sound on is such a plus for me! Haven't won anything yet but still have had some great times there! Top notch service from everyone super clean building and the food.... well you just have to go there for yourselves.... Wait don't.... you are just taking up our spaces!!!

This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. With all the great reviews, I don't know why it took us so long to get around to going here. 

We sat in the bar area, which was less crowded than the main dining room. Our waiter, Alex, was right there waiting to take our orders. I try to stay away from mixed drinks these days, but the wine availability is very limited. So I decided to have a small (12 oz.) margarita. Because the kind of wines I wanted wasn't stocked, I was treated to HH pricing and my choice of tequila. It was the best margarita I've ever had, by a landslide. Not too syrupy, just the right amount of ice, and the slice of lime in the bottom of the glass kept it flavorful to the last sip. Next time I won't care about the wine; I'll just go straight for the hard stuff.

We ordered the flaming fajitas for two - chicken for my husband, Mr. Cluck, and shrimp for me. I was so happy to learn that we could have regular or black beans, rice or - be still, my heart - steamed veggies, and could choose two of those in any combination. I swear, in my next life I definitely WILL be a vegetarian! The veggies were a mix of many kinds, and fresh and unadorned, just as I like them. The black beans didn't taste like they came out of a can. The tortillas were the lightest I've ever tasted, which explained why the complimentary tortilla chips were light as air, too.

Those tortilla chips were accompanied by a dish of grilled onions and jalapeno strips, and two salsas and a bean dip. When I tried the bean dip I thought I tasted lard. I asked Alex, and he confirmed it, then asked if we wanted dip without lard. It was replaced before I could blink.

To top off the fabulous service and food, the background was my beloved Mariachi music, making me yearn for the good ol' days, when I was in school there for three summers and then visiting the country often twice a year. Juan's is that authentic, and I look forward to another visit very soon.
The reviews are spot on. Food is really good and prices are very fair. Definitely will return. Atmosphere is just okay. Service was a little slow.
Always packed for a reason. The fajitas are to die for. Everything tastes really fresh and spiced well. Margaritas are just as good.

I went to flaming juans yesterday evening with a friend of mine. It was about a 20 minute wait with most people standing outside. The patio was closed also. When we finally got seated, it looked like there had been people already at the table as there was plates, waters, and chips/salsa already setup. Drinks were served promptly and the meal was out quick. My friend and I did the 2 Fajita share with chicken and steak. We also ordered a few drinks. The white queso dip was phenomenal. After a little bit of time, the manager came over and asked for us to move and be reseated to a different location within the bar. I have never, at a restaurant, been asked to be moved to another table after a certain time. Now, we were comped a $5.00 off next visit on the next meal, but after being asked to move, my friend and I promptly left the restaurant.  If you are looking for some great mexican food, this is the place, but be wary of the service coming here. The parking is a little rough at this restaurant too. There is limited spaces.

Wow, call to make a reservation lady checks availability, comes back and says you have to have a party of 10 or more? I am bringing 7 other people to spend money on food and drink, guess it's not enough business for them now. 

Funny how I have made reservations there for over a year with the same amount of people, thanks!

They keep the place clean and it's a cute restaurant with a fun feel. Not 1 server was friendly. They were all rude including the hostess... wait was long but not too bad. Waited about 30 mins. chips and salsa were mediocre.. food was ok. Margaritas we're ok.... kinda weak. My boyfriend liked his burrito .... my vegetable fajita tasted like chemicals and alcohol.......... kinda like nail polish remover . Kudos for the $5/50 offer through yelp tho just won't be back
This place is authentic and great Mexican food. The best part is the service. You will be well attended and the perfect place for food!

Guarantee you will leave with a full and happy tummy. Not only is the good great, the customer service here is amazing. Can't beat their complementary bean dip and salsa! Food is always fresh and never disappointing. Fajitas are always a good choice and when you order the fresh guac, they'll prepare it at your table! It's like dinner and a show! Will definitely be back whenever I'm in town!

Absolutely love the food but the service is suspect. Fajitas are so good I went twice in 3 days, but... 1st time the service was abysmally slow but that happens, 2nd time they over charged us on multiple items. 

If you go, you'll love the food but double check your bill and prepare to wait.

Yay I love this place especially for Monday or Thursday night football. Awesome happy hour from 3-7 and a separate football specials menu. The table side guacamole is awesome as is the shrimp Jalisco Plato con nopales mmmmm!!!! 

I've also had the fish tacos which are grilled fish and are delicious. Ceviche is a favorite as well. 

Service is always fast and friendly. Huge projector tv in the bar area. Rolando is a great server, my friend and I usually sit in the bar area and get great service. Friendly owner. The place is nonsmoking (yay!!) and they also have outdoor patio seating.

The food here is delicious and I agree they have the best fajitas in town. 

I have mixed feelings about their service because I've had good service and I've had horrible service here so it depends on who you get and how busy they are.

 I will say that this place absolutely sucks for big parties because they have no room the waiters and waitresses are very irritable and they will not split checks whatsoever which I thought was ridiculous. 

I'll stick to a table for 2

The people there are awesome. Very helpful and friendly. The chips, 2 kinds of salsa, bean dip and peppers and onion made a great appetizer and the chicken fajitas were fun to be served and very tasty. Parking is horrible and the restaurant is small and they have the tables pretty close together. Food and people made it all good.

I may have found me my go to sit down casual dining Mexican restaurant! Took my wife here for a date night. The food was very good, not quite superior. I like the addition of beans and peppers/onions with the chips/salsa. My tamale and flaunts were both delicious....the meats that went into them both were nicely flavored, and the masa for the tamale was fluffy and not dry at all. The service was quiet yet very attentive and friendly.
Me and my girlfriend come he often and we share the juans flaming fajitas. The food is good but the service is outstanding!
I am giving five stars for customer service.  Juan presented me with a gift certificate.

Some of the best Mexican food in Vegas! The onions and jalapeños they serve with the chips, salsa and bean dip are amazing! We ordered the Flaming Fajitas for two and it was delicious!! The beef was very tender and well cooked not at all dry. You are given a choice of vegetables or the traditional rice & beans or can you split the order. We split the order and was also very tasty!!  The service was excellent to top it off!! I would highly recommend!!

Ordered today, 7/17/2016, from GrubHub.

Food was delivered within 30 minutes of ordering it, amazing. 

I'm from East LA and no other restaurant in Vegas has come even marginally close to reminding me of home. 

This restaurant just got it right. So yep, five stars. I'll be ordering from this place again in the near future.

My husband and I shared a 3 burrito combination plate. The steak was excellent, the pork was good and the grilled chicken was very good. Our server was 5 stars. She was very friendly and she was the one to recommend the steak. The table next to use had the flaming fajitas, they looked huge and smelled terrific.
The chicken fajitas are the best I've had so far, waitresses are nice and speedy service.

This has to be the best Mexican food in Las Vegas, I'm convinced. First off they start you out with complimentary chips with salsa, beans, and a plate with grilled onions and peppers. (Delicious!) Next it gets even better with their house margs. They have happy hour everyday from 4-7 so a 16 oz margarita on the rocks was under $10. For meals, my boyfriend and I had the shrimp enchiladas and the pollo asada tacos. Both were absolutely delectable! Each entree came with a Mexican soup as well as beans and rice on the side. The portion sizes were just right, not too much and not too little. To finish off our meal we ordered the fried ice cream for dessert, definitely recommended! Love this place! Great service & great food!
Our first time here!  Really enjoyed the great service by our server Lupe!!  Food was delicious!!!  We'll be back!!  *****five stars!!

I wish I had gotten the name of our waiter, because he was beyond accommodating! My friends and I headed to Juan's after a couple hours driving and hiking at Red Rock Canyon. We were looking for some delicious food & drinks. Juan's DEFINITELY satisfied. 

We made it just in time to order off their lunch menu (ends at 3pm). And then just in time to order from their happy hour drinks (starts at 3pm).

The meal starts off with complimentary chips & two types of salsa, a bean dip, and grilled onions & peppers. It was all SO good--especially the grilled onions and peppers. 

My boyfriend and I ordered steak fajitas & a chicken burrito (comes suiza [topped with red or green sauce & cheese]) and added lettuce, tomato, and sour cream. It was all so delicious! 

As other reviews state, the margs are definitely strong. 

To top off our meal, our waiter also let us use the Yelp deal! Four of us dined for about $46--which was a steal! Of course we tipped well because the service was phenomenal.

Had a wonderful lunch here today!  Everything was delicious. Nice that they start u off with chips, 2 salsas, beans and onion and Chilis! We ordered the fajitas for 2 with steak and shrimp and it was Very good and plenty of food for 2 people. Going to be coming here often
This place is good!  Love the cocktail menu and guacamole.  The service is excellent and the prices are extremely fair.

One of the best restaurants in town! They put on a great show with the table side fire fajitas! Free chips & salsa & beans & grilled poblano peppers! The service was amazing, they never let us run out of water or drinks! The organic margaritas are the best!!! The steak fajitas I had were seasoned just right & sizzling hot! (Hence the fire/flames) We were so full we didn't try dessert but look forward to next time!!! Can't wait to go back there!

We were looking for good Mexican food. Tried Juan's based on reviews and we were not let down.  The service was good and the fajitas were really good.  We are from out of town but will go back every time we return to Las Vegas!

Great food!  

But BIGGEST pet peeve ever: When the server brings your change when you pay your bill, but they short you the coins. 

Not the first time they've done this.

I absolutely love this place! Friendly and fast service, never pushy. Food is fantastic. The obvious choice is the flaming fajitas.. I always have tons leftover.  Great flavor and perfect spice level (spicy flavor not just heat) The complimentary soup is amazing and they will remove the noodles for you if you are gluten free. They will also make you a quesadilla on a corn tortilla instead of the traditional flour tortilla if you are gluten free. This may seem like a small thing to some people, but this is huge for me! We go here at least once a week... My pants hate it but the fat kid inside couldn't be happier.

Went here for lunch, since it was local and reviews were decent. Arrived at the start of happy hour. They have a few good deals for happy hour appetizers and drinks. I would suggest trying the Queso Fundido. 

Food was above average for most Mexican restaurants, and service was the same. Portions are huge, I'm 225 # and ordered three items off the combo list. Two of them I had to take home in a box.
Price is about the same as lunch at most places, around 12 to 20 per person with a house margarita.

Im in town for the week and I definitely plan on going back before I leave. I have to try those flaming chicken fajitas.
Fantastic food and even better service. Super attentive and overall great experience!

This place is amazing.  From the service to the food, everything was great.

The service - server was friendly, professional and helpful. It's like she knew us when I asked her if we should get the two person fajita or the single portion! The manager took time to check on every table in the restaurant which was much appreciated.  He followed up with our table at least twice.  What fantastic hospitality!

Our server suggested the single steak fajitas for both of us since we weren't too hungry.  We ordered it protein style with fresh romaine wraps and in addition we ordered shrimp ceviche and the churros and scoop of ice cream.  Gotta have balance! 

The fajitas came out blazing hot. The food runner lit it and it bursted into flames... hence Juan's Flaming Fajitas.  The steak was juicy with a lightly charred exterior and it came with caramelized onions and peppers.

The shrimp ceviche was alright.  We honestly had better.

The churros were .com So get that with a scoop of dulce de leche  ice cream if you have space.
They have the best salsa. Awesome service. Food is excellent no matter what you order. Love it here

I have been to many taco joints and Mexican restaurants in Henderson Nevada and Las Vegas and I must admit  that even though I live in Henderson, I will take and make the journey of pure joy to Juan's Flaming Fajita.  Our waiter was excellent and was always there to fulfill our hankering for some seriously awesome street tacos.   By the way, they have happy hour specials on a Saturday which was a nice surprise.   Truly fantastic eats and beverages.  Awesome wait staff.  I will never be able to complain about driving for 25 minutes for awesome eats and drinks.

Great portions ! Food is delicious and very flavorful.  

Environment is cozy to me with lots of tv's giving it that sports mexican bar theme going.

Family friendly, and they have plenty of boothes(for parents).

The team is very attentive and on point.  Didn't have to ask for one refill and I drink a lot !! (Water)
My favorite Mexican Restaurant, not only is service prompt, friendly service with great food. Our go-to spot, we love it!
Excellent food & great service! Very authentic & delicious Mexican food! Omar the waiter was very good and Patty the bus person was outstanding!

As the name describes it, they server flaming fajitas. The concept is great, the taste is just decent. They bring your fajita in a skillet and they set it on fire on your table, it was actually pretty cool!  I feel like the meat needs some more flavor, it was a bit overcooked and under seasoned. Chips, salsa and guacamole were very good. I really do not have a lot of bad things to say, but I was really not impressed. The service was good, the atmosphere are price are excellent! Fajitas, rice, beans, guacamole and sopa de fideos with two choices of meat for just 24 dollars! It really sounds like a good deal.

The pictures of the salsas, chips, bean dip, and onions/peppers drew me in. I judge all Mexican restaurants by their salsa. Theirs was great! I came during happy hour and they had some good specials there as well. I got a combo platter of nachos, flautas, and quesadilla- it was too much for just me, but really good none the less. I frequent Vegas often and have just found my new go to place. :)

What a great place!  Live music on some nights as well.  The flaming fajita for two was delicious and more than enough food for two, we also ordered the chimichanga, enchiladas, carne asada and they were all delicious!  Fried ice cream and churros were great and they even serve authentic sopapiilos, which were excellent!!!  Our friends come here often so we decided to try and this was our third visit!
The service is beyond comparison, simply OUTSTANDING!!!! Our waiter was very attentive and the manager (owner?) even took the time to stop by and ask how we were doing.

It was refreshing to have such attentive service and eat authentic, from the heart, food!  I highly recommend them to anyone!!!!!!!!!!

Wow!  All I can say is wow!  We had the veggie fajitas and they were beyond delicious!  The service was excellent.  We really wish that we lived by this fabulous restaurant....we would be eating there twice a week!!  Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!

Great food and excellent service! I was visiting from the bay area but I will definitely go back! The fajitas were delicious! Our server was Santiago (It's been a few days so I'm pretty sure that was his name). I've dined at five star and Michelin rated restaurants all over the world, and he provided some of the best service from behind the bar I have ever experienced! Great service is hard to come by these days and it was definitely noticed and appreciated!

In summary, this place is a hidden gem! Make time during your Vegas trip to go!

This is the best Mexican Restaurant I have been to in 20 years. Everything was outstanding. The Fajitas were nicely done. Our waiter, Terrence, made our lunch fun and he was always very attendant to our needs.

I've picked up my order here many times, living near by, it is always finishing being, prepared, packaged hot and fresh with tortilla chips, salsa, bean dip and great soup for cold the Fried Ice Cream great! Plus the friendly and courteous ladies up front by 15-20 minutes. Great atmosphere! Busy bar area with outdoor seating, patio and smiling faces coming from the full dining area. Great Food!, Big portions no complaints and great location!

We have been looking for good Mexican food in Vegas for 10 years. We found a great place. The best food we have had in a long time. Sunday football specials cant be beat.  We ordered street tacos, quesadilla,and fundido, with drinks under $30. Flavorful and authentic. Great staff great place. It will be our go to place.

Omg! Like they say! Flaming fajitas is real authentic Mexican food! They are crazy busy..y cause they Rock! Our waitress claire was fabulous! She didn't rush us we told her we're not in a hurry! Manager Ruth check on us! I thought she was the hostess!! She is amazing mgr and our waitress and her bus boys! Tremendous!! Bartender on it!

This place is great I loved the flaming fajitas and the customer service was the best. We sat in the bar because we were child less this evening Happy hour was sooo good I loved the house margaritas. The price for the food we got a lot of food for a great price. Love their chips and salsa and bean dip. However they have a onions and jalapeño side dish it wassssss hotttttttt lol. I can't wait to go back. Amanda was a great waitress I want her all the time.
absolutely brilliant.....   great fresh food, strong drinks.... lively atmosphere...  large portions
Loved my shrimp fajitas, grilled with green peppers and onions they were very tasty. Delicious chips and salsa and beans. Had a great time with family.

Every time. This place is so. Freaking. Good.

Ordered delivery again, this time with a friend in town. Time after time, Juan's delivers (pun intended) high quality, fresh, delicious food. Their carne asada (ordered in salad and burrito) is so good! 

I love the healthy options - their steamed veggies aren't lame carrots either, it's a mix of zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli -- AND they are small pieces not giant chunks. 

And once again - that green salsa is bomb.

I love this place!!!

This is a great restaurant definitely a family favorite. Fajita's are good as are other items. Don't hesitate in going here. It would be 5 stars but our service wasn't great. The place is extremely busy but the weren't serving as quickly as possible to move ripple in and out. We had to ask for extra salsa and tortilla's. The servers weren't loafing but just didn't seem to anticipate the diners needs. But, again, this is a minimal complaint. I look forward to out next visit. Hint: Go early. The place gets busy after 5:30-6:00.

One of my favorite places in Vegas to eat good Mexican Food. With a large family of 9 we never have a problem getting in. Pricing is great and everyone loves the food. Give it a shot. You will not be dissappointed. Honestly one of our favorite things is the jalapenos and onions they give you. Amazing. Fajitas amazing. You can't go wrong.

Went to my fav place while visiting in Vegas and of course Juan's you never fail me! I always take whomever I am with even if we have to leave later lol I am going to JUANS!!!! Please open a location in California!

Fast & efficient Service. came during my lunch with a few co workers and was in and out with the hour. Was not disappointed, obviously their specialties are fajitas had a good mix ratio of vegetables with chicken not all vegetables. Everybody was friendly, I will come back with my family.

Fantastic. An absolute fantastic place. Great service to our standards. Awesome fajitas. Especially the signature flaming fajitas. It's a great place. Great vibe. Great food. I will recommend JFFC to anyone.

I hate giving out one star reviews and it's been on my mind to give Juan's another try. While our 1st visit was good, the second visit was rough. But the 3rd visit puts Juan's back in 4 Star territory. And there are two key reasons for those stars. Our server, Omar provided great service, and then there's the steak. The OMG, melt in your mouth, cooked to perfection steak tacos that my wife ordered. It was so good she shared some with my son and I and it got a unanimous vote of approval. One bite and we gave each other "that look"... the smile that comes from when you order something and it exceeds your expectations and is just amazing! 

Parking was a bit of a pain as always but the wait was super short, the front door staff actually paid attention to us this time and then when Omar took over we were well on our way to a good experience. 

Try the queso, and don't ignore the plate of jalapenos and onions they bring out. Dip those jalapeno slices in the queso and you'll be hooked. I'm also a fan of their fish taco. It's one of the few that's not overly cooked or more batter than fish. 

I'm happy to bump Juan's back to 4 Stars, and my wife is like we gotta try the steak fajitas next!

This is by far my favorite Mexican food restaurant in Las Vegas, and I don't even like fajitas.  The food is great and the service is better.  They also carry local beer (lovelady).  Overall this place is awesome.
Took my wife to this restaurant since she wanted to check it out . Great service! We went during their Happy Hour and had their ceviche and drinks at a good price!

We started off with the traditional salsa and chips plus a bean dip.  We ordered the signature flaming fajitas with chicken that also included a cup of tomato soup.  The flame was a nice gimmick but the bottom line was the fajitas and soup were pretty average.

A rating of 2.5 is appropriate.
This is the best Fajita place in Vegas! Every thing was excellent from start to finish. And don't forget to have the sopapillas at the end of your meal!

This was suggested by a friend that lives in Las Vegas and I was glad I took her advice.  As soon as you walk in the door the aroma of the fajitas about knocks you over.  It smells sooo good and you get more hungry while you wait to be seated.  The food is good and the staff is friendly.  I'm headed back when I come to town again.

My go to spot for Mexican food. Service is consistently good even though they are usually busy. The fajitas are the star, but I enjoy ordering their chicken mole and other Jalisco dishes. Chips and salsa are good. Sometimes they have live music. A guy and a guitar serenaded our table. Added to the atmosphere. Always looking toward to coming back.

My family and I go here every Saturday, it's really good for. We sit outdoors and Mimi is usually our server. She's a sweetheart and already knows what we usually order. One of the best servers in town!

It's rare I ever write a good review on places but wow this place is amazing they start you off with chips with 3 different sauces which is nice I like different varieties and then the fajitas was what I came for and they light it on fire and are very friendly the staff here are always busy and even though they're busy they still find time to ask you for refills and if you need anything else. Next time I'm in vegas I'll definitely be back here again to try the whole menu out :)

Iv been here a few times I dont see what the hype is personally..the place is small and they try to pack u in like sardines..we went a Saturday night we waited a hour for a table..after we got the table the place was so packed people's backsides were in front of our table waiting to get seated(not something i wanna smell during dinner) the food is cheap and tastes cheap 

The service is ok but its like their  rushing you the whole time to get you in and get ur butt out the place is just ok...prolly wont be back i can tell all the crap is out of a can.drinks are cheap but id rather pay extra $4 to be comfortable 

Personally i work to hard to not have a great dinning experience u feel
Like ur in a high school lunch room

Very delicious. Arrived at a busy moment and was told the wait was 30-35 minutes. We are a party of 5 with 3 kids all under 3...waiting is always unpredictable. Waiting area is small and felt in the way with people going in and out. We were actually seated in 10 minutes! Had the table right in front of where they make the tortillas! This was great for our almost 3 year old. Wait staff was grand; never had an empty drink! Chips and salsa were wonderful! Added bonus was the grilled veggies that came first! Ordered steak fajitas for two (loved the fact you could choose rice and bean or veggies) and a children's quesadilla (had choice of rice and beans or french fries)! Fideo before entree was another added bonus!  All food was amazing! Kids started to argue over the one orange slice so asked waiter for another one, he brought six! Fantastic place and we will definitely drive all across the valley again to come back!

This was my first visit at Juan's restaurant. I took a group of 16 people and everything was great. Especially the SERVICE! Excellent. We all had separate check and tried all kinds of things from the menu. The food was so good. All were very pleased. We will be back. This is a keeper for Vegas.
Oh my gosh! A MUST stop when in Vegas! Been here several times and have never been disappointed, and the service was 5-star just like the food. We will be back Juan!!

Consistently the best:  food, service, ambiance.  Chips and guacamole outstanding; all fajitas are excellent.  Omar is a great server.  Management takes personal interest in every guest.  Just a fantastic Mexican restaurant.

Simply excellent food. An array of complimentary salsa's with chips, all great. I had the lunch Carne Asada. Great flavor! Attentive service, bit noisy at lunch time if you plan to have a business meeting. Overall, it was simply excellent.  Will definitely return!

I am becoming a regular at this place, I still highly recommend the al pastor, excellent customer service from the entire staff, especially Carla. Thank you for a wonderful experience and margaritas made with anejo tequila.
Chile Verde was epic, and  as you might expect, the Fajitas are outstanding. Muy Bueno!
Always packed. Always good. Always super smoky from the flaming fajitas. Definitely our go to Mexican restaurant
So great to find a great Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Everything we ordered was fantastic and the staff was so warm and welcoming. This will be our go to for Mexican food from now on.

I'm not as big a Mexican food fan as I used to be, but going to eat at Juan's Flaming Fajita's has given something new to look forward to!

The chips and salsa are delicious starters before the meal.

Attentive service and not very long waits.

I really enjoyed their breakfast items!  I absolutely LOVE chorizo and their chorizo and egg dish is out of this world delicious!  The fact that they marinate and grill their steak right near your table when you order a steak dish is amazing!  Very well done!

Excellent. Juan has come to my table multiple times. He knows my parents by name because they come here all the time. The people that posted low stars are obviously difficult customers and don't know how to act in a restaurant. I've been here at least 3 dozen times. It's my regular Mexican food spot. Ive never had a bad experience. I run into people i haven't seen in years at this place. Everyone comes here. The food is always awesome. My order is always correct. They have great daily deals. The staff is always friendly and quick. As I write this review, I try to think of anything negative I have experienced, but I just can't find any. I've had family birthdays, graduations, cinco de mayo, big family gatherings, small mother son dates, and random stop ins. It's always 5 stars.

This may not count for much coming from a Virginian, but this was probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. The service was great, the price was right, and everything I tasted was delicious. Plus you get so much for free! Salsas, bean dip, fried onions and peppers and chips right off the bat and then a bowl of soup with dinner. We look forward to incorporating a visit to Juan's into our annual Las Vegas trip from now on!

Best Mexican hands down. Service was excellent,  as was or last visit.  Ask for Omar! He's the best and very personable.  So glad we discovered this place. My father in law said that the chicken chimichanga was the best he ever tasted.  And you can't beat the happy hour menu.  Forget about Lindo (over priced, and tasteless). Once you come here you won't go back to other Mexican restaurants. Enjoy!

Love the food here. Their salsa is the best!! And the service is incredible especially the restaurant manager is so customer service oriented which is such a breath of fresh air. I go their almost once every 2-3 weeks .

Good atmosphere, terrific prices, superb customer service, and scrumptious food... this place is a new favorite! The staff was quite attentive and very polite. The food is authentic and their salsas were some of the best we have ever tried. We will definitely be going back again and again and I would without a doubt recommend this restaurant.

After coming here a few times, I think the best time to come here is during happy hour, which goes from 4:00pm - 7:00pm daily.  Some of the highlights:

Import Draft Beers: $3.50 for 16oz or $4.50 for 20oz
Well Drinks: $3.50
Margaritas: $3.50 for 12oz or $4.50 for 16oz
Fajita Quesadillas: $6.95

Come in during happy hour, and for around $20 or so you can have quesdillas, free chips and salsa/beans, and three drinks.  Not bad at all.

Outside of happy hour I've had their fajitas: beef, chicken, pork, and shrimp.  The fajitas are decent, but not necessarily something to go out of your way for.  The fajitas for two combo is about $25, which really can be enough for three people if you keep snacking on the chips and dips.  Again, not really good enough to warrant going out of your way for, especially since they close pretty early.  Fridays and Saturdays they close at 10:00pm, the rest of the week they close at 9:00, so unless you're in the area you'll want to be sure to come here early.

Love the fajitas, the atmosphere and the staff!! This place is awesome for a family dinner, a team party or a date night. Great ownership and management that Truly cares. It shows every time we come in. We love our local favorite restaurant.

I love this place! I stumbled upon it when I was looking for Buzz BBQ (Buzz closed and Juan's opened up in its place). The staff was super friendly & attentive, the owner even came over and chatted with us for a little. Fresh chips, salsa, bean dip with roasted jalapeños & onions were brought out a minute after we sat. We ordered the fajitas and they even gave us complimentary dessert (churros). SO BOMB. I was so impressed with the food quality, cleanliness, friendliness and efficiency I had to bring my roommate back the week after. They also have a great selection off their happy hour menu; I believe it's daily from 3-7PM. Best Mexican food in Las Vegas.

We go here quite often. The service is great and the food is delicious. From the salsas to the flaming fajitas to even the chicken fingers, everything is delicious. I love the flaming fajitas and they come on a sizzling platter so that really makes them even more appetizing. The shrimp cocktail and ceviche is very well made too.

This place came highly recommended by a friend. When we walked in we told the hostess it was our first time, immediately people waiting for tables were telling us how much we would enjoy it. We waited no more than 20 minutes on a Friday night. I can't say how fantastic the food was and the customer service was exceptional. It's nice to see servers hustle when there is a crowd and they are eager to please, refill drinks, and get food out quickly. We will return for sure!
Always great foot and  awesome customer Service!!!  We've eaten here three times and never been disappointed. Plus there are coupons sometimes!

Love the happy hour specials here!  Food is straight forward and simple how mexican food should be...  All the other mexican places around Summerlin try to make classical dishes with all kinds of flashy small portioned crap.  That's why they don't last and dissappear after 6 months... I've visited here at least 20 times and always great service and delicious food...Orale Flamer Juan!

My husband and I have been here several times, we've sat at the bar, we enjoyed the delicious chips and salsa, my husband loves the margaritas he said there the best! the staff is very friendly we usually go on Fridays its always busy, so far I've tried the fish tacos chicken enchiladas my son has had the shredded beef burrito,  my husband tried the ceviche and a shrimp chesse foundo all delicious we were all happy with food and flavor. they also have a nice patio if you like to sit outsideI would recommend this place try it I don't think you'll be disappointed:-)
The food was delicious and fresh. The services was outstanding. The prices were reasonable I will definitely  come back.

Hands down the BEST Mexican restaurant near Summerlin, or maybe even in Vegas.  I am usually pretty picky with my Mexican places since many places in Vegas seem to have either no flavor or are too greasy.  The service was absolutely fantastic, from the hostess to our server Omar, everyone was very courteous and helpful but not naggy or anything annoying.  It was great.  We were immediately seated and brought chips and salsa and our drink order were taken. We went with the pork and shrimp fajitas, and wow sooooo good. They light them up when it's wheeled out to you, super cool! The veggies, meat, and shrimp had so much flavor.  The tortillas were very fresh and warm.  All the sides: guac, cour cream, pico, beans, and rice were fresh and super tasty! I would definitely recommend this to any Mexican food lover or anyone who needs to be converted.  Definitely my new favorite place!

This place is wonderful! We drove across town to try it and was soooo worth it! Our server  was Claire and she went above and beyond to make our first experience here amazing! We tried the guacamole, shrimp ceviche, tacos and taco salad. The salad was enormous! The churros completed the meal perfectly! We will definitely be back!
Good food and firiendly sevice. Fajitas are awesome

Maybe the best Mexican food either my wife or I have ever had.

FOOD: 5-Stars. We filled our stomachs with the amazing chips & salsa & beans & grilled peppers/onions. We shared a Steak fajita plate for ONE and were stuffed.  Steak was real thick and real tasty.

DRINKS: After a day of sitting poolside all we ordered was water.

SERVICE: 5-Stars. Waitress had a great sense of humor and was very helpful. "This is great... pass on this... try this..." Even our busboy, Erick, was cheerful and attentive.

COST: I figured it would be $30+/-.  It was $17.25. 

DEFINITELY COMING BACK!

Food just tastes better here. Juan's Flaming Fajitas & Cantina is at the top of my list for Fajitas and Margaritas. The tables always start off with chips, two salsas, and sauteed onions and jalapenos. It's always fun to try the different combinations of each or just pile them all on and enjoy. Their Steak is  always tender, Shrimp are never overcooked, and the Chicken has never been dry. I'll have to get back to you when I try the Pork. The little flambe show is always entertaining and the char on the veggies and proteins from the sizlling hot fajita grill adds a great smoky flavor. It comes with their rice, refried beans and all the sides you would expect so you know you won't be leaving hungry. 

I always enjoy their Margaritas whenever I get a chance. They pair so well with the food. I'd have to say my favorites so far have been the Mango, Peach, Pina Colada, Raspberry, and Strawberry. All the fruity combinations have me feeling like I'm drinking candy.

Their Happy Hour menu is no joke. You expect portions to be smaller like other restaurants, but what we got looked like a full order. Juan's Flaming Fajitas has given me more for my money on a happy hour menu than any other place I have been to. 

Service has always been friendly and attentive whenever I have visited. I look forward to visiting again. Save a little room for dessert!

This place was awesome! My fiancé and I shared the steak fajitas for two and ordered our kids a taco and quesadilla meal off the kids menu. The portions were awesome and very filling. Their margaritas were yummy. I got mine on the rocks but think I will try a frozen strawberry one next time! The service was fast and excellent. Not to mention the price to feed a family of 4 only costed us $60. I will definitely be back soon!

Great food at very good prices here. For $26.95, we get the flamin' fajitas for two, I get shrimp, he gets steak. The food comes out quickly and the portions are huge. The best part is after you get served your chips and salsa, you get a cup of yummy fideo soup which is a great complimentary starter to your meal. There are big screen TVs there so you can watch the game while you eat, there is a separate bar area and a dance floor. The wait staff try very hard to be attentive. It can be hit or miss depending on who you get and how busy it is, but if you are not quite happy or if there is a something amiss they do not hesitate to try to fix it. Luckily, there were no big issues, just a misunderstanding with our fajitas for two. I wanted the shrimp cooked separately and not mixed in with the steak fajitas. They offered to remake the meal, but we declined and ate it anyway and it was delicious. Try this place, it a new business that is working very hard to make a great impression on every single customer.

Juans Flaming Fajitas was just ok for me.

Typical long wait on a Saturday for a known good restaurant. 45 mins- 1hr.

Hostesses were friendly.

Our waiter Omar was EXCELLENT!! He took care of our table with exceptional sevice. He was on top of everything. He checked on us regularly to see if we needed anything else , asking how are meal was and we never had to worry about our drinks being refilled. Service with a smile, professional, and extremely efficient. 5 stars for Omar.

The live music by the gentleman playing guitar was awesome!! We really enjoyed that. :)

Restaurant a bit too smokey for me. Yes, it's because of ALL of the flaming fajitas. Hence the name "Juans Flaming Fajitas" I know.  I smelled like mexican food the whole way home. If I come back, I will request the outdoor seating if it's available. ;)

Unfortunately, the food was too salty for my liking. The soup and my steamed veggies were packed with sodium I'm certain. I was unable to finish either. :( 

Fajitas sadly the same. Too much salt. MY goodness! My suggestion- I would have liked the option to salt my food myself, if at all. 

Ambiance was ok,  service was fantastic, dinner was clearly a miss, dessert  (fried ice cream)  was a hit though. That's how I arrived at my solid 3 star rating.

Alot of great things about this restaurant on Yelp. Based on service I would recommend. Definitely give it a try. You can decide. When you do, maybe leave a review. :)

We are visiting  from Huntington Beach CA and my son brought us here for my B Day  . What a great experience we had .From the chips and salsa bean dip and their Habanero hot sauce to their famous sizzling Steak and Chicken Fajitas  so good  not  mentioning the wonderful service .Our server Sebastián and his helper Jari were amazing very attentive and professional  the whole thing was awesome can't wait to come back when i visit again

Awesome fajitas that they light on fire at your table. Warm chips with an array of dipping options, along with roasted onions and jalapeños. The two person option was enough for three, well worth the wait to come here!
Lunch margaritas are big, delicious, and cheap. The food is amazing and the portions are very generous. The servers are very friendly and attentive. We loved every aspect of our dining experience.

This was only the second time I have been here. My friend and I went for a relaxing meal on our day off work. We ordered the fajitas and got the Wednesday special $4 margaritas!!! $4 people!!! They were decently loaded with alcohol and made the meal pop. Our food came out quickly. They bring your fajitas out on a cart and set them an fire table side. It is a fun show and makes the meal that much better. These were probably some of the best fajitas I have ever had. I will definitely go back just for them.

The Staff: the staff greeted us upon entering and gave us all the available seating options (patio, bar, dining room) which was nice. They were quick to seat us and the waiter we had was great. He knelt down to our level to talk to us which made it more personable. He was extremely attentive and caring. He always asked us or anticipated what we needed before we even asked. Keep up the great service guy!!!
Live this place! My man an I come here all the time! Amazing food, great service even when they are busy. And the price is affordable.

I have frequented at the place often. They have the best Mexican food in vegas in my opinion. The happy hour is every day of the week. The HH food portions are perfect and their drink prices are wonderful. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating. They are known for their fajitas and they always deliver. I recommend this place to everyone.
This place has great service and some of the best Fajitas I have ever had.  The guacamole is killer also.

First time here last night, and we will always return when we're in the mood for Mexican food, in particular fajitas!  It's really hard to find decent Mexican food in Vegas, and we believe we finally found our Mexican spot.  From the minute we walked in, everyone was so welcoming and friendly. But, the people that stood out the most were our server, Amanda, and her sidekick Erick!  They gave 5 star EXCELLENT service! They were so awesome, always checking on us, giving us refills on beverages, chips, salsa, etc! The food was so yummmmmy and authentic!  The complimentary chips, salsa, grilled onions, jalapeños were to die for, and we couldn't get enough!  Can't wait to return!!!

Juan's is our favorite go to Mexican place in town.  The service is always outstanding.  My husband enjoys being greeted by the manager who will help him with his Spanish.  The bartender always recognizes us.  The cups are never empty.  The chips, beans, and salsa are always refilled.  Food always comes out Flamin' fresh.  My husband and I always get an iced tea, a coke, and chicken fajitas for 2...  We love getting the two plates of grilled veggies rather than the rice and beans. With tip it comes to $36.  How can you beat that?  That is enough to take home to add to lunch salads for two days as well!  For great food, friendly service, and fun atmosphere, check this place out!
It was decent Mexican food, ordered the enchiladas and were very good.  Place and ambiance was great and clean.
asked him he had a rewards program and he said no cause he don't care about his customers

Came here on a Wednesday: $4.99 margaritas! :) my friends couldn't be any happier. 

I ordered beef fajitas that came with a cup of fideo soup, flour or corn tortillas, and a plate with rice, beans and guacamole.
The fideo soup was flavorful. My fajitas were seasoned and cooked well. The rice, beans and guac were unremarkable. Corn tortillas were served warm. 
We all enjoyed our churros filled with dulce de leche for dessert. 
Try out Juan's Flaming Fajitas for an awesome experience!

Omg! ,, without a doubt absolutely the best Mexican food this side of the Border and  that's saying a lot we grew up in San Diego having dined in Puerto Nuevo, Ensenada, Cabo, ect !We service is absolutely excellent as well as the value. Our server was Vinny give the man a raise! Thank all of you for a wonderful evening.

Disappointed went to dinner and loved it. Sunday , decided to try brunch. So disappointed watered  down drinks with brunch , so they upsell premium drinks.   The eggs were burned and ruined my brunch selection.  Your only allowed one brunch selection.  Out of all the brunch places in Vegas. This is not one to do.  Over priced and undervalued.  The place was empty for brunch.  That should have been a clue.

Juan's has good traditional style Mexican food. They have a big menu & they're great for Happy Hour. I personally love their flavored frozen margaritas. Peach & mango are my favorites! The service is always consistently great. Everyone I've dealt with is fluent in both English & Spanish. It's a very family friendly place. I've eaten there for a girls night out & I've also went with family & young children. I love seeing the actual flaming fajitas come out because the flames are enormous & fun to watch. 

If you enjoy authentic Mexican food, rather than the Americanized Taco Bell version then definitely check this place out!

This place is just okay and overpriced. Mexican food in Vegas is severely lacking to make a huge understatement. I've been here multiple times with family and out of town visitors. Nobody has been impressed. I want to like it, they just put forth minimum effort in every way.

Be prepared to wait for dinner - It was worth the 45 min wait.   
There is a bar where you can wait and watch sports or play (video poker I think) 
On the Thurs night we went the bar and restaurant was packed -- there was a 30 person retirement party set up in the bar area taking up most of the tables and chairs.
Service is pleasant and efficient.
Food was very good.
We will be back!

Last night was our first time here and we loved it, friendly service on arrival and once we were seated we were brought chips and 3 different dips! We were then brought complimentary soup which was tasty and my 7 month old son loved it!! Since we were at flaming fajitas I wanted to try them and they didn't disappoint! I got shrimp and they were the best my husband and I have tried for a long long time! I think he wishes he'd gotten them too! Overall a really good dining experience and we will go back for sure!
Very good, was an awesome experience and we didn't want for anything! Omar was sweet and made sure our margaritas were always full! Good was delicious as well, on of the best happy hours!
Good authentic Mexican food here. I was impressed when they had a side of mixed veggies. Prices right as well.

Always great. Fantastic service. They are fast, nice and friendly.

Chile rellano was super! Batter is fluffy. 

I love the margaritas.

We will be back!!!

This review is a bit late, we visited Juan's a couple times over the last 6 months and it was fantastic.  The appetizer sampler was ginormous and the flaming fajitas were large and out of this world.  The servers could not have been more friendly and professional.  A must visit on this side of Vegas.
You have to try the fajitas at least once. So FUNNNNN. Big portions for fair prices. Nice employees.
Love this place! Great atmosphere, delicious food and great staff! Come here a lot and always have a great time! Would recommend in a heart beat!

Second time here.
Shared the fajitas for two with my daughter.
We brought so much home it could have probably served 3 or 4.
This is probably because we are so many of the fresh made tortillas and dip.
Had the pork and carne asada with napales.
Everything was very flavorful. Servers were patient with the first timers

Enjoyed our time here. Super cheap and super delicious, the portions are generous too! Gabriel & Chapo are the tag team you need  Will return. Also, super cool how you get so many accompaniments with your chips &  (salsa)

Some friends of mind suggested Juans.  I loved the décor, the chips and salsa were good, the grilled onions and jalapeños were just like  dad makes at home. The flaming fajita are just that, the table side server was excellent, and the staff prompt and courteous.  It's a bit of a ways off the strip, and more of a locals join, but well worth the visit.  We had a bit of a wait, but it was a Friday night and there was 4 of us, but really the food and server were worth the wait.

Ok so, been looking for a good Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  Finally decided to visit this location and I was not disappointed.  Husband had the fajitas & I had the 3 taco plate.  Everything was delicious, tasty & we left nothing behind. Alcoholic drink was strong according to hubby.  I'm a big fan of this place & would return when my craving kicks in for Mexican food.  

FYI: Parking could be a hassle and wait time can be long.

I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant! I was next-door getting my car fixed and noticed this place across the street it's always been one of those places where you drive by but never stopped and eat at. It was my best friends birthday so I suggested this place being that we both love Mexican food. Upon arrival we were greeted by 2 really friendly hostesses. I asked if they had happy hour and they said yes from 3 to 7 and it's not only in the bar area like most restaurants its everywhere you sit which is a plus. They have a bar as well as a patio outside. The restaurant had a very authentic Mexican feel, I loved the ambience. I was really surprised with their happy hour menu there were so many choices! The margaritas were amazing and only four dollars for a 12 ounce or five dollars for a 16 ounce you can't beat that! I ordered the piña colada margarita on the rocks and my friend had the blended mango margarita both were amazing and just the right amount of alcohol. I like how they offered complementary chips and three different salsas some restaurants charge extra. I ordered the steak quesadilla and I was so shocked at how big it was two people definitely could have shared it! My friend ordered the cheese enchiladas with red sauce and she was scraping her plate at end it was so good. I informed the waiter that it was my friends birthday and he made sure to bring out a complimentary dessert and they sang for her. Overall I loved the experience at Jauns the service was quick everyone was professional and friendly and very attentive. They have one of the best happy hours I've ever seen I will definitely be back!

BEST SERVICE!!! From our waitress AND the busperson(?) who would always come by and take any plates we were done with.. And they use legit NY STRIP steak for their steak fajitas fyi.. A MUST try :) The wifey and I left happy.

AWESOME happy hour! It goes until 7pm every day and they have a huge selection of food and drinks. I always fill up on the chips, salsa, veggies and beans they serve as soon as you walk in and end up taking most of what I ordered home. Their margs are pretty decent, especially considering the happy hour price. The staff is friendly and attentive.

This was my first visit, We wanted Mexican food so started looking around for someplace we have not tried before. Most of what we found where counter style places but this one stood out, so we decided to give it a try.

   Its off on the west side so people from the strip over have to travel a bit but let me tell you ts worth it. They share a parking lot with some other businesses that are not open at night so plenty of parking. Oh did I mentioned its next to an In and Out? 

   The restaurant has to seating areas the bar and the main dinning. The bar looks a little dark compared to the main dinning but looked inviting also. We sat in the main area, let me tell you its a bit of show with flames shooting up from almost every direction.. They ignite the fajitas table side with a nice shot of tequila.  I myself have not tried them but they look fantastic  and smell wonderful.

    The menu has lots of options and will cover just about any ones taste.  They start you off with chips beans and 2 salsas, one green ( which I preferred ) and one red (this on was a bit bitter to me ). But both tasty. 

    The staff is very efficient we did not have to ask for a thing. they kept us filled on chips and drinks and food was done in a timely manner and served very hot. The staff continued to check on us to make sure everything was on par. The food was fantastic, good flavor and you can tell not bag and box seasoning. Portion where large we had enough for a second meal at home the next day.

   Juan's has become part of my top five in Las Vegas closer to the top of that list. I can say with confidence I will be back many times in the near future.  

     If you get a chance to be in the area of Juan's I highly recommend you pay them a visit.. you wont be disapointed
Ordered the mix fajitas and was surprised with so much flavor. Service very good I would recommend this place to friends and family.

Oh my goodness!  Delicious carne fajitas!  I came here due to the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We arrived around 4:30 and there were already parties waiting to be seated.  Luckily my friend had arrived earlier and had already secured seating.  The service and food was great.  The carne fajitas were tender enough I could cut them with my fork.  The flour tortillas were very moist; sticking together in the tin foil(not a bad thing).   The salsas provided with the chips were delicious. 
 One of them looked like a roasted version and it was my favorite of the salsas presented.  The only item I would say that I ordered that I did not finish was the refried beans.  To me they were good, but on par with my other favorite Mexican restaurant beans.  You can feel the heat coming off the fajitas when they flambé them table side.  There were a couple of times when they would be serving other customers nearby and I was concerned that one of people in my party would have her hair ignited as she used a lot of hairspray and the flaming fajitas were very near her!  Luckily, she stayed flambé-free.  I wish the tables were not packed in so close together.  You have to maneuver carefully so as not to bump into people seated as you attempt to get to and from seating.  I realize they are popular so they pack in as much seating as they can, but it makes for feeling like you are also dining with others nearby.  I was too full to try a dessert; a good reason to come back.  There is covered patio dining.  The parking lot is challenging as the spaces are packed in like the seating inside the restaurant.  These 'challenges' however will not deter me from coming back.  I've been here once and anticipate returning.

AYYYYY MUCHO CALIENTE PAPIIII~!!!!

haha I have been wanting to try this place just because the pictures look so darn cool! Coming in I knew that we just HAD to try the flaming fajitas I mean if it's in the name of the restaurant then you should probably try the dish right? HAHA Walking into the place it's your typical family run Mexican joint nothing fancy but it was very clean and colorful. There is a full bar and patio area to the left and then the main dining room is comprised of both tables and booths.. I even think they have a little dance floor area. 

We ordered:
-Table-side made Guacamole: ($7.95) They make it exactly to your liking so if it tastes bad it is your own fault!
-Chicken & Beef Flaming Combo Fajitas for Two: ($25.95) I don't even like fajitas but these were so good. Good quality meat and you gotta love the little fire show that you get.. I love that the plate is indeed sizzling and pretty much stays sizzling so your meat/onions/peppers stay hot! 
-Combo comes with guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream, rice, beans or you can substitute the rice+beans for VEGGIES yay.. I love how they bring 2 separate plates of these instead of 1 to share between the 2 people! Combo also comes with a choice of corn or flour tortillas (6 total!)
-Complimentary Fideo soup which is like a tomato based soup with some noodles.. was a little salty for me but I still liked it!
-Complimentary Chips, Salsa & Bean Dip: The chips were mixed with the standard yellow chips and red and green chips.. served warm but not oily.. The salsa tasted fresh and was not too spicy and the bean dip was a little too salty for me but still tasty! 
On the menu it says the first round is on the house but that they charge after that.. They asked us if we wanted a refill and I said yes but they didn't charge us so maybe it's 1 per person? 

Awesome friendly service from all of the wait staff.. Food took a little bit longer than I had expected but I didn't really notice since I was too busy munching on chips.. I told Juan I found them through Yelp and he said Yelp has really helped them.. I definitely recommend trying this place out.. If you don't like fajitas they have a bunch of other items (no a la cart items though) & they have a daily HAPPY HOUR 3-7! 

HOT TIP: print this coupon before you go.. I forgot to print mine so they didn't accept it but oh well haha: https://mobileapp.moneymailer.com/IcfV2/getIcfImage.aspx?im=sat&o=7ACFE9EB-ADE7-4468-B58D-244231566823&di=&t=HOTPDF&p=F
Clearly the best place to go for fajitas in Vegas. Worth the drive from the strip. We went two days in a row!

Food - 4/5
Service - 5/5

Food
There are a variety of mexican selections from nachos, tacos, and burritos etc. I decided to try the Carne Asada Burrito which came in a huge portion with rice, beans (substitute with veggies) and guacamole. The burrito was very filling for the price, if you don't eat too much, two people could have shared the burrito. We ended up with a lot of to go.

Prices
The Burritos were all about $12.95. In my opinion, it was a little bit pricey for a casual lunch.

Service
The service was great. They also have complementary chips and salsa for us which was great for us when we were talking and waiting for the food to arrive.

Overall
The food was good and met my expectation. The price was a little bit pricey so unless you want to spend $10+ for a burrito, might want to consider ordering something else or sharing with a friend. Otherwise highly recommend for some tasty mexican food when you want to avoid the fast food places like Cafe Rio and Chipotle.
Last time we went here we got a hair in the food. Unfortunately, this is enough to prevent us from returning based on the thought of it grossing us out so bad. It's too bad too. :/

Wow!  Coming from Arizona you have the belief you can't get good Mexican food anywhere else.  Don't be fooled by that thinking.  The food here is fantastic!

Starting with the chips, salsa, and bean dip to the unbelievable fajitas.  You're most certainly will not be disappointed with a trip to Juan's!9010 W Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas
10/10 would recommend. Filled up on free chips/ salsa, taking entree home for later. Very delicious, the flaming fajita platter is a joy to watch.
I've been going to this place for a couple years now. The food and service is always on point. I wish I could give it 6 stars. The sopapillas are bomb too.

So good.  Just go. And bring your picky eaters with cause they'll be satisfied too.
I don't eat meat, & this place satisfies. Great selection of non-meat dishes & they are Delish!  Not just over salted, over cooked limp veggies. 
We're talking perfect like you'd make for yourself! Portions are huge, salsas are fantastic, staff super friendly, prices reasonable, atmosphere awesome cause everyone's table seems to get fajitas and they lite that puppy on fire & that's super cool. 
Only bad thing, parking lot is tight!

So glad we came in tonight for dinner. The place was packed with people waiting outside. The greeter was nice and organized. The smell of foods was everywhere. We knew we were going to have a fantastic meal. We ordered a flaming fajitas for 2, shrimps and steak. The server came out to light the flame before serving...so cool!! We only ate half of the portion and took home the rest. Definitely come back again soon.

1st visit, Wednesday late lunch. Early Happy Hour specials today, good selection.
Shrimp ceviche: $7.95 special, very good & large portion.
Queso Fundido: $3.95 served in sizzling skillet, hot and delicious w corn or flour tortillas.
Warm chips served complimentary w 2 salsas and a bean dip.
16oz margarita specials for $4, good but not very strong.
Flaming fajitas, cooked already but quickly flamed tableside for show, kids would like it.
Food was hot & tasty, excellent service. Good prices and a lot of food for the price. Will definitely come back!

WOW FROM THE START!!! Great house margarita and the chips with the side of onions and pepper slices and bean dip were awesome. The service was smoking fast and it was a busy night. We got the Steak and Shrimp Fajitas for 2....... REALLY nice sized shrimp and grilled great along with the steak..... they came served on a cast iron dutch oven lid with a 2' high flame...........GREAT flavor....... voted #1 by LVRJ people........BEST OF LV. Guess what........ these are the best fajitas I've had in Vegas.... CAN'T WAIT TO GET BACK!

My family and I moved out here from Southern California recently and have been trying to find a good Mexican restaurant. So far nothing has blown us away, until now. Service, food, drinks are all top notch at Juan's. From the salsa, bean dip, and fried onions/jalapeños they bring before the meal to the great enchiladas, Juan's is hands down the best Mexican food in Vegas!

The atmosphere is very lively and the food was very delicious!  Prices are very reasonable!!! The staff were all very friendly and speedy service!  Highly recommended if you're in the SW area of town! Thank you for a wonderful evening! Keep up the excellent work!

The food:
Chips, and bean dip are good. Salsa is a bit mild, but has a good flavor.
Fajitas were bland, but flaming as advertised and somewhat burnt.
Rice was stone cold and they forgot the tortillas.
Corn tortillas are store bought just like the generic brand at Food4Less back in the day.

The service:
We were seated right away.
Our server seemed interested, but never checked on us until long after the food arrived.
The server delivering the food was in way too much of a hurry to even care to check that the order was even correct. So we waited until finally someone came over to check.
Then, they kept interrupting while we were trying to eat just to keep apologizing. 
I get it... you're sorry... are you trying to make me leave?

Summary:
Food was "meh" at best, service was horrible.
I'm hoping this was an "off" day because I really wanted to like the place.
Awesome place and service. The food was so good. I can't wait to go back. You won't be disappointed :)

I really liked this place.  The hostess was nice and so was our waiter.  The service was good and they were on top of refilling our chips, salsa and bean dip.  At the end of the meal, the owner came to talk to us and ask us how our food was.  This place is new and there's not much decoration, but there's enough.

I love love love that they have a vegetarian section in their menu.  The menu has 6 different vegetarian plates.  I ordered the vegetarian fajitas with no sour cream or cheese and it came out flaming and on fire.  It was a pretty cool presentation of it.  The servings are big and I was full after eating 2 fajitas. My bf ordered the vegetarian enchiladas and he said it tasted good.  We both had leftovers to take home for tomorrow.  I also our love our bill and how it $20 for the both us!!  It's hard to eat out at restaurants nowadays for two people and pay $20 for the meal.

This place also has happy hour from 3pm-7pm.  If I can remember correctly, the happy hour menu has nachos, fajitas, and something else for like $5.  They also have alcohol for happy hour too.  I think this place will give Frank and Fina's and Lindo a run for their money.   

I will definitely come back and try more stuff on their menus.  I'm gonna try hard not to stuff my face with chips, salsa and bean dip so that I have room to order dessert!! :)
The food is amazing.  The staff was very attentive and very courteous. We will be back for sure.
The food is Yummy. When you order to go they give you a good amount of free chips&salsa and beans. The lady that works there is nice.

Yea, so this is my happy place.  Everything is delicious, but get the fajitas.  Sit bar side, the crew on that side is incredible.  You have a handful of people from bartender to bussers who really do pay attention and are incredibly thoughtful. I tell everyone i know to try it out and it quickly becomes their new go-to. Grab a beer, order up a ton of food and enjoy..

This place gave me terrible stomach pains. By stomach pains, I mean I ate wayyyy too much! Come prepared in your finest stretchy pants. Service was quick and the food was great. We ordered the beef and shrimp fajita for two. The serving was plentiful and came with all the fixins, including a cup of fideo. They also give you chips with beans and salsa. The only thing I didn't care for was the horchata, too watery. Other than that, I left pregnant with a food baby. Success!

We went here hoping for a good Mexican meal, but got much more than that! With fantastic food and great, accommodating service, I would definitely come here again any day of the week. Chips are highly addicting though so watch out!

OMG!!!! This is my new spot for my Mexican cuisine! The flaming fajitas are the BOMB DOT COM! So fresh and yummy! Me and my Hubby went last night and The also had $4 house margaritas! Yum!!!! We had a great buzz when we left!! Great price for the quality too. I knew it was there but I just never stopped in and boy I've been missing out!!! No Mas!!!!!!!
Best Mexican is Las Vegas!  I finally found a great place for Mexican.  Get the fish tacos!
The food was fantastic, the margaritas were superb, and the Wait Staff were great!!  First time, but definitely coming back!

You can't go wrong with this West Vegas local restaurant. Always packed. You can smell the food two blocks away. The only problem is  this restaurants in the same parking lot with in and out burger. That makes parking measurable. So don't expect to rush in eat and leave. It's going take you 10 minutes to find a parking spot. But it's worth the wait. There's usually always a waiting list. Not very long but weekends tend to get busy as heck. Service is always good and so is the food.

I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. The only complaint I could ever have is the long waits at dinnertime, but it's worth it. I'm a fan of the fajitas with steak and shrimp, but I've tried many other items and loved them all! Great happy hour specials too. Also, I wish I could eat their salsa all the time because it's so fresh and delicious. :)
Best service!! It is so good I had 5 Diet Coke refills 2 baskets of chips and 2 bean dip refills. Food is amazing!! Fast and efficient .

Hands down the BEST Mexican restaurant I've been too. Everything came out fresh. Our server was amazing (can't remember name). The fajitas for two, which was shared by my mother and I, was a lot and we had some to bring home as well. All of the staff was very friendly and smiled at us. I will be bringing friends and family here from now on.

I love this place! We have been on several occasions and they never disappoint. The flaming fajitas are always delicious, my favorite is the shrimp, cooked perfectly every time. The plate of grilled onions and jalapeños are also good, I need a plate to myself. Service is always awesome!

Got salt? If you do please bring some to Juan, he is out. 
I've been there once before and the food was good,  enough for me to go back.  But tonight was a different story. The staff was horrendously unattentive. We just about finished our chips and salsa before we were able to flag down our server and tell him we were ready to order.  I could understand if the place was packed and everyone was running around but it wasn't. In fact I saw our server sit down for a few seconds before he jumped up to serve the table by us. The rest of the night unfortunately didn't speed up.  We had to ask for the check after we were obviously done.
