The food lacked any flavor.  We had the fajitas. Wow, the worst fajitas I've ever had.  I can make amazing fajitas at home - salt, pepper, a little cumin and spice. Apparently the chef has never heard of spices because he sure did not use any.  

Just an overall disappointing experience. I don't go out to eat too often and when I do I expect it to be on par or even better than what I can cook at home.  I doubt I will ever be back.

Yesterday was my 21st birthday so we decided to celebrate and have dinner here. It was the first time my family and I have been here but we've heard good reviews. We had about a 30 minute wait for a table which was not a big deal. So my mom and I went to the bar to order my first drink as a 21 year old. The people at the bar were super friendly and made it fun. The margaritas were super bomb, too. We got seated on the patio and our server was Christian. He was an absolute amazing server and made the night even funnier than it already was. He was on top of everything and just added in to how crazy and loud my family is. I love servers who know how to have fun with a family like mine. The food was awesome and I loved the experience. I'll definitely be coming here on my Friday's for a margarita and some queso dip lol. Love love love

It was our first time eating there and we had such a wonderful experience. We had a party of three and the hostess was very courteous. The wait was maybe 5 min on a Saturday night. To be honest, we got so full before our entree even came! Hubby and I shared a steak and shrimp fajitas combo. When we sat down, our waitress quickly took our drink order. When she returned, someone also brought chips and salsa. He brought a mini bowl with no spice for our son just in case and a side of grilled onions and jalapenos which was super yummy. We ordered a chicken quesadilla appetizer, which I completely recommend! The quesadilla was HUGE and the chicken was flavorful. Our entree came with a side of fideo soup and they even offered to refill our basket of chips and salsa, but I was already feeling stuffed and our entree hasn't come yet so we declined. I thought I was a nice gesture because from entry, their staff seemed like a we'll oiled machine in customer service. The wait time for all of our food was minimal. The fajitas were superb and it came with a size of tortilla, rice, beans, sour cream, Pico and guac (my choice). I can't wait to come back to try other things on the menu!
Every time I come back to visit vegas Juans is a must! Hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants out there!
Juan, there were two fires lit at lunch today, one on my amazing shrimp fajitas and one in my pantalones... for that I am grateful as is my bf. You can light my fire any day!

Amazing food, great atmosphere complete with flaming fajitas of course, and super nice service! My husband and I had the queso for an appetizer which reminded us so much of the white queso dip you can get in the Midwest - but even better - and we shared the two person mixed fajitas with chicken and shrimp - again amazing!

Interestingly enough, I didn't realize I haven't written a review for this place. I have been multiple times and each time was as good as the previous visits, if not better. 

Our favorite thing to get here are the fajitas. The shrimp and steak combo hits the spot every time! Fajita platters come with a side of rice and beans as well as guacamole. Of course it wouldn't be called Juan's Flaming fajitas without the fire show that accompanies it. It's worth getting it every time just for that lol. Portions are huge and very shareable. 

Also worth noting is their happy hour everyday from 3-7. Plenty of food and drink options and a perfect place to just relax and unwind after a crazy week or day at work. It's a suitable place to have a get together with friends or to celebrate something. Reservations for large parties recommended obviously, they don't really like splitting checks but they'll work with you if you do it in groups. All in all a solid 4 and a place I see myself returning to over and over again.

I love fajitas. When I hear that sizzling sound coming toward my table, I am a happy camper.
Unfortunately, in every Mexican restaurant in which I've eaten, the fajitas cost twice as much as the combo plates, so I've been eating combos because I get 3 selections, and they fill me up.
What separates this place from the other Mexican restaurants are the fajitas.
They are reasonably priced, AND the portions are bigger than most other places, so for me, it's the best of both worlds.
I can't fault them for being on the other side of town, so I'll just eat my combos closer to home, and when I'm in the mood for fajitas, I'll drive the extra 15 or 20 minutes and go here. It's worth it!
Really, really good!

Excellent service and food. Came from out of town for the races. Hate eating on the strip. Always looking for local restaurants. Fajitas were great as well as the salsa and bean dip. Margaritas also were good. We will be back again.

I rate this place 4.5 Stars.
  
A fun, lively atmosphere, solid food, and good service make this one of the better Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas. 
The food is delicious, seasoned and well prepared. 

I ordered the staple dish which is the fajitas, the flames was cool but I was more interested in how it tastes. 
The pork fajitas tasted excellent!! 
Succulent with a kick because I added jalapenos to it. 
The portion is enough for two people to eat and for $17 that's a bargain.
My friend got the chicharrones, I sampled a small amount and it was amazingly flavorful.

This place also great for happy hour, $5 margaritas and $3.50 for domestic beers. 

The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to make the experience fun.

I'll definitely be coming back here.

We live close by so we are here for dinner at least every month. We love it and our kids love it. The food is always great and the staff is always so friendly. Tonight we got takeout and it was excellent! They gave us a huge bag of chips along with salsas, bean dip and soup. Everything was so good just as if we were sitting in the restaurant. Highly recommend this place.

This is by far my number one Mexican restaurant in Vegas. It's fresh and authentic. Just by tasting the salsas, you know it's going to be great. I come here solely for the bartenders. Venny and Alex. Being in the bar industry, I have high expectations and they more than fulfill and satisfy every need of mine and their other patrons. I am very observant and always come by myself so I can't help but watch how attentive others are with their guests. They are AMAZING! Always on top of it. If they're not charming their guests, they are cleaning or preparing wonderful drinks. Two of my favorite bartenders in Vegas, hands down!

This place is always a favorite & I haven't had anything here that I don't like...always fast to get our food and always delicious and the staff there are the friendliest around...the steak fajitas are my absolute favorite!! can't wait to go back!!

Tonight was our second visit to JFF. Both times it was extremely busy but the wait wasn't longer than 10 minutes to get a seat. My husband and I aren't huge fans of fajitas so we haven't ordered them...yet. The fajitas roll out of the kitchen every few minutes and smell and look delicious. I ordered the street tacos last time and tonight ordered the sampler appetizer platter, happy hour price was $8.95 and it was giant and delish! We ordered the queso fundido both times and it's simple, cheesy and so tasty. We asked for tortillas with it instead of using the chips and the tortillas are so fresh, I could eat them all day long! The only thing better than the food is the service. I had to give my compliments to the manager and I also wrote it on the check because as busy as it was, the service was excellent both visits. This place is about a 15-20 minute drive from our house but worth the drive!

Excellent food and service!  I got the Chile Verde and it was great! Another thing that I love about this place is that they serve abundant chips with 3 different types of salsa.  I was introduced to this restaurant by my sister.  My wife and I will probably eat here every time that we come to Las Vegas. Five stars for this exceptional restaurant.

Amazing food! Great speedy service! Always had drink refilled. EVEN REFILLED BEAN DIP! Chips were crispy and warm. Soup had too many veggies , could use some more noodles . Great atmosphere: was greeted and waited upon as soon as I got out of car. Horchata could use more sweetness, but still good. Chips came with free fajitas! Owner greeted us as well! My girlfriend like their salsa. HAd a burrito with green sauce ! OMG too good!


My girl had a mojo de ajo which was even better ! Fresh guacamole , delicious fried ice cream with plenty of whipped cream ! Even the rice and beans were delicious! Everything was hot and fresh. People were nice , staff was even nicer. Got attended by Arturo. Ask for him! He is a great server. Calm and well mannered , and always brings you refills. Never leaves you dry , which is my favorite part about him. Love this place , love the food. Taste authentic , and that's what I was looking for. 


Will definitely be back !

My second visit here was fabulous! Thank you to Amanda our serve for being so attentive! We did the large order of table guacamole tonight inside of the table side and it was delicious! I still need to bring my family here! 

It's just a fun atmosphere with happy employees! The vibes are radiating! The fajitas are out of this world & the table side fire sizzle is always fun and a bit warm. I haven't tried anything else besides them. They have a for 2 option which is a perfect & generous portion for two. Even the house brewed tea ice was yummy. They had a table next to us with a large party celebrating a birthday. This is definitely a great place to bring a big party too. The prices are very fair and they have a nice happy hour menu too. Oh and the flan not that my diet self had any is finger licking good :( lol
Great food, great servers. We love the grilled onions and peppers the give for free, as well as the bean dip, chips and salsa. Flaming shrimp fajitas are great.

I've visited JFFC plenty of times in the last few years and I've even had them cater two separate parties. The food is amazing and authentic. Love Juan's Flaming Fajitas and the staff is warm and welcoming. Highly recommend JFFC for dining in or taking out or catering. You won't be disappointed!
The staff is super friendly and the food is nothing short of AWESOME !!! I will definitely be back ... Thanks !!

My FAVORITE Mexican food in Vegas!! From the service to the food I'd give 5 stars all around!!! Everyone is always friendly and welcoming!!! 

I can't ever get enough chips and salsa and margaritas!! My mouth is watering just thinking of it! 

It's Soo fun too see the FLAMING fajitas being served to tables and the smell is to die for!!!! It can get pretty busy though so I'd recommend making a reservation if you're looking to go in the evening time, or try to catch a seat at the bar! It's a great family place but also perfect for a date night!!

My husband loves the chicken enchiladas with red sauce but my favorite is the Mulitas!!!! Although I prefer the lunch portion because it's a HUGE serving and I can rarely even finish one!! No worries, you can always take the leftovers to enjoy later at home!!!

Really no place compares in my opinion to Juans, it's just excellent all the way across the board!! Soo happy to finally have a great Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood!! Good job Juan!!! :)

If your patio is closed on a Saturday evening...than....you really should not advertise on your website...you have a pet friendly patio. period. 

Sun was down....people waiting outside for a table...they had enough business....redic.

Gotta say that this was one of the best Mexican restaurants period..if you don't believe me then just try it yourself

And all for under $40.
Definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in the valley. I haven't had a dish here that I did not like.

Reading the yelp reviews prior to my visit, I was expecting a lot more. While the hostesses were friendly, the waiter I had was not. He was short, despite me being very polite, and that frustrates me when I am patronizing a business. 

I ordered the vegetarian fajitas, but was dismayed when I was offered a side of rice. As a precaution, I asked if the rice had any meat in it or if it was cooked in a meat based broth. Indeed, it is cooked in chicken stock. Okay, why, then, was I offered it if I ordered off the vegetarian section of the menu? 15 minutes later, I was brought a complimentary appetizer soup. Again asking the same question, I was told that this, too, had chicken stock in it. Hmm.

My suggestion to Juan: please tell your staff to not offer meat-based items to those guests who order off of the vegetarian section of the menu. Or, offer them, but indicate right then that they are made with meat-based ingredients. 

When my entree came out, the pan was barren and a couple veggies that were listed on the menu were not served. And the taste was nothing to get excited over. There are two other Mexican spots in town that have delicious veggie fajitas, and these ones just left me yearning for more.

I met up with some girlfriends for dinner on a Friday at 430. This is my first time here so I'm really excited and I could smell the fajitas in the park lot. The parking lot is way too small for this restaurant AND an In N Out (just saying). 

Once I walked in the I was greeted by the hostess and found my friends immediately. We ordered margaritas off the happy hour menu. They make a mean margarita! Then we had the fundito cheese to start along with warm tortilla chips and 2 types of homemade fresh salsa. The fundito cheese is basically a flavorful cheese melted on a hot ass grilled plate. It was DELICIOUS!

Once we placed our entrees, we were brought out a small cup of hot fiedo soup. It was the best fiedo soup I've ever had. 

We HAD to order fajitas at a Flamming fajita's restaurant! So I see the fajitas coming out way. Once they came to the table the waiter ignites the fajitas on FIRE! It smelled so good. My friend ordered the steak fajitas. The meat was so tender and had such an amazing seasoning on it. I recommend the steak or beef opinion. Then to finish off the night we ordered the fried ice cream.

Ambience: Fun but a little loud and smoky a bit during to the fajitas on fire. 

Quality: 10 out of 10. Great flavor and so tender!

Price: Very well priced. Between the 3 of us each of us paid $23 bucks

Service: The best. Very attentive without being too attentive. 

Once we left the waiting area was full and people were actually waiting outside! So their busiest time is between 5-6pm. 

Final thoughts: I have to bring everyone I know here it's THAT good!

We tried this on a Yelp!! Recommendation, and we were not disappointed. We were greeted and seated immediately hostess was very friendly. We chose to sit in the cantina area, and as soon as we sat down Vinnie our waiter was table side with drink order chips and bean dip and salsa. Also grilled jalapeño and onion taster. They have 7 day a week half of drinks and appetizer happy hour. I ordered a beer Josie a Mango margarita. Both arrived promptly. Josie had a chicken taco and I ordered a Beef chimichanga. Chimichanga for me was really tasty. The guacamole was quite good. It was a smaller portion than most Mexican restaurants but that is good I did not leave overly full or waste leftover food. The staff was ON IT. Never had empty water. Bonus!! I recommend this place can't  wait to try other dishes. I also liked the fact that many regulars came in and were greeted by name and staff came through to say hi to the regulars. Have to say, best experience I have had eating in quite awhile.

Try to make reservations because this place gets pack during prime hours 
Came here for my birthday and they were very accommodating for large parties.
This place smelled so good the moment you entered the doors.

We all tried their flaming fajita which is what they were known for. As the dishes come out they come sizzling and the server lights up the fajitas and it was flaming!

Ordered the steak and shrimp fajita and the flavors were on point! The plate didn't really burn the meat or shrimp and it was not over cooked. The servers were very friendly and even brought out a special hot sauce for us which just added a habanero mouth water king kick to our fajitas !

I will definitely want to come back and try their happy hour menu! This is also a great place to bring guests who are coming in town to visit.

I've been looking for a good place for some Mexican food and this place is it! The service is exceptional! The food is delicious and the salsa, beans and chips they give you is absolute awesomeness! Best part is, the servers are very attentive and never let you feel that anything is lacking. Overall, love this place. Good food, good service and great prices. What more can you ask for?

Although we don't normally think of "mexican" food when we decide to go out to watch football, we decided to give our favorite mexican restaurant, Juan's, a try since we know they have a lot of TV's and heard they had some food & drink specials...good call for sure! They have carne asada fries now (A-mazing), and although not on the menu, we asked if they could make a "California"-style carne asada burrito for my daughter and not only did they cheerfully oblige, when it came out it was HUGE and so delicious! What a great Sunday combo-great drinks, lots of TV's & fantastic food!!!
We ordered the fajita's, which were excellent. The service was continually excellent throughout our visit. The service alone warrants 5 stars. My drink was never empty!

Love love this place.  The food and service was top notch. They gave 15% discount for veterans on Monday's. There happy hour was reasonable and the portions are huge. 
The fajitas was over the top.  Thank you Mario for the excellent service. We will be back for sure

The food was really great! Today. 
Everything was fresh and delicious. 
They have really good prices on lunch specials if you come in before 3 pm and the portions are good. Good place to bring the family. The salsa is extremely good. And good service.

If you needa fajita, your search should end here. From service to environment to flaming, delicious fajitas, Juan's has all of the bases covered for a gorge-worthy Mexican meal.

The restaurant is huge and provides the perfect setting for a variety of purposes. There is a spacious dining room, perfect for families and date-nights. There is even a stage, and when we visited, they had a live mariachi. There is a bar area with one gigantic and several smaller screens, perfect for all your sports viewing. And, then they have a spacious patio, perfect for basking in the perfect Vegas sun. They also have a daily happy hour from 3-6pm that can be enjoyed anywhere in the restaurant. It features food items and $1 off adult beverages. 

From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted with smiles and genuine service. Everyone who visited our table was clearly concerned with ensuring we had an enjoyable experience.

And we did! First, I thought the salsa was delicious, and I appreciated it was actually spicy versus the mild you typically receive. In addition to salsa, you receive bean dip and grilled onions and jalapeños. Meals also come with fideo soup. 

We had to go with the flaming fajitas for two, and we decided to sample beef, chicken and pork. They are happy to split up the meat. We were told by two separate employees that the meats are marinated for 48-hours, and I believe them. All of the meats were tender, juicy and flavorful. For the first time I can remember, my husband and I actually finished fajitas for 2! 

Considering every detail of the experience, it is definitely worthy of 5-stars. I am sure we'll be adding it to our regular rotation!
Holy crap!!! Get their queso fundido with carne asada and mushrooms!! It's so freaking good!!
This is a great place!  Omar is usually our waiter and he's the BEST!!  Today we sat in the bar area (no kids) and received the same great service.  Food is excellent.

Hands down the best chicken fajitas ive had in Vegas and Ive had a lot of different restaurant's fajitas. Service is always great, prices are good, and I am really looking forward to the breakfast menu that they are launching soon.

This place is always a win. There is always a wait though so be prepared. The wait never takes as long as they say it will tho. 

They hand you chips, salsas and amazinggggg bean dip right when you sit down. Seriously get a few extra things of bean dip. The soup they bring out is excellent as well. 

I always order the grilled fish tacos. The fish is so tender and moist. And the homemade tortillas are the bomb.com. 

Such a great restaurant. Always one of my go-to's when people are visiting from out of town. And the service is fast and attentive

PS grab some of the green/white candy on your way out. So good!!

Absolutely love this place. New favorite restaurant for authentic Mexican food. It also comes with really delicious sopa. The service was amazing, too. The facility was clean and quaint; I can definitely see how maddening and crazy this place could get during a meal rush. You definitely have to try this place; you'll love it! I promise.

Craving Mexican tonight and with my 3 best girls and we did the old where should we go game... after rattling off the usual spots, we opened trusty yelp and the Flaming Fajita popped up as a hit and so we decided to give it a go as two friends had given rave reviews.

Location was in a strip mall and parking was a little tight but once we got into the restaurant it felt nice and cozy ... it  was split between a full bar section and full dinning with TVs and Mexican decor.
 Comfortable seating and when some restaurants are uncomfortable when packed, it was actually nice.

Menu was an excellent selection and a great variety of many options from tacos, enchiladas, burritos and chimichangas to some very ethnic meals.

We were greeted by the best waiter we have had in a long time, Christian was on the ball, had excellent recommendations and was so very friendly, he made us feel like fast friends and regulars.  

We ordered our typical order for a new place to make sure we like the menu, starting with a large Guacamole for the table that accompanied beans, salsa and tortilla chips, then for entrees, 
Chicken enchiladas suiza style, 
California burritos (one with steak the other with chicken), 
One taco al pastor 
and a kids meal with a cheese quesadilla and fries.
All meals came with Fideo soup and rice and beans
.
Ok, so now that I told you the order, let me tell you how amazing the food was.

Now, if you follow me or have read some of my reviews, you know that I am a wimp when it comes to spicy food and so I have to have my friends who love spice be my testers to make sure I can handle it.. sadly the salsa was a fire maker for me (see wimp) but I could handle the beans (ha ha ha) and the guacamole was delicious and fresh and the hint of lime was perfect.
Just make sure you don't eat too many of the chips (you will thank me later as the portions are huge) the fideo soup comes next,  and it was a very light, tomato and noodle broth that was a great pallet lightener from the guacamole and beans (and those that can handle the salsa )

Then the meals came out 
The Burritos were huge!!! We have enough left over for breakfast and lunch and the meat was so tender and juicy and full of fresh flavors.
The taco al pastor did not disappoint, we all tried each dish and couldn't say which was the best but I did love the chicken enchiladas with the corn tortillas and the creamy sauce, I could only eat half.

We did see many tables order the "Flaming Fajitas" which looked and smelled amazing, (another must try for our next stop).
We sadly did not have room for dessert but will be back and start with dessert then.

We were not disappointed at all with anything, the service was excellent from our waiter Christian (who we will ask for again!!) to the service help staff keeping our drinks topped and table cleared of empty plates..and the hostesses were on the ball to make sure we got a great table.

Will be eating here again!

If you're looking for real Mexican food, you need to come here! Very family oriented. Very clean. My family and I LOVE this restaurant. Most of the workers know us by now! LOL It's family owned and the owner always walks around to make sure everyone is doing okay. The food is amazing. The service is awesome! They're always super fast to bring out our food. I'm sad because we are moving in about a month - our house now is right next to this place and our new home is farther away. You better believe though we will be driving the extra miles though just to come and eat here. My favorite restaurant!
We love this place food is great drinks are good service outstanding priced very reasonable we will return.
This place is just ok. 3 times we ordered for pick up and all three times food was incorrect.  I been to better places

Just moved to town and have been back twice in the first week!  Fantastic fajitas, though the chips, salsa, beans, soup & grilled veggies are a meal in itself!  Service has been attentive and friendly both visits, and food arrived quickly. We'll be back!

If you're looking for good Mexican food in Las Vegas, you've found your place! We come here every couple of months when we have a hankering for Mexican food. I usually get the blackened shrimp tacos, which I would highly recommend. Last time I was there, I got hr vegetarian enchiladas, which were also quite tasty! I've had a mango margaritas, which is also pretty good.

This is one of my favorite places for Mexican food in Las Vegas. I love the bean dip and the queso fundido with chorizo is phenomenal. I always order the same thing which is a combo of a beef burrito and chicken taco. The burrito is flavorful and juicy. The chicken in the taco varies a little each time though and can either be juicy or quite dry, but when it is dry I just put salsa on it and it is fine. The staff is always super friendly and quick. 

I've seen at least two other restaurants fail in this location, but Juan's seems to know what they are doing because it is usually pretty packed.

I am giving it four stars rather than five because the drinks are very inconsistent. Sometimes the apocalypse drink tastes great and other times it has so much alcohol I can't even drink it.
Absolutely amazing place to dine. Excellent food service and atmosphere. Highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for excellent Mexican food and wonderful service. Family-friendly.

My friend and I decided to frequent Juan's flaming Fajitas & Cantina for a quick happy hour after work. I have heard a number of good things about this place so we decided to try it out. During our visit I had the chimichanga and an appetizer. A number of people around us ordered the Flaming fajitas which seem to be very popular at the restaurant. I guess it was very popular because it was enough to feed two people off of one entree. When I got my chimichanga the carne asada was overcooked therefore making it dry and less flavorful. I'm not saying that I wouldn't return to this place but, I feel that if I do I should do as everyone else and order the Flaming fajitas. However, on the upside their Margaritas are amazing and they come in a multitude of flavors for you to try. It's Cinco de Mayo coming up I highly suggest you get there early to partake in all of the festivities and nice food that they have to offer.

Went here on a Sunday night for a family dinner. It's great for any party size, big or small. The vibe is lively and you might even catch a guitarist making rounds singing and playing the guitar! Once you get seated you are greeted with chips, bean dip, salsa, and sauteed veggies. Be sure to save some room for the actual food you are ordering! Their serving sizes can be very big so be warned! 

They can get busy at times so prepared for a wait time.

I cannot tell you how much I love this place. We have been here 3 times in the last week alone.  I'm not alone in feeling this way because it is packed when we go. Love the two different salsas they serve (one red and mild and the other is greenish and has some heat) with the chips and also the bean dip. My kids eat it with a spoon, it's that good.  My husband and I share the Guadalajara special. It's carne asada covered in melted cheese with shrimp and scallops on top, sitting in a spicy white sauce. It is magical!  We've also split the carne asada a la tampiqueña and that is in a red sauce (not spicy at all) with shrimp on top and an enchilada on the side. Also, amazing.  The kids split the carne asada on the kids menu and it's a good amount of meat for a child entree.  I'm scared to give such a good review because it's just going to get busier (parking is a drag), but they deserve it!
Authentic Mexican food... and this is from someone that was raised on it!! Happy hour Bomb.com!!

When I want to see something get lit on fire, that I can put in my mouth, I come here. The fajitas are so worth the place being named after.  
Great food, on point service, and all around fun spot to hang out at. If you don't believe me, come try finding a spot at the bar. People love it so much they don't mind the little wait. 

Speaking of the bar and the post of homeboy jumping on top of it like he's at a restaurant's pay place.
Juan's has very responsible bartenders and as soon as he started getting loud, they let him know, cut him off,  and gave him a chance to stick around. The man didn't know his limits or how to act. For that, he was quickly removed.
Easily my favorite Mexican food in town! Even when they're busy, the wait is never too long. My only complaint is that I wish it was closer to me.

service was awesome and the server was funny. fodo was good, not really anything to write home about but it was good. I probably would have given 5 stars if the salsa was actually spicy. we will definitely go again and try more than just fajitas

I was skeptical to try out this place because of the weird name. It's kind of like judging a book by its cover - I'm really good at that. So as we're driving into the parking lot of the Flaming Fajitas I quickly pulled out the Yelp app and checked some of the reviews. Norm K. recommended the flaming fajita so I decided then and there that that's what I'm getting. 

Immediately upon sitting down, a waitstaff came over to our table and laid down a plate of grilled onions and jalapenos, chips and salsa. I absolutely loved the grilled jalapenos and the bean dip that came with the chips - so much that I asked for extra servings of jalapenos! 

The flaming fajita serves two people. We shared that and had plenty of leftovers. Normally I find that beef served at Mexican restaurants are always on the tough side. But at Juan's Flaming Fajitas, the beef was very tender and flavorful. 

Over all it was a great experience! I will sure to come back to try out the flan, more grilled jalapenos and more flaming fajitas!

OMG, if authentic Mexican food is what you want, Juan's Flaming Fajitas is the restaurant to go to. The food is soooo delicious, they never disappoint. The cantina is a great place to watch any sporting event also.

Honestly, this place is probably one of the few good non chain mexican restaurants in Vegas. The service was great and the food was sooo good! The chips with salsa and bean dip was spiced well. My mom ordered the chicken fajitas which were amazing and had flavor. I got the grilled fish tacos and chicken tamale with green sauce and it was very flavorful even the rices and beans were. The prices are a little cheaper compared to Lindo Michocan and way better quality. Even the margaritas are good. I got a mango margarita. I will be returning to this place more often. Oh and every entree you order you get a delicious fideo soup which is my favorite. 

TIP: Ask for side of roasted jalapeños (free)

Yummy excellent service.. Ordered the carne asada medium rare. It was perfect. And delicious. Their customer service was awesome. They were so friendly and made sure all was good. I definitely recommend this place.

My husband and I are very picky when it comes to Mexican food and we decided to try out this place based on the reviews on Yelp as we just moved to Las Vegas. The service here is great and the food is fantastic! We eat here pretty much once a week. The fajita combo is awesome and I love the grilled onions. The salsa is very fresh and has a nice heat to it. Our toddler loves to eat here too and will eat the soup they bring out until the bowl is dry....which says a lot since he is a very picky eater!! You won't be disappointed.

After 2 years in Vegas I've finally found my go-to Mexican place! You get great value for food here.  Complementary chips come with 2 salsas, bean dip, and roasted onion and peppers.  Most of the entrees come with a cup of fideo soup.  If you're looking for a bit of a show get the fajitas, which they flame tableside.  
Be sure to stop in for happy hour sometime for great margaritas and good deal on beer.  Food offerings on HH special are prefect especially for cheese lovers - go with the Juan's sampler or Juan's nachos to share for the table, otherwise it'll end up being your dinner.
I've also come in for brunch and their breakfast burrito offerings are excellent!  Brunch meals even come with a beverage

We were in the looks for fantastic Mexican food and hit a homer in with amazing place!!  All little things done with love, care and home style  flare!  Outstanding server and busboy!  They were like mother hawks taking care of their young!  Never missing a beat!  The serving are delicious large portions that are hard to stop eating!  Come hungry & ready to chow!!

Why all the rave reviews. Probably because of the service. The bartender Mimi is a rockstar. Everyone is very gracious.

The complimentary chips, salsa, beans, peppers and onions are great.

I had the gringo enchiladas. They were tasty because of the great cheese sauce. If it wasn't for the sauce they'd just be ground beef enchiladas.

Check it out if you're in the mood for Mexican!

No lie, these are probably the best fajitas I've had outside of Cali. It might even be better than Cali. Everything is so fresh! I love how they serve roasted onions and jalapenos with the salsa and bean dip. Hubby had chile colorado and it was delish. I had the scallops and shrimp dish ( can't remember its name) and it was amazing.  But something about those flaming fajitas keeps me coming back.  And the house margaritas are awesome!!  Service is always on point! We're going back tonight and my mouth is already watering!

All the 5-star reviews got us intrigued by this place so, we gave it a shot. The parking lot was full but there were lots of empty tables when we went.

We were given a bowl of chips, salsa and refried beans. They have the usual fare: ceviche, tacos, enchiladas, chimichangas, etcetera. Since they call themselves Flaming Fajitas, we got fajitas (and a few drinks). The service was friendly but not that efficient. 

Shrimp and Beef Fajitas:
You can get portions for 1 person or 2 people. Honestly, the portion for 2 was big enough for 3. You can get flour/ corn tortilla. You also get rice, guacamole, and salsa. I didn't really taste what was 5-star worthy about the food. To me, it was just ordinary and nothing different from all the fajitas I've had from other places. Ok, so they bring a cart by your table and you can watch your food go up in flames (well, not really) but that's about it. 3/5

Horchata:
When I'm at a Mexican restaurant, I have to have horchata. Their version was a cross between Mexican horchata (distinct cinnamon taste and sweet) and Spanish horchata (bland). 2.5/5

Mayan Apocalypse:
Amaretto, vodka, Citrus Cruzan, Midori, triple sec, sweet and sour, Southern Comfort and cranberry juice. Tasty but strong. This was the best thing I ordered. 4/5

My mom has had a huge hole in her heart since her beloved Viva Mercados shut down. In an act of desperation and pure genius, she phoned me and asked if I knew of a great Mexican restaurant in the area. It just so happened that I had bookmarked Juan's a few days earlier and deciding to to put my faith in my fellow Yelpers, we headed over... And once again, my Yelp compadres, you did NOT disappoint.

As soon as my mother and I opened the door we were greeted. This is a large space, with a separate bar and patio area (which pleases me because I don't have to sit near children - no offense to you parents out there). We were seated at a table and were greeted within 15 seconds. Needless to say, the serve was on point all night. My iced tea was never more than half full the entire night.

Chips and salsa and bean dip came out immediately, quickly followed by grilled peppers and onions.Then we got a cup of the sopa de fidello.  Being the avocado lover I am, I had to gets my guacamole on; Juan's make theirs table side with fresh cilantro, tomatoes, jalapenos, and onions. You really can't mess up guac, it was a total win. Fresh to death. 

My mother and I wanted to see what these Flamingo Fajitas were all about. We ordered the fajitas for 2 (priced around $23), steak and chicken combo. It came with a side of rice and beans, as well as more guac (there is no such thing as too much guac), pico de gallo, and sour cream. The fajitas came out, our server set the tray done and lite that bad boy on FIY-AH! It was awesome. The fajitas were then placed on the table and we devoured them. The meat was perfectly season as were the onions and peppers. DELICIOSO!!! Some of the best fajitas I've ever had. This entree actually served three and we had left overs.

We didn't have room for dessert so we skipped that. All in all, the hole in my mom's heart has been filled. Juan's delivered. Great food, great service. I am a fan. I cannot wait to go back and try their other entrees. Ole!

Came here with my girlfriend and we loved it. Price, portion, food, and service were all great so it deserves a five star in my eyes. Our server was really attentive and nice and so was the wait staff assisting him. 

Some tips: Unless you're dangerously hungry, an entree should be enough for one person. We got an appetizer, entree and drink, and boy, were we filled. We ended up taking a lot of to-go.

The food itself is awesome though. What we had:

House Margaritas ($3.50 during happy hour from 3pm-7pm. Felt like a generous portion of tequila. I like.)
Juan's Sampler (Tasted great, but wow did it fill us up.)
Combo Beef & Shrimp Fajita for Two. (Great flavor and very tender. Comes with a good portion of sounds. They even light it on fire before they serve it, awesome.)

There are also the complimentary chips and dip. Honestly, one of the best dining experiences I've had. Great place. Our server even mentioned they were planning on increasing the store hours for later nights since they have a full bar and all.
Excellent Mexican food!  The fajitas are great, as well as the burritos.  The margaritas are generous and fabulous.  I highly recommend it!

We ate here again the other day with my brother and mother.  This time, I got the Chimichanga with shredded beef and sopapillas for dessert.  I really liked the flavor of the beef in the entrée. It was not over powering and had just the right amount of spice to it.  Again, we all got soup with our meals, free beans, salsa, and chips.  They also brought tortillas when we asked.  I got the dessert to go and ate it at home. You can get an order of 3 or 6.  We got the six and had some left over the next day.   It came ready to go with butter, honey and cinnamon sugar.  Again, Juan, the owner, was very visible and came to all of the tables to check on the meal.  Very nice!
First time here it was great the service was great the food very good. We live in Henderson but will be sure to be back. Had fajitas, burrito, guacamole tacos, shrimp tacos. Way to much food
Great service, great food, great place! Highly recommend it. First time here and didn't disappoint. We ordered the shrimp fajitas and got large delicious shrimp with all the fixings.

Outdoor patio, separate nice cantina with televisions to watch your favorite game or event, five gaming machines to try your luck, and a separate well appointed restaurant.   Living in south Texas for the last twenty five years this is the closest I have found resembling the delicious flavor or TexMex.   Signature flaming fajitas are a treat to the eyes and the taste buds.    Great weekend brunch offerings.   Salsa chips and bean dip welcome every customer!
Service here is excellent. The chicken and pork combo fajitas for two were delicious and enough to feed three.

Staying on the Strip in Vegas and Yelp'd this place on our way back from a day trip. This place IS as good as they say! Don't be put off by the strip mall location. It's very nice inside. VERY friendly and attentive wait staff. I informed our waiter that my wife can't do cilantro (I happen to like it but it bugs me when chefs toss it on everything but oatmeal (Bobby Flay do you hear me? So he made sure that there was no cilantro (except some on the side for me). He even had the chef slice up some nice avocado instead of giving us guacamole which had cilantro. Super margaritas. Chip, salsa you expect, but the EXCELLENT warm bean dip was a delicious surprise if I lived near here I would come in for margaritas and chips and the bean dip. We had fajitas for two, chicken and pork. SO MUCH FOOD! And skillfully prepared. Very fresh and al dente veg. Cup of soup included was delish as well. Can't tell you about dessert, we never made it through HALF of our fajitas!!
This place is alright, not a big deal, I had better Mexican food...I wouldn't be excited to go back and eat there again..
We went here with a group of 11. The service was wonderful and the food was amazing! Highly recommend!

I love all the differnt sides that come with the complimentary chips, several salsas, beans, and grilled onions & jalapeños, plus the yummy tomato noodle soup all before your entree arrives, and the fajitas are amazing and so fun when they set them on fire table side. The have good selection of beer and other drinks and lots of tvs for sports fans. All and all the atmosphere os awesome plus amazing food, this place is an A+

This was our first visit to Juan's but we felt at home because we used to deal with all the same people at a previous restaurant. So glad that we found you! The food is wonderful and the service is excellent!
You get chips, salsa, beans and jalapeños and onions to start. They make fresh tortillas on site. Great food and service won't disappoint. You still have life long patrons that will definitely be back!

This place is delicious. My favorite part is the happy hour. The service is ok, but not very attentive. The worst part is the churros. They aren't sweet and very doughy. I'll be back but won't have the churros again

Excellent service from start to finish. Seated quickly and our hostess checked on us frequently. I ordered the Steak fajitas which was enough for 2 people at least and my date ordered the Tex Mex Enchiladas with Verde sauce and he thought his food was great too. I cant wait to go back for more fajitas! Next time, I would like to try their dessert seeing how their other food was delicious. Thank you!

We usually go to Lindo Michoacán when we want Mexican at a sit down restaurant, but I felt like we were just there and talked my husband into trying Juan's.
Ok, we're hooked! Service was great.
We got the Fajitas for 2 with Steak and Chicken, add cheese...so good, lots of flavor. Loved the fideo soup and chips with the onions and peppers, the salsa and bean dip were good although not my favorite.
My only other gripe is smelling of fajita when we left, I smelled like I had worked the grill, my clothes were saturated with the smell and my skin felt greasy. I had noticed the smell and cloud of smoke in the restaurant when we sat down. I'll just be sure not to have anything special planned after we eat here.
Prices were on par with other Mexican restaurants and you get more than enough to eat.
We will definitely be back and we'll be packing the Febreeze!
They don't have enough staff to serve anyone anymore. Service has gone way downhill. Not like it used to be.

I tried Mexican in USA for the first time. I am not sure what the dish speciality was. The price is actually high as a visitor from oversea. I do not see anything special about this place? Maybe I missed something?

If you haven't tried this place, I highly recommend you do! WOW!!! Staff members are courteous and quick, but the food is what keeps me and my family going back! I typically order the gringo enchiladas and my husband likes the flaming fajitas. We've eaten here several times and only once was our order wrong. The staff was quick to fix it and made it right immediately. Our glasses are never empty and always leave with our bellies full.
The best fajitas in town, my husband and I love this place also the Margaritas are ridiculous good...

While this place is good, it's doesn't bring the Bonito Michoacán wow factor.  There's nothing wrong with the place, it just failed to live up to the overload of editorial hype in every locals magazine.  We stopped in on a Friday night around 8 about 2 months after they opened, and there was a 40 minute wait.  It took 20 minutes to get our beer order.   The presentation and delivery of our carnitas fajitas for 2 was fantastic; they flambe them.  And whoooosh!  A giant ball of flames erupts over the serving dish.

Delicious, great atmosphere, friendly staff, decent prices and entertaining food service...it must be Juan's!! This place is amazing!! So hard to find decent Mexican food here in the valley and I found the hole in the wall that has it all!! Must have...flaming fajitas, hmmm wonder what gave it away!? For a casual, uplifting meal any day of the week, this is the place!! :)
One of the better Mexican restaurants in LV. Finally a place that doesn't put veggies in the rice! This is our new go to when we are in the mood for good authentic Mexican.
Love this place! All my buddies from vivas work there! The service is amazing and the food is delicious cooked just right and the marinade is sooo good! Two thumbs up!!! Always a great experience:)

I was VERY uninspired about coming here due to the very cheesy name they chose for the place but I was made wrong once I ate here.

  Pulling up to the location sucks and the parking lot is a nightmare due to In N Out burger sharing the same parking lot with them so make sure you plan ahead. Inside the waiting area isn't that larger so patrons are forced to wait outside the restaurant with no added seating while you wait for your seat.

  Food is rather tasty and for what it is you'll be happy. The guacamole was super fresh, cold and seasoned well; as were the salsas they place on the table. Fajitas are really good and they're highly recommended.

 Service was decent but could use some more training on table maintenance to ensure you have a full beverage, clean plates and utensils.

All in all good place to grab some grub

We were invited to a birthday dinner and had no idea this place existed! It's a good little find whose claim to fame is their fajitas which was good. Not being huge fans of peppers and onions, you can't really make sense of our choice. The drinks were okay, not the best but good for the prices offered. The service was not the best; our server wasn't very friendly and didn't have a stellar personality to match his profession. 

We could take or leave coming back.
It is nice to have a GOOD Mexican restaurant in this area.  Every meal I have had has been tasty and very fresh.

Ate at Juan's today for lunch and everything was ok, not great, not bad, but ok. The service was definitely lacking compared to what we're used to getting there after many, many times eating there. The fajitas were burnt on the bottom and that took away from our experience as well.

We haven't abandoned Juan's and hope that when we return everything is back up to par next time.

Steak fajitas for two were terrific! Lots left over. Their complimentary chips and salsa spread is great too, includes refried been dip and grilled onion and jalapenos. Next time I'll probably try a top shelf margarita - their 12 oz house margarita is a great deal too though.

Amazing fajitas and food , however I would recommend booking a reservation as this place can get pretty busy. Also plan on coming on a fairly empty stomach as the portions are huge, but do make great leftovers as well. This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas.

We went to Juan's on Mother's day. SUPER BUSY....we decided to visit the bar while we waited to be seated. While there we decided just to eat at the bar! The service was FANTASTIC...drinks were delicious! We ordered Queso fundido and OMG....I am a huge fan of Queso fundido but a lot of places do not know how to truly make it...not here! Perfection!!!  The seasonings and gooeiness of the cheese was perfect!  We ordered the flaming fajitas for 2..steak and chicken!!! They literally come out on fire...actual fire!!! The ratio of meat to grilled veggies was outstanding!!! Sooooo much meat. Like no where else!  The veggies were actually grilled...not just warm.  We left stuffed and happy. We took so much home because they give you sooooo much food. Our fajitas for 2 probably could have fed 3...and we can eat! ;) 
we will definitely be back!!!

Great Mexican food!  The service was spot-on, Gustavo our server and Jose our  busboy were so attentive and always made sure we had plenty of chips, salsa, water, etc.  The food was yummy and plentiful and the restaurant had a nice atmosphere.  My son had the flaming steak fajitas, which were delicious, and I had the enchilada suiza, which was also very tasty.  We really enjoyed our dining experience at Juan's!

We found this place on Yelp and give it a 4 1/2. The service is wonderful, our server Omar was great. Great Marggies and on happy hour until 7pm. Roxanne had her carnitas and I had steak tapaquiena which was excellent. Homemade tortillas, 3 different salsas and a jalapeño plate. I highly recommend this restaurant

This place is our go to spot for quality authentic Mexican food. Omar is awesome and the rest of the staff . The margarita are awesome and potent . All and all an awesome place to go if you are hungry and /or thirsty

The customer service is exemplary! They give you complimentary freshly made chips and salsa. They even gave us a complimentary queso for waiting. The fideo soup was delicious and is also complimentary. Everything was fresh, including their handmade tortillas. Best tamale I've ever tasted! We also had the flaming steak and shrimp fajitas. Margaritas were great. Best overall Mexican food I've ever had in my life. This awesome experience is also attributed to their friendly staff. I definitely will be coming back on my next visit to Las Vegas.

You cannot beat this place you have to start with the queso dip because it is hands down the best queso ever. And make sure you get a michelada too because why not. Also the Mexican seafood platter is delicious. I mean DELICIOUS. The scallops literally melt in your mouth. Ask for the sauce on the side of you don't like spicy. The fried ice cream is an amazing dessert to finish it all off with
Wow!!!! This is real delicious Mexican food! Even their margaritas. Try their shrimp ceviche and the Mulitas. Enough food to bring home some. Super nice service.

THE FOOD LIVES UP TO THE REVIEWS!

They are a long way from my house, almost 40 miles round trip. Which is why we waited so long to try it. Nothing fancy or like interior authentic, just really good food and plenty of it.

The chips and salsas are tasty but the grilled onions and jalapenos take the whole amuse bouche (sorry don't know the Spanish term) to another level. The Sopa de Fideo reminds me of Texas in the 60s.

The shrimp ceviche was so fresh tasting and a huge portion. I will need to tweak the Margarita Martini a little to get it where it needs to be but they have Bohemia; absolutely the best Mexican beer by far and harder and harder to find Outwest.

My GF ordered the Chile Relleno. Now a short discourse on that dish; it should be made with a Poblano chile that has been roasted and peeled NOT deep fried and peeled. An Anaheim or long green is too mild and somewhat insipid tasting, deep frying leaves the pepper al dente. Even though picadillo is also traditional filling, I prefer cheese with a thick but fluffy batter. A light red sauce and some queso leaves you with a 9 out of 10 relleno!

I had the green chile burrito enchilada style (an homage to the Jungle Club/El Jardin) and a cheese enchilada (because I am from Texas). The enchilada sauce was darker than I usually like, a little bitter but really tasted homemade and the enchilada was great!

Rice and beans are well above average and the service was excellent. $60.00 for 3 beers, a $9.95 Margarita, a huge appetizer, and 2 combination plates. Living La Vida Loca!

Very good. A rare 5 star here in Vegas. Soon as your seated they stuff you full of chips and 4 different salsas and bean dip with grilled onions & jalapenos and a good soup. Then come the fajitas, this is the way fajitas are supposed to be. Service is attentive but not overbearing.  Margaritas are very good also. Prices are average.
Thee best Sea Bass tacos! Great Good, service & ambience! Hope the Henderson location opens soon so the wait so t be so long.

Took Mom here for Father's Day based upon a recommendation from a friend. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but once you walk in the vibe is quite nice. Definitely the look and feel of an authentic Mexican restaurant. Was a little disappointed that three TV's had the US Open on and not one had on FIFA Women's World Cup.

The place was semi-busy even though we got there when it first opened. They have Coke Zero too so that made the visit that much more awesome. Both Mom and I ordered the shredded chicken taco salad. They came back in less than ten minutes. Now that's fast! But, I have to admit I was skeptical with it coming back that fast. The server mentioned it was a simple process, that's why it was so fast. That didn't help matters for my skepticism.

It was actually pretty good. At first, the taste was not what I was used to. The chicken tasted a little funny, at first. But after a few bites, I couldn't stop eating! Overall it was pretty darn good. And they serve chips, refried beans, salsa, onions and jalepenos while you wait for your food. Good thing because I was starving!

I will definitely come back to try something else on the menu. Until then, four stars. Have to explore the menu. As far as customer service, it was extremely good. And they do not rush you to order or pay, for that matter. Great spot!

This restaurant was recommended to me a couple months ago. My daughter was craving Mexican food! So we checked it out!!! Omg!!! She ordered the kids bean burrito with rice and beans on the side. I ordered the steak fajitas. The food was authentic and the customer service great! They brought out chips and a few different salsas. Our drinks never were empty. I had a great experience! My daughter loved her food!

This place is definitely worth the trip and time (if you have to wait). We live in Henderson but made the drive over here based on recommendation and I can say I will be coming back frequently. 

I have lived in Vegas for over 15 years and have been to many of the Mexican restaurants in town. Although, there are very many different styles of Mexican food and a lot of great hole in the walls, this place beats the best of them. If your on the fence just go! 

Update: round 2 was just as good as the first. Love this place.

Literally my husband and I's favorite place to relax and enjoy fajitas! The happy hour is amazing, the staff friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. You will find yourself returning over and over again! We've brought friends local and visiting and it never disappoints.

The food is amazing and service as we'll be back I'll be back to this place when I'm in Vegas- Hernan the server is on point with everything and knows the menu very well. And yes the margaritas are to die for 5 stars all the way!

What can I say? Juan's is fantastic! Their fajitas are the best that I've ever had and the service is spot on. My only complaint is that they are super busy most of the time and waiting is sheer torture because you can smell the delicious food but can't have any yet. I would recommend to anyone that enjoys excellent Mexican food. This is also a great place to bring friends/family from out of town. Delicious!!!

So good! We visit Juan's at least once a month. We usually order combo plates because I like to try a little bit of everything, but right now I am so in love with their chile rellenos! Perfect melty cheese in a flavorful chile---I feel like I could eat 20! Lack of a star is only because a couple times shrimp fajitas were ordered by someone in my group, and there were very few shrimp both times. But otherwise a great place!

Loveeee this placeeee!!! Favorite Mexican restaurant ever!!! Service is amazingg!! Everyone is super nice and we had multiple people check on us during dinner. Ordered the steak and shrimp fajita combo for 2!!! Sooo yummy!! Shrimp ceviche is really good too!! We were super full and still had leftovers to take to go!!! OSWALDO was our server and he was THE BESTTTT!!!! Highly recommend and totally worth the wait!

By far the best Mexican food I've had in Las Vegas and I was born and raised here. This place blows Lindo Michoacán and Bonito Michoacán out of the water. We came here on Friday at 11am and it was PACKED! That says something right there. We waited five minutes to be seated and within a minute one of the servers placed two different salsas, refried beans, and fresh tortilla chips on our table and took our drink orders. Im one of those guys that goes through three glasses of soda during my meal and not only did my glass never go empty, they refilled it when it was only half way gone. The service is unbelievable! I ordered the lunch special and opted for the carne asada burrito and the chicken taco. I've never had carne asada this good. Tender, juicy, hot, with just the right amount of spice as to not overpower the meat. The chicken taco was also delicious and juicy. My wife chose the chile relleno and she loved it as well. She kept saying the word authentic (She was born in Mexico City) and that this tasted like a meal her mother and grandmother would make. The only downside to our visit was we got so full that we didn't save enough room for desert and we wish we should have because they looked amazing. I can't say anything more about this place other than you should stop reading and go in.

After a nice afternoon strolling around Spring Mountain Park, I was feeling margarita-ish. My husband actually utilized yelp and Flaming Fajitas popped first on the list. Since we were in the vicinity...Flaming Fajitas it was.

Upon entering the hostess was on her way to seat a couple before us, but made sure to let us know she will be right with us. Right with us she was because we were immediately seated into a large booth that accomodated these minions perfectly. Booths were high enough so when the 2 year old decides to abruptly stand on his seat he isn't looking over into anyone's way or making eye contact with the people.behind us.

As soon as we were seated, it seemed like we were instantly served freshly fried house chips, salsas, and their bean dip. They also brought a small.plate of grilled jalapenos and onions. In which to my surprise the jalapenos were sweet and not spicy. I'm not accustomed to the non-spicy jalapenos. I thought it was a nice touch as that isn't something we typically see when eating at a Mexican restaurant as a house offering. She then brought out a couple cup size bowls of their fideo soup. Which was awesome because we I ended up feeding it to my 10month old...twas a good tranquilizer. Lol.

They serve their happy hour menu daily from 3-7pm. We came in close to 4 and the place was just filling up. It's a nice restaurant that offers a 21 year and over section, and even patio seating. 

I quickly found the house margarita on their happy hour menu. You can choose between a 12 of a 16oz for $4.95. I think the 12oz is for a dollar less. I didn't pay attention because I was looking for the largest size I could get at a deal. 

Honestly, I wasn't expecting their house margarita at a happy hour menu price to be potent. I kinda don't expect that anywhere. I will say that their house margarita was delicious! I thoroughly enjoyed it and found it to taste better than alot of margaritas ive tried. I can't imagine what their top shelf margaritas taste like! I would have to return without the kids to find out. 2 16oz glasses of their margarita later, and I literally could of drank 4 more to probably catch a thorough buzz. It did, however, fulfill my taste buds for that margarita crave. Since I had the kids, coming from a quick hike, and bound for the mother-in-law's house...I suppose it was a good thing the drink wasn't doused in tequila or else I'd be heading to the in laws drunk. Not a good look. Lol.

Anyway, with the chips and salsas...they were super quick to refill our chips and dips. I love how they offer a nonspicy salsa for the kids. They certainly weren't afraid to serve those up. I even told my husband if they keep refilling our chips, bean dip, and salsa...I don't even think we'll order actual food. 

Which is kinda what happened. My kids just wanted taquitos, which to my excitement was on the happy hour menu. Lol. So I ordered one beef and one chicken in which each plate comes with 4 taquitos cut into halves. So in total...you have 8 pcs to pick at. I had to try them, and thought they were pretty good. There was certainly flavor in the meat.

The husband and I decided to share....we'll what else, a Flaming fajita. You have the option of ordering the Flaming fajita for one or two. Because I wasn't that hungry anymore after all the chips and salsas I had been chunking down...we opted for the one and decided to share that. 

Our orders did not take too long to come out. Perhaps I didn't notice because the chips and my margarita was distracting me from keeping time. When they bring out your fajitas....they literally flame it up infront of you. Our waiter, Hernan, fantastic by the way! He drizzled some kind of oil and lit that sucker on fire. And voila, Flaming fajita right before your eyes.

Overall, it's pretty standard. The service was wonderful and homely at the same time. Our waiter counted our 4 boys, plugged in the 5th child girl spill...the lady who kept cleaning our table off always took the time to stop and play with our 10month old the way an aunt would. When our 10month old would fuss she'd come by with crackers...so that was real thoughtful. 

We certainly had a great experience. The meats in the taquitos and the fajitas (husband chose pork, btw) were definitely moist and not bland at all. The service completely made it a 4 star experience. We would certainly come back.

Definitely recommend if you are in the vicinity. Kid and stroller friendly! Although, I'd say just leave the stroller in the car just so it isn't in the way, unless, they can seat you in booths that have lots of aisle space. Also, working buckles on their highchairs! Thank you for that!

P.S. Always check-in each visit as you get 15 percent off your bill. Shibby!

What a great find! First visit. The waiters were amazing! The chips are fresh and crisp and you get beans, and two types of salsa right away. We ordered and had food within 15 minutes. Their guacamole is absolutely delicious! Honey had a carne asada burrito and the steak was juicy and tender. Everything was phenomenal. Hernan, our waiter, was very attentive and checked on us every 7-10 minutes to make sure everything was perfect. This is definitely going to be added to our date night rotation! 4 stars for first visit, but will easily become 5 stars if the service is as awesome next time!

I come here frequently for their awesome fajitas and chips n salsa. Their food is so good!!! I always end up during at the bar area so if you are into sports they have giant TVs everywhere showing the games. I always see specials for margaritas and they have happy hour and game time specials too.

Don't let the outside appearance fool you like it did me! It's next to Inn N Out so I've driven by it a hundred times, but never had the desire to check it out, even tho my mom heard thru the grapevine how good this place is, my loss. I had the steak fajitas and they were soooo YUM-EEEE! Very tender and flavorful. Don't get me started on their chips, salsa and bean dip because I couldn't stop! To top it off, the prices are reasonable. There were 6 of us and the bill came to $80 something, and we left stuffed and with leftovers. Can't wait to go back!

The service here is 5 star. From the hostess to the bus boys to the expediters to our server. Super friendly and amazingly efficient. If only all restaurants were like this.

Food: Husband ordered the Carne Asada burrito. It was excellent and he cleaned his plate. I ordered a combo with a Chile relleno and a cheese enchilada.  It was good, but nothing special. So, knocked off a star since it was just ok. Didn't like that the cheese used in the relleno didn't melt. 

I'd definitely come back and try the fajitas. They looked amazing.

My friend had been raving about this place to me for weeks! Finally she took me to try it out today and I was not disappointed. She did warn me that it would be busy and there would be a wait, she wasn't kidding! It was packed. The hostess told us it would be a 45 min wait but honestly I don't think we waited more than 20 min. So it really wasn't that bad, despite how many people were waiting outside. 

The food and the service was so good I would have waited 2 hours! When they sat us at our table there was already chips and salsa with a small plate of grilled onions and peppers waiting for us! The waitress was super sweet and perfectly attentive. They have generous portions, we shared the steak fajitas for 1 and still had food left over. And their prices are really unbeatable. I can see why this place is always packed. I can't wait to go back!

This newer establishment was a pleasant surprise. We found the place based on other yelp reviews and the reviews were right!

The bartender went out of his way to be funny and engaging with the patrons (here's your shout out - forget about the menu print font)

Food was good as was the service. Get the table side guacamole. Live music and Jose Quervo ladies were an added treat. 

Try this place!  You won't be disappointed.  I'll be back my next trip to vegas.

This place is awesome!!  30 minutes till closing and there were still accepting Patrons to sit and have dinner!!  Most businesses would've stop taking incoming patrons before their closing time...high five!!  Then, I was WOWed at how fast they took our orders and brought the food to the table!  And, the portions are pretty good for the price too.  
You must check this place out guys!!!
This place is amazing!  Hibatchi for fajitas:) environment is kid friendly.  Wait a little long but staff is friendly and fast paced. Loved it! Yummm af-

Just finished a meal here for the first time with my boyfriend and it was awesome!!! He got chicken fajitas and I got a two entree plate. Everything was fresh and tasted great. My michelada could have been a little spicier but still great!!! All of the staff was also extremely friendly and welcoming! Will definitely be back!

This place is awesome! They start you off with delicious bean dip with chips. I always get so full off them I can barely eat my food. I don't care for fajitas in general but my husband loves them. I do enjoy their other foods.

This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! As a vegetarian I was so excited to see a whole section of veggie substitutes to all the standard dishes! I got the vegetarian Fajitas....so so good. And so many veggies. (Their refrained beans are vegetarian too!) My boyfriend got the steak and loved it as well. The guac was amazing...no need to go for the table side-their house guac is so worth it. 
And even with all the amazing food, the best part about this place is the service. Few times have I experienced such excellent service in a restaurant. Everyone was attentive, polite and nice. Even one of the bus boys brought us napkins when he saw the ones in our hands wadded up. I will be back and I will recommend this place to everyone! 
Update: after writing this review Juan sent me a message ensuring I knew which sides they give with all meals had a meat base and let me know which I could get vegetarian. Even more respect for this place!

First off, YES at the wrong time parking does suck due to the In-N-Out traffic, but nonetheless a small technicality. My wife got into it with someone because they stole our parking spot. This became her topic for dinner conversation.....WOW! Anyway after a couple presidente margaritas all I could do is enjoy some really great food. 
Love this place!
Great service and excellent food.  We tried the menudo, carnitas tacos and a pollo asado chimichanga.  $4 margarita Wed made it all the better!

Absolutely killed it. Great service, my glass was never empty, staff was very friendly. Portions of the meal was very filling . And the food was reasonably priced. This is a must go to for the family and friends.
The fajitas for 2 are a good buy at about $30 and plenty of food! Margaritas are good and service has always been good.

Delicious!!!! Great fajitas they set them on fire infront of use be careful if you have kids. Great food though. Sorry it was short, thanks for reading. 


-Laberta
Tried steak fajitas and very good , service was ok and what I always look for is ... spicy homemade style salsa ... nope didn't have

First time in my 22 years in Vegas, Best margarita I ever had, and on Wednesday it's only 4 bucks all day. The happy hour Fajita nachos is the greatest. Love it. I'll definitely be back... Frequently! Yummm

Thanks again to Juan's crew for the excellent service and food. Always can count on Flaming Fajitas for the best Mexican food in town. They always take care of me and my family. Thank you!! Jason and the girls

Loved this place went on Friday afternoon,  May 4.   Waiter etc fantastic service.  (Except hostess not friendly at all, sorry to disturb you).  Even met Juan himself.  Great service and loved the fajitas for 2 and happy hour margaritas- delish.  So glad to hear they are opening in Henderson end of September.  Will tell my friends and family
This place is Deeeelicious!!! You need to try the Fried Ice Cream it's Amazeballs!!! I will be coming here more often

This place is walking distance from my house and that, my friends, is a dangerous thing. Everything they have is so yummy!! Obviously you have to try the fajitas but to be honest, my go to is their shredded pork enchilada (soooooooo good). My favorite thing is that they have a dog friendly patio
Amazingggg food and the service was even better!! Thank you Flaco and Alex for your exceptional guest service and delicious drinks
This place was amazing my girlfriends and I had a taste for Mexican and we were so pleased with the food and service! great place to eat and not far from the strip with a car!

We have been here before but it was a while ago. Today i was craving Mexican food after church and I must say that place totally answered that craving. I had the New Mexico Enchiladas......soooo good. It was also a huge hit with the kids (that can be rare these days with new places). Needless to say we found a new "go-to" Mexican joint.

The food was pretty good. I had the steak fajita lunch special. Would come again. 

As mentioned in other reviews the bean dip and salsa is complimentary. Salsa was very good. Bean dip was good but bonito michocan has cheese on theirs so it's a lose here for me. 

I like them at for lunch the drink was only 1.50 instead of 2.50 which was a nice surprise. 
Overall service was good. Will be back to try the carne asada instead of the fajitas

Open for about three months, I didn't even know about Juan's until I saw Misti's review and then my gal pals suggested it for dinner because it was close to Sweet Addiction--hah!  See how I pick my friends?  Always thinking about the sugar!  Anyway, we had a solid meal here, going with the flaming fajitas, of course.  I got chicken and my pals shared a chicken and steak combo for two.  Both courses came out in a timely manner, with the flaming presentation for each, literally.  It's cool to see your food on fire.  I enjoyed my chicken fajitas and my pals rated the chicken better than the steak, too.  The chips and salsa were nothing special.  Service is attentive and friendly and the rest of the menu is quite extensive, but for my first visit I had to have the fajitas and not bad at all for $13.95.  I'll come back to try something different next time--nice to have an option for Mexican cuisine on this side of town, near Sweet Addiction AND Perfect Scoop ;).

There's nothing decent about this place in my opinion I had a awesome dining experience here. The chips and salsa was on point with their sauce was very good. As for starter we ordered Pozolé, it had so much flavor in it, and the meat was tender. We ordered a alcoholic drink which was the Micheladas for about $8-9 can't remember?

For our final entree we got the fajitas for two combination of shrimp and steak. They do live for their restaurant name for "flaming fajitas" as it put on a fire show infront of our table as they served it. It came with your choice of rice and beans with pico de gallo for two. The meats were not bad but not the best I ever had. Overall the service was great always checking on us, and the environment has a good warm welcoming feeling. 

Will come back again soon to try some of their enchiladas. They do offer 15% off for checking in which saved me a ton.

This place is taaaaaaaasty!! I've been here twice in the past week. Last Friday on a whim instead of going to In n Out, and today for a bday lunch. I loved the fact the owner immediately recognized us and welcomed us with open arms. Their lunch specials are a great deal and comes with a drink! Score!! If you leave room for dessert, you have to try their churros! Better than Disneyland's!! Can't wait to go back and try their happy hour. 7 days a week 3-7 HH is prime time on my book!!

Got there friday at 7 -had to wait about 30 - 40 min. We ordered beef &. Chicken fajita with margarita. Chip and soup were served with grilled vegetables. - nice :)  Our server was very friendly. Food was good - steak was not tender but seasoning was good- not the best fajita i ever have but good enough. Yes i will recommend this place and will come back. It deserve 5 star overall - service and food. Looking for reasonable - not over priced Mexican food? This is the place.

This place is great. Hey have a pretty extensive, authentic Mexican menu and it's very affordable. I had the shredded chicken burrito with vegetables. We also had Enchiladas Suizas, which I regretted not getting (they were killer). The staff was great to my kids and they were super attentive. The bar is separate from the main part of the restaurant so it's more quiet if you like that. Drinks were great too. Bathrooms were very clean which speaks highly of the staff and management. I think our waitress' name was Patty and she was very nice! Good little place to eat!!

Delicious food at good prices is enough to bring me back.  Add to this the good service we received and the outdoor seating and we were VERY happy.  The shrimp ceviche was great and enchiladas were stuffed with flavorful beef.
The chips and salsa included 2 salsas, bean dip , and grilled onions & jalapeños.  All were great and fresh.  
If you like mexican food you should go.  you will be pleased.

The service was great no complaints, the chips & salsa also come with bean dip for your complementary starters. We went during lunch on Friday (today) not crowded, we ordered burritos off the lunch menu ( I think the menu it was slightly priced to high ). The food was good, not great. We saw allot of the flaming fajitas come out, probably try on my next visit.

First of all, I would just like to point out the fact that this place has not been open very long. Maybe a year or two, max. I remember it being a barbecue place, with that said, it has more reviews than other Mexican restaurants I was looking to take my husband to for his birthday. So, to me it says something that a place that hasn't been established long has so many great reviews. 
Service- everyone there is very friendly and go above and beyond. Example- we brought our 17 month old and after seating him a lady brought out a drawing game for him to play with, this ended up being a lifesaver!!!!! I also saw her bring one out for an older boy, as well as the standard coloring paper and crayon. Everything came out very fast and was a pleasant experience. 
Food- the chips, bean dip and salsa were good! They literally bring it to you as your seated! The sopa de fideo is so tasty even my picky toddler gobbled it up!! 
My husband and I both ordered a 3 item plate, chicken tacos, beef flautas, and cheese enchilada. The beef was shredded and moist and oh so tasty, I didn't make it to my taco, but it was generous in size and my husband said his was great. The enchilada comes with red or green sauce, which to me can make or break the enchilada. The green sauce was very good and so was the red. The portions are HUGE so expect leftovers. We ordered the churro, even though the server recommended the fried ice cream, now I wish I had gotten that. The churro wasn't really anything special. Not something is get again, bit hey, I don't typically have room for dessert at a Mexican place, so it doesn't knock off any stars in my book. 
The place has happy hour every day and it's not crowded at all...yet, although the way the reviews are going I'm sure it will get there.

We really enjoyed our visit, after all our strip walking this meal hit the spot. We arrived to an overflowing crowded entry area, however, in no time the crowd dwindled down. We were seated much sooner from the time originally quoted. The hostess alerted us of the soon approaching end of Happy Hour, and we began with the best House Margaritas. They served chip and dip, 3 kinds of dip. My favorite was one made out of bean, so good! We after had some type of shrimp ceviche, very good & entrees. I was happy with whole dining experience.

Their flaming fajitas are the BEST. Their food is really delicious and i really enjoy their customer service. Price wise, to me its fair. I can never finish my meal, it is such a big portion. Me and family always enjoy coming here.

We visited juans on Sunday and as always were very happy with the food and great service by our waiter Omar and his busser.   We started with 2 happy hour beers and an iced tea.
