Omar always starts us with a heaping plate of chili's toreados and queso fundido.  We love the fried chili's and onions rolled in tortillas.   Our meal started with a cup of fideo soup always yummy and full of flavor.  While the draw here is the flaming fajitas our favorite has always been the seafood parillada for 2.  It is shrimp, fish and scallops on a bed of grilled onions.  While it was for 2, the 3 of us did not finish it and there was still some fish on the plate.  Omar finished our meal with a complimentary fried ice cream.  Service and food have always been top notch here and all your requests are easily met.  We have been coming here at least once a month since they opened and if we did not have a 45 minute drive across town to get there it would definitely be more often.  Our bill was $45 + a $15 tip for $60 total.

We have come back here a few times since my original review and we are still fans. So far I have stuck with the fajitas, which are still consistently good. I still feel like this is the best mexican place I have found in Vegas, but to be fair I haven't tried anything but the fajitas so far. My husband has had the nachos on the happy hour menu before and enjoyed them. They have been busy each time we have gone, but we never have to wait long and everyone there goes out of their way to greet you, ask you how everything is, if you need anything else...etc. Top notch customer service for sure!

Service was excellent. We came in just before the rush and a Knights game was starting soon. Our waitress was amazing, chips, beans, salsa was provided and refilled. We even asked to put the game on and they changed all of their televisions to the game. She let us know it was happy hour which was another sweet surprise. The food is amazing, we got the steak and shrimp fajitas and it was delicious. Homemade flour tortillas, you can see someone making them. The childrens plates were portioned on the heavier side but we just took it home. Everyone had a good time, we had a table of 8 and I felt like we were well taken care of. Even my parents who usually have something to complain about, didn't have nothing but good things to say.

Great Mexican food.  We enjoyed the two salsas, bean dip and grilled onions and jalapeños.  Very authentic.  We also got the cheese fundido, which was very stringy and oily.  It was on the happy hour appetizer specials.  Next time, we'd choose guacamole instead.  Entrees were a combo platter of a burrito and an enchilada.  Both were very good. The best thing we got, however, was the fajitas.  Very authentic and very good food.  We will definitely be returning.

I'M A FAN!!

I have had Juan's bookmarked for a long time, but haven't made it because it's on the other side of town from me. Well, the time finally came and my boyfriend and I were craving fajitas.

We waited about 10 minutes for a table, which is amazing because this place is HUGE and it was very busy. The staff is all super friendly and everyone we encountered was amazing.

They have a lot of options on the menu, beyond fajitas. We ordered the queso dip to start and went to town on the chips and salsa (big mistake!). We then decided to share the steak fajitas for 2, which is SO much food. I love the presentation - they wheel up a cart to your table and set your fajitas on fire. Pretty cool. Each person gets a plate with beans/rice and sour cream/guac. This was way too much food for us and we ended up taking quite a lot of it home.

I have a theory that there is always room for ice cream, so of course we ended the meal with fried ice cream.

Overall, I really enjoyed our experience at Juan's and we will definitely return!

Incredible service and food! If you didn't already know by the name "Jaun's flaming fajitas" the fajita table side sizzling and on fire. I was skeptical at first and thought they might be bitter and taste burnt but no that were cooked perfectly and tasted even better then that looked. Server  Arturo did an amazing job accommodating me and my guest and never let are drinks go empty. A must try family friendly Mexican restaurant.

First visit here and won't be our last. Love the complimentary salsa and bean dip and the fact they have special salsa for kids. The queso with carne asada was mind blowing it was so good. I have the steak fajitas, steak wasn't juicy as I would like. My husband had the chimichangas and loved them. My kids ate off the kids menu cheese sandwich which was on torta bread and my daughter had the taquitos. She loved the rice. Oh and the soup was very good as well. Service is outstanding very attentive. We had to wait a while for the food however they apologized to us. We also got churros not sure if that comes to everyone or due to our wait but better then Disney. Can't wait to go back

My family and I really enjoyed this place. Super busy on Friday night with about a 45 min wait, but as for lunch Monday through Friday it's extremely fast service. Plate are very reasonably priced with a pretty fair portion size. Staff does a fantastic job of working together!
WOW! Amazing food and amazing service from Amanda. It was our first time here and we will be back for sure. Thank you Team for delivering a great experience.

First time here got great service from the staff they were  attentive.  You get alot of food chips salsa bean dip and the entrees are pretty big.  We came during happy hour which is from 3-7.  We got the shrimp ceviche which was 7.95 during happy hour and its worth it.  Definitely coming back again.  Great waiter in ernoldo and the support staff.

My family likes Mexican food and they like this place. The food is very good and tasty. Service is friendly and quick. It was a special treat to see how they actually light their fajitas on fire. They are tasty too :) A family favorite!

Good food, crowded.......
high end Margies worth it.....
Fajitas are The best in town! My favorite Mexican place now Juan is the old Manager of Viva customer service is the best!

I have to admit that I was skeptical of all the great reviews ... I must qualify that by saying I am very picky about Mexican food. ... Because I love it & eat it all the time!!

1st visit: I had the chorizo tacos ... Excellent!
Rice and beans were good, too
I was especially impressed with the fideo soup ... very tasty broth.  I don't usually like fideo [Lindo you better step up your game]

Service was excellent ... I came after work, and got no grief for asking for a booth even though I was solo. 

I'll probably give 5 stars after trying a few more items!!

2nd visit: less than 1 week later, I'm here after a hard day's work. Happy Hour ... YAY!

Enjoyed the HH classic margarita on the rocks. Today, I tried the Juan's sampler which included taquitos, nachos & quesadilla with sour cream, and guac ... Again enough food for two meals. 

Excellent service, upon arrival I was asked if I wanted my usual booth ... Of course I did, glad the host remembered me.  

I wish they were close to home, but they're close to work so that's OK too

The food here is delicious.. like really really good!  I had the vegetarian fajitas the first time we went.  I'm not a hardcore vegetarian, but I like to throw some veggies in my repertoire once in awhile. ;)  They were plentiful and yummy!  The second time, I had the chili verde.  So good, not fatty, very lean and great flavor.  The salsa choices are good and I'm pretty sure their tortillas are homemade.  Good stuff!

If i could give a zero star I would. The manager was terrible. We walked out and not even two minutes later realized we left our to go box. Within 5 minutes in total of us walking out and walking in they said we never had a to go box and they obviously threw away our food that we spent 50+ dollars on. Not only did they say we lied about not having a to go box but she said I can't accommodate you. We go there all the time and when we said we wouldn't be coming back they just said okay ! Terrible customer service. The night manager is awful !

I was a bit hesitant on first glance, because this has more the feel of a sports bar than a restaurant, but the steak fajita is actually quite tasty, on par with better fajitas I have had in other cities. And the lunch version of it is a reasonable amount of food at a reasonable price. Service was also attentive, which is a plus.

great food, great atmosphere.  Love the outside patio in the spring and summer.  The Margaritas are to die for.  Huge servings.  We were out to dinner w/ friends and they were about to close and we were having a great time, having conversation and didn't realize that they were going to close.   The server told us to stay, relax, finish our food and we stayed much later than closing and never felt rushed.   This was great customer service.   Can't wait until the spring to go back here and enjoy a Margarita and great food!

Juan's is fabulous!  My husband and I have been looking for good Mexican food in the SW and we found our spot!!  Marguerite on the rocks was delish and my husband had a draft Pacifico.   I was amazed that we not only were served chips, salsa and a delish bean but also a tasty plate of roasted peppers and grilled onions. Amazing!!
Lupe was our waitress and she was  terrific.  Very attentive and just a doll.  I had Poblano mole steak and it was so delicious.  Very generous portion.  My husband had the Carne Asada  and he enjoyed it very much. 
Friendly service, delicious food, generous portions at reasonable prices.  Highly recommend!!
Delicious! The food here was wonderful, best enchiladas that I've had in a long time! Our waitress, Araceli and busser Ruben were very friendly, quick and attentive.

Born and raised in Las Vegas and this is the best Mexican food I have had in Las Vegas in 32 years. It is across town from me and we drive for it. We are on our way to Juan's now and I'm so excited for the chips, bean dip, and amazing salsa. Its happy hour from 3-7 every day what could be better!
3rd time here and I will continue to keep coming back. Service & food is great! I would recommend this place. Best Mexican food I've had in the Las Vegas area.
Amazing food! Great service, friendly staff. Located right behind In n Out and not easily seen. Best Mexican food in Vegas.
The best Mexican food hands down. I don't like Mexican food typically, but this place is .

We really enjoyed this place! Food was yummy, and VERY filling. You get what you pay for and then some. 

Service: Chips and salsa were also filled, food was fast, and waitress was nice. 

Environment: We went at peak times so it was a little noisy, but did not take away from our dinner in any way! Wonderfully decorated as well. 

Food: We both had fajitas. So much food! We almost could have shared. If I was into that food sharing thing. Meat was cooked well, and tasty! Felt like we got more than we paid for which is always a nice feeling.  
The chips and salsa also came with a bean dip which was a nice surprise. 

Overall, it was excellent and we will go back sometime!

We usually go to the Mexican place down the street out of convenience but since it has changed names, food hasn't been the same. Not that it was ever spectacular but Juan's? This place is awesome!

Chips were great and not greasy, I love the complimentary grilled veggies and they even tossed in fideo soups for both my son and I (it usually only comes with an entree at other places and I ordered the app nachos and he the kid's meal). Service was really exceptional. Omar waited on us and there was also another lady that really took care of us. Drinks were filled without being asked and dirty plates were taken away without being noticed. I had mentioned it was my first time and Omar brought us churros at the end of the meal! 

Food was great and portions plenty. I ate about a third of my nachos and the kiddo didn't finish his kids meal either. I really digged the environment,  decor and murals too. Considering this used to be a no-frills BBQ place, they really amped up the Mexican theme. The flaming fajitas tableside really added to the fun of the whole place and we enjoyed being wowed when others ordered it.

Juan's is def my new neighborhood spot for Mexican.

It took my wife and I 2 years to check this place out when we moved to Summerlin. I wish we had gone the day we moved because we could have been enjoying it that much sooner! Food is excellent, fajitas are out of this world especially, the salsa, chips, service, etc... It's the whole package. Only place that even comes close is Poncho's in Downtown Summerlin and it's a bit more expensive. I'm always excited to eat here!

We came here on a Saturday night at 6pm.  Not the best time  to walk in if you're hungry as we were quoted 45 min to an hour wait time.   However,  because of the wait the parties ahead of us were dropping like flies and we were seated in 15 minutes. 

We were given our complimentary chips and salsas immediately and our server got us our drinks right away.   Their selection of drinks with free refills was great.   I loved their horchata and am impressed that the refills are free. 

We got shrimp and steak fajitas for two which was so much food for 2 people.   I think 3 or even 4 people could eat from this meal.   The food was very tasty and came out super quick.

I can't wait to come back!   I'm very exited to try their tamarindo and some desserts! 

Definitely worth any wait you may encounter!

Went here with my husband for lunch. We got the fajitas for 2 since fajitas is in the name. We started out with some tableside guacamole, I like garlic and roasted jalapeño in mine so it was just okay. We probably won't get it again, also, because they give you SO MUCH stinking food for the fajitas. When the server arrived with our chicken and steak fajitas they light it on fire with I'm guessing is tequila? Correct me if I am wrong. We OHHHH'd and AHHH'd!! With your meal comes soup which was DELICIOUS (the hubby paid a bit more to get the pozole soup, just lacked some salt) and each person gets their own sides of beans, rice, sour cream, pico, and guac. You also get a choice of 6 flour or corn tortillas. There was so much food I didn't touch my beans or rice, you could easily share this with 3 or 4 people. The chicken was BANGIN' the steak not so much, I found it dry and tough. Next time we want to try to shrimp!! 

OH before I almost forgot. The chips and salsa are pretty good, not the best I've had but the best I have found in Las Vegas!! The service was mehh which is why I knocked a star off but I am more then willing to give it another shot.

This place is delicious!!! My hubby and I arrived to the restaurant on a Saturday night and the intriguing smells of fajitas tantalized my senses from the parking lot. The restaurant was packed which is always a good sign so we went to the bar for drinks while we waited to be seated. To drink, I had a strawberry daiquiri that was very yummy. For my meal, I ordered the flaming chicken fajitas with corn tortillas and devoured my entire serving of fajitas. 
Upon delivering fajitas to your table they light them on fire... it's dinner and a show:)

This place is fantastic. If you like Mexican food you will LOVE this restaurant!
My family loves this place! Steak and Shrimp fajitas for two are amazing and the tex mex enchilada is great too. Service is always awesome.

Wow! Came here on Cinco de Mayo knowing it would be a long wait and I am so glad we did! This place is so delicious and they are all so nice and our drinks never we're empty... Large portions and authentic food! We will be back!!

I had almost given up on finding a good Mexican restaurant in Vegas until I stumbled upon this amazing place! 
First we were given delicious basket of chips, salsa and beans before ordering. We ordered the fajitas and it came with a ridiculous amount of yummy sides. The roasted jalapeños were out of this world and so was the fideo soup that came with the entrée. 
You have to check this place out! Best Mexican food in Vegas.

Food was pretty decent.... Went here for another birthday celebration, I ordered the steak and shrimp fajitas.. They got my mothers order wrong but took care of her meal and made her a new one.. Also boyfriend and mom complained about the house soup being a little too salty.. I guess majority of us prefer lindo michocan.. But besides that the staff were very speedy and friendly but all in all we will probably not come back.
Reasonably priced! Great service, great food(steak Nachos-two thumbs up), and margaritas topped it off! All around good experience

This place is so good.The Steak Fajitas were soooo good.The service was excellent...We live in Anthem area ...can't wait to go back for happy hour.Everyone that worked there was so nice...They even brought me out a milder salsa...even though there is 2 types served....

This place is so much fun and really adds a great twist with the fajitas being served flaming at your table.  Casual atmosphere but not your typical Mexican Restaurant.  I recommend it to anyone.  The margaritas are good too!

Service was good.  Food was good.  We ordered the sampler for an appetizer.  It was plentiful; nachos, quesadilla, and 2 flautas.  Chips came with salsa and a bean dip.  Beans were good, but lukewarm.  We ordered, New Mexico platter, chicken enchilada, fajita salad, and flautas.   Fideo soup was brought to each of us.  It was mildly spicy, but tasty.   Server apparently misheard or scribbled, and fajitas were brought instead of flautas.  No apology was given and our diner felt pressured to keep the fajitas, which she graciously did.  Food was good, but not mind blowing.  We were still charged for the fajitas, which were more expensive than the flautas, even though it was their error.  Again, no attempt was made to rectify their mistake.  For this reason, and the fact that I found a long strand of hair in the salsa, I am giving Juan's 3 stars instead of 4.  I will go back, but I will have the waiter repeat our order next time.

Fantastic Mexican food!!!   Great service even though they busy.   Recommend them as one of the best Mexican Restaurants in town.  The
Fajitas are great!

Probably the best happy hour for Mexican cuisine! You can get a loaded steak quesadilla and a beer (or two ) for under $20! Of course the flaming fajitas are great, but how would they not be! It's in the name!
Best food hands down! I love far from here but had to try and I'm glad I did. Great customer service and great food portions. Also had great  prices. I will bring my husband to try for sure!

My husband and I often come here for happy hour or dinner. Their staff is always friendly and attentive. The prices are very reasonable and the food is consistently good! The happy hour shrimp ceviche is a must !!

We've been coming here since they opened. Everyone that works here is really nice and really good at their job. I never feel like I'm bothering anyone by asking for anything there. They will always put on Pittsburgh sports for us, even though I am pretty sure they aren't Pittsburgh fans.

I really like that they have a vegetarian menu, but last time we were in there, the waiter told us the fideo is made with chicken broth (I knew that) and so is the rice (I didn't know that). I mostly don't worry about stuff like broth when it comes to Mexican food, but I do think they need to either tell people or get it out of the rice, because it's a little misleading to call it vegetarian when it isn't. On the other hand, I did ask Juan once if they'd ever consider tofu or fake meat for the fajitas and he told me if I brought some in, they'd try it in ours. I'm not sure if I'm going to do that, but it was nice that he offered!

This place is awesome. Free chips, salsa, onions and peppers. I had the 3 entree plate. Comes with fideo soup (sooo much flavor). I had the 3 asada tacos ranchero. They were soo good and so big. So much flavor. The rice and beans were also good. The salad they serve with it was super fresh. I ordered a margarita, also super fresh! You can tell they make it fresh and not from mix. The staff is amazing. Very attentive and friendly. They are sincerely happy to have you there because of how new they are. Overall this place is amazing. Finally we have a Mexican restaurant on this side of town that is actually good!!

Amazing, I'm obsessed. The staff is always super nice and on top of refills. They have vegetarian options for about everything! I always get the shrimp fajitas and my boyfriend gets the chicken and steak combo and we both are more than happy each and every time. I do not know what they do with their proteins, and I don't care all I know is it's nothing short of amazing.

I have come here since they opened the door and it's absolutely,  hands down our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!
The Food Is amazing. ...we bring friends from all over who come to visit and we always go here and they are always satisfied and raving about the restaurant. 

The staff...from the bus Boys all the way to Juan, the owner.....are extraordinary!  

Ask for Hernan....best waiter around!!
Order the Queso Fundido for your appetizer!!!!   Soooo yummmmyyy!!!

Once you go here, you WILL go back.  Best Mexican Food in town!!
Memorable and best value Mexican food in Las Vegas.  My husband and I ordered steak and shrimp fajitas dinner for 2 people.  The flame is a nice touch.  Portion is big.  Service is good.

This is a gem in sw Las Vegas. Tropicana and Grand Canyon, just behind In n Out. Arguably the best Mexican restaurant I've eaten at in Las Vegas. Good prices for outstanding food, and the salsa is great! Coming for dinner? Get here early, line is out the door. Very casual with good lunch specials and drink specials.

Although I'm really not a big fan of Mexican cuisine I can't believe we've not been to Juan's Flaming Fajita's before this. A friends of mine said he heard it was good so my wife and I tried it after reading all the rave reviews online. Well we now have a new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. What can I add to what's already been written? The service is friendly, attentive and overall outstanding. The fajitas are very generous (the two of us could have split the chicken fajitas for one) and my wife enjoyed the enchilada and taco combination plate which she ordered with the fresh vegetables. That's a really nice touch that you don't see often as an alternative to rice and beans (they have refried and black beans). As everyone has said the chips and salsa/bean dip that arrive moments after you are seated are excellent. We heeded everyone's advice and held back so as not to spoil our dinner.
We went on a Monday at 6:00pm and did not have to wait for a table. The place was busy and as people left they were replaced by an endless stream of customers. They do have outdoor dining but it was 109 degrees outside, even shade with misters (both of which they have) wouldn't be enough to make it comfortable for me (admittedly an wimpy AC devotee).
We really enjoyed Juan's a lot.

I love Mexican food but this was not really my type of place. Just didn't do it for me.
I had carne asada burrito and it was not good.

I have finally found some very yummy Mexican food!  We have been here twice now and both times have been super delicious!  The shredded beef flautas were so good!!  The hubs loves the steak fajitas and we both enjoy the margarita made with don Julio tequila, maybe just a little too much!  Service is great and the restaurant is clean!

We love Juans! Juan-a know why!? Ever since we dropped in for happy hour a few weeks ago we have been back at least once and some weeks twice! The food is delicious and consistent, servers are very friendly. We've only sat in the bar and the only  thing disappointing for me is most times we've been there the patio is closed and that's where we always want to sit. I understand on windy days but not others,maybe it's staff issues because the service has been slower on the patio. So four stars due to closed patio. Food and drinks is a five.

I've been several times for lunch and the food has been fantastic every time. The fajitas are so good I can't bring myself to try anything else on the menu. The onions and peppers are perfectly cooked with just the right amount of caramelization that makes them irresistibly tasty. Price is great as well.

Happy how the owner handled the situation and went out of his way to leave a gift card for the past experiences. They have increased staff for dinner and it was a great experience.  Lunch time servers can be lacking and not as eager. Food and margaritas are still top notch we will just stick to dinner.

Great service, great food! The fajitas are the go to with the big flames however everything I tried including the chips and salsa were great!

Thanks , will be back!

Always my go to place in Vegas!  Amazing food & amazing service!  The best Mexican food with great atmosphere!  The staff is always excellent!  

Fajitas are a definite must!  The portions are pretty large so consider sharing an order and trying another dish on the menu...you will not be disappointed!  

It's only a 15 minute drive from the strip but totally worth it!

Juan's Flaming Fajitas is a surprising great dining experience that is only 8 miles from my apartment. Don't know how I missed it and or never heard about it till last night.

First pyromaniacs will love this place! The name "Flaming Fajitas"  is well deserved and quite frankly and understatement. When they bring your Fajitas out the server ignites the dish and the flames shoot 3 to 4 feet into the air! 

The food was top notch fresh and flavorful. The only negative experience of the entire night was in relationship to their cheese dish I ordered to go along with my chips. It had to be cut with a knife and fork and couldn't be spooned up by a nacho chip. It had great flavor but I won't order it again as it was to much effort for chips and dip.

The wait staff was great, drinks were never more than half empty, the complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip was similarly filled whenever they appeared low. We had one main waiter but he was getting help from everyone else on the staff and he was helping out the other waiters and their tables. It would appear they are a highly functional unit that wasn't worried about sharing their tables tips. Simply stated it was a true pleasure to dine here.

You could read that and guess it was a slow night but no, there was only one maybe two empty tables in the entire restaurant. 

If you live near or far you must come experience this dining experience its something you will not regret!
Great food, excellent service, and magnificent Margaritas! Looking forward to going back real soon.

We tried this place because of the favorable Yelp reviews and were disappointed.  Granted, we did a carry out, we felt the food was best marginal.  On a scale of 1-10, we gave the food a 3-4.  Very plain  across the board.  

Service and manager was friendly.

May be better eating in the restaurant.

Oh my goodness, this place is delicious! The prices aren't too bad, especially considering the portions. The flaming fajitas for one ($16) are definitely big enough for two and the one for two ($30) is easily big enough for 3. We had steak and chicken both were flavorful. They serve it and set it on fire at the table. Today we had three of us and each had three fajitas off the one for two. Delicious! I only wish it wasn't so far away. But definitely worth the drive! Staff and service was fast and friendly.

Not sure what to think about this place. Not so friendly server, wrong food was brought out and stale 4 day old chips.... The enchilada I ordered was not an enchilada it was tortilla with melted cheese Maybe it will be a better place next time..
Wow.. Best Mexican Food I have had in along time.. Well worth the drive from the east side of town.. Service Great.. Food Amazing..will return..It was my daughters birthday and we all left happy..

The food was good, but don't order fajita for 2! Just order a single.... It's not worth the extra $10 because it comes out on the same platter. My friend ordered a single version and it looked exactly like a double. You just get an extra plate of rice/beans/soup. Wait staff was mediocre, had to ask for refills a lot on drinks. They water down the ice tea. I watched the guy poor water then add a little tea.

The cheese here is really amazing! I had the steak fajita - order it rare and it will come out medium rare since it continues to cook on the cast iron. Try to go easy on the chips and salsa - it's addictive and so easy to get full of it before your meal comes out.

I attended this place last weekend for lunch and I highly recommend you coming here also. I was impressed with the flaming fajitas. As you eat your food the flame in the pot keeps your food hot the entire meal that was very impressive to me. The meats they used were juicy and tender. The margaritas that were served to me were awesome too, the consistency of the frozen margaritas was just perfect. I love it when the chips come out nice and warm, salsa was on point too. Just go, and you will be grateful you made a right choice. Im adding this place to my re-arrivals, lol. I only recommend the best spots!

Visited here while in Vegas with our son & his family.  It was great and the flaming fajitas were fun!  We enjoyed the food and the service was amazing.  It is always a little challenging to dine with a 2.5 year old and a 9 month old but this restaurant handled everything in stride.

We were meeting some friends for lunch and we asked them for ideas. They chose Juan's and I am glad they did! Located just west of the 215 on Tropicana they are easy to find. We were immediately greeted and sat in a large booth. 

Within seconds our waitress arrived for our drink orders and chips, salsa, bean dip and grilled onions and peppers were delivered. The latter is a nice touch that I have not seen before. I went with the shrimp fajitas (lunch size) which comes with rice and beans and all the typical sides. Our friends ordered the queso fundido which was excellent. 

When the fajitas are delivered they set them on fire (hence the name Juan's "flaming" fajitas). The shrimp were cooked well and came with plenty of grilled green and yellow peppers and onions. The service throughout the meal was excellent. We were always offered more chips and salsa and our drinks were filled.

The only downside for me was the guac didn't seem like it was made fresh and the cast iron skillet had a lot of oil in it making it a little greasy. Besides that it was a great lunch.

Quick tip: If the restaurant is called Juan's Flaming Fajitas, you should order the fajitas. 

We came here for our Cinco de Drunko dinner celebrations without any high hopes or expectations. All we were looking for was a Mexican restaurant near the house where we could partake in the national drunk day! Man we hit a jackpot with this joint!


We ordered flaming beef  fajitas (for one) and 3 combo plate (carne asada, pollo asada and carnitas) all tacos.

We got dinner and a show with the fajitas! I'm usually not a big fajita fan because every time I get them the meat is usually dry and rubbery.  Their meat was moist, juicy and full of flavor! (insert gay joke here) The peppers and onions were cooked just right as they still had a little snap to them. 

The tacos were decent in both taste and size but could not compare to the flaming fajitas! This place is called Juan's flaming fajitas not Juan's flaming tacos so order accordingly. If the tacos had the same pop as the fajitas this place would be a 5* without question. 

The freebie chips and dip were decent. They provided warm beans along with the salsa. One surprise was they provided grilled chilies and onions with the salsa! The chips were nothing special and probably of the bagged variety. 

Very friendly and attentive wait staff. We never had to ask for more chips and salsa or to have our water refilled. Our waiter was quick to point out that since it's cinco de drunko that the best bang for our alcoholic buck was the beer margarita since it was only $1 more than a standard margarita. SOLD! No need for up sell here my friend..

I think that we found a new place near our house to get our Mexican and margarita fix.!
The best fajitas I've ever had in my life!! Such huge portions! Share! Service is little sloppy  and slow but other than that great place!

Top notch Mexican food just 20 minutes off the Vegas strip.  My lady and I were tired of the over priced and underwhelming options on the strip, so we swung out in the rental to hit a few desert parks on the outskirts on Vegas, hitting Juan's for dinner on the way back.

Juan's did not disappoint.  We sat in bar area, as main dining area was full.  Waiter took drink orders immediately after we sat, then after offered good suggestions on the menu items. Another waiter brought a big bowl of chips with 3 different salsa, some melted cheese, some beans, a plate of fried onion, and a plate of nice hot peppers, a nice damn little meal by itself.

An appetizer of ranchers taco's was 6 excellent tortillas fried crispy filled with shrimp.  We both had Jalisco style platters, she had steak Monterey style, loaded with peppers. onions, and monterey cheese, myself the chicken poblano, a deep, dark mole sauce with sesame seeds.  Both came with a cup of soup, beans and rice and were more than ample sized, that we had take out to drop in the cooler for a morning snack in the desert.

Fairly priced, superior customer service by the wait staff and great portions of real hearty Mexican food and non watered down drinks make this a must stop anytime I am in the Vegas area.
Definitely suitable for carnivores. My vegetarian dish did not exceed the expectation.

Such a bummer. We LOVE their food- come here monthly. Needless to say this is the THIRD time we have come in the evening to take advantage of the patio and they REFUSE to serve customers out there. Why have a patio and never have it open? They turned away 30 customers. Unbelievable! What a poor decision by management to do that. We even asked to order "to go" and eat out on the patio so their precious servers wouldn't have to walk outside. The hostess staff was extremely rude and screamed at our group that they don't serve on the patio! Meanwhile, they do have one table out there getting service. Your service SUCKS! Keep turning away loyal customers and watch your sales dwindle. We will never recommend this restaurant again regardless of the food because the staff is so rude and they continually turn paying customers away.

Our new favorite Mexican restaurant! I made my mouth so very happy by feeding it New Mexico enchiladas! What flavor! Chicken wrapped in a blue tortilla surrounded by New Mexico chile sauce. mmmmm-mmmm-mmm! I love it when I meet such wonderful medleys of flavor provided by an array of well-balance spices. Didn't need to drown it in salsa. Didn't need salsa!  The table next to us order their specialty, flaming fajitas. That's what I plan to order next time!
Fun lively spot. Nice to get off the strip and find good family food. Fajitas are awesome and specialty. Loud inside when busy but organized and attentive. Food not fuel. I will return.

I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican but this place was good.

Free chips, sauteed onions and peppers, and soup!

I ordered a taco salad... I asked for no rice and they offered to replace it with steamed veggies. I was very happy.

They were able to make a dirty martini and it was only $5.50 which is half of what I was expecting it to be (grey goose vodka too)

The service was very good. The workers were definitely hustling... Very quick to refill water, chips, and take away finished plates. 

The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because my boyfriend asked for the steamed veggies too, but was given rice instead, and some of the chairs were cheap and looked like they belong in a cafeteria.

Great margaritas n yummy fajitas.  The prices are right in line with other family Mexican places in the area.  Very nice wait staff. Nothing fancy about this place as I sit in sneakers and jeans with a belly full of fajitas. .definitely recommend for a nice lunch/dinner out when you're being low key. Oh and its not just a name. .the fajitas come out in a flaming presentation.
I love this place,  the staff is always friendly, the food is delicious! I also love that there are tvs around so you can watch the games (hehe)

I asked my mom what she wanted for lunch and she mentioned Mexican. I have had my eye on Juan's Flaming Fajitas for a while so it was the perfect opportunity to try a new restaurant.

We arrived around noon and the place wasn't busy at all. We were seated in the bar area and given the full menu as well as their lunch specials after our drink orders were taken. The lunch specials were all very reasonably priced and they all include a soft drink or iced tea. I decided on the steak fajitas with corn tortillas and my mom chose the chicken mulitas. Both came out quickly and of course the fajitas were flaming as promised. The first attempt didn't work out, so the server had to go back get some more oil to stoke the fire, literally. Second times a charm and they were certainly flaming. The fajitas were good. I don't typically order fajitas, but these were solid. I wish they were a little less well done, but all the flavors were right and the portion was generous. I enjoyed the entire meal.

The best part about Juan's is the fabulous service. Our server was so friendly and attentive and the rest of the staff checked in with us regularly, made sure our drinks were always full and that we had everything we needed to make our meal the best it could be.
great place!!! come with a appetite & leave full! the drinks  are very good... great place & good staff and the price is g r e a t !
The taquitos are must have, everything is good!!!! Best Mexican food I've had in a long time that's not made by my mom.

I really like this place...The Fajitas are really good and the custom made iron pots that keep them hot and cooking are fantastic.  Service is superb and food fantastic.  Overall a great place.  This location has seen several restaurants come and go.  Hope you support Juan who is a hands on owner that I would love to see make it!
Awesome mexican food and a fine margarita too. Can be a bit hard to find but worth the trip.

Excellent food and service!!! My only complaint was the non recyclable styrofoam "to go" containers. Taking that aside, I would give this restaurant 5 stars. Highly recommend the chicken fajitas. Easily enough for 2 as the portions are mind blowingly large.

If your from Los Angeles, and moved to Vegas, it's hard to find a decent Mexican restaurant in Vegas, well I finally found , Juan's Flaming Fajitas, it is, hands down the best authentic Family Mexican restaurant I've found to date. The staff, the food, and the atmosphere are all five stars. After my 3 year search, I know longer need to look any further. Thanks Juan.

What can I say but the best!  We originally ordered thru Postmates but they cancelled the order.  I called Juan's and the person who answered was so nice.  He understood our issue.

We ordered 2 steak fajita meals and carnitas.  A side of chips salsa and bean dip.  The portions were huge!  Easily enough for 2 meals each.  We got all the sides and condiments.  The food was awesome!

Our go to for Mexican food from now on.
Hard to walk into a place called Juan's Flaming Fajitas without ordering the fajitas. They're the tits.

This place was delicious!  Along with nachos they also give you a cheesy bean dip, salsa, and hot peppers and onions to start with!  The peppers and onions were certainly a treat for my husband and I.

My Margarita was great.  The Chicken Flaming Fajita and Cheese Quesadilla were both very good.  The Chimichanga was not as crunchy as we're used to (that's part of what we used to like about it) and we got the regular one, which tasted like they just boiled the chicken in water and was VERY bland and gross.  The chicken that came with the Fajita was grilled and delicious.  Our waiter suggested we should have gotten the Grilled Chicken (Pollo Asado) Chimichanga instead and then it would have tasted better - wish they had recommended it back when we asked what Pollo Asado was!

There were so many other authentic looking Mexican dishes on the menu that we can't wait to go back and try something new!  Overall a nice spot with good ambiance - oh, and the busboy walking around singing to himself while he wipes down the tables is a HOOT!

I had heard of this place for awhile but WOW... great food, great customer service , and great ambiance. The wait was worth it... we came here Sunday evening (6pm) and there was an hour wait. It moves fairly quickly but glad we gave it a shot. They are known for their fajitas, the presentation is phenomenal! It's on fire *literally*. I will definitely be back :).

I come here so often it's almost embarrassing. The food is amazing and so is the service. I've been here so many times and not once have I ever been disappointed. I've also tried an assortment of their entrees and they're all delicious. Some of my favorites are the Tex Mex Enchiladas, Carne Pollo Chimichanga, Steak Nachos, and Flautas. Literally everything is so good. Their happy hour is good, too. The only thing next for me to try is their brunch :)

Went there sat with high hopes of finally finding a decent place to eat..as we were looking over menu..Juan the owner came over..we told him it's our 1st time here..he said order the fajitas..it's the best you'll ever taste..and he said if we didn't like them..he would buy our meal..so we ordered chicken fajitas for 2..and I ordered 1 crispy beef taco..server was horrible..had no knowledge of the menu or ingredients..the food came out..of course the fajitas smelled awesome..that's from the liquid they pour on to make sizzle..after the sizzle dies down..I could really tell the chicken had no flavor at all..hardly no bell peppers or onions like they should..didn't like my taco..I want shredded cheddar cheese..but it came with the white crumbly cheese that I don't like..I couldn't even send it back..because after the server..which had no personality whatsoever..dropped off our food..he never checked back not once..so I finally got someone to get the manager..he felt really bad..and he bought our lunch..which we hardly touched..which was nice..he then gave me his card with a 10% discount for us to come back and give it another try.. the salsa had no flavor..and it wasn't even a little spicy..tortillas were overcooked..I have no idea how this place got 5 stars..I honestly think people dont know good mexican food...
Greatest restaurant in Vegas. If you are lucky you can bump into Vince Neil or the Owner of nationally acclaimed Food and Beverage Magazine.  Ask for Mimi..
